title: Warehouse Clerk (OS&D)
description:
Job Description

We are currently looking to hire a versatile and dynamic person who enjoys teamwork. Are you looking for a challenging position? GLS Canada has it all!!

Working Conditions
  • Type: Permanent Full Time
  • Monday to Friday
  • 10:00am to 6:30pm
  • Salary: $18.00/hour
Responsibilities
  • Fielding phone calls and follow-up as required
  • Conducting warehouse searches
  • Replying to customer service / tracing emails
  • Entering data including adding comments in the system for tracking
  • Updating problem shipments on drive
  • Comfortable with Google applications ( email, drive, docs etc. )
  • Excellent communication and teamwork
  • Ability to work independently and with a team
  • Physically able to lift up to 75 lbs. continuously
  • 60% computer/phone - 40% standing or walking in the warehouse ( varies on day )
  • Experience with TDG would be a bonus!
  • Working with Freight & Parcel OS&D
What is in it for you?

GLS Canada offers a wide range of benefits for our employees:
  • Competitive salaries
  • Stimulating positions
  • Opportunity for advancement
  • Medical/Dental Insurance plans according to your needs
  • RRSP plan
  • Corporate discounts
  • Refund for safety boots
  • Annual salary review
  • Vacation
  • Personal/Sick Days
  • Access to the Employee Assistance Program
  • Referral bonus
  • Personal Protection Equipment (Safety boot allowance program, safety vest(s), COVID-19 masks, ear protection etc.)
Job Requirements
  • Previous OSD experience an asset
  • Must be able to lift up to 75lbs
  • Standing bending & twisting
  • Good typing/data entry and clerical skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office & google applications
  • Able to communicate both verbally and in writing
  • Able to work efficiently as a part of a team as well as independently
  • Attention to detail in all areas of work
  • Strong work ethic and positive team attitude
Please note that GLS Canada is subscribed to a program of employment equity. *Only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

GLS Canada is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, Aboriginal/Indigenous status or any other factors considered discriminatory. If you require an accommodation during the recruitment process, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Company Profile

Founded in 1968 as a courier service with a single car and driver, GLS Canada now serves customers across a wide range of industries with multiple modes of transportation fulfilling over 80,000 shipments each day.

GLS Canada meets the needs of business-to-business (B2B) and business-to-consumer (B2C) customers through parcel, freight and logistics services, tailored to each and every one of those customers’ unique needs and requirements.

As of August 30, 2018, Dicom was sold to General Logistics Systems (GLS). This will allow GLS Canada to have access to the complete GLS network and allow for expansion into international services.

The fusion between the two company will offer many advantages to our employees, clients and partners.

Job originally posted on GrabJobs. If you need to report this job please contact GrabJobs

title: Courier Delivery Driver
description:
TMT dispatch is looking to hire company drivers to deliver parcels for our E-commerce services.

Company drivers will have a car provided to them and expenses are taken care of by the company. Warehouse location is in Richmond and deliveries will be made in the lower mainland, driver will need to be comfortable driving in different cities. Candidates experienced in delivering in Vancouver will be prioritize.

Owner operators will be responsible for vehicle and expenses related to work.

Responsibilities

  • Load and deliver the assigned shipment effectively and efficiently
  • Use applications on phone to communicate and receive orders from dispatch
  • Verify locations for pick ups and deliveries
  • Drive in a safe and professional manner. Be aware on road while delivering by following all the rules and regulations
  • Average of 150-180 deliveries E-COMMERCE

About You and our Team

  • A positive attitude, hard working, willingness to learn and able to deliver outstanding customer service;
  • Able to speak, read and write in English;
  • Able to work independently, follow direction as needed
  • Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail and well organized;
  • Previous delivery experience is a plus

Requirements

  • clean criminal record
  • Class 5 driver license;
  • Able to lift up to 50 lbs;
  • Smart phone with up to 3GB data

Please note that the relationship between Owner Operators and TMT dispatch is via sub-contracting agreement, not an employee-employer relationship

Who Are We?

TMT dispatch is a fast-growing transportation company based in the lower mainland. We are a proud family run company that takes care of our staff, we belive in a fun and consistent work environment for all our staff from drivers to employees we want you to enjoy work!

Our number one goal is to ensure complete client satisfaction. We offer a full range of services to suit the needs of businesses in the Greater Vancouver Area and throughout canada and the United states. When customers are unable to find their desired service, we go above and beyond to provide custom service and to meet any and all expectations for our clients and vendors

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $4,250.00-$4,500.00 per month

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 12 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Richmond, BC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

title: AZ City Driver ($23.35 to $31.89 per hour)
description:
Do you enjoy physical work and are you looking for a permanent, stable job in an environment where
you will be treated like family?


Do you want to be part of a dynamic team where you will have fun at work each day?


GLS Canada is the company for you!!!



GLS CANADA provides a delivery service 24 hours a day, 365 days a year and is currently looking to hire a Professional AZ Driver for our Cambridge Terminal.


Start time: 2:00pm (10-12 hours)

Salary: $23.35 / hour + $1.00 per stop AND MORE!!!
(Company Payroll)


What's in it for you:

  • Home every day with your family
  • Monthly paid BONUS premium
  • Safety orientated team
  • Driver Recognition Program
  • Annual Survey to receive your valued feedback
  • Employee Assistant Program (EAP)
  • Paid weekly - Every Friday
  • Offered a competitive stating salary
  • Extended Benefits for you (and your family) available from FIRST day of joining our team
  • Supplied company uniforms
  • Receive a hiring Bonus ( $500)
  • Receive a referral Bonus ($500)
  • Eligible for Corporate discounts with several retailers and sports centers
  • RRSP employee contribution & employer contribution
  • Yearly Vacation
  • Personal Protection Equipment (Safety boot allowance program, safety vest(s), COVID-19 masks, ear protection etc.)


Our equipment:

  • Tractor-trailers with air suspension
  • Air conditioned cab with air suspension
  • Dual soundproofing
  • Air suspension seat Premium Plus
  • Electric Windows/. Luxurious interior
  • Manual and Automatic Transmission
  • 6 setting lumbar Position

Do not wait to send us your resume and become part of a winning team! or for any questions, call Teresa at 905 464 8199 or via email at tboychuk@gls-canada.com


JOB REQUIREMENTS

Job Requirements

  • AZ License
  • Comfortable with material handling up to 70 pounds
  • Clean Drivers Abstract
  • Clean CVOR
  • Ability to operate manual and automatic transmission is an asset

Do not wait to send us your resume and become part of a winning team TODAY!

GLS Canada is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, Aboriginal/Indigenous status or any other factors considered discriminatory. If you require an accommodation during the
recruitment process, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Founded in 1968 as a courier service with a single car and driver, GLS Canada now serves customers across a wide range of industries with multiple modes of transportation fulfilling over 80,000 shipments each day.

title: newSales Representative
description:
Bel-Air Lexus is looking for a Product Advisor to join our Sales Team!

Job Details

  • Permanent full-time position
  • Guaranteed base salary plus commission and other performance-based incentives
  • Scheduled to work 42 hours per week

Job Duties

  • Greet customers and evaluate their needs, motivations and requirements in terms of an automobile
  • Gain and apply knowledge of the product
  • Provide details about features, special programs and other sales promotions
  • Provide information on pricing, credit terms, trade-in allowances, warranties and delivery dates
  • Attend sales meetings, assist the dealership where necessary, etc.

Qualifications

  • Bilingual in French and English (Asset)
  • Car sales experience (Asset)
  • OMVIC license (Asset)
  • Sales experience (Required)
  • Driver's G (Required)
  • Ability to work weekends and evenings (Required)

Condition of employment:

  • All new hires must provide proof of double vaccination prior to hire

About Us

Welcome to the Dealer that dares to be different. Our family-owned and operated dealerships have thrived on pleasing customers in the Ottawa/Gatineau area since 1969. Over the years, we've perfected an exceptional formula of outstanding vehicles, first-class service, and genuine, personalized care, which we tailor to suit our customers’ needs. The Company offers an automotive experience designed with the customer in mind. We're ready to exceed our customers’ expectations. All our staff members strive to offer attentive, informative service that's also friendly and genuine. Come join our team today!

We are an equal opportunity employer

Thank you for your interest, however, only the selected candidates will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $60,000.00-$95,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Commission pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Store discount
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
All customers and employees must wear masks in all public areas and complete screening questionnaire prior to entering service area. Valets to disinfect vehicles upon arrival and departure. Common surface areas disinfected regularly

Experience:

  • sales: 1 year (preferred)
  • customer service: 3 years (preferred)

Language:

  • French (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • OMVIC (preferred)

title: Kilted Window Cleaner
description:
Want an opportunity to chase your dreams? Join Men In Kilts!

I know what you’re thinking, it's just window cleaning. How can window cleaning help me accomplish my dreams? Let us show you!

Let’s Start with You

There are two types of people we hire at Men In Kilts. Those looking for a career, and those looking for a stepping stone to help them along the way to their long-term goals. Which Are You?

Looking for a Career?

Men In Kilts is growing quickly and has the opportunity for leaders to grow within the company and stand out in the service industry. Follow our training program and advance into many different roles including Lead Technician, Lead Trainer, Estimator, Manager and even a Franchise Owner, as we look to promote and hire from within our ranks of kilted employees.

Looking for a Stepping Stone?

We are looking for window cleaning technicians who will come and hang their hat with us for a year or two while they gain experience and skills to help them move on to their next step in life. We want to support you in that effort and help our team members achieve their milestones on the way to accomplishing their goals. Our competitive and performance-based earnings are perfect for those who are driven and have a great work ethic.

Some Details You Should Know Before Applying

We provide window and exterior cleaning services to residential and commercial customers. Our service offerings include window cleaning, gutter cleaning, pressure washing and siding cleaning. Check out our website and google reviews to get a better understanding of how we excel in the industry.

You should also:

· Be comfortable working outdoors in all weather.

· Have a valid working permit and driver's license with limited demerits.

· Love the idea of building and being a part of an exceptional team.

· Dig the idea of wearing a kilt every day and getting lots of attention.

What Can We Offer?

- During your first month of training, you will receive a base rate of $20/hour. As you enter your second month, you will progress to performance pay, which is based on production.

- We offer year-round work with no seasonal layoffs!

- Our technicians are compensated under a revenue sharing model where the harder you work, the more you make; all while delivering exceptional service and making people smile.

- We provide you with all the uniforms, supplies, tools and training you need to be successful because when you succeed, so does the company!

- Benefits after 3 months which includes a health spending account, profit sharing, company events and even a birthday bonus.

- Lead Drivers are provided a vehicle to take home to shorten their morning commute.

Who Are We Looking For?

We're looking for reliable, fit, motivated individuals who understand the importance of not only working hard but also working smart. Our technicians excel at doing things right the first time and providing a world class service experience to our customers.

What is expected of our Technicians?

· Represent our company with integrity and passion.

· Be reliable, coachable, and excited to develop your skills.

· Be a part of a team and treat our customers like gold.

· Safely and efficiently operate provided vehicles and equipment.

· Complete the work assigned to a high standard of quality.

If you think you have what it takes, we'd love to hear from you. Apply today!

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $20.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Commission pay
  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Company car
  • Company events
  • Profit sharing

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Licence/Certification:

  • Driver License (required)
  • working permit (required)

title: House Cleaner
description:
Earn Significantly More as a House Cleaner + Join an Awesome Environment

We're looking to hire three house cleaners (part-time or full-time available) with cleaning experience, high attention to detail, and a positive, upbeat attitude to join our fast growing team.

This position is based at 470 Argentia Road, Mississauga. The successful candidate will use our company vehicle to drive to and from client service locations (aka residential homes) with 1-3 additional colleagues. We will provide and take care of all cleaning supplies - no need to wash cloths or vacuums.

We are a residential home cleaning service based in Southwest Ontario that aims to deliver the highest standard of cleaning and integrity to our customers.

Come work as a Professional House Cleaner with Summerhill Clean!

This position presents an exciting opportunity to take on a leadership role within our company with an opportunity for continued growth as our business grows.

Put your eye for detail, customer relations skills, and pride for a job well done to use and make a meaningful difference in customers' lives. We provide people something that's more valuable than money or objects - time. Come be part of our team with a vision to build a better cleaning company - working our way to growing to become the #1 cleaning service in Ontario!

What's In It For You?

  • Competitive Base Pay: $19.00 - $22.00 starting with scheduled pay increases every three months, deposited in your bank account every Friday. You get paid for every minute you're working or driving to/from our home base.
  • Incentive Bonus Paid Every Three Months: Ability to earn up to an extra $250 every three months based on a weighted review of your performance and positive customer feedback.
  • Earn up to a $15 bonus per positive online client review, which can seriously add up
  • Uniform: We provide you with Summerhill Clean polos to be worn during your shift. You must wear black work pants and non-slip shoes.
  • Health, Dental, and Vision Benefits: Starting after the first 90 days, you begin receiving full Health, Dental, and Vision Benefits through a Health Spending Account, whether full or part-time.
  • Vacation Days: Vacation pay is paid weekly at 4% on your paycheque and you take two weeks off annually. Beginning in Year 3, we begin paying 6% vacation pay and you take three weeks off annually.
  • Personal Paid Days: Up to five paid sick or personal days to be used annually.
  • Career Opportunities: Ability to get promoted to lead a team or district, lead quality assurance, customer relations, and more!

Your Qualifications

  • Provide two pieces of government photo ID
  • Ability to pass an enhanced criminal record check
  • Ability to pass a soft credit check (no bankruptcy within the last two years)
  • Ability to communicate in English with customers and colleagues in a respectful manner
  • Ability to wear a face mask, disposable gloves, and disposable shoe covers while cleaning in people's homes
  • Ability to differentiate between cleaning products and use
  • Ability to read cleaning instructions
  • Strong communication and customer service skills
  • Ability to lift and carry 20 lbs of equipment
  • Ability to withstand regular physical contact with dog and cat hair, mold, dust, mildew and cleaning solutions

Job Responsibilities

  • Creating an exceptional customer cleaning experience
  • Communicating with clients to ensure their complete satisfaction, including completing post-cleaning assessments and providing photography
  • Create moments of magic to ensure a positive customer experience
  • Complete quality control assessments and reviews to ensure our highest standards of client experience is met
  • Complete cleaning activities, including but not limited to:
  • Use Summerhill Clean cleaning products and procedures to clean in customer homes
  • Use provided equipment including vacuums and microfibre cleaning cloths
  • Clean all surfaces in home, including fans, blinds, light fixtures, baseboards, fixtures, counters, showers, toilets, cabinets, and floors
  • Ability to clean floors on hands and knees in kitchens and bathrooms
  • Vacuum all stairs, carpet, hard surface floors and furniture
  • Move all reasonably moveable furniture to clean under and behind
  • Carry all cleaning products and equipment to and from office, vehicle, and customers’ homes
  • Assist in keeping supplies stocked and maintain equipment
  • Contribute to a positive work climate with a pleasant attitude and contribute to the overall team effort including being in uniform, dependable, and on time
  • Has respect and understanding for co-workers and customers

This Job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by those assigned to this position. This is not a comprehensive list of all responsibilities, duties, skills, efforts, and conditions associated with this position. The Company reserves the right to modify this description in the future, with or without notice to the employee.

This Job description does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, and employment with the Company remains at will. These responsibilities are subject to possible modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent
Part-time hours: 15-45 per week

Salary: $19.00-$22.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Overtime pay
  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Company car
  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Day shift

COVID-19 considerations:
All clients and colleagues are required to wear a mask while on-site.

Licence/Certification:

  • Driver's License (preferred)

title: Driving Instructor
description:
When you become a Young Driver's employee, you are joining the largest and most reputable Driver Training Organization in Canada.

YOUNG DRIVERS® in Peterborough, Lindsay, Cobourg and Bowmanville are currently seeking someone who "loves to drive" and wants to make a difference in people’s lives.

If you are a "people person", love to drive, and have patience and a passion for excellence, we can offer you a CAREER with YOUNG DRIVERS OF CANADA that offers both great personal satisfaction, career advancement and we provide the training.

You will need a minimum 10 years of driving experience, a clean driving record (zero demerit points) and no criminal record. You must obtain a Vulnerable Sector Check and a Police Information Check.

Young Drivers of Canada instructors receive competitive pay rates, extended health/family benefits, the advantage of driving NEW vehicles, and the ability to govern their own flexible schedules to maximize their earning potential. YD can provide you with a CAREER that offers personal satisfaction, CAREER advancement and a robust set of professional resources. (Our instructors have been with Young Drivers an average of 15 years).

You have the opportunity to move up into a Classroom Teacher role when you are ready.
You control your income but because many of our clients are High School students, our Instructors must be available to work afternoons & evenings until 9 PM a minimum of 4 evenings per week and 2 Saturdays per month.

The YOUNG DRIVERS® Driving Instructor position is the EXACT OPPOSITE of a “Monday-to-Friday-nine-to-five” office job, but for most of us, this is the best job in the world! WE SAVE LIVES!!

If you love to drive, love to teach, and want to make a difference, please send us your resume and let’s see if this position is right for you! Our next hire date is June 6, 2022.

Thank you for considering a CAREER with Young Drivers of Canada. Serious applicants only please. Applications will be accepted via email only.

Job Type: FULL Time, Permanent

Salary: $50,000 to $65,000 per year

Job Locations: Peterborough, Lindsay, Cobourg, Bowmanville

Required education: High School or equivalent, proficiency in Internet & Mobile Technology

Required experience: driving: 10 years (Required)

Application Questions

  • Do you have the following license or certification: Class G Drivers License?
  • How many years of driving experience do you have?
  • Do you live in Peterborough, Lindsay, Cobourg, Bowmanville, ON

Expected start date: 2022-04-25

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $50,000.00-$65,000.00 per year

COVID-19 considerations:
Student must answer Covid screening questions prior to getting in the car, mask must be worn by both Instructor and student, instructor cleans inside of car with Vitaloxide Disinfectant spray prior to each lesson.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $50,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • Life insurance

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Peterborough, ON K9J 7J6: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Expected start date: 2022-06-06

title: Dispatcher
description:
We are currently looking to hire a versatile and dynamic person who enjoys teamwork.

Are you looking for a challenging position?


GLS Canada has it all!!


Working Conditions:

  • Type: Permanent Full Time
  • Monday to Friday
  • 11:00am to 7:30pm
  • Salary: $17.00/hour


Responsibilities:


  • Freight dispatching & handling equipment break down issues.

  • Internal billing.

  • OS&D work

  • Daily Reports.

  • Nightly emails.

  • Answering phones & emails for customer service related items.

  • Must have computer knowledge (Microsoft, excel, ETC).

  • Must be comfortable to work at a desk for extended periods of time

  • Customer service and dispatching experience is a bonus.



What is in it for you?

GLS Canada offers a wide range of benefits for our employees:

  • Competitive salaries
  • Stimulating positions
  • Opportunity for advancement
  • Medical/Dental Insurance plans according to your needs
  • RRSP plan
  • Corporate discounts
  • Refund for safety boots
  • Annual salary review
  • Vacation
  • Personal/Sick Days
  • Access to the Employee Assistance Program
  • Referral bonus
  • Personal Protection Equipment (Safety boot allowance program, safety vest(s), COVID-19 masks, ear protection etc.)



JOB REQUIREMENTS

Job Requirements:
  • Previous OSD experience an asset
  • Must be able to lift up to 75lbs
  • Standing bending & twisting
  • Good typing/data entry and clerical skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office & google applications
  • Able to communicate both verbally and in writing
  • Able to work efficiently as a part of a team as well as independently
  • Attention to detail in all areas of work
  • Strong work ethic and positive team attitude

Don’t wait send us your application and become part of a winning team today! You can submit your resume directly to our Talent Acquisition Specialist, Katelyn at kpalmatier@gls-canada.com

Please note that GLS Canada is subscribed to a program of employment equity. *Only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

GLS Canada is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, Aboriginal/Indigenous status or any other factors considered discriminatory. If you require an accommodation during the recruitment process, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Company Profile:
Founded in 1968 as a courier service with a single car and driver, GLS Canada now serves customers across a wide range of industries with multiple modes of transportation fulfilling over 80,000 shipments each day.
GLS Canada meets the needs of business-to-business (B2B) and business-to-consumer (B2C) customers through parcel, freight and logistics services, tailored to each and every one of those customers’ unique needs and requirements.
As of August 30, 2018, Dicom was sold to General Logistics Systems (GLS). This will allow GLS Canada to have access to the complete GLS network and allow for expansion into
international services.
The fusion between the two company will offer many advantages to our employees, clients and partners.

title: AZ Truck Driver - Line Haul Float Position
description:
GLS Canada provides a delivery service 24 hours a day, 365 days a year and is currently looking to hire a professional Company Line Haul Truck Driver for our Brampton ON terminal.

Shift:

starting between 7:30pm and 9:00pm

Monday to Friday

  • Home every day!

Route:

Start in Brampton > Various Switch Points

Salary:

$0.2718/km + $24.52/hour (wait & exception time)

Job Requirements:

  • AZ Drivers license

  • 2 years of Tractor Trailer Driving experience

  • Clean CVOR

  • Clean Abstract

  • Ability to operate Automatic and Manual Transmission an asset

JOB REQUIREMENTS

What's in it for you!

  • Home every day with your family

  • Safety orientated team

  • Receive a hiring Bonus ( $500)

  • Receive a referral Bonus ($500)

  • Monthly Bonus Payments!

  • Milestone Anniversary Awards!

  • 5% Annual increase rate

  • Perfect attendance acknowledged

  • Driver Recognition Program

  • Annual Survey to receive your valued feedback

  • Employee Assistant Program (EAP)

  • Paid weekly - Every Friday

  • Offered a competitive stating salary

  • Extended Benefits for you (and your family) available from FIRST day of joining our team

  • Supplied company uniforms

  • Eligible for Corporate discounts with several retailers and sports centers

  • RRSP employee contribution & employer contribution

  • Yearly Vacation

  • Personal Protection Equipment (Safety boot allowance program, safety vest(s), COVID-19 masks, ear protection etc.)



Our equipment:

  • Tractor-trailers with air suspension

  • Air conditioned cab with air suspension

  • Dual soundproofing

  • Air suspension seat Premium Plus

  • Electric Windows/. Luxurious interior

  • Manual and Automatic Transmission

  • 6 setting lumbar Position




Do not wait to send us your resume and become part of a winning team TODAY!

Company Profile:

Founded in 1968 as a courier service with a single car and driver, GLS Canada now serves customers across a wide range of industries with multiple modes of transportation fulfilling over 80,000 shipments each day.

GLS Canada meets the needs of business-to-business (B2B) and business-to-consumer (B2C) customers through parcel, freight and logistics services, tailored to each and every one of those customers’ unique needs and requirements.

As of August 30, 2018, Dicom was sold to General Logistics Systems (GLS). This will allow Dicom to have access to the complete GLS network and allow for expansion into international services.

The fusion between the two company will offer many advantages to our employees, clients and partners.

Please take note that GLS Canada is subscribed to a pay equity in employment. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted

We provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and Employees and do not discriminate on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, record of offences, marital status, family status, disability or any other characteristic protected by local law.

title: $5,000 SIGNING BONUS & RELOCATION ASSISTANCE AVAILABLE** Tra...
description:
COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement: Pursuant to the Government of Canada's mandate that all federally-regulated employers require their employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, CP requires all prospective employees to confirm their vaccination status, or have an approved Transport Canada exemption, as part of the hiring process and as a condition of continued employment.


NEW HIRE CONDUCTORS WILL RECEIVE A $5,000 SIGNING BONUS AND RELOCATION ASSISTANCE!! (must commit to working for CP for one year or the signing bonus and relocation bonus will be repayable). Current and previous Canadian Pacific employees are not eligible to receive the signing bonus)


Earn $85,000 in your first year working as a qualified conductor. The average conductor earns approximately $107,000 annually, with the ability to make up to $140,000.


  • Req ID: 88784
  • Department: Operations Pacific Division
  • Job Type: Full-Time
  • Position Type: Union
  • Location: Revelstoke, British Columbia
  • Country: Canada
  • Job Available to: Internal & External
  • Deadline to apply: 05/31/2022

Conductor Training Class - No Experience Required!


**We are currently collecting resumes for current and future openings in 2022**



This is an exciting opportunity to join CP in an entry level Railroading position, where no previous railroad experience is required. We provide 16 weeks of paid training. Other exciting benefits you can expect are a Defined Benefit Pension Plan, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Tuition Reimbursement Program and more!


This is a Safety Critical position, which will require pre-employment checks that can take multiple weeks to complete once successfully selected. For transparency in the recruitment process (9-12 weeks), the steps in the recruitment process include:



1. Collect and gather applicants (2-3 weeks)
2. Screen and interview candidates (2-3 weeks)
3. Criminal, Drug and Medical Clearances (3-4 weeks)
4. Notice period for new hires to current employers (2-3 weeks)


To see the if the Conductor position is a good fit for you, please complete this Realist Job Preview prior to applying: https://www.cpconductor.rjp.cdglhosting.com/


Canadian Pacific is a transcontinental railway in Canada and the United States with direct links to major ports on the west and east coasts. CP provides North American customers a competitive rail service with access to key markets in every corner of the globe. CP is growing with its customers, offering a suite of freight transportation services, logistics solutions and supply chain expertise. Visit cpr.ca to see the rail advantages of CP. For more on our purpose, culture, and strategy, visit cpr.ca/en/about-cp.


POSITION DESCRIPTION:

Are you looking for an exciting career? Becoming a Train Conductor is the perfect career for you! As a Train Conductor you will start your rewarding long term career at CP.


As a Train Conductor you will work as a member of a train crew that will assist with switching cars, making or splitting up trains in yards, or moving cars between yards, sidings or tracks;


POSITION ACCOUNTABILITIES:

  • Work in either train or yard service depending on their seniority;
  • Carry out specific instructions detailing a train's route and specific movements;
  • Handle the switching of cars, including coupling and uncoupling cars, and is able to lift out coupling device;
  • Observe, interpret, and relay signals and other indications affecting movement of train;
  • Signal crew members for movement of the engine or train using specific signals, or radio to indicate when to start, stop, back-up, set or release air brakes;
  • Provide flag protection and relays signals to trains in an emergency situation, as stipulated in the operating rules;
  • Move on and off moving or stationary equipment while train is performing industrial, station, or yard switching;
  • Ride moving car by hanging onto grab irons or ladder, sometimes for extended periods of time;
  • Fill out forms including train orders and switch lists and prepares required clear and legible reports;
  • Work irregular hours, including holidays, weekends, days and nights and for periods of time up to 12 hours;
  • Must be constantly alert to changing conditions and events and take safe and responsible action as required.

POSITION REQUIREMENTS:

  • High School Graduation or General Equivalency Diploma (GED);
  • 3 to 5 years’ work experience with a demonstrated safe work record;
  • Valid driver's license is required;
  • Must be at least 18 years old;
  • Demonstrated mechanical aptitude;
  • Must be able to work with minimal supervision;
  • Able to take action and/or make decisions affecting security/well-being of others, i.e. alerting others to unsafe conditions;
  • Must have good spatial ability with regard to a sense of layout and space, together with an ability to judge speed and/or distance of moving objects;
  • Able to communicate effectively both oral and in written;
  • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to operate as a contributing member of a team;
  • Must be prepared to work weekends and shifts - on call 24 hours/day with 2 Hours’ notice depending on location, (with exception of Annual Vacation);
  • Work may require extended time away from home;
  • Must be able to pass the required examinations, read and understand safety instructions, books of rules, instructions and regulations, timetables, bulletins, waybills, placards, and other written or printed material;
  • Must be prepared to work in adverse weather conditions;
  • May be required to lift up to 80 lbs.
  • Must be able to cross the United States border for work purposes;
  • Must be able to obtain a passport.

WHAT CP HAS TO OFFER:

  • Competitive benefits package
  • Competitive company pension plan
  • Annual Fitness Subsidy

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:


Medical Requirements:

Operating safely is a core foundation of CP. Our commitment is to protect our people, customers, communities in which we operate, the environment and our assets. We are also committed to a healthy and safe workplace. CP’s Alcohol and Drug Policy and Procedures (“Policy and Procedures”) support these commitments. All new hires for a safety critical position will be required to complete a pre-employment medical that includes a physical, vision, hearing, alcohol and drug audit assessment. Pre-employment qualification drug test(s) are also required. This includes candidates participating in the Trainee Program who will also be required to pass a drug test during the training process before receiving final qualification for the position.


Background Investigation:

The successful candidate will need to successfully complete the following clearances:

  • Criminal history check
  • Reference check
  • Education verification
  • Driver's License Verification

CP is an equal opportunity employer committed to the principles of employment equity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals. All applicant information will be managed in accordance with the federal Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act ("PIPEDA").

title: Window Cleaner/Driver
description:
Job details

Salary: $18 - $39

Job Type: Full-time

Number of hires for this role: 2

  • We believe that your personality and attitude is MUCH more important than your qualifications.
  • We have excellent on-site training for the right candidate.
  • No experience required for this amazing opportunity.

Required Qualifications

  • Car
  • Valid Driver's License

Benefits

  • Full Benefits Package after 3 months
  • Hard work = Recognition, Incentives, Rewards & Employee Discounts
  • Guaranteed hourly pay by the job plus easy commission bonus pay

Full Job Description
No Experience Required! Earn Up to $80,000 per year

You don't like being stuck indoors in an office??? Come work for us and have fun enjoy the weather and work outdoors.

We are seeking diligent workers and intrapreneurial minds. We want people that are highly motivated and have a passion for having fun and building relationships through customer service. We are looking for Brand Ambassadors! We value workers who see the company they work for as their own and understand that they can create their future.

Experience in any service industry is a huge plus, but is not necessary. You must also be comfortable with heights and working on ladders.

Our services include but not limited to:

  • Window Cleaning
  • Pressure washing
  • Soft washing
  • Gutter Cleaning

If you want to join our team of exceptional professionals, apply today. Our team members

can earn up to $80,000 per year with a great work-life balance!

The Vision:

We want to PUSH the Boundaries of the industry

We want to create an experience for homeowners to understand the value of

having their homes serviced for them and how their quality of life will increase

Want more? Climb the ladder of success with our team and really watch your professional

career take off!

We believe in internal promoting and will inspire you to grow to your full potential

The Atmosphere:

Our team is held to a high standard. And we are a family! In order to create a modern

service experience, our service technicians are compensated for bringing innovative ideas to the company. We thrive in a setting that allows us to have open communication and work together as a team to create something bigger, and to create synergy!

What we are NOT?

We pride ourselves in being diligent doers and focus on being exceptional while we deliver excellent customer service. We do not cut corners or reduce our standards, so we expect you to provide a great experience and build loyalty with every customer, every day! We put a premium on a positive team mindset. We cannot accept a negative work environment.

Do you meet the above standards, want to build a career, and like to join our family? Then

apply today!

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Commission pay
  • Tips

License/Certification:

Driver's License (Required)

Work Location:

Multiple locations throughout the Greater Ottawa Area

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $18.00-$39.00 per hour

  • Commission pay
  • Overtime pay
  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Discounted or free food
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • Paid time off
  • Store discount
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Licence/Certification:

  • G2 or G drivers License? (required)

Expected start date: 2022-04-18

title: Autoramp Assistant
description:
Role:

Automotive Assistants are responsible for the safe unloading, loading, and placement of vehicles in a safe and timely manner that responds to the customers’ needs.For more information about the position please click here: http://www.cn.ca/en/your-industry/automotive

Critical Performance areas:
  • Performing yard checks and inventory updates
  • Operating, loading and unloading ramps
  • Opening and closing railway car doors
  • Removing and Installing vehicle blocks
  • Installation and removal of bridge plates between railway cars. Bridge plates are the link or connection between the railway car junctions used to bridge the gap

Working Conditions:
  • Working shifts, weekends, and holidays
  • Frequent lifting weights up to 50 pounds
  • Able to work outdoors in extreme weather conditions
  • Physical work, being able to walk long distances, climb railcar ladders and crouching inside railcars

Employment Requirements:
  • High School degree or equivalence
  • Must possess a valid class 5 driver license, and be able to drive a manual transmission
  • Minimum two years’ driving experience
  • Clean driving record is a must, no infractions in the last five years. The candidate will have to provide their driving record
  • Good teamwork and communication skills
  • Good hand-eye coordination
  • Technology and computer skills that apply to the job
  • Ability to correctly analyze a situation and respond appropriately

Training:

Automotive Assistants are given a 2 day classroom training with a health & safety team member covering the theory of CN’s rules, polices, procedures, and safety measures at the Automotive Facility. This is followed by a 2 week on the job practical training. New hire is then mentored and coached during the 3 month probation period.

Salary:
Hourly rate up $28.61.

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.


CN requires that all employees be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. The Company’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly owned subsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers and anyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

title: Sign Installer - Commercial
description:
Regent Signs is a small, family-run business that manufactures and installs signage in Edmonton and area. We believe that you should enjoy what you’re doing; our owners and staff work hard together to achieve our company goals and have fun along the way!

We are looking to hire a Commercial Sign Installer. This job lets you move around, enjoy the outdoors, and gain new skills or refine existing ones.

As a Commercial Sign Installer, you will:

-Install large Commercial and Development signage

-Organize your daily tasks by efficiently planning and scheduling your jobs

-Prioritize projects

-Track jobs & paperwork communicating to both the office and clients via phone and email with some on-site meetings with clients
-Provide general labor support to our fabrication shop as needed
-Create Sign Stands, keep materials needed for install organized and ordered.

The perfect person for this job is someone who:

-Has a valid driver's license
-Can lift 100+ lbs
-Has organization skills
-Can work independently
-Is dedicated to a high quality of workmanship
-Has a great attitude and is willing to assist and work together with others in a team atmosphere

We're looking for someone who may already have these skills, but are open to providing training/growth opportunities in these areas:

-Mapping and driving in Edmonton and surrounding areas
-Using power and manual tools

-Other equipment operating experience ie) skid steer, trailer, man lift

You will be working Monday to Friday from 9am until 5pm.

At Regent Signs, we believe in working together to provide our customers with quality products and great experiences (and to cover Edmonton with our signs!) We're always excited to see the results of our hard work all over the city and beyond. If you are looking for a fun and dynamic work environment and want to join our team please send us your resume!

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $17.00-$21.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Overtime

Application question(s):

  • Are you able to produce a clean drivers abstract and if not how many demerits do you have and what are they for?
  • How comfortable are you with basic car maintenance? For example have you done oil changes, changed a tire, tire rotations etc.?
  • How soon are you available?
  • How many years have you been driving?
  • How well do you know your way around the City of Edmonton? Please include how you would locate an address without GPS or Google Maps.

description:
We are expanding and looking to hire a full-time Pest Control Technician. Duties include:

  • Invoice clients, collect payments and completes a daily report of work completed.
  • Work after hours, early mornings, evenings, late nights etc. in case requested by client or required by the nature of job being rendered.

title: Landscaping Technician
description:
We are currently seeking rock star landscapers for our growing company! We are looking for hardscapers, landscape installers, paver layers, brick layers, anyone with landscape construction experience.

Our growth is massively exceeding our staff which means its time to hire a few more crews. We take so much pride in our work its no wonder we cant keep up! We treat our employees and our customers like our business depends on it - because that is 100% true and we know it. Our team members are a part of our ever growing family and once they are here - they stay! This is because we believe in working hard to play hard after - But only AFTER the work is done to our standards. We work a FOUR DAY WORKWEEK!! WOOHOO!!!!

In addition to steady and continuous work, we offer BBQ's every Friday with 1 Friday out of every month being a HUGE BBQ with all our staff and suppliers and friends who come on down to enjoy our free beer and food and very own DJ! Its a blast!

Alright, so we are fun, thats great! But who will fit in to this tight knighted company who aims for only the very top? Well, we want:

- Learners who are reliable and follow direction well. Do you want to learn the craft from the best? Then apply.

- We also want the best of the best for team leads - if this is you then apply immediately with your experience.

We surround ourselves with people we like to be around, which is why we are all hard working professionals who are also a bunch of goof balls.

A driver's license and comfort driving pickup trucks, is an asset.
Previous work experience in landscaping, horticulture, gardening, or construction.
Experience safely operating power tools and other maintenance equipment.
Working phone, with data preferred.

Email your resume asap with a brief description about yourself and your experiences in the email. *Either that or attach a cover letter to your application

***If you do not write a short email describing yourself or attach a cover letter we will likely not respond.*****

Benefits:
Flexible working hours
Take time off whenever needed!
Company Truck
Possibility of Benefits.
4% Paid Vacation
Year Round, Full-Time Employment if wanted!
Great Work-Life Balance
We don't Work Weekends, Evenings or Holidays
Huge growth potential
Performance baised raises!
Amazing educational opportunities
Perks & Discounts at local restaurants
Surrounded by like minded hard workers (Whoever doesnt fit in will get weeded out by natural selection)

Landscape construction

Building dream backyards for customers which includes but is not limited to:
Retaining walls, artificial grass, decks, fences, sod install, paving stones, walkways, driveways, excavation, planting etc.

We offer the opportunity for lots of growth within the company. We are growing RAPIDLY.
Estimated hours: Monday - Thurs 7-5

  • On-site gym

title: Estimating Assistant Co-Op
description:
Coco Paving is looking to hire 3 Estimating Assistant Co-Op Students for Summer 2022 for the following locations Belleville, Kingston & Morrisburg. Coco Paving Inc. is a division of the Coco Group, a vertically integrated heavy civil infrastructure and development company with over 50 years of expertise.

Coco specializes in a wide range of heavy civil construction services and material products. In addition to the heavy civil construction company, Coco Group owns and operates a precast manufacturing facility (Co-Pipe Products), asphalt cement terminal (Coco Asphalt Engineering), portable concrete batch plants, and a number of pits, quarries and asphalt plants.

Since 1964, Coco Paving is proud to continue as a family owned and operated entity, successfully executing its vision, through on time and on budget execution and completion of its projects to the satisfaction of our customers.

Job Duties & Responsibilities

This position will support the Estimating and Operations Department, performing a variety of functions to support the day-to-day operations and projects.

Duties include but are not limited to:

  • Assist Construction Manager and Field Manager in all aspects of construction project management
  • Project Management of assigned jobs, process from beginning to end
  • Assist with procurement and schedule management of field crews and sub-contractors and corresponding equipment requirements
  • Review and process shop drawings & submittals
  • Process change orders to ensure costing is tracked and invoiced
  • Review and understand architectural and engineering drawings and specifications
  • Assist with field measurements, site meetings, health, and safety management
  • Assist with costing, risk management and quality control
  • Performing Takeoffs and reading drawings
  • Tracking job progress
  • Assisting project managers, supervisors and foreman’s in day to day activities
  • Preparing and managing traffic control plans

Skills & Qualifications

  • Proficient with MS Word and intermediate to advanced Excel skills
  • Strong planning and project management skills
  • Keen eye for detail
  • A high level of integrity, confidentiality, professionalism and accountability
  • Strong organizational and multi-tasking skills
  • Effective interpersonal communication skills
  • Strong written communication skills
  • Typical Work week is a minimum 44 hours
  • All applicants must have a valid Class G driver's license
  • Car required

Job Types: Full-time, Internship / Co-op
Contract length: 4 months

Salary: $19.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Expected start date: 2022-05-02

title: Heavy Haul Highway Truck Driver (Ruth Lake)
description:
Position Scope:
This position is based in Fort McMurray, NO CAMP provided working Monday to Friday (40+ hours per week).
Responsibilities:
  • Class 1 air brakes with minimum 5 years of experience
  • Journeyman Crane Ticket is considered an asset
  • Experience in car carriers/deck trucks or slide axle trailers /highboy/step deck and 10 axle trailer
  • Experience in loading and unloading all types of components
  • Must have load securement knowledge
  • Must be Local & familiar with all sites (SITE ORIENTED PREFERRED)
  • This job position is very demanding, there is a lot of climbing, squatting, crouching and kneeling etc.
  • Monday to Friday (occasional Saturdays)
  • No Camp/No Flights
  • Must have good communication skills

Summary:
All successful candidates must:
  • Be proficient in English, both verbally and written
  • Have a valid Class 5 Driver’s License
  • Have experience as requested as mentioned above
  • Undergo and successfully pass the following testing:
    • Breath Alcohol Test
    • Urine Drug Test
    • Fitness-to-Work Assessment
    • Audiometric Testing
    • Vision Screening
    • Criminal Record Check
Shift, site, and start times are subject to change.

All successful candidates MUST provide the following items prior to confirmation of their start date:
  • CSO or OSSA (BSO) Certification
  • Copy of Valid Class 5 Driver’s License
  • Copy of recent Driver’s Abstract
  • VOID cheque/direct deposit form
Once dispatched the following processes will occur:
  • Will receive a call from NACG to set up all required pre-employment testing
  • An email will be sent with all required New Hire Paperwork to be filled out
  • After all results are received by NACG candidates will be contacted by Site Admin to schedule orientation and confirm your start date and other site specific details.
Please note the entire On-boarding process can take anywhere from 3-8 business days.

NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE, SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED VIA PHONE OR EMAIL.
Overview:
North American Construction Group (NACG) has served as an industry leader in the heavy construction and mining industries for over 65 years. In that time, we’ve proven ourselves as a safe and reliable contractor who can complete projects of any size and scope. We’ve also taken a number of bold steps forward to broaden our footprint, expanding to mines outside our provincial borders, and providing third-party maintenance services to clients and customers.
In addition to providing employees with rewarding careers, North American has a whole lot more to offer:
  • Significant Growth – As a company, NACG is rapidly expanding, and has practically doubled in size over the past year alone.
  • Long Term Contracts – With over $1 billion dollars in contracted work booked through 2023, NACG can provide long term employment solutions and numerous opportunities for advancement.
  • Commitment To Safety – With a top tier record for safety performance, NACG is dedicated to ensuring that everyone gets home safe, and constantly strives for a goal zero performance.
  • Competitive Compensation – NACG provides competitive compensation packages for all employees.
North American Construction Group is an equal opportunity employer, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected.

Become a member of the North American family today!

title: Drivers & Chasers for Designated Driving Company (Drive Smar...
description:
Help us reduce drinking and driving in Victoria- have fun and get paid while doing it! Apply to be a Driver or a Chaser with Drive Smart Designated Drivers

Drive Smart is a designated driving company that drives customers home in their own vehicles. To accomplish this we work in a driver/chaser pair.

The Driver drives the customer home in the customers car, while the Chaser follows in their own car to chauffeur the Driver from trip to trip

Qualifications for each position
1. DRIVER- Drives the customers car, must be able to drive manual transmission and be comfortable driving a variety of different cars. A Class 5 Canadian Drivers License is required.

2. CHASER- Uses their own vehicle to transport the Driver. A Class 5 or "N" Canadian Drivers License is Required. It is beneficial that your car is fuel efficient for this position.

3. We also hire in TEAMS, if you have a friend/family worker/partner/co worker in mind apply as a Driver/Chaser TEAM and work your shifts together.

Hours of operation
Sunday-Wednesday 6pm-12:30
Thursday 6pm-1am
Friday & Saturday 6pm-2am (weekend shifts are approximately 5-6 hours with start times at 6pm, 7pm, 8pm, 9pm and 10 pm)

Head to https://drivesmartvictoria.com/become-a-driver/ for answers to FAQ's

Apply today and we'll email you back to schedule a 5 minute informational phone call

Job Type: Part-time

Salary: $75.00-$125.00 per day

Additional pay:

  • Tips

Schedule:

  • Weekend availability

title: newDelivery Driver
description:
1-800 Radiator & A/C seeking a Delivery Driver to join our team. The right candidate should be a positive individual, a team player, and have a great attitude – the rest we can teach, but we can’t teach a great attitude! The position could result in the development and promotional opportunities for the ideal candidate.

Ideal Candidate:

· A team player, someone willing to step in and help out in all tasks and works well with others

· Willing to learn and has a positive attitude to work

· Excellent communication skills

· Knowledge of the automotive industry or cars, in general, is a plus but is not required

· Clean driving record, a driver’s abstract will be required prior to hire

· Previous warehouse experience is an asset

· Previous delivery driver experience is an asset

Primary Responsibilities:

· Delivering parts (company vehicle) to customers in the local area. This is the primary responsibility

· Picking orders

· Assist to load and unload trucks

· Assist to move and stack materials

· General housekeeping duties in the warehouse or production area and duties as assigned

What we offer:

· Unlimited Candy!

· We provide the delivery vehicle

· Great working environment in a growing company

· Career opportunities for the right individual

As one of the largest independent auto parts distributors in the nation, 1-800-RADIATOR & A/C sells more than 1,000,000 radiators every year with more than 200 locations. 1-800-RADIATOR & A/C has the largest inventory of radiators, condensers, air conditioning parts, fan assemblies, fuel pumps, and related parts in the nation.

Driven Brands is the world’s leading automotive aftermarket franchise company. Based in Charlotte, North Carolina, the company’s growing portfolio of brands includes Meineke Car Care Centers, MAACO Collision Repair and Auto Painting, 1-800 Radiator, and CARSTAR.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $15.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Experience:

  • Warehouse: 1 year (preferred)
  • delivery driving: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Class G Licence (preferred)

title: Recruiter - AZ Drivers (Contract)
description:
Now Hiring

DRIVER RECRUITER - Contract


At Canada Cartage we work with intelligent and focused leaders who are driven to create an outstanding customer experience in partnership with Canadian leading brands. Canada Cartage is deep rooted in family values with an entrepreneurial culture where ideas are welcomed, growth is fostered and high performance is championed. A recognized thought leader and founded in 1914, Canada Cartage dominates the industry by delivering innovative fleet solutions.

We are currently looking to add a Contract Recruiter for AZ Drivers. Someone who is equally passionate about serving the community and achieving operational success alongside our dedicated and loyal employees.

This is a hands-on role with involvement at every step of the recruitment cycle, from requisitions to on-boarding. This position involves local travel, mostly locally. It’s expected that this person will spend time out of the office, out on the road recruiting drivers and promoting the industry and Canada Cartage. This may include some evenings and weekends.

Responsibilities:

Driver Recruiting: Full life cycle of recruiting

Pro-actively developing a network of potential candidates and sources
Sourcing and interviewing candidates; reviewing resumes, credentials; verifying backgrounds
Ensuring qualified candidates complete the recruitment process, including coordinating road tests and orientations
Preparing and presenting offer letters, new hire packages
May also include participating in Orientations and post-hire follow-up


Metrics: Measuring the success of recruiting initiatives

Accountable for measuring results and meeting objectives including: time-to-fill, quality candidates (road test success rate, quality of hire metric, turnover metrics)
Providing reports and updates to others as required

Core Competencies and Qualification:

  • Must have recent hands-on experience recruiting drivers within the transportation industry, in a fast-paced environment where he/she is accountable for results (5+ years of experience)
  • Must have knowledge of competitive driver compensation packages, and a strong sense of what makes a good driver and what it takes to keep a good driver within a competitive industry
  • Knowledge of industry trends
  • Must have a strong sense of urgency and accountability
  • Strong English communication skills, including writing
  • Good computer skills including MS Outlook, Word and Excel
  • Must be able to work well within a team, while at the same time be responsible for his/her own results and be able to be self-sufficient
  • Must be organized and professional
  • University degree or post-secondary education preferred


Why work for Canada Cartage?

Our Team

We are a family-oriented company with competitive benefits, including extended health and dental, RRSP and Company-Matching pension plans; discounted hotels, car rentals, entertainment, gym memberships, phone plans, electronics, to name a few of the perks; a cohesive team and a positive, hard-working atmosphere. We have fun events throughout the year, like truck rodeos, summer barbeques and driver-appreciation week that regularly bring us together. It’s important to give back to the communities in which we operate, so we volunteer with and donate to local charities

We also have Company wide recognition initiatives designed to recognize drivers and staff when they demonstrate outstanding customer service, teamwork and our core values.

Why do we have one of the lowest driver turn-over rates in Canada? A team environment, short-haul regular routes and great benefits. Come work with us: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rpMA1riOzPI


Recognized leader in the industry:

Canada Cartage has been recognized on the Forbes list of Canada’s Best Employers 2022. This is the sixth straight year that Canada Cartage has been included on this list. https://www.forbes.com/companies/canada-cartage/?list=canada-best-employers&sh=7841454553d8

The Canada’s Best Employers 2022 title, along with our 6th year of being recognized by Trucking HR as one of Canada’s “Top Fleet Employers” serves to reinforce Canada Cartage’s reputation as an employer of high quality.

We’re growing! We have also been ranked in the top 10 of Today’s Trucking top 100 ranking of Canada’s largest for-hire truck fleets for 2022. https://hubs.la/Q017bTLd0

Celebrating 100 years: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b3S-CtHQhVY


Our Values

Integrity: We conduct our business with honour, honest and ethics with our people, the environment and legal matters. We believe I being transparent and trustworthy, respecting the traditional “handshake” value system and earning our way in.

Humanity: We are a family minded organization, caring for people and treating them with dignity, decency and respect, be it employees, customers, suppliers or our partners. Open door policy and dealings is our way.

Accountability: Accountability and accessibility to our staff, customers and our customers’ customers is of utmost importance to us. We enable a high level of two way communication, providing access to people who wil deal with issues ad have the willingness to resolve things. We will be relied on and held accountable for our results and our long term commitments.

Collaboration: We understand that results are the product of a team effort. As part of our process, we ensure collaboration with all our staff at all levels in all roles across departmental lines. With our customers, we use a collaborative style approach, sharing ownership to ensure a successful operation.

Dedication: Our organization is employee and customer-driven. We encourage an environment of conscientious effort and earnestness, hiring problem solvers who are responsive and have a "can-do" attitude to get the job done.

Leadership: Personal leadership to us means being competent, taking ownership, demonstrating initiative, and having a voice. Corporate leadership to us means being leaders in the market, continuous improvement and innovation, and empowering those around you. https://jobs.jobvite.com/canadacartage

Come work with an industry leader!


We would like to thank all those expressing an interest in this position; however only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Committed to employment equity, Canada Cartage Systems LP encourages applications from Aboriginal people, members of visible minority groups, and women.

title: Accounts Executive
description:
We are Ria Money Transfer

Ria Money Transfer was founded in 1987 with a single storefront in New York City, delivering remittances to the Dominican Republic. Now, with more than 500,000 locations, in 165 countries and employing over 4,000 people, we've become the second-largest money transfer company in the world.

We are looking to hire an Account Executive who will be responsible for identifying new business relationships and growing our existing agents. This position reports directly to the Regional Manager and is a part of the Canada sales team. The Account Executive's territory is the greater Toronto area (GTA East) and requires excellent communication skills in English and other languages to meet our business needs for our clients.

Responsibilities

  • Install and remove existing equipment and/or debit terminals at new and existing agent locations
  • Train and support new and existing agents and assist them with troubleshooting equipment
  • Other duties and/or technical projects as assigned by direct manager
  • Source new prospect Agents and manage the entire sales process from identifying prospects, cold calling, face to face meetings, conducting presentations and user demonstrations
  • Deliver a target of minimum 4 new Agents monthly
  • Manage the assigned Agent network (organic) and sustainably grow the transaction volume
  • Manage the new Agent onboarding applications, installations and training process
  • Train and support new and existing agents and assist them with troubleshooting equipment
  • Provide the agents with standard point of sales material and support with AR/Compliance training
  • Increase sales and market share of existing products (money transfers, bill payments)
  • Analyze company reports and market data to address, reinforce and correct performance trends to capitalize on market opportunities for new and existing Agents in the assigned territory
  • Provide fact-based recommendations on product pricing and Agent commissions
  • Regularly visit top productive Agents in the assigned territory, monitor performance vs monthly targets, personnel training needs, customer dynamics and create sustainable relationships
  • Execute both self-conceived and assigned marketing plans to support transaction growth
  • Supports various departments at headquarters to ensure that Agents comply with company policies, compliance guidelines and procedures

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business or equivalent work experience
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English other languages to meet our business needs for our customers
  • Two or more years of experience in outside sales, business development and account management
  • Must possess experience in cold calling, product demonstration and selling products or services
  • Ability to travel within assigned territory daily, have a valid work permit and driver license
  • Reliable owned automobile transportation (car allowance provided)
  • Must be able to maintain an acceptable driving record and auto insurance coverage
  • Able to work occasionally on weekends to participate in community and marketing events
  • Must possess intermediate computer skills in Microsoft Office

Key Characteristics

  • Strong interpersonal and time management skills, self-motivated and works well under no supervision
  • Ability to effectively present information in meetings with customers, Agents, and other employees of the organization

Working Conditions

  • Ability to work from office, from home and travel to assigned territory as needed
  • Ability to sit for prolonged periods of time as a driver in an automobile
  • Ability to visit businesses and work in tight places to install equipment or marketing materials
  • Ability to lift a maximum of 11.3 kilograms / 25 pounds

We Offer

Base salary and monthly commissions. Benefits so you can take care of your family. Paid time off, sick time, and paid holidays. We reimburse work-related expenses. Growth opportunities within the organization.

Join Us

Does this sound like you? Does Ria sound like the company you've been looking for? We hope you can help us on our mission to open ways for a better everyday life for our customers, our clients, and our employees.

Apply Today!

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $35,000.00-$85,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Commission pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

title: newExterior Cleaning Tech
description:
• Window Butler is hiring 2-4 exterior cleaning technicians (window cleaning, pressure washing, gutter cleaning).
  • This job is mainly completing a route/list of jobs with 1-2 people across Ottawa using company vehicle to get around and to and from work each day (typically)
  • If you are looking for a low stress, high job satisfaction position this could be for you. Once you learn our systems/methods there isn't a ton of oversight (the clients usually let us know if there's a problem!)
  • The job is mainly outdoor physical work with and without ladders and use of equipment to provide exterior building cleaning services to residential and commercial clients.
  • If you don't want to be stuck inside this summer then this job could be perfect.
  • If you want to earn more there are overtime opportunities as well as commission for jobsite sales.
  • Industry experience is an asset but other similar experience (home services, ladder experience, automotive detailing, etc) also a good qualification.
  • Attention to detail is a definite asset.
  • Window Butler has been in business 15 years in Ottawa and steadily growing.
  • Experience pressure washing an asset
  • No criminal records, must be able to get reliability status or already holding a clearance.
  • Experience/Comfortable with - Using ladders, working with extension poles, working at heights, heavy lifting, etc.
  • Work - This position is only for low-rise commercial, residential, and some boom work.
  • Boom license an asset but not required.
  • Working at Heights required, (we can help arrange training to be certified if needed)
  • Company vehicles are provided
  • Must have a valid driver's license, if you do not have one we will not hire you.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $18.00-$25.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Commission pay
  • Overtime pay
  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Company car
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
We work outside and in small teams so not a big concern.

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Ottawa, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

  • Maintenance: 1 year (preferred)
  • Window Cleaning: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • G2 Driver's License (required)

Application deadline: 2022-05-13

title: Owner - Operator Driver Recruiter
description:
Now Hiring

OWNER OPERATOR – DRIVER RECRUITER

Canada Cartage is deep rooted in family values with an entrepreneurial culture where ideas are welcomed, growth is fostered and high performance is championed. We are currently looking to add a full-time Recruiter, specializing in Owner/Operators, to our team. Someone who is equally passionate about serving the community and achieving operational success alongside our dedicated and loyal employees.

Located at our Davand location in Mississauga, the Owner Operator Recruiter is responsible to grow our Owner Operator pool in Ontario and ensure our Owner Operators are capitalizing on their maximum revenue capabilities. This position will contribute to the broader vision, strategy and roadmap for attracting and retaining Owner Operators who are driven to build, grow and win.

This opportunity comes with a great compensation package which includes a stable base salary and commission structure with expected earnings to be at $120,000/year.

  • Growing our Owner Operator pool by attracting and retaining talent
  • Working closely with the recruitment sourcing team to identify the best suited Owner Operator candidates
  • Building an end to end talent journey
  • Ensuring it is widely known that Canada Cartage is an employer of choice
  • Ensuring our recruitment process is fair, inclusive, diverse and attracting the best
  • Measuring clearly defined metrics that will be used to assess and assist Owner Operator performance
  • A strong focus on retention initiatives and programs


Who you are:

  • You have a love for working with people and setting them up for success
  • You have a minimum of 5 years operational background in transportation, logistics or trucking
  • familiarity working with Owner Operators
  • experience with P&L's, familiarity with truck specs, fuel surcharges, etc.

  • You will successfully pass a criminal background check

The Canada’s Best Employers 2022 title, along with our 6th year of being recognized by Trucking HR as one of Canada’s “Top Fleet Employers” serves to reinforce Canada Cartage’s reputation as an employer of high quality.

We’re growing! We have also been ranked in the top 10 of Today’s Trucking top 100 ranking of Canada’s largest for-hire truck fleets for 2022. https://hubs.la/Q017bTLd0

Humanity: We are a family minded organization, caring for people and treating them with dignity, decency and respect, be it employees, customers, suppliers or our partners. Open door policy and dealings is our way.
