It’s our expertise across the entire vehicle, key strategic partnerships and culture of innovation that allow us to make our industry-leading technologies road-ready. And it is how we’ll continue to build a safer, smarter and more connected mobility experience for all people.']

title: Lube/Tire Tech - Full Time
description:
General Responsibilities

If you're looking for the benefits of joining an industry leader, with a high-charged, energy-filled environment, then you can stop looking, because you have found what you're looking for in the Utility Person position at our Hertz Rent-A-Car location. Bring your energy, drive, and motivation to Hertz, and set your goals on cruise control! The Hertz Corporation, a world leader in the car rental industry, currently seeks energetic team players to join our team.

Duties include changing oil, changing tires, and 13-point inspections.  Must be a quick learner, and have some auto mechanical knowledge.  Applicants must have an assortment of tools, oil filter wrenches, socket set, and a toolbox to keep them in. Must be able to work flexible shifts including weekends and holidays; and work overtime as required.

 

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Perform preventative and routine maintenance on vehicles such as changing oil, changing and rotating tires, changing light bulbs, repairing/replacing brake pads, and checking fluids.
  • Work with Mechanic in repairing out-of-service and warranty vehicles; inspect vehicles to document associated problems, cause and actions needed to repair vehicle; log status of repaired vehicles to computers.
  • Work with Mechanic or Fleet Manager with in-fleeting and turning-back vehicles by preparing vehicles for rental and/or delivering vehicles to auction
  • Receive and respond to customer complaints or problems such as disabled vehicles, vehicle lock-outs, and locating repair shops or dealerships.
  • Maintain the cleanliness of work area.
  • Perform various warranty repairs as identified in technical service bulletins and/or recall notices.
  • Perform related responsibilities as required or assigned.

Essential Requirements

Knowledge and Skill

  • Knowledge of automotive repair and operating procedures.
  • Knowledge of CRT operation.
  • Ability to operate mechanical tools including tire machines, balance machines, battery chargers, and AC vacuum motors.
  • Basic knowledge of the car rental industry.
  • Good oral and written communication skills.
  • Ability to prioritize work.
  • Ability to write clearly and concisely.
  • Ability to understand and follow oral and written directions.

Required Education/Experience

  • High School Diploma or Equivalent
  • Vocational Training or the equivalent in Automotive Mechanics or a related field
  • Valid driver's license.

At Hertz, we champion and celebrate a culture of diversity and inclusion. We take affirmative steps to promote employment and advancement opportunities. The endless variety of perspectives, experiences, skills and talents that our employees invest in their work every day represent a significant part of our culture – and our success and reputation as a company.

Individuals are encouraged to apply for positions because of the characteristics that make them unique. 

Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Hertz is a drug free workplace.

EOE, including disability/veteran

title: Delivery Driver
description:
Delivery Driver
Salary:$21.00/hour
Shift: Monday-Friday (Early Start Times). NO WEEKENDS!!
Perks: Hourly increase possible after 60 days, 6 months, & 1 year. **$1,000 sign-on bonus!** (Paid out as $500 after 6 months & $500 after 12 months of continuous employment as a full-time employee)!

What can Keystone Automotive Operations do for YOU?
KAO provides its employees with more than a job;we provide them with a career. Our company believes in offering its employees the opportunity tolearnandgrowusingcompetitive training programs, coaching, communication, and collaboration.This empowers our employees, further allowing them to pursue both functional and upward mobility within the company. Keystone Automotive Operations also offers:
  • Company paid training
  • Company provided uniforms & steel toe footwear
  • Medical, Dental, & Vision Insurance available
  • RSP (Retirement Savings Plan)
  • Paid Company Holidays, Paid Time Off
  • Tuition Reimbursement for Employees
  • Employee Discounts
  • And More!

Who is Keystone Automotive Operations?
We are the leading distributor of specialty automotive and RV aftermarket parts and accessories, and we have developed a culture of family that has allowed our business to grow across the globe.

With our more than 2,000 employees, we strive to reflect this culture by living our values ofCommitment, Customer Service, Execution, Integrity, Leadership, Teamwork, & Fun. Through these values, we’ve been able to provide our employees with the tools they need to succeed. That’s because when you succeed, we succeed at our goal ofdelivering the products that people need when they need them!

Your Role with Keystone Automotive Operations
Keystone Automotive Operations, Inc. is currently looking to hire Delivery Drivers for our Mississauga, ONlocation. Our drivers provide a face-to-face delivery service to our customers. In addition to our full-time schedule & excellent benefits, our delivery vehicles are equipped with heat, A/C, and are regularly maintained!

Responsibilities Include:
  • Having fun while being safe!
  • Driving company vehicles in a responsible manner.
  • Delivering invoiced product to our customers.
  • Accurately and carefully loading & unloading product.
  • Providing excellent customer service.
  • Communicating well with team members and management.
  • Maintaining a clean, professional appearance.
Basic Qualifications:
  • Must be 21 years of age or older
  • At least 6 months experience driving 15 ft (or bigger) box truck
  • No motor vehicle violations in the last 24 months
  • Ability to lift up to 75 lbs.

title: Automotive Detailer - Part Time
description:
General Responsibilities

Well known for our solid worldwide reputation, Hertz is proud to be the largest car rental company. At Hertz, we know service excellence is built on our employees. 

 

Join the winning team at a company whose reputation speaks for itself…

 

As a Vehicle Service Attendant (VSA)...

 

  • You'll be responsible for vehicle preparation to ensure vehicle is ready for customer pick-up.
  • Drive and park vehicles on-lot as needed.
  • Check for vehicle damage and ensure features of the vehicles are operational.
  • Check vehicle status.  (rentable/non-rentable)
  • Ensure interior of vehicle is clean.  (windows, door jams, trunk, vacuum, etc)
  • Fill gasoline tank and check fill levels of all fluids
  • Clean the exterior of vehicle. (debug and wash)
  • Meet processing and standardization quotas.
  • Perform related tasks as directed by managers.
  • Able to work outdoors in all types of weather conditions.

 

******************

 

Préposé au service pour les véhicules

Largement reconnue pour sa solide réputation mondiale, Hertz est fière d’être la plus grande compagnie de location de voitures au monde. Chez Hertz, nous savons que l’excellence de notre service repose sur nos employés.

 

Joignez-vous à une équipe gagnante, au sein d’une entreprise dont la renommée parle d’elle-même.

 

En tant que préposé au service pour les véhicules, vous aurez les responsabilités suivantes : 

  • Préparer les véhicules afin de vous assurer qu’ils sont prêts au moment où les clients viennent les chercher.
  • Conduire les véhicules et les stationner à leur emplacement au besoin.
  • Inspecter les véhicules pour les dommages et vous assurer que toutes les fonctions de la voiture sont opérationnelles.
  • Vérifier l’état des véhicules (louables ou non).
  • Vérifier que l’intérieur des véhicules est propre (notamment fenêtres et coffre; blocages de portière; passer l’aspirateur, etc.).
  • Remplir le réservoir à essence et vérifier le niveau de tous les liquides.
  • Nettoyer l’extérieur des véhicules (mise au point et nettoyage).
  • Respecter les quotas de traitement et de normalisation.
  • Effectuer les tâches connexes à la demande des gérants.
  • Être en mesure de travailler dehors dans toutes les conditions météorologiques.

Essential Requirements

Educational Background:

  • Secondary School Diploma/GED

 

Professional Experience:

  • Detailing experience preferred.

 

Skills:

  • Must have a valid driver's license and excellent driving record
  • Ability to drive multiple types of vehicles
  • Effective verbal communication skills with customers, co-workers and management

Additional Notes:

  • Must be able to carry out additional duties and responsibilities as assigned by management due to operational needs.
  • Must be able to work days, nights, weekends and holidays.
  • Must be at least 20 years of age.
  • Must be able to work outside year-round.

 

***********************

 

Scolarité :

  • Diplôme d’études secondaires (formation générale).

 

Expérience professionnelle :

  • Detailing experience preferred.

 

Compétences :

  • Doit détenir un permis de conduire valide et un excellent dossier de conducteur.
  • Capacité de conduire plusieurs types de véhicules.
  • Bonnes compétences en communication orale avec les clients, les collègues et la direction.

 

Remarques additionnelles :

  • Doit être capable d’accomplir d’autres tâches et d’assumer des responsabilités supplémentaires, à la demande de la direction, selon les besoins opérationnels.
  • Doit être en mesure de travailler le jour, la nuit, les fins de semaine et les jours de congés fériés.
  • Doit être âgé d’au moins 20 ans.
  • Doit être en mesure de travailler dehors tout au long de l’année.

At Hertz, we champion and celebrate a culture of diversity and inclusion. We take affirmative steps to promote employment and advancement opportunities. The endless variety of perspectives, experiences, skills and talents that our employees invest in their work every day represent a significant part of our culture – and our success and reputation as a company.

Individuals are encouraged to apply for positions because of the characteristics that make them unique. 

Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Hertz is a drug free workplace.

EOE, including disability/veteran

title: Delivery Driver
description:
Position: Delivery Driver

Location: Whistler, BC
Wage: $17-$20

Put yourself in the driver’s seat. Literally. Are you looking for an entry-level job close to home? A job that comes with a company car, too? Join our Whistler, BC, team and let work, work for you.

Lordco Auto Parts is Canada’s largest independently-owned automotive parts retailer, with over 100 locations across Western Canada and is a family-owned and operated business since 1974. Start your career in customer service and grow with us today!

Why work for Lordco?

Our employees are our family, and we want to make sure they are taken care of. Whether you work full-time or part-time, we support the health and well-being of you and your family through quality programs and plans. We want you to feel valued and welcomed within our diverse, inclusive team, and here’s how we do it:

  • $750 Hiring Bonus
  • Refer a friend bonus with amounts up to $1000.
  • Flexible shift/hours to suit your Whistler living
  • Competitive Wages based on experience
  • Potential moving costs provided, as well as a potential increase in wage dependent on commute
  • Ski/bike days: one unpaid day off a month to explore what Whistler has to offer
  • Bike and Ski Pass
  • Extended Benefits for You and Your Family
    • Health and Dental Insurance
    • Vision Care Expense Insurance
    • Short-term and Long-term Disability Insurance
    • Life Insurance
    • Accidental Death & Dismemberment Disability
  • Education and Savings Plans, RRSP matching
  • Health and Wellness program
  • Employee & Family Assistance Program
  • Generous Employee Perks and Discounts
  • Promote-From-Within Culture

Do you fit the part?

Qualifications:

  • Valid Class 7 or 5 License is required with a clean driver’s abstract preferred
  • Excellent customer service skills and the ability to communicate effectively in person and over the phone
  • Strong attention to detail and highly organized with good time management and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team, managing multiple priorities
  • Ability to lift items up to 50lbs and knowledge of workplace safety procedures and the ability to adhere to the Lordco Occupational Health and Safety program

Responsibilities:

  • Deliver automotive parts and accessories to customers using a company vehicle in a safe and timely manner
  • Coordinate deliveries from the store to the customer and communicate with customers regarding order status, ensuring seamless customer service
  • Receive and maintain inventory as well as daily vehicle logs

 Apply now and join our family today!

title: Driver
description:
Overview:

Enterprise Holdings, operating the National, Enterprise, and Alamo car rental brands is looking for a driver to join our amazing team!  Enterprise Holdings is the largest and fastest growing privately owned automotive rental and leasing company in the  North America.    

 

The Driver delivers vehicles and in some instances, customers, employees or vendors safely and timely to the appropriate destination(s) while giving helpful, courteous and professional customer service.

 

This Position is Part Time and Pays $11.45 / hour

 

Branch Location: 1100 SCARTH ST REGINA, SK S4R 2E2

 

Schedules:

  • Sunday: 9:00am - 5:00pm
  • Monday: 1:00pm - 6:00pm
  • Friday: 1:00pm - 6:00pm
  • Saturday: 8:30am - 3:00pm  

 

Responsibilities:

The Part Time Driver is responsible for the transporting of fleet cars and vans to and from rental locations, as well as navigating written directions.

  • Drive and deliver vehicles locally or out of area as needed, following all rules of the road
  • Deliver customers and vehicles to appropriate destination in a safe and courteous manner
  • Ride with or follow another driver to drop off vehicle(s) or pick up multiple vehicles
  • Organize travel route and ensure vehicle paperwork is accurate and timely
  • May need to communicate via 2-way radio or cellular phone
  • May be asked to clean vehicle and/or keep bus clean during shift
  • May be asked to assist customer(s) with directions, car options and basic policy/procedures
  • May be asked to assist customer(s) load and unload luggage, enter and exit vehicle and miscellaneous customer needs
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned
Qualifications:
  • Must be at least 18 years of age
  • Must have a valid driver's license with no more than 2 moving violations and/or at-fault accidents on driving record in the past 3 years
  • No drug or alcohol related convictions on driving record (DWI/DUI) or criminal record within the last 5 years  
  • Must be able to lift 30 lb. in order to assist customers
  • Must be authorized to work in Canada and not require work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future.
  • As per governement mandate, all employees on-site are required to be fully vaccinated per Vaccination Requirement, subject only to limited exceptions mandated by legislation.

title: Account - Logistics Coordinator
description:
Now Hiring

Account / Logistics Coordinator 
Contract

 

At Canada Cartage we work with intelligent and focused leaders who are driven to create an outstanding customer experience in partnership with Canadian leading brands. Canada Cartage is deep rooted in family values with an entrepreneurial culture where ideas are welcomed, growth is fostered and high performance is championed. A recognized thought leader and founded in 1914, Canada Cartage dominates the industry by delivering innovative fleet solutions.

We are currently looking to add an Account Coordinator to our team on a 6 month contract, with the possibility of becoming full-time permanent.

Someone who is equally passionate about serving the community and achieving operational success alongside our dedicated and loyal employees.

Located at17508 116th Avenue NW, Edmonton, the Account Coordinator is responsible for planning and managing all details of the dedicated accounts assigned. Ensuring all vacated runs are covered by a driver, updating accurately our system and reporting all delays to customers.

Shift: Monday to Friday, dayshift

 

Responsibilities:

  • Maintain data entries specific to accounts, including pro bills, and progression
  • Manage all assigned equipment for each account, scheduling maintenance as required
  • Foster driver relationships for each account to ensure driver retention
  • All driver disciplinary issues to be elevated to Supervisor/Operations Manager
  • Provide Operations team with needed reports for assigned accounts
  • Provide excellent customer service for assigned accounts, taking care of customer requests
  • Ensure all driver trips are planned and confirmed for assigned accounts
  • Ensure all driver paperwork is submitted and audited daily
  • Track and Trace our drivers as required
  • Plan and cross-train staff to help cover holiday requests on assigned accounts
  • Continually strives to improve work processes, methods, environment, customer service, and personal/team performance
  • Other duties as required

 Core Competencies and Qualification:

  • Strong communication skills – must be able to effectively communicate with both drivers and customers both orally and written.
  • Previous account management experience in transportation is an asset
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Proficient in the following Microsoft Office programs: Word, Excel and Outlook.
  • Ability to type up to 45 words per minute
  • Familiarity with transportation and hours of service an asset
  • Proven experience in handling multiple priorities
  • Must be available to work overtime if the demand arises
  • Strong leadership skills
  • Cross border (US) paperwork experience considered an asset
  • Successfully pass a criminal background check

 

Why work for Canada Cartage?

Our Team

We are a family-oriented company with competitive benefits, including extended health and dental, RRSP and Company-Matching pension plans; discounted hotels, car rentals, entertainment, gym memberships, phone plans, electronics, to name a few of the perks; a cohesive team and a positive, hard-working atmosphere. We have fun events throughout the year, like truck rodeos, summer barbeques and driver-appreciation week that regularly bring us together. It’s important to give back to the communities in which we operate, so we volunteer with and donate to local charities

We also have Company wide recognition initiatives designed to recognize drivers and staff when they demonstrate outstanding customer service, teamwork and our core values.

Why do we have one of the lowest driver turn-over rates in Canada?  A team environment, short-haul regular routes and great benefits. Come work with us: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rpMA1riOzPI 

 

Recognized leader in the industry:

Canada Cartage has been recognized on the Forbes list of Canada’s Best Employers 2022. This is the sixth straight year that Canada Cartage has been included on this list. https://www.forbes.com/companies/canada-cartage/?list=canada-best-employers&sh=7841454553d8

The Canada’s Best Employers 2022 title, along with our 6th year of being recognized by Trucking HR as one of Canada’s “Top Fleet Employers” serves to reinforce Canada Cartage’s reputation as an employer of high quality.

We’re growing! We have also been ranked in the top 10 of Today’s Trucking top 100 ranking of Canada’s largest for-hire truck fleets for 2022. https://hubs.la/Q017bTLd0

Celebrating 100 years: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b3S-CtHQhVY 

 

Our Values

Integrity: We conduct our business with honour, honest and ethics with our people, the environment and legal matters. We believe I being transparent and trustworthy, respecting the traditional “handshake” value system and earning our way in.

Humanity: We are a family minded organization, caring for people and treating them with dignity, decency and respect, be it employees, customers, suppliers or our partners. Open door policy and dealings is our way.

Accountability: Accountability and accessibility to our staff, customers and our customers’ customers is of utmost importance to us. We enable a high level of two way communication, providing access to people who wil deal with issues ad have the willingness to resolve things.  We will be relied on and held accountable for our results and our long term commitments.

Collaboration: We understand that results are the product of a team effort. As part of our process, we ensure collaboration with all our staff at all levels in all roles across departmental lines. With our customers, we use a collaborative style approach, sharing ownership to ensure a successful operation.

Dedication: Our organization is employee and customer-driven. We encourage an environment of conscientious effort and earnestness, hiring problem solvers who are responsive and have a "can-do" attitude to get the job done.

Leadership: Personal leadership to us means being competent, taking ownership, demonstrating initiative, and having a voice. Corporate leadership to us means being leaders in the market, continuous improvement and innovation, and empowering those around you.https://jobs.jobvite.com/canadacartage

Come work with an industry leader!

 

We would like to thank all those expressing an interest in this position; however only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Committed to employment equity, Canada Cartage Systems LP encourages applications from Aboriginal people, members of visible minority groups, and women.

title: Forklift Driver - Full time
description:
Check this out! WE are hiring for a Licensed Forklift Driver on Royal Windsor Dr, Mississauga to start this week! Apply for this urgent walkie/forklift driver opportunity in a great automotive manufacturing warehouse.

Are you a Walkie / Forklift Driver ready to step up in a great automotive manufacturing company? Have you been looking for a Forklift opportunity for a long time? This is the time for you to join the team at one of Canada’s leading automotive manufacturers in Mississauga! This is your chance to work for a forward-thinking manufacturing company that puts employees first. This is a great opportunity for Pump Trucks/Walkie Drivers who are looking for an opportunity for career growth and advancement. We’re looking for experienced Walkie Operators, ideally with a background in the automotive manufacturing industry. If you are a Licensed Forklift / Walkie Operator and is looking for a long term career, we have a great opportunity for you! Our Client is looking for a candidate to start immediately. We are seriously accepting applications and we are moving fast!

Job Title: Licensed Walkie or Forklift Driver

Warehouse Location:
Winston Churchill & Royal Windsor Drive (Mississauga)

Shifts Available:
Afternoon: 2:30pm - 10:30pm (Monday - Friday)

Pay Rate:
$18.75
*$.50 premium is added after 4 months = $19.25ph

RESPONSIBILITIES
- Operating the Pump Truck/ Walkie
- Order-picking, shipping and receiving with the RF scanner
- Handling automotive parts
- Sorting
- Put-away
- Loading and offloading
- Lifting up to 30lbs

Reach us at meryrose.acero@randstad.ca or text " Forklift Mississauga " at 437 326 6034


Mery


Advantages
-Opportunity to work with a world class Manufacturing company
-Competitive pay (including 4% vacation pay)
-Paid breaks
-Full time opportunity
-Great benefits
-Monday - Friday working
-Cooperative and inclusive culture
-Training & Development opportunities

Responsibilities
- Operating the walkie and counterbalance
- Order-picking, shipping and receiving with the RF scanner
- Handling automotive parts
- Sorting
- Put-away
- Loading and offloading
- Lifting up to 30 lbs


Qualifications
- 6 months of forklift experience
- 6 months manufacturing experience
- comfortable lifting up to 30lbs (not continuously)
- must be eligible to work in Canada

Summary
Pallet Jack Operator
Straight Day shift
Mississauga location
Contract to hire role


If you meet the qualifications, APPLY IMMEDIATELY as these position fill fast.
• Email: meryrose.acero@randstad.ca
• Apply through this posting!
• Text "FORKLIFT OPERATOR" to 437 326 6034
• Call 437 326 6034

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Environmental Conservation Coordinator
description:
AGS Automotive Systems is a full-service automotive supplier specializing in the manufacture and supply of complex high value-add automotive metal components, including in particular front and rear impact assemblies, principally for pick-ups and the heavy truck market. AGS offers full range of in-house capabilities including design and engineering, high tonnage metal stamping, light weighting solutions, innovative multi-material joining, high performance coatings including chrome plating and automated manufacturing processes.

AGS is committed to delivering high quality, high value products to our customers, who include several of North America's largest automakers. For over 70 years AGS has stood behind our belief in quality, technology, and teamwork.

AGS is looking for an Environmental Conservation Coordinatorto join our dynamic organization. This role is in our Cambridge plant.


LOCATION: Cambridge preferred, but there is some flexibility with splitting time between facilities


JOB SUMMARY

Reporting to the Environmental Team Lead, the Environmental Conservation Coordinator will be playing an integral role in the continued implementation of the 50-5 Conservation Initiative across the organization, focusing on reducing our usage of electricity, water, gas, chemical use and production of waste. Experience with AerMOD and Cadna software would be a strong asset in order to provide Environmental Compliance Approval support with emissions and noise modeling and/or virtual modeling for various facilities within the organization.


MAIN DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Work directly with the various AGS plants to help implement, sustain, and further develop/improve compressed air leak management programs with the objective of maximizing energy savings
  • Work closely with the IT department and environmental team to help implement and develop a "50-5 database" with the goal of capturing, tracking and effectively communicating all 50-5 initiatives and related information throughout the organization. This also includes establishing and maintaining a "learning center" related to all energy and waste reduction initiatives.
  • Champion and participate in various improvement teams/projects across the organization, within the scope of the Corporate 50-5 Reduction Initiative, that focus on reducing electricity, gas, water and chemical use as well as reduce the production of non-process waste.
  • Research/investigate new technologies/processes that focus on conservation and evaluate the feasibility or benefit of applying those technologies across the five 50-5 categories: electricity, gas, water, chemical use and non-production waste.
  • Work with vendors and utilities, where applicable, to determine availability and amount of grants or funding to help offset project costs and improve project payback.
  • Manage Save On Energy (SOE) and other project funding applications.
  • Participate in developing, implementing and communicating instructional process guides and standards for various energy initiative topics that will help ensure energy conservation successes are repeated consistently throughout the organization.
  • To be/become familiar with AutoCAD, Cadna and AerMOD software and to apply the use of this software(s) as applicable to support the modelling of emissions and noise at AGS facilities and participate in the design and implementation of abatement strategies.
  • Responsible for maintaining safe working conditions, practices and ensure that good safety processes are included in all activities.
  • Travel to AGS facilities within Canada and the US will be necessary to conduct these duties and responsibilities.
  • Additional duties: Participate in other duties as assigned.

EMPLOYMENT REQUIREMENTS

  • Graduate of an Environmental Studies, Energy Conservation or Sustainable Energy Management program.
  • Good organizational, communication and computer skills.
  • Good understanding of energy conservation and sustainability principles
  • Valid G drivers license
  • Experience with AutoCAD, Cadna, or AerMOD software would be a great asset.

Accessibility: We are proud to support the full inclusion of persons with disabilities as set out in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005. We are committed to ensuring the workplace is free from discrimination. During our hiring process, we will notify job applicants that accommodations are available upon request. If a selected job applicant requests accommodation, we will consult with the individual and provide or arrange for the appropriate accommodation taking into account the applicant's disability-relate

title: Auto Mechanic- Barnes Wheaton South Surrey
description:
Barnes Wheaton GM is hiring all levels of Service Technicians to join our team! 

 
Job Summary: 

Reporting to the Service Manager, you will be passionate about providing exceptional vehicle maintenance and have a results-oriented outlook on all maintenance or repair work. As an Automotive Service Technician for our brand and high volume location, you must be self-motivated, high-energy, dynamic and results-oriented with a proven track record of vehicle service excellence. 

Responsibilities: 

Our Automotive Service Technicians are responsible for offering a consultative, results-oriented approach to vehicle repairs by performing the following duties: 

  • Performing the work described in the work orders efficiently and accurately, based on the dealership and manufacturer standards. 

  • Determining the cause of any defect and repairs it. Detects the defects in the vehicle, based on the customer's complaints and his/her own inspection. 

  • Ability to handle rapidly increasing workload. 

What we need: 

  • Red Seal Automotive Service Technician certificate is an asset. 

  • An Apprentice Service Technician certificate is an asset. 

  • Demonstrate a high degree of accuracy, sound judgment and attention to detail. 

  • Ability to identify and resolve issues effectively and efficiently. 

  • Knowledge of rules surrounding automotive safety, best practices and consumer protection. 

  • Excellent organizational and realistic time management skills. 

  • Ability to work well in a team and on own initiative. 

  • Driver's license in good standing and clean driver's abstract required. 

  • Ability to drive both manual and automatic transmissions. 

What you get: 

  • Compensation – Best in industry pay, $36.75-$39.50

  • Culture – we are a performance driven organization with high accountability and constant feedback on how our team members are doing. If you are looking for a place to perform and showcase your skills, this is the culture that fits you need.  

  • Health & Dental – Do benefits make you SMILE? Show off that grin! Receive comprehensive benefits such as health care, dental, mental healthcare benefits, and more! 

  • Community – we give back to the communities we do business in in meaningful ways.  

  • Family Owned and Operated – For over 40 years the Barnes Family has been hands on running  our dealerships, get personal leadership and mentorship not some corporate text book.

title: Automotive Service Technician
description:
Overview:

If you are a Red Seal Certified Automotive Service Technician and enjoy working with brand-new cars, Wallenius Wilhelmsen is looking for you!

 

We are hiring for the shifts: Tuesday to Saturday (7:00am â€“ 3:30pm) Or Sunday to Thursday (7:00am â€“ 3:30pm)

 

Who are we?

 

We are the Wallenius Wilhelmsen group, delivering innovative and sustainable global shipping and logistics solutions for manufacturers of cars, trucks, heavy equipment and specialized cargo. Our longevity of 157 years in business means we stay relevant and in motion!

 

Wallenius Wilhelmsen Solutions - Vehicle Services Centre (VSC) operates one of Canadaâ€™s premier vehicle processing terminals, employing approximately 310 union and exempt staff.   Located on Annacis Island in Delta (BC), we receive, accessorize, and distribute new vehicles from a wide range of manufacturers to locations throughout Canada.

 

 Why should you join us?

  • Competitive hour wage: $40.27/hour
  • Company-paid 15% RRSP Contribution
  • Company-paid extended health benefits, medical, dental and vision coverages
  • Tool allowance
  • Collaborative teams and supportive managers in a union working environment
  • Excellent career growth in a global organization with +155 years in business, +8,200 employees across 29 countries
Job Description:

Here is what an ordinary day of work might look like:

  • Conducts diagnosis and repair of vehicles; routine vehicle maintenance; pre-delivery inspections and accessory installations; provides technical assistance to installers as needed.
  • As instructed, maintains and repairs vehicles according to established procedures, including overhauls/repairs of clutches, differentials, brakes and standard transmissions.
  • Performs routine maintenance functions, such as pre-delivery inspections, tune-ups, lubrication and oil changes, wheel alignments, brake and headlamp adjustments, etc., following vehicle specifications.
  • Meets applicable production flat rates.
  • Assures process complies with customer service manual specifications.
  • Function and/or road test to ensure mechanical repair quality.
  • Performs other tasks as required.
Job Requirements:

This job is for you if you:

  • Have a Red Seal Certification for Automotive Service Technician (a must). You will also make yourself stand out from other candidates if you hold a Motor Vehicle Inspection (MVI) Certificate
  • Have a valid BC Class 5 driver's license (a must) and a good driving record which can be obtained from ICBC. Please kindly note that we only consider applications with a driving record attached.
  • Be able to proficiently drive vehicles with manual or automatic transmissions.
  • Have experiences with truck/van maintenance and exposure to electric vehicle
  • Demonstrate the ability to carry out specified work procedures and follows directions.
  • Have clear oral and written communication skills.
  • Self-motivated individual with a positive attitude.
  • Possess superior organizational and time management skills.
  • Capable of working with minimal supervision in a Mechanic Shop atmosphere.

If everything sounds good to you thus far, we would like to invite you to apply online. Please upload your resume along with a copy of your Driverâ€™s License Abstract for us to consider your application.

 

Thank you and we cannot wait to receive your applications !!!

Pay Type :Hourly

title: Owner - Operator Driver Recruiter
description:
Now Hiring

OWNER OPERATOR – DRIVER RECRUITER

 

At Canada Cartage we work with intelligent and focused leaders who are driven to create an outstanding customer experience in partnership with Canadian leading brands. Canada Cartage is deep rooted in family values with an entrepreneurial culture where ideas are welcomed, growth is fostered and high performance is championed. A recognized thought leader and founded in 1914, Canada Cartage dominates the industry by delivering innovative fleet solutions.

We are currently looking to add a full-time Recruiter, specializing in Owner/Operators, to our team. Someone who is equally passionate about serving the community and achieving operational success alongside our dedicated and loyal employees.

Located atour Davand location in Mississauga, the Owner Operator Recruiter is responsible to grow our Owner Operator pool in Ontario and ensure our Owner Operators are capitalizing on their maximum revenue capabilities. This position will contribute to the broader vision, strategy and roadmap for attracting and retaining Owner Operators who are driven to build, grow and win.

This opportunity comes with a great compensation package which includes a stable base salary and commission structure with expected earnings to be at $120,000/year.

 

Specific role mandate includes:

  • Growing our Owner Operator pool by attracting and retaining talent
  • Working closely with the recruitment sourcing team to identify the best suited Owner Operator candidates
  • Building an end to end talent journey
  • Ensuring it is widely known that Canada Cartage is an employer of choice
  • Ensuring our recruitment process is fair, inclusive, diverse and attracting the best
  • Measuring clearly defined metrics that will be used to assess and assist Owner Operator performance
  • A strong focus on retention initiatives and programs

 

 Who you are:

  • You have a love for working with people and setting them up for success
  • You have a minimum of 5 years operational background in transportation, logistics or trucking
  • familiarity working with Owner Operators
  • experience with P&L's, familiarity with truck specs, fuel surcharges, etc. 
  • A natural collaborator and influencer
  • You will successfully pass a criminal background check

 

Why work for Canada Cartage?

Our Team

We are a family-oriented company with competitive benefits, including extended health and dental, RRSP and Company-Matching pension plans; discounted hotels, car rentals, entertainment, gym memberships, phone plans, electronics, to name a few of the perks; a cohesive team and a positive, hard-working atmosphere. We have fun events throughout the year, like truck rodeos, summer barbeques and driver-appreciation week that regularly bring us together. It’s important to give back to the communities in which we operate, so we volunteer with and donate to local charities

We also have Company wide recognition initiatives designed to recognize drivers and staff when they demonstrate outstanding customer service, teamwork and our core values.

Why do we have one of the lowest driver turn-over rates in Canada?  A team environment, short-haul regular routes and great benefits. Come work with us: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rpMA1riOzPI 

 

Recognized leader in the industry:

Canada Cartage has been recognized on the Forbes list of Canada’s Best Employers 2022. This is the sixth straight year that Canada Cartage has been included on this list. https://www.forbes.com/companies/canada-cartage/?list=canada-best-employers&sh=7841454553d8

The Canada’s Best Employers 2022 title, along with our 6th year of being recognized by Trucking HR as one of Canada’s “Top Fleet Employers” serves to reinforce Canada Cartage’s reputation as an employer of high quality.

We’re growing! We have also been ranked in the top 10 of Today’s Trucking top 100 ranking of Canada’s largest for-hire truck fleets for 2022. https://hubs.la/Q017bTLd0

Celebrating 100 years: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b3S-CtHQhVY 

 

Our Values

Integrity: We conduct our business with honour, honest and ethics with our people, the environment and legal matters. We believe I being transparent and trustworthy, respecting the traditional “handshake” value system and earning our way in.

Humanity: We are a family minded organization, caring for people and treating them with dignity, decency and respect, be it employees, customers, suppliers or our partners. Open door policy and dealings is our way.

Accountability: Accountability and accessibility to our staff, customers and our customers’ customers is of utmost importance to us. We enable a high level of two way communication, providing access to people who wil deal with issues ad have the willingness to resolve things.  We will be relied on and held accountable for our results and our long term commitments.

Collaboration: We understand that results are the product of a team effort. As part of our process, we ensure collaboration with all our staff at all levels in all roles across departmental lines. With our customers, we use a collaborative style approach, sharing ownership to ensure a successful operation.

Dedication: Our organization is employee and customer-driven. We encourage an environment of conscientious effort and earnestness, hiring problem solvers who are responsive and have a "can-do" attitude to get the job done.

Leadership: Personal leadership to us means being competent, taking ownership, demonstrating initiative, and having a voice. Corporate leadership to us means being leaders in the market, continuous improvement and innovation, and empowering those around you.https://jobs.jobvite.com/canadacartage

Come work with an industry leader!

 

We would like to thank all those expressing an interest in this position; however only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Committed to employment equity, Canada Cartage Systems LP encourages applications from Aboriginal people, members of visible minority groups, and women.

title: Summer Terminal Labourer - Selkirk, MB
description:
Job ID:  403140

 

Ash Grove Cement, a CRH company, provides portland and masonry cements to help build the foundation and infrastructure for the world around us.  We ship millions of tons of cement from our plants and network of terminals located across North America. When you work for Ash Grove, you are connecting to something bigger. Join our team and help Ash Grove build North America.

 

 Position Overview 

Reporting to the Terminal Manager, the incumbent will be required to operate & maintain equipment involved in the loading and unloading of cement from silos, rail cars, or trucks.

 

Key Responsibilities (Essential Duties and Functions)

  • Receive, position, and unload hopper rail cars or trucks according to accepted, unloading, practices. Report operating and maintenance problems to the Terminal Manager.
  • Load customer trucks and common carriers in a timely and efficient manner recognizing the company policy on load limit weights and clean air standards.
  • Prepare bills of lading and maintain inventory records.
  • Perform emergency, periodic and preventive maintenance on all equipment according to the terminal maintenance program.
  • Recommend cost-saving and work simplification ideas.
  • Maintain the terminal in a clean, neat, and tidy condition, which properly reflects the company’s image.
  • Support company safety programs through the use of safety equipment and the observance of safe work methods.
  • Handle special assignments or projects as needed.
  • Able to handle terminal alone for short periods of time.  Shift hours demand careful and responsible work habits for longer periods of time.

 

Qualifications

Education/Experience

  • High School Diploma
  • 1-2 years experience preferred

 

Knowledge/Skills Required

  • Basic math aptitude to handle the paperwork.
  • Driver's license and own car, no access via public transportation
  • Mechanical ability is an asset
  • Experience with inventory control software, proficiency with MS Word and Excel

 

Core Competencies

  • Must be safety aware and able to adhere to company safety requirements
  • Good communication skills to deal with truckers, customers, and other employees
  • Work well with others and individually
  • Effective problem solving, Decision making and attention to detail
  • Significant use of memory

 

Physical Requirements

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

  • Working outdoors and varied temperatures and weather conditions
  • Working indoors in varied conditions (ie. hot noisy, dusty)
  • Effortless mobility
  • Ability to climb stairs several times a day as required
  • Ability to lift and carry 50-60 lb
  • Working at heights

 

Work Environment

  • This position is based across the company operations either in plants or supply terminals. 

 

What CRH Offers You

 

  • Highly competitive base pay
  • Health and wellness programs
  • A culture that values opportunity for growth, development, and internal promotion

 

 

About CRH

 

CRH has a long and proud heritage. We are a collection of hundreds of family businesses, regional companies and large enterprises that together form the CRH family. CRH operates in a decentralized, diversified structure that allows you to work in a small company environment while having the career opportunities of large international organization.

 

If you’re up for a rewarding challenge, we invite you to take the first step and apply today! Once you click apply now, you will be brought to our official employment application. Please complete your online profile and it will be sent to the hiring manager. Our system allows you to view and track your status 24 hours a day. Thank you for your interest!

 

Ash Grove Cement, a CRH company, is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer.

 

EOE/Vet/Disability--If you want to know more, please click on this link.

title: Parts Manager
description:
If you are a dynamic outgoing people person and looking for a change, ready for the next step, have the ability to work in a fast-paced environment, organised with meticulous attention to detail. We welcome you to apply today to join our family at Bayview Bathurst New Brunswick. Bayview has been in business for over 50 years.  Here, you're able to contribute to our goal of providing an extraordinary experience to all of our clients. At Bayview, we set each member up for success by providing comprehensive, highly specialized training for each position within our organization, complete with on-the-job training and ongoing personal development. We offer above average industry wage, we understand and like to practice work life ballance. 

Bayview Trucks & Equipment Ltd. is a Full Service, Parts and Sales dealer for Kenworth Trucks and KUBOTA farm and construction equipment, with 5 locations in New Brunswick (Saint John, Fredericton, Moncton, Woodstock & Bathurst) and 2 in Nova Scotia, New Glasgow and to Dartmouth.  Bayview also operated 3 TRP Parts stand alone locations. 

Re location assistance and or signing bonus may be available for the right candidate. 

We offer a comprehensive benefits package including:

  • Health & dental
  • RRSP shared contribution
  • Boot allowance
  • Paid training
  • Competitive hourly rates. 
  • More::   

Reporting to the General Manager of Fixed Operations the Parts Manager is responsible for the successful day-to-day operation of the Parts department, including performance management of Parts staff to achieve sales targets. 

Key Responsibilities   

  • Maintain appropriate inventory levels to meet customer needs and optimize inventory turns. 
  • Assist and oversee Parts staff in the branch, as required.  Coach staff on best practices and policies
  • Oversee shipping and receiving.   
  • Evaluate and recommend parts required based on customer information.
  • Answer and make sales calls as needed.
  • Oversee and perform inventory cycle counts to maintain accuracy.
  • Ensure the showroom is clean and the displays are effective and professional in appearance.   
  • Look up and locate parts in inventory or order parts from suppliers as per policies.
  • Generate quotes and complete orders as per customer requests.
  • Negotiate key sales issues and handle objections as required.
  • Assist customers post-sale with warranty claims 
  • Explain warranty coverage to customers (as applicable).
  • Assist with inter-branch transfers.
  • Maintain a professional appearance and a safe, clean work environment.

Qualifications that a candidate MUST possess in order to gain consideration for this position:

  • Previous experience in the Medium / Heavy Duty truck, automotive industry.
  • High degree of product and technical knowledge.
  • A team player with a strong sense of commitment to the customer.
  • Self-starter and motivated to sell.
  • Good written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to handle competing priorities and meet deadlines.
  • Available to work evenings or weekends if necessary 
  • Excellent computer skills. Excell & Word
  • Good business acumen.

Experience working with PACCAR systems or KARMAK would be a great asset.  

All new hires are required to present a clean criminal reference check.  All employees operating company vehicles are required to present a clean Driver’s abstract.   Bayview will reimburse the cost of these documents when presented with the receipt of payment.   

We are an equal opportunity employer and prohibit discrimination/harassment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Location Manager I
description:
General Responsibilities

Well known for our solid worldwide reputation, Hertz is proud to be the largest car rental company.   At Hertz, we know service excellence is built on our employees. We recognize that you are a unique individual and we understand that you value benefits and rewards that provide flexibility, choice, and control.  Benefits to working at Hertz can include health benefits such as medical, dental, vision, tuition reimbursement, online learning and development, employee discounts, retirement plan and much more!

 

Join the winning team at a company whose reputation speaks for itself…

 

General Responsibilities:

  

As a Hertz Location Manager, you have responsibility for one or more distinct areas of operation at our airport locations. A Location Manager oversees all of the personnel and operational functions of an airport location. You are responsible for managing a workforce, delivering quality customer service, scheduling adequate staff coverage, handling customer issues and requests, reviewing competitive situations and training new personnel.

 

In addition, you are responsible for the rental fleet at your location and the staff that maintains it. You need to be aware of daily and hourly reservation counts, car and model availability, preventive maintenance schedules, etc.

 

In your position as a Location Manager, you will move between these key areas of responsibility, learning the functions of each, and in that way gain a working, on-site knowledge of the business that can help you move to higher management career growth.

 

******************************************************************

 

Bien connu pour sa solide réputation mondiale, Hertz est fier d’être la plus grande entreprise de location de voitures. Chez Hertz, nous savons que l’excellence du service repose sur nos employés. Nous reconnaissons que vous êtes une personne unique et nous comprenons que vous appréciez les avantages et les récompenses ainsi que la flexibilité, le choix et le contrôle. Les avantages de travailler chez Hertz peuvent comprendre des avantages pour la santé tels que l’accès à la médecine, les soins dentaires, la vision, l’apprentissage et le perfectionnement en ligne, les rabais pour les employés, le plan de retraite et bien plus encore!

 

 Joignez-vous à l’équipe gagnante d’une entreprise dont la réputation parle d’elle-même...

 

Responsabilités générales:

 

En tant que gestionnaire de location Hertz, vous êtes responsable d’un ou de plusieurs domaines d’exploitation distincts à nos aéroports. Un gestionnaire de location supervise l’ensemble du personnel et des fonctions opérationnelles d’un aéroport. Vous êtes responsable de la gestion d’une équipe d’employé, de la prestation d’un service à la clientèle de qualité, de la planification d’une couverture adéquate du personnel, du traitement des problèmes et des demandes des clients, de l’examen des situations concurrentielles et de la formation du nouveau personnel.

 

De plus, vous êtes responsable de la flotte de location à votre emplacement et du personnel qui l’entretient. Vous devez connaître le nombre de réservations quotidiennes et horaires, la disponibilité des voitures et des modèles, les calendriers d’entretien préventif, etc.

 

Dans votre poste de gestionnaire de location, vous alternerez entre ces différents champs de responsabilité, en apprenant les fonctions de chacun, afin d’acquérir une connaissance de travail sur place de l’entreprise qui peut vous aider à croitre dans une carrière de gestion supérieure.

 


Essential Requirements

Requirements:

 

Educational Background:

  • College Diploma or University Degree

 

Professional Experience:

  • 1+ years of management experience preferred
  • Customer Service, Management, and Sales experience preferred.
  • Experience in car rental, hospitality, or tourism a plus.
  • Familiarity with Lean/Six Sigma/Toyota Management techniques is an advantage.

 

Skills:

  • Professionally direct employees including training, setting expectations, follow up and corrective action.
  • Excellent communications skills with the ability to engage in verbal interactions with customers.
  • Strong sales skills.
  • Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills.
  • Ability to project professional appearance.
  • Must have basic computer skills and knowledge of Microsoft Office programs.
  • Proficiency in English.
  • Must have a valid driver's license.

******************************************************************

 

Formation:

  • Diplôme d’études collégiales ou universitaires
  • Expériences professionnelles:
  • Une année ou plus d’expérience en gestion est un atout.
  • Service à la clientèle, gestion et ventes sont un atout.
  • Expérience dans une agence de location de véhicule, Hotel et ou tourisme est un atout.
  • La connaissance des techniques de gestion Lean/Six Sigma/Toyota est un avantage.

 

Compétences:

  • Diriger professionnellement les employés, y compris la formation, l’établissement des attentes, le suivi et les mesures correctives.
  • Excellentes aptitudes en communication avec la capacité d’engager des interactions verbales avec les clients.
  • Excellentes aptitudes en vente.
  • Solides aptitudes pour la résolution de problèmes et la prise de décisions.
  • Habileté à projeter une image professionnelle.
  • Doit avoir des compétences de base en informatique et une connaissance des programmes Microsoft Office.
  • Maîtrise de l’anglais.
  • Doit posséder un permis de conduire valide.

 

At Hertz, we champion and celebrate a culture of diversity and inclusion. We take affirmative steps to promote employment and advancement opportunities. The endless variety of perspectives, experiences, skills and talents that our employees invest in their work every day represent a significant part of our culture – and our success and reputation as a company.

Individuals are encouraged to apply for positions because of the characteristics that make them unique. 

Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Hertz is a drug free workplace.

EOE, including disability/veteran

You need to be aware of daily and hourly reservation counts, car and model availability, preventive maintenance schedules, etc.', "Must have a valid driver's license.", 'Strong sales skills.', 'Excellent communications skills with the ability to engage in verbal interactions with customers.', 'Customer Service, Management, and Sales experience preferred.', 'As a Hertz Location Manager, you have responsibility for one or more distinct areas of operation at our airport locations. Hertz is a drug free workplace.']

title: HR Manager
description:
Now Hiring

Human Resources Manager

 

At Canada Cartage we work with intelligent and focused leaders who are driven to create an outstanding customer experience in partnership with Canadian leading brands. Canada Cartage is deep rooted in family values with an entrepreneurial culture where ideas are welcomed, growth is fostered and high performance is championed. A recognized thought leader and founded in 1914, Canada Cartage dominates the industry by delivering innovative fleet solutions.

We are currently looking to add a full time HR Manager to our team. Someone who is equally passionate about serving the community and achieving operational success alongside our dedicated and loyal employees.

Located at our Head Office in Mississauga the HR Managersupports the execution of human resources strategies that deliver on established and future business priorities. The HRM manages and ensures the administration of all HR processes and programs including employee relations, performance management, succession planning, employee engagement, training and development and policy and procedure interpretation and application.

 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • Strategic business partnering of the human resources activities for Ontario and Quebec regiona, providing exceptional HR business partner coaching and support to management and employees;
  • Works effectively as part of the HR team. Champions and/or participates in key strategic projects in support of the Company vision, mission, strategy and culture in support of the overall company transformation;
  • Designs effective HR programs to develop and retain employees with the appropriate skills, knowledge and aptitude to meet current and emerging business needs;
  • Provides development and mentorship to the HR team to support employee engagement and succession planning;
  • Establishes key process improvements to enhance the productivity and effectiveness of human resources programs;
  • Provides coaching and development for managers on high-performance leadership skills and engaging people;
  • Provides support to people leaders in the resolution of issues, including conducting investigations, coaching, counseling and recommendations on appropriate actions;
  • Under the guidance of the Director, the HRM will be responsible for the administration, application and interpretation of multiple collective agreements;
  • Plays a key role in the implementation/continuation of national programs and procedures in collaboration with the HR Director.
  • Provides Generalist support to the branch/division on HR matters such as performance management, training & development, employee engagement/retention, onboarding & orientation and employee relations;
  • Models effective communication, management and partnership with internal and external stakeholders;
  • Participates in other initiatives, projects and duties as assigned.

 

 Working Experience and Skills

•                      Post-secondary degree with a specialization in Human Resources Management.

  • Certified Human Resources Professional designation is an asset.
  • 5 – 7 years progressive experience in Human Resources or an equivalent  combination of educational and experience
  • Experience with a unionized environment and labor relations is an asset
  • Superior human resources and business acumen, combined with proven strategic, ethical and tactical reasoning skills
  • Ability to effectively work in a dynamic, fast paced environment and the ability to manage multiple competing priorities
  • Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Superior interpersonal and relationship building skills; ability to influence and  be assertive when necessary
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently with minimal day-to-day supervision
  • Leads by example and provides consistent coaching and mentorship to HR team
  • Strong critical thinking skills and demonstrated ability to challenge the status quo
  • Successfully pass a background check


  

 Why work for Canada Cartage?

Our Team

We are a family-oriented company with competitive benefits, including extended health and dental, RRSP and Company-Matching pension plans; discounted hotels, car rentals, entertainment, gym memberships, phone plans, electronics, to name a few of the perks; a cohesive team and a positive, hard-working atmosphere. We have fun events throughout the year, like truck rodeos, summer barbeques and driver-appreciation week that regularly bring us together. It’s important to give back to the communities in which we operate, so we volunteer with and donate to local charities

We also have Company wide recognition initiatives designed to recognize drivers and staff when they demonstrate outstanding customer service, teamwork and our core values.

Why do we have one of the lowest driver turn-over rates in Canada?  A team environment, short-haul regular routes and great benefits. Come work with us: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rpMA1riOzPI 

 

Recognized leader in the industry:

Canada Cartage has been recognized on the Forbes list of Canada’s Best Employers 2022. This is the sixth straight year that Canada Cartage has been included on this list. https://www.forbes.com/companies/canada-cartage/?list=canada-best-employers&sh=7841454553d8

The Canada’s Best Employers 2022 title, along with our 6th year of being recognized by Trucking HR as one of Canada’s “Top Fleet Employers” serves to reinforce Canada Cartage’s reputation as an employer of high quality.

We’re growing! We have also been ranked in the top 10 of Today’s Trucking top 100 ranking of Canada’s largest for-hire truck fleets for 2022. https://hubs.la/Q017bTLd0

Celebrating 100 years: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b3S-CtHQhVY 

 

Our Values

Integrity: We conduct our business with honour, honest and ethics with our people, the environment and legal matters. We believe I being transparent and trustworthy, respecting the traditional “handshake” value system and earning our way in.

Humanity: We are a family minded organization, caring for people and treating them with dignity, decency and respect, be it employees, customers, suppliers or our partners. Open door policy and dealings is our way.

Accountability: Accountability and accessibility to our staff, customers and our customers’ customers is of utmost importance to us. We enable a high level of two way communication, providing access to people who wil deal with issues ad have the willingness to resolve things.  We will be relied on and held accountable for our results and our long term commitments.

Collaboration: We understand that results are the product of a team effort. As part of our process, we ensure collaboration with all our staff at all levels in all roles across departmental lines. With our customers, we use a collaborative style approach, sharing ownership to ensure a successful operation.

Dedication: Our organization is employee and customer-driven. We encourage an environment of conscientious effort and earnestness, hiring problem solvers who are responsive and have a "can-do" attitude to get the job done.

Leadership: Personal leadership to us means being competent, taking ownership, demonstrating initiative, and having a voice. Corporate leadership to us means being leaders in the market, continuous improvement and innovation, and empowering those around you.https://jobs.jobvite.com/canadacartage

Come work with an industry leader!

 

We would like to thank all those expressing an interest in this position; however only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Committed to employment equity, Canada Cartage Systems LP encourages applications from Aboriginal people, members of visible minority groups, and women.

title: Drivers - AMA Service Vehicle (Tow Truck) Operator
description:
AMA:

PART PROBLEM SOLVER.PART MECHANIC.

ALL superhero.

 

 

Posted: 2022-05-02

Closing: Until Filled

Location: Edmonton Service Centre

 

Our AMA brand is important to us and we set the bar for the towing industry.   Safety, using the best towing equipment available, and providing a first-class member experience are the hallmarks of working for AMA.

AMA leads the towing industry in compensation providing a competitive base salary and an incentive compensation program for our drivers.   In addition to this, AMA offers a flexible benefit plan and company provided uniforms and moreâ€¦  

 

We are hiring for ;

  • Full-Time Seasonal (Hourly) roles are 6-months in length.
  • Auxiliary (Hourly) employees typically work weekends, as well as weekdays as per availability.
  • Regular Part-Time (Hourly) employees work a minimum of 21 hours per  week providing coverage over weekend and weekday shifts, with the opportunity for additional hours and overtime.    

 

Successful candidates will be trained on standard tow truck operation and required to work rotational 8-hour shifts, as per scheduled  days (including holidays), between the hours of 6:00am and midnight.

 

 

ABOUT YOU

 

Youâ€™re one of those amazing people who goes out of their way to help others. Helping a young mother with a baby stroller up the stairs or carrying groceries inside for an elderly person is just all in a typical day for you. Youâ€™re like an everyday superhero (only without the weird cape). We could use someone with your super powers and passion for helping others. You donâ€™t have to be a top-notch mechanic or have any other special skills â€“ with your willingness to learn, weâ€™ll provide you with all the training youâ€™ll need, along with access to state-of-the-art technology and equipment.

 

 

WHAT MOVES YOU

  • You love the idea of being able to help people and make a difference in their day â€“ even in a challenging situation.
  • You may not be a mechanic by trade, but you have a knack for the automotive industry and enjoy working with your hands (and donâ€™t mind getting them dirty). You also donâ€™t mind showing off your muscles by doing a bit of lifting now and then.
  • You know how to think on your feet â€“ for you, thereâ€™s nothing more satisfying than solving puzzles and finding creative solutions.
  • You're not a 9-to-5 desk job type of person. You want variety and a job that offers something different each day.
  • You work well on your own but you also enjoy being part of a team.
  • You care about doing things right and your mom is proud of your safety-first attitude.

 

WHAT YOU'LL DO

  • Report to the Fleet Supervisor.
  • Work various shifts (including evenings and weekends) enduring all kinds of Alberta weather.
  • Respond to our members when they need service, minor mechanical assistance or towing.
  • Ensure that AMA vehicles, communication equipment, and tools are kept clean, orderly, and in good working condition.
  • Promote AMA memberships and provide general information about AMA to our members.
  • Stay up-to-date on your knowledge of our communications and operating equipment.
  • Make sure Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) is used and worn at all times.
  • Keep yourself and everyone else safe by ensuring all engineered controls, safe work procedures/ policies, environmental issues, rules and work practices are followed as outlined in the Service Vehicle Operator handbook.

 

WHAT YOU'VE DONE

  • You have a high school diploma.
  • You have a Class 5 driverâ€™s license with fewer than 6 demerit points at any one time and have been driving for at least five years (you'll get bonus points if you have a good grasp of city routes).
  • Youâ€™re able to be licensed for Automotive Lock Bypass
  • You will be able to pass a Canadian Criminal Record Check
  • You're not required to be licensed as an Automotive Service Technician, but it definitely helps!
  • Youâ€™re comfortable working rotational shift work.

 

WHAT YOU'LL GET

  • You'll be provided with all the training needed to become a Service Vehicle Operator by one of our AMA experts.
  • Competitive salary.
  • Benefits options.
  • Great AMA discounts.
  • Unlimited learning opportunities.
  • Vacation earnings.  
  • Floater day (Regular Part-Time).  

 

We thank all applicants for their interest;  however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Driver - Sidney
description:
Overview:

Enterprise Holdings, operating the National, Enterprise, and Alamo car rental brands is looking for a driver to join our amazing team!  Enterprise Holdings is the largest and fastest growing privately owned automotive rental and leasing company in the  North America.    

 

The Driver delivers vehicles and in some instances, customers, employees or vendors safely and timely to the appropriate destination(s) while giving helpful, courteous and professional customer service.

 

Location: 9429 Canora Rd, Sidney BC V8L 1P2

 

This position pays $15.70 / hour  

 

Schedule:

  • Monday-Friday 8am-1pm

 

Responsibilities:

The Part Time Driver is responsible for the transporting of fleet cars and vans to and from rental locations, as well as navigating written directions.

  • Drive and deliver vehicles locally or out of area as needed, following all rules of the road
  • Deliver customers and vehicles to appropriate destination in a safe and courteous manner
  • Ride with or follow another driver to drop off vehicle(s) or pick up multiple vehicles
  • Organize travel route and ensure vehicle paperwork is accurate and timely
  • May need to communicate via 2-way radio or cellular phone
  • May be asked to clean vehicle and/or keep bus clean during shift
  • May be asked to assist customer(s) with directions, car options and basic policy/procedures
  • May be asked to assist customer(s) load and unload luggage, enter and exit vehicle and miscellaneous customer needs
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned
Qualifications:
  • Must be at least 18 years of age
  • Must have a valid driver's license with no more than 2 moving violations and/or at-fault accidents on driving record in the past 3 years
  • No drug or alcohol related convictions on driving record (DWI/DUI) or criminal record within the last 5 years  
  • Must be able to lift 30 lb. in order to assist customers
  • Must be authorized to work in Canada and not require work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future.
  • As per government mandate, all employees on-site are required to be fully vaccinated as per Vaccination Requirement, subject only to limited exceptions mandated by legislation.

title: Autoramp Assistant
description:
Role:

Automotive Assistants are responsible for the safe unloading, loading, and placement of vehicles in a safe and timely manner that responds to the customers’ needs.For more information about the position please click here: http://www.cn.ca/en/your-industry/automotive

Critical Performance areas:
  • Performing yard checks and inventory updates
  • Operating, loading and unloading ramps
  • Opening and closing railway car doors
  • Removing and Installing vehicle blocks
  • Installation and removal of bridge plates between railway cars. Bridge plates are the link or connection between the railway car junctions used to bridge the gap
 
Working Conditions: 
  • Working shifts, weekends, and holidays
  • Frequent lifting weights up to 50 pounds
  • Able to work outdoors in extreme weather conditions
  • Physical work, being able to walk long distances, climb railcar ladders and crouching inside railcars

Employment Requirements:
  • High School degree or equivalence
  • Must possess a valid class 5 driver license, and be able to drive a manual transmission
  • Minimum two years’ driving experience
  • Clean driving record is a must, no infractions in the last five years. The candidate will have to provide their driving record
  • Good teamwork and communication skills
  • Good hand-eye coordination
  • Technology and computer skills that apply to the job
  • Ability to correctly analyze a situation and respond appropriately
 
Training:
 
Automotive Assistants are given a 2 day classroom training with a health & safety team member covering the theory of CN’s rules, polices, procedures, and safety measures at the Automotive Facility. This is followed by a 2 week on the job practical training. New hire is then mentored and coached during the 3 month probation period.

Salary: 
Hourly rate up $28.61.

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

 

CN requires that all employees be fully vaccinatedagainst COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. TheCompany’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly ownedsubsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers andanyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.
