title: Vehicle Technician
description:
Job Description

Why join us?

SNC-Lavalin provides cutting-edge engineering, procurement, construction and financing solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world. From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region and Australasia, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision.

SNC-Lavalin is truly a global expert in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world.

How will you contribute to the team?

The Vehicle Technician carries out comprehensive maintenance, fault diagnosis, recovery and repair service to Trillium Line trains and vehicle department equipment, ensuring that the trains operate in a safe reliable and efficient manner. The Vehicle Technician maintains trains and related support equipment in accordance with procedures, engineering drawings and specifications, and is proficient in the operation and maintenance of shop equipment associated with train maintenance.

  • Follow written procedures, engineering drawings and instructions to implement the required maintenance, modification, overhaul and corrective maintenance requirements on trains and related support equipment as required or directed by the Vehicle Maintenance Manager or Vehicles Team Leader.

  • Diagnose the cause of failures to train equipment and rectify them in an efficient manner following standard procedures and safety instructions; return trains to service as efficiently as possible.

  • Assist with commissioning of new and existing trains or related systems and support systems ensuring high reliability and safety of equipment.

  • Complete check sheets relating to all work completed on trains and complete all necessary documentation relating to certifying Trillium Line vehicles as serviceable.

  • Carry out train movements to facilitate maintenance & fault finding.

  • Carry out train rescue and or recovery as required.

  • Participate in Total Productive Maintenance initiatives with a focus on Continuous Improvement.

  • Engage in developing a full working knowledge of the trains and operating systems, mechanical, electrical and electronic.

  • Contribute to the delivery of safe, reliable required levels of vehicles in service as efficiently as possible.

  • Carry out all activities with strict adherence to all relevant Safety Regulations, Departmental Instructions, Maintenance Procedures and Instructions.

  • Well motivated and take a proactive approach to teamwork.

  • Recommend a course of action in the event of an asset failure.

  • Complete training for and operate the Wheel Lathe, Cranes, Train Wash and Jacks as required.

  • Assume Hostler duties as required.

  • Ensure that the Depot is maintained as a clean, healthy and safe working environment under the direction of the Vehicles Team Leader and Vehicle Maintenance Manager.

  • Direct and monitor the work of contractors employed within the Vehicles Department as required.

  • Must maintain Certified Car Inspector qualifications.

  • Other related duties as assigned.

What will you contribute?

  • Heavy Duty, Automotive Mechanic, Industrial Electrician, or Avionics Technician, Aircraft Maintenance Engineer, Electrical, Mechanical or Electronics Technologist or recognized equivalent.

  • Minimum of 3 years relevant experience within a maintenance / workshop environment, experience with DMU vehicles or in a heavy industrial environment.

  • Graduation from a recognized Trades or Technology School relevant to qualifying as a Trillium Line Vehicle Technician.

  • Must possess strong communication skills; ability to work well with others in a team environment.

  • Must be well motivated and have an aptitude for mechanical, electrical and electronic systems.

  • A combination of education and experience may also be considered.

  • This position requires shift work (nights, weekends and holidays) for continuous operation based on a 24/7 environment. Shifts will be awarded in accordance with date of hire.
    Note: Flexibility will be required to meet operational and other needs and may require working shifts other than normally assigned.

  • Required to give clear and concise reports both written and orally.

  • Take ownership of their Personal Development Plan.

  • Valid class G Ontario driver’s license.

  • High School Graduation (grade 12)

SAFETY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Adherence to all statutory and TransitNEXT Operations workshop and trackside regulations and procedures, including impairment and hours of work policies.

  • Adherence to SNC-Lavalin Blue Book and associated Blue Rules.

  • Carry out maintenance activities in a method that will not cause harm to themselves or other staff.

  • Ensure that the tools used are correct for the maintenance action and are free from defect.

  • Ensure that all Testing and Measuring equipment is calibrated and within date.

  • Ensure all licenses are current and valid for equipment to be operated.

  • Attend required safety related training.

ENVIRONMENTALASPECTS

  • This role has Significant Environmental Aspects associated with it which may include fuel handling and exposure to batteries used in trains and from time-to-time other cleaning or hazardous product.

  • Proper handling and disposal of all chemicals and items deemed to be surplus.

What we offer at SNC-Lavalin?

At SNC-Lavalin, you will enjoy good compensation, a safe and healthy work environment, and a full range of benefits (i.e.: group insurance, retirement savings plan, share purchase plan, continuing education program, etc.):

  • Opportunity to work on various projects of various sizes.

  • Competitive salary.

  • Motivational financial package & flexible benefits.

  • Defined contribution pension plan in which SNC-Lavalin contributes.

  • Work equipment provided according to the season (boot, bib, helmet, gloves, etc.).

  • Employee Share Ownership Plan (ESOP).

  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP).

  • Learning and Development programs, training, career opportunities.

Additional Information:

Appropriate accommodations will be provided upon request throughout the recruitment and hiring process as required by Company policy and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).

Successful applicants will be notified about SNC-Lavalin’s accommodation policies at the time the employment offer is extended, and the information will be shared with new personnel during the onboarding process.

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.  

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice  on our Careers site to know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

Founded in 1911, SNC-Lavalin is a fully integrated professional services and project management company with offices around the world. SNC-Lavalin connects people, technology and data to help shape and deliver world-leading concepts and projects, while offering comprehensive innovative solutions across the asset lifecycle. Our expertise is wide-ranging — consulting & advisory, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and sustaining capital – and delivered to clients in four strategic sectors: EDPM (engineering, design and project management), Infrastructure, Nuclear and Resources, supported by Capital. People. Drive. Results. www.snclavalin.com .

Worker Type

Employee

Job Type

Regular

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.  

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice  on our Careers siteto know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

title: Automotive Finance Administrator
description:
Do you possess automotive or financial services industries experience?
Do you have a strong Administrative background and enjoy building customer relationships?
If so, this could be a great opportunity for you!

We are hiring for an Automotive Finance Administrator for a long-term contract position to start with potential to be hired on permanently for the right candidate.




Advantages
- Working for a reputable company in Ayr - easy commute from Cambridge or South Kitchener
- Core Day hours (Monday - Friday)
- Competitive wages
- Weekly pay cheques
- Eligible to purchase benefits through Randstad's affiliate program
- Must have your own transportation and this is not on a bus route

Responsibilities
As an Automotive Finance Administrator, your duties include:
- Develop a thorough understanding of policies, processes and procedures relative to loan processing (ie. floorplanning)
- Understand how the loan processing role contributes to the greater purpose of the business, in compliance and to reduce risk
- Understand and operate within compliance of all applicable laws and codes for their assigned geographic area
- Process and manage titles including receiving, scanning, filing, sending, and tracking
- Communicate across the organization and/or management to resolve issues
- Complete lienholder direct pays and non-auction purchase processing
- Notify appropriate team members of document related issues or concerns
- Apply payments and process daily deposits

Qualifications
The ideal candidate will have strong problem-solving skills, top-notch listening skills, the ability to work in a fast-paced environment,
and process high volumes of documents with a strong attention to detail.
- Minimum 1 year of relevant experience is preferred
- Familiarity with concepts, procedures and processes typically used in automotive and financial services industries is desired
- Preparation or review of documents and reports using Microsoft Office based products
- Customer relationship management (CRM) tools such as Salesforce is a definite asset
- Good organizational and verbal communication skills are required.
- Must have intermediate proficiency of Microsoft Office ie. Excel, Word, and Outlook
- Occasional local travel may be necessary. A valid driver’s license is required

Summary
If you are interested in the Automotive Finance Administrator and would like to apply, please review the details below:

How to apply:
1) Respond directly to this job posting
2) Apply at www.randstad.ca and follow up with a phone call an hour afterward to 519-772-0181 ext. #3 and ask for Saudia or Lauren.
3) You can also email: saudia.yusuf@randstad.ca AND lauren.campana@randstad.ca

Our services will never be at a cost to you. Registration with Randstad offers you the benefits of our industry knowledge and client database which spans many industries.

Ask us about our new MyRandstad app, which sends automatic alerts about new shifts that you can accept or decline depending on your availability

Randstad Waterloo is committed to helping you tackle the challenges and take advantage of promising career opportunities. Connect with us today to learn more about the many positions we have to offer at the Waterloo Randstad.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Dispatcher - Night shift
description:
Now Hiring

DISPATCHER – NIGHT SHIFT

 

At Canada Cartage we work with intelligent and focused leaders who are driven to create an outstanding customer experience in partnership with Canadian leading brands. Canada Cartage is deep rooted in family values with an entrepreneurial culture where ideas are welcomed, growth is fostered and high performance is championed. A recognized thought leader and founded in 1914, Canada Cartage dominates the industry by delivering innovative fleet solutions.

We are currently looking to add a full-time NIGHTSHIFT Dispatcher to our team. Someone who is equally passionate about serving the community and achieving operational success alongside our dedicated and loyal employees.

Located at Maple Leaf 7474 Mclean Road, Guelph (Aberfoyle) and reporting to the Operations, the Nightshift Dispatcher will be responsible for managing day-to-day operations of driver dispatch, scheduling, routing and to ensure that all activities are accurately recorded in the company’s transportation management system.

 

Responsibilities:

•Ensuring that all work is accurately entered and managed in the A1T system in a timely manner, from; order entry, to planning, to activating, progressing and closing trips

•Plan and schedule drivers efficiently, resulting in the reduction/elimination of non-revenue hours, empty miles and an increase in driver productivity

•Manage and direct all incoming inquiries through the dispatch telephone lines to ensure a clear, efficient flow of information to the appropriate people

•Be the front line contact for drivers regarding scheduling and work availability

•Coordinate with maintenance and Operations to ensure that the required equipment is available

•Assign equipment to upcoming runs to ensure all of our customer’s needs will be met

•Communicate with drivers to ensure that appointment delivery times are met

•Monitor special driver requirements for each site to ensure they are being adhered to

•Report all driver absences and tardiness to the Manager

•Ensure proper placement of trailer pool to support customers’ daily requirements while maintaining costs

•Complete customer reporting and tracking spreadsheets as required

•Assist in the dispatching of drivers as required

•To perform other duties as assigned by the reporting manager

 

 Core Competencies and Qualification:

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to handle multiple projects and tasks
  • 2 years of prior dispatch experience is required
  • 1-2 years of planning and scheduling experience is required
  • Previous experience and/or a familiarity with trucking is required
  • Must be able to work in a fast paced environment and possess excellent problem solving skills
  • Experience with Elogs and XRS experience is an asset
  • Proficient in Windows Outlook, Microsoft excel, and a transportation management system
  • Must be willing to work a flexible schedule and overtime if the demand arises
  • Experience in a 24 x 7 operation, preferably in the transportation industry
  • Trained in Hours of Service an asset
  • Familiarity with A1T an asset
  • Successfully pass a criminal background check

 

Why work for Canada Cartage?

Our Team

We are a family-oriented company with competitive benefits, including extended health and dental, RRSP and Company-Matching pension plans; discounted hotels, car rentals, entertainment, gym memberships, phone plans, electronics, to name a few of the perks; a cohesive team and a positive, hard-working atmosphere. We have fun events throughout the year, like truck rodeos, summer barbeques and driver-appreciation week that regularly bring us together. It’s important to give back to the communities in which we operate, so we volunteer with and donate to local charities

We also have Company wide recognition initiatives designed to recognize drivers and staff when they demonstrate outstanding customer service, teamwork and our core values.

Why do we have one of the lowest driver turn-over rates in Canada?  A team environment, short-haul regular routes and great benefits. Come work with us: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rpMA1riOzPI 

 

Recognized leader in the industry:

Canada Cartage has been recognized on the Forbes list of Canada’s Best Employers 2022. This is the sixth straight year that Canada Cartage has been included on this list. https://www.forbes.com/companies/canada-cartage/?list=canada-best-employers&sh=7841454553d8

The Canada’s Best Employers 2022 title, along with our 6th year of being recognized by Trucking HR as one of Canada’s “Top Fleet Employers” serves to reinforce Canada Cartage’s reputation as an employer of high quality.

We’re growing! We have also been ranked in the top 10 of Today’s Trucking top 100 ranking of Canada’s largest for-hire truck fleets for 2022. https://hubs.la/Q017bTLd0

Celebrating 100 years: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b3S-CtHQhVY 

 

Our Values

Integrity: We conduct our business with honour, honest and ethics with our people, the environment and legal matters. We believe I being transparent and trustworthy, respecting the traditional “handshake” value system and earning our way in.

Humanity: We are a family minded organization, caring for people and treating them with dignity, decency and respect, be it employees, customers, suppliers or our partners. Open door policy and dealings is our way.

Accountability: Accountability and accessibility to our staff, customers and our customers’ customers is of utmost importance to us. We enable a high level of two way communication, providing access to people who wil deal with issues ad have the willingness to resolve things.  We will be relied on and held accountable for our results and our long term commitments.

Collaboration: We understand that results are the product of a team effort. As part of our process, we ensure collaboration with all our staff at all levels in all roles across departmental lines. With our customers, we use a collaborative style approach, sharing ownership to ensure a successful operation.

Dedication: Our organization is employee and customer-driven. We encourage an environment of conscientious effort and earnestness, hiring problem solvers who are responsive and have a "can-do" attitude to get the job done.

Leadership: Personal leadership to us means being competent, taking ownership, demonstrating initiative, and having a voice. Corporate leadership to us means being leaders in the market, continuous improvement and innovation, and empowering those around you.https://jobs.jobvite.com/canadacartage

Come work with an industry leader!

 

We would like to thank all those expressing an interest in this position; however only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Committed to employment equity, Canada Cartage Systems LP encourages applications from Aboriginal people, members of visible minority groups, and women.

title: Mechanic
description:
Overview:

Fountain Tire Vaughan (8300 Jane Street) is hiring a Mechanic (Automotive Service Technician)!  

 

At Fountain Tire, our associates are our number one asset. As a member of our team you will get to enjoy some of our great benefits:

  • Competitive compensation ($35 - $45 / hour)
  • Hourly and / or no limit commission structure available
  • Signing bonus!
  • Retention bonus
  • Flexible hours (full-time / part-time)
  • A shop committed  to safety excellence
  • Clean environment
  • Specialty tools provided
  • NAPA autotech training provided
  • Certified hoists
  • Uniform/safety equipment provided
  • The opportunity to work with an excellent management team, associates, and customers
  • Regular day shifts
  • Great discounts for you and your family on tires, parts and mechanical services at all Fountain Tire Stores
  • Health, Dental and Vision Benefits
  • RRSP Matching Program
  • Team building activities
  • Accommodate use of translation Apps while candidate works on English / French skills
  • Referral bonus for attracting new team members
  • Boot allowance
  • Large network of locations - potential to accommodate  transfer requests

Your duties will include:

  • Completing inspections and diagnostics
  • Repairing commercial vehicles through the disassembly of faulty assemblies  and repairing or replacing worn or damaged parts
  • Performing scheduled maintenance services such as oil changes, lubrications and tune-ups
  • Ensuring all equipment used in the Service Department is in good repair and undergoes regular documented maintenance
  • Ensuring the best service is provided to our clients and customers

What does it take to get on track?

  • Must possess Ontario Class Mechanics license (310S-Automotive)
  • Valid Driverâ€™s License and satisfactory driver's abstract
  • Ability to lift and carry 25kg

At Fountain Tire, you'll have a great place to workâ€”competitive compensation, a manager with a large support network, and the chance to learn and grow. Please apply in person or online.

title: Lot Attendant (FT)
description:
Clearway Car & Truck Rentals is seeking a Lot Attendant who is looking for job security, competitive wages and benefits.

Wage & benefits:
  • Starting wage at $18-20/hour.
  • Great health plan – Prescriptions, dental, naturopath, RMT, Chiropractor, etc.
  • Rental vehicle benefits – discounted rental rates for you and your family.
  • Personal vehicle repairs – discounted automotive repair rates.

Main responsibilities:
  • Provide great customer service.
  • Answering calls and creating reservations.
  • Providing quotes.
  • Building relationships with regular customers.
  • Video recording of all vehicles when rented out and returned daily.
  • Preparing our vehicles for rental, ensuring a high standard of cleanliness.
  • Fueling vehicles and submitting quantities.
  • Providing light maintenance on a diverse fleet of cars and trucks such as tire pressure, check fluids, replace marker lights, etc.
  • Inspecting all vehicles and report damages that need attention.
  • Transfer vehicles between locations.
  • Picking up and dropping off customers as needed.

Requirements:
  • Class 5 driver's license.
  • Fluent in English.
  • Physically fit to perform medium duty labor.

Job types: Full-time, permanent
Salary: From $18.00 - &20.00 per hour
Working location: This position is based out of Chilliwack




    About Clearway Rentals Inc:

    Clearway is a family owned and operated company that has been in business since the 50’s we have an amazing and unique culture that strives to empower our employees to become the best versions of themselves. We offer competitive wages and a comprehensive benefits package with lots of opportunity for growth within the company. For this position we are looking for a strong self-starter with a growth mindset who has strong organizational skills with experience in web design and data analytics.

title: Shift Manager - Senior Shop Foreman - Afternoons
description:
Now Hiring!

SHOP FOREMAN –HEAVY DUTY MECHANIC

 

At Canada Cartage we work with intelligent and focused leaders who are driven to create an outstanding customer experience in partnership with Canadian leading brands. Canada Cartage is deep rooted in family values with an entrepreneurial culture where ideas are welcomed, growth is fostered and high performance is championed. A recognized thought leader and founded in 1914, Canada Cartage dominates the industry by delivering innovative fleet solutions.

We are currently looking to add a Shop Foreman to our team. Someone who is equally passionate about serving the community and achieving operational success alongside our dedicated and loyal employees.

Located at4700 – 102 Avenue SE, Calgary and reporting to the Fleet Shop Foreman, you will be responsible for over-seeing the workload, assigning jobs, overseeing two mechanics and ensuring timely completion of work.

Afternoon Shift:  Monday to Thursday, 2:00pm – 12:30am

 

Responsibilities:

  • Ensuring that the truck, trailer and tire maintenance areas are functioning effectively and efficiently throughout the course of the shift.
  • Ensuring that the output of work by team members is done in a timely manner and that everyone is focused on high priority equipment and meeting operational needs
  • Includes ensuring that all maintenance and repairs are done promptly and properly
  • Ensuring preventative maintenance and any other company policies and/or procedures are followed
  • Handling over-the-road emergency repairs
  • Creating electronic repair orders, assigning technicians jobs daily and creating work schedules for Maintenance staff
  • Maintaining paperwork associated with day to day operations
  • Providing leadership to all aspects of the shop, including providing a motivating environment through the application of team building practices including regular performance reviews, feedback and coaching
  • Daily communication with your team and shop managers.
  • Maintaining a safe work environment, through corrective action and education
  • Maintaining positive cross-functional working relationships
  • Related responsibilities
  • Continuous Improvement: Continually strives to improve work processes, methods, environment, customer service, personal and team performance.

 

 Core Competencies and Qualification:

•Strong written and verbal communication skills

•Strong interpersonal and leadership skills

•Ability to multi-task in a fast paced environment

•Good attention to detail

•Ability to do quick math (addition, subtraction, multiplication and division) accurately and quickly

•Ability to interact in a professional manner with customers and colleagues

•Must have current heavy duty mechanics license.

•Previous experience working as a licensed journeyman – Heavy Duty Mechanic

•Minimum 5 years of experience supervising a shop

•Must have completed high school; post-secondary education is an asset

•Transportation experience preferred

  • Able to lift up to 50 lbs
  • Successfully pass a criminal background check

 

Why work for Canada Cartage?

  • No mandatory overtime.
  • $300.00 tool allowance
  • Minimal outside mobile work (only boosting).
  • Heated shop equipped with pits for easy servicing.
  • Uniforms provided.
  • Recession-proof business model, steady hours all year around.
  • Well maintained, modern fleet (mostly 2018 and newer).
  • Performance based remuneration.
  • Online OEM Education (Navistar, Cummins).
  • Comprehensive benefits (life, disability, medication, dental, vision, RRSP and more).
  • 3 paid sick days per year.
  • Group discounts (Costco, Hertz, Bell, GMC, Lenovo, Goodlife Fitness and more).
  • boot and winter coat allowance.
  • College tuition fees reimbursement for apprentices.
  • Solid career advancement opportunities.

 

Our Team

We are a family-oriented company with competitive benefits, including extended health and dental, RRSP and Company-Matching pension plans; discounted hotels, car rentals, entertainment, gym memberships, phone plans, electronics, to name a few of the perks; a cohesive team and a positive, hard-working atmosphere. We have fun events throughout the year, like truck rodeos, summer barbeques and driver-appreciation week that regularly bring us together. It’s important to give back to the communities in which we operate, so we volunteer with and donate to local charities

We also have Company wide recognition initiatives designed to recognize drivers and staff when they demonstrate outstanding customer service, teamwork and our core values.

Why do we have one of the lowest driver turn-over rates in Canada?  A team environment, short-haul regular routes and great benefits. Come work with us: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rpMA1riOzPI 

 

Recognized leader in the industry:

Canada Cartage has been recognized on the Forbes list of Canada’s Best Employers 2022. This is the sixth straight year that Canada Cartage has been included on this list. https://www.forbes.com/companies/canada-cartage/?list=canada-best-employers&sh=7841454553d8

The Canada’s Best Employers 2022 title, along with our 6th year of being recognized by Trucking HR as one of Canada’s “Top Fleet Employers” serves to reinforce Canada Cartage’s reputation as an employer of high quality.

Celebrating 100 years: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b3S-CtHQhVY 

 

Our Values

Integrity: We conduct our business with honour, honest and ethics with our people, the environment and legal matters. We believe I being transparent and trustworthy, respecting the traditional “handshake” value system and earning our way in.

Humanity: We are a family minded organization, caring for people and treating them with dignity, decency and respect, be it employees, customers, suppliers or our partners. Open door policy and dealings is our way.

Accountability: Accountability and accessibility to our staff, customers and our customers’ customers is of utmost importance to us. We enable a high level of two way communication, providing access to people who wil deal with issues ad have the willingness to resolve things.  We will be relied on and held accountable for our results and our long term commitments.

Collaboration: We understand that results are the product of a team effort. As part of our process, we ensure collaboration with all our staff at all levels in all roles across departmental lines. With our customers, we use a collaborative style approach, sharing ownership to ensure a successful operation.

Dedication: Our organization is employee and customer-driven. We encourage an environment of conscientious effort and earnestness, hiring problem solvers who are responsive and have a "can-do" attitude to get the job done.

Leadership: Personal leadership to us means being competent, taking ownership, demonstrating initiative, and having a voice. Corporate leadership to us means being leaders in the market, continuous improvement and innovation, and empowering those around you.https://jobs.jobvite.com/canadacartage

Come work with an industry leader!

 

We would like to thank all those expressing an interest in this position; however only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Committed to employment equity, Canada Cartage Systems LP encourages applications from Aboriginal people, members of visible minority groups, and women.

title: Highway Truck Driver (Heavy Haul) in Fort McMurray, Alberta | Careers at North American Construction Group
description:
Position Scope

This position is based in Fort McMurray, NO CAMP provided working Monday to Friday (40+ hours per week).

Responsibilities

  • Class 1 air brakes with minimum 5 years of experience
  • Journeyman Crane Ticket is considered an asset
  • Experience in car carriers/deck trucks or slide axle trailers /highboy/step deck and 10 axle trailer
  • Experience in loading and unloading all types of components         
  • Must have load securement knowledge 
  • Must be Local & familiar with all sites (SITE ORIENTED PREFERRED) 
  • This job position is very demanding, there is a lot of climbing, squatting, crouching and kneeling etc.
  • Monday to Friday (occasional Saturdays)
  • No Camp/No Flights
  • Must have good communication skills

 

Summary

All successful candidates must:

  • Be proficient in English, both verbally and written
  • Have a valid Class 5 Driver’s License
  • Have experience as requested as mentioned above
  • Undergo and successfully pass the following testing:
  • Breath Alcohol Test
  • Urine Drug Test
  • Fitness-to-Work Assessment
  • Audiometric Testing
  • Vision Screening
  • Criminal Record Check

  • Shift, site, and start times are subject to change.

     

    All successful candidates MUST provide the following items prior to confirmation of their start date:

  • CSO or OSSA (BSO) Certification
  • Copy of Valid Class 5 Driver’s License
  • Copy of recent Driver’s Abstract
  • VOID cheque/direct deposit form

  • Once dispatched the following processes will occur:

  • Will receive a call from NACG to set up all required pre-employment testing
  • An email will be sent with all required New Hire Paperwork to be filled out
  • After all results are received by NACG candidates will be contacted by Site Admin to schedule orientation and confirm your start date and other site specific details.

  • Please note the entire On-boarding process can take anywhere from 3-8 business days.

     

    NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE, SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED VIA PHONE OR EMAIL.

    Overview

    North American Construction Group (NACG) has served as an industry leader in the heavy construction and mining industries for over 65 years.  In that time, we’ve proven ourselves as a safe and reliable contractor who can complete projects of any size and scope. We’ve also taken a number of bold steps forward to broaden our footprint, expanding to mines outside our provincial borders, and providing third-party maintenance services to clients and customers. 

    In addition to providing employees with rewarding careers, North American has a whole lot more to offer:

    • Significant Growth – As a company, NACG is rapidly expanding, and has practically doubled in size over the past year alone.
    • Long Term Contracts – With over $1 billion dollars in contracted work booked through 2023, NACG can provide long term employment solutions and numerous opportunities for advancement.
    • Commitment To Safety – With a top tier record for safety performance, NACG is dedicated to ensuring that everyone gets home safe, and constantly strives for a goal zero performance.
    • Competitive Compensation – NACG provides competitive compensation packages for all employees.

    North American Construction Group is an equal opportunity employer, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected.

     

    Become a member of the North American family today!

title: Distribution Centre General Manager
description:
Now Hiring

Distribution Centre General Manager

 

At Canada Cartage we work with intelligent and focused leaders who are driven to create an outstanding customer experience in partnership with Canadian leading brands. Canada Cartage is deep rooted in family values with an entrepreneurial culture where ideas are welcomed, growth is fostered and high performance is championed. A recognized thought leader and founded in 1914, Canada Cartage dominates the industry by delivering innovative fleet solutions.

With locations across Canada, Canada Cartage System is a recognized leader in transportation & logistics delivering customized solutions for the transportation, distribution and warehousing marketplace.

We are currently looking to add a full-time Distribution Centre General Manager to our Distribution Centre in Delta, British Columbia. Someone who is equally passionate about serving the community and achieving operational success alongside our dedicated and loyal employees.

We offer a competitive remuneration and benefits package, advancement opportunities and career development.

DC General Manager is responsible for leading the day-to-day activities of warehouse operations, administration, and finance, to effectively implement logistics services to customers and to ensure that all activities are accurately recorded in the company’s warehouse management system; customer service, productivity, and financial targets are being met, and contribute to the growth of the company.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Manage and mentor operations and office management and supervisors;
  • Hiring, firing, employee discipline and training;
  • Ensuring employees have the necessary tools to perform their job functions;
  • Ensuring team members are scheduled appropriately to meet customer expectations;
  • Troubleshooting and resolving day-to-day issues and activities;
  • Conducting regular formal employee reviews and informal feedback discussions for all staff within their area of responsibility;
  • Monitoring service levels to ensure customer expectations are met or exceeded;
  • Work with local Human Resources on administering disciplinary action as required;
  • Acting as primary front-line operations point person for any billing/payroll issues;
  • Supporting and enforcing the Company’s Health and Safety and Compliance policies;
  • Make recommendations to improve production methods, working conditions, and increase efficiency;
  • Act as liaison between supervisors, staff and customers;
  • Manage the Branch finances and analyze financial reports.

 

 Core Competencies and Qualification:

  • 5 years in a management role in the logistics/ warehouse operations industry;
  • Experience in a multi-client 3PL environment an asset;
  • Post-secondary or equivalent experience an asset;
  • Excellent leadership and analytical skills;
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills;
  • Ability to multitask;
  • Direct experience with staff scheduling in a variable work volume environment;
  • MS Office proficiency necessary;
  • Familiarity with WMS systems an asset.
  • Successfully pass a background check

 

Why work for Canada Cartage?

Our Team

We are a family-oriented company with competitive benefits, including extended health and dental, RRSP and Company-Matching pension plans; discounted hotels, car rentals, entertainment, gym memberships, phone plans, electronics, to name a few of the perks; a cohesive team and a positive, hard-working atmosphere. We have fun events throughout the year, like truck rodeos, summer barbeques and driver-appreciation week that regularly bring us together. It’s important to give back to the communities in which we operate, so we volunteer with and donate to local charities

We also have Company wide recognition initiatives designed to recognize drivers and staff when they demonstrate outstanding customer service, teamwork and our core values.

Why do we have one of the lowest driver turn-over rates in Canada?  A team environment, short-haul regular routes and great benefits. Come work with us: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rpMA1riOzPI 

 

Recognized leader in the industry:

Canada Cartage has been recognized on the Forbes list of Canada’s Best Employers 2022. This is the sixth straight year that Canada Cartage has been included on this list. https://www.forbes.com/companies/canada-cartage/?list=canada-best-employers&sh=7841454553d8

The Canada’s Best Employers 2022 title, along with our 6th year of being recognized by Trucking HR as one of Canada’s “Top Fleet Employers” serves to reinforce Canada Cartage’s reputation as an employer of high quality.

We’re growing! We have also been ranked in the top 10 of Today’s Trucking top 100 ranking of Canada’s largest for-hire truck fleets for 2022. https://hubs.la/Q017bTLd0

Celebrating 100 years: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b3S-CtHQhVY 

 

Our Values

Integrity: We conduct our business with honour, honest and ethics with our people, the environment and legal matters. We believe I being transparent and trustworthy, respecting the traditional “handshake” value system and earning our way in.

Humanity: We are a family minded organization, caring for people and treating them with dignity, decency and respect, be it employees, customers, suppliers or our partners. Open door policy and dealings is our way.

Accountability: Accountability and accessibility to our staff, customers and our customers’ customers is of utmost importance to us. We enable a high level of two way communication, providing access to people who wil deal with issues ad have the willingness to resolve things.  We will be relied on and held accountable for our results and our long term commitments.

Collaboration: We understand that results are the product of a team effort. As part of our process, we ensure collaboration with all our staff at all levels in all roles across departmental lines. With our customers, we use a collaborative style approach, sharing ownership to ensure a successful operation.

Dedication: Our organization is employee and customer-driven. We encourage an environment of conscientious effort and earnestness, hiring problem solvers who are responsive and have a "can-do" attitude to get the job done.

Leadership: Personal leadership to us means being competent, taking ownership, demonstrating initiative, and having a voice. Corporate leadership to us means being leaders in the market, continuous improvement and innovation, and empowering those around you.https://jobs.jobvite.com/canadacartage

Come work with an industry leader!

 

We would like to thank all those expressing an interest in this position; however only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Committed to employment equity, Canada Cartage Systems LP encourages applications from Aboriginal people, members of visible minority groups, and women.

title: Director of Operations - Bilingual
description:
Now Hiring

Director of Operations - Bilingual

 French to follow

At Canada Cartage we work with intelligent and focused leaders who are driven to create an outstanding customer experience in partnership with Canadian leading brands. Canada Cartage is deep rooted in family values with an entrepreneurial culture where ideas are welcomed, growth is fostered and high performance is championed. A recognized thought leader and founded in 1914, Canada Cartage dominates the industry by delivering innovative fleet solutions.

We are currently looking to add a Bilingual Director of Operations, to our team. Someone who is equally passionate about serving the community and achieving operational success alongside our dedicated and loyal employees.

Located in Laval, Quebec the Director of Operations is responsible for working with and leading the day-to-day activities of the Operations Team (Customer Service, Operations Managers, Planning, and Dispatch) to effectively implement transportation services to customers and to ensure that all activities are accurately recorded in the company’s transportation management system for the Ontario Region. Regular interaction with customers to strengthen business relationships and foster a high level of communication.

 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Balance the needs for high service levels and at the correct cost levels
  • Profit & Loss responsibility for the operations
  • Manage driver relations in the region
  • Monitor fleet suitability to perform the commissioned work
  • Conscious of the needs for a safe workplace and compliance with laws in order to ensure that the Carrier Profile in the region is kept at an acceptable level
  • Responsible to ensure the front-line operations teams use the technology provided and use it in the company-sanctioned manner. This includes the A1T Transportation Management System (TMS) and the Canada Cartage On-Board Mobile tracking and KPI-generation system
  • Develop a winning team and provide communications to all employees through staff and driver meetings
  • Participate in regular communications and strategy sessions as they involve new customer acquisition, customer retention, continuous improvement and cost containment strategies
  • Participate in meetings when requested by the VP and prepares for the operations meetings to ensure the territory meets and exceeds the established criteria
  • Ensuring operations team have the necessary tools to perform their job functions
  • Conducting regular formal employee reviews and informal feedback discussions for all staff within their area of responsibility
  • Monitoring service levels to ensure customer expectations are met or exceeded
  • Administering disciplinary action as required
  • Supporting and enforcing the Company’s Health and Safety and Compliance policies
  • Working closely with the Operations Managers in all aspect of the day-to-day Operations of the account(s) they are responsible for
  • Training, coaching, development and leadership of staff
  • Developing and implementing goal, target and performance standards
  • Keeping open communication with local staff, regional and head office

 

 Experience and Required Skills:

  • Excellent leadership and analytical skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to handle multiple projects and tasks
  • MS Office proficiency necessary
  • Experience with budget planning, P&L responsibility
  • Professional conduct and excellent customer service
  • Ensuring that the branch environment is up to the standards and policies of the Company
  • Excellent communication skills
  • 10 years of experience in Transportation, Warehousing, and or Distribution
  • Post-secondary education is an asset
  • Experience with managing a large driver/employee base
  • Self- Motivated and driven
  • Great attention to detail
  • Success in a Computer and technology focused environment
  • Fluently bilingual French / English
  • Excellent track record for customer service

 

Working Conditions

  • Some travel may be required
  • Manual dexterity required to use desktop computer and peripherals
  • Overtime as required

 

Why work for Canada Cartage?

Our Team

We are a family-oriented company with competitive benefits, including extended health and dental, RRSP and Company-Matching pension plans; discounted hotels, car rentals, entertainment, gym memberships, phone plans, electronics, to name a few of the perks; a cohesive team and a positive, hard-working atmosphere. We have fun events throughout the year, like truck rodeos, summer barbeques and driver-appreciation week that regularly bring us together. It’s important to give back to the communities in which we operate, so we volunteer with and donate to local charities

We also have Company wide recognition initiatives designed to recognize drivers and staff when they demonstrate outstanding customer service, teamwork and our core values.

Canada Cartage has been recognized on the Forbes list of Canada’s Best Employers 2022. This is the sixth straight year that Canada Cartage has been included on this list. https://www.forbes.com/companies/canada-cartage/?list=canada-best-employers&sh=7841454553d8

The Canada’s Best Employers 2022 title, along with our 6th year of being recognized by Trucking HR as one of Canada’s “Top Fleet Employers” serves to reinforce Canada Cartage’s reputation as an employer of high quality.

We’re growing! We have also been ranked in the top 10 of Today’s Trucking top 100 ranking of Canada’s largest for-hire truck fleets for 2022. https://hubs.la/Q017bTLd0

Celebrating 100 years: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b3S-CtHQhVY

Integrity: We conduct our business with honour, honest and ethics with our people, the environment and legal matters. We believe I being transparent and trustworthy, respecting the traditional “handshake” value system and earning our way in.

Humanity: We are a family minded organization, caring for people and treating them with dignity, decency and respect, be it employees, customers, suppliers or our partners. Open door policy and dealings is our way.

Accountability: Accountability and accessibility to our staff, customers and our customers’ customers is of utmost importance to us. We enable a high level of two way communication, providing access to people who wil deal with issues ad have the willingness to resolve things.  We will be relied on and held accountable for our results and our long term commitments.

Collaboration: We understand that results are the product of a team effort. As part of our process, we ensure collaboration with all our staff at all levels in all roles across departmental lines. With our customers, we use a collaborative style approach, sharing ownership to ensure a successful operation.

Dedication: Our organization is employee and customer-driven. We encourage an environment of conscientious effort and earnestness, hiring problem solvers who are responsive and have a "can-do" attitude to get the job done.

Leadership: Personal leadership to us means being competent, taking ownership, demonstrating initiative, and having a voice. Corporate leadership to us means being leaders in the market, continuous improvement and innovation, and empowering those around you.https://jobs.jobvite.com/canadacartage

Come work with an industry leader!

 

We would like to thank all those expressing an interest in this position; however only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Committed to employment equity, Canada Cartage Systems LP encourages applications from Aboriginal people, members of visible minority groups, and women. 

___________________________________________

Poste à combler

Directeur/directrice des opérations — Bilingue

 

Chez Canada Cartage, nos leaders sont talentueux et axés sur la création d’une expérience client exceptionnelle, en partenariat avec les grandes marques canadiennes. La culture d’entreprise de Canada Cartage est profondément enracinée dans les valeurs familiales où les idées sont les bienvenues, la croissance est encouragée et un rendement élevé est recherché. Un chef de file reconnu et fondé en 1914, Canada Cartage domine l’industrie en offrant des solutions de flottes novatrices.

Nous cherchons actuellement à ajouter à notre équipe un directeur ou une directrice des opérations bilingue. Une personne qui est tout aussi passionnée à servir la communauté et à atteindre le succès opérationnel aux côtés de nos employés dévoués et loyaux.

Situé à Laval, au Québec, le directeur ou la directrice des opérations est chargé de la direction des activités quotidiennes de l’équipe des opérations (service à la clientèle, gestionnaires des opérations, planification et service de répartition) afin de mettre en œuvre efficacement les services de transport aux clients et de s’assurer que toutes les activités sont enregistrées avec exactitude dans le système de gestion des transports de l’entreprise pour la région de l’Ontario. Une interaction régulière avec les clients est nécessaire pour renforcer les relations commerciales et favoriser un niveau élevé de communication.

 

Les fonctions et responsabilités essentielles incluent, mais ne sont pas limitées à :

  • Équilibrer les besoins pour atteindre des niveaux de service élevés à des coûts raisonnables
  • Assumer la responsabilité en matière de bénéfices et de pertes pour les opérations
  • Gérer les relations avec les camionneurs dans la région
  • Veiller à ce que la flotte ait la capacité d’effectuer le travail commandé
  • Être conscient des besoins d’un lieu de travail sécuritaire et du respect des lois afin de garantir que le profil du transporteur dans la région conserve un niveau acceptable
  • S’assurer que les équipes opérationnelles de première ligne utilisent la technologie fournie et l’utilisent de la manière approuvée par l’entreprise. Cela comprend le système de gestion des transports (SGT) de A1T et le système de suivi et de génération d’indicateurs clés de rendement (ICR) de Canada Cartage On-Board Mobile.
  • Former une équipe gagnante et fournir des communications à tous les employé(e)s par le biais de réunions avec le personnel et les camionneurs
  • Participer à des sessions régulières de communication et de stratégie, car elles impliquent l’acquisition de nouveaux clients, la fidélisation des clients, l’amélioration continue et les stratégies de maîtrise des coûts
  • Participer aux réunions lorsque le VP le demande et préparer les réunions des opérations pour s’assurer que le territoire respecte et dépasse les critères établis
  • S’assurer que l’équipe des opérations dispose des outils nécessaires pour exécuter ses fonctions
  • Mener régulièrement des évaluations officielles des employés et des discussions informelles sur la rétroaction pour tout le personnel dans leur domaine de responsabilité
  • Surveiller les niveaux de service pour s’assurer que les attentes des clients sont satisfaites ou dépassées
  • Appliquer les mesures disciplinaires requises
  • Soutenir et appliquer les politiques de santé, sécurité et conformité de la Société
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les gestionnaires des opérations dans tous les aspects des opérations quotidiennes des comptes dont ils sont responsables
  • Veiller à la formation, l’encadrement, le perfectionnement et le leadership du personnel
  • Élaborer et mettre en œuvre des objectifs, des cibles et des normes de rendement
  • Maintenir une communication ouverte avec le personnel local, le bureau régional et le siège social

 
 Expérience et compétences requises :

  • Excellentes compétences de leadership et d’analyse
  • Excellentes compétences en communication verbale et écrite
  • Capacité à gérer plusieurs projets et tâches
  • Compétence MS Office nécessaire
  • Expérience de la planification budgétaire et des responsabilités des profits et pertes
  • Conduite professionnelle et excellent service à la clientèle
  • S’assurer que l’environnement de la succursale est conforme aux normes et politiques de la Société
  • Excellentes compétences en communication
  • 10 ans d’expérience en transport, entreposage et/ou distribution
  • Une éducation postsecondaire est un atout
  • Expérience dans la gestion d’une importante base de camionneurs et d’employés
  • Avoir de l’initiative et être dynamique
  • Grande attention au détail
  • À l’aise dans un environnement axé sur l’informatique et la technologie
  • Couramment bilingue français et anglais
  • Excellente réputation en matière de service client

 

Conditions de travail

  • Il peut être nécessaire de voyager
  • Dextérité manuelle requise pour utiliser un ordinateur de bureau et des périphériques
  • Heures supplémentaires si nécessaire

 

Pourquoi travailler chez Canada Cartage?

Notre équipe

Nous sommes une entreprise familiale qui offre des avantages concurrentiels, y compris une assurance médicale et dentaire complémentaire, des REER et un régime de retraite avec une contribution équivalente de l’entreprise; des tarifs réduits pour les hôtels, la location de voitures, les divertissements, l’adhésion à un centre de conditionnement, des appareils électroniques, des forfaits téléphoniques, pour ne citer que quelques-uns des avantages; une équipe soudée et une atmosphère positive et dynamique au travail. Nous organisons des événements amusants tout au long de l’année, comme les rodéos de camion, les barbecues d’été et la Semaine d’appréciation des camionneurs qui nous rassemblent régulièrement. Il est important de redonner aux communautés où nous sommes présents, c’est pourquoi nous participons et faisons des dons aux organismes de bienfaisance locaux.

Nous avons également des initiatives de reconnaissance à l’échelle de l’entreprise qui ont été élaborées pour souligner l’apport des camionneurs et des membres du personnel qui font preuve d’un service à la clientèle et d’un esprit d’équipe exceptionnel, et nos valeurs essentielles.

Pourquoi notre roulement du personnel est-il parmi le plus bas au Canada?  Parce que nous avons un bon esprit d’équipe, des trajets réguliers de courte distance, et de grands avantages. Venez travailler avec nous : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rpMA1riOzPI. 

 

Un chef de file reconnu dans l’industrie :

Canada Cartage a été reconnu sur la liste Forbes comme faisant partie des Meilleurs employeurs du Canada en 2022. C’est la sixième année consécutive que Canada Cartage a été inclus dans cette liste. https://www.forbes.com/companies/canada-cartage/?list=canada-best-employers&sh=7841454553d8

Le titre de Meilleur employeur du Canada en 2022, ainsi qu’une reconnaissance pour une 6e année par RH Camionnage comme l’un des « Meilleurs transporteurs employeurs » du Canada, renforcent la réputation de Canada Cartage en tant qu’employeur de haute qualité.

Nous sommes en croissance! Nous avons également été classés par Today’s Trucking parmi les 10 meilleures flottes sur les 100 plus grandes flottes de camions pour location au Canada pour 2022. https://hubs.la/Q017bTLd0.

Notre célébration de notre centenaire : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b3S-CtHQhVY 

 Nos valeurs

Intégrité : Nous exerçons nos activités en faisant preuve d’honneur, d’honnêteté, et de sens éthique avec nos collaborateurs, l’environnement, et les questions juridiques. Nous croyons qu’il faut être transparent et digne de confiance, en respectant le traditionnel système de valeur établi par des liens personnels, pour laisser notre marque.

Humanité : Nous sommes une organisation à caractère familial : nous sommes attentifs et nous traitons les autres avec dignité, courtoisie et respect, qu’il s’agisse des employés, des clients, des fournisseurs ou de nos partenaires. Nous faisons preuve d’ouverture et de transparence.

Responsabilité : L’accessibilité et la responsabilité envers notre personnel, nos clients, et les clients de nos clients, sont de la plus haute importance pour nous. Nous entretenons une communication bidirectionnelle de haut niveau, en offrant un accès aux personnes-ressources qui ont la volonté et la capacité de résoudre les problèmes. Nous assumons la responsabilité pour nos résultats et nos engagements à long terme.

Collaboration :Nous comprenons que les résultats sont le produit d’un effort d’équipe. Dans le cadre de notre processus, nous nous assurons de la collaboration de l’ensemble de notre personnel à tous les niveaux de service. Nous adoptons avec nos clients une approche collaborative, en partageant la responsabilité pour le succès des activités.

Dévouement : Notre organisation est axée sur les besoins des employés et des clients. Nous favorisons un environnement où nous recrutons des personnes consciencieuses et appliquées qui résolvent les problèmes et qui ont une attitude ouverte et positive dans l’accomplissement de leurs tâches.

Leadership : Le leadership personnel signifie pour nous être compétent et responsable, faire preuve d’initiative, et avoir la capacité de s’exprimer. Le leadership d’entreprise signifie pour nous être un leader dans le marché, et favoriser l’amélioration continue et l’innovation, tout en renforçant la capacité des gens qui vous entourent. https://jobs.jobvite.com/canadacartage-fr/

 

Venez travailler avec un chef de file de l’industrie.

 

Nous tenons à remercier toutes les personnes qui expriment leur intérêt envers ce poste; toutefois, nous communiquerons uniquement avec les candidat(e)s sélectionnés pour une entrevue.

En tant que société engagée envers l’équité en matière d’emploi, Canada Cartage LP encourage les candidatures provenant des Autochtones, des membres de minorités visibles et des femmes.

title: Heavy Haul Highway Truck Driver (Ruth Lake)
description:
Position Scope:

This position is based in Fort McMurray, NO CAMP provided working Monday to Friday (40+ hours per week).

Responsibilities:
  • Class 1 air brakes with minimum 5 years of experience
  • Journeyman Crane Ticket is considered an asset
  • Experience in car carriers/deck trucks or slide axle trailers /highboy/step deck and 10 axle trailer
  • Experience in  loading and unloading all types of components                
  • Must have load securement knowledge  
  • Must be Local & familiar with all sites (SITE ORIENTED PREFERRED)  
  • This job position is very demanding, there is a lot of climbing, squatting, crouching and kneeling etc.
  • Monday to Friday (occasional Saturdays)
  • No Camp/No Flights
  • Must have good communication skills

 

Summary:

All successful candidates must:

  1. Be proficient in English, both verbally and written
  2. Have a valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License
  3. Have experience as requested as mentioned above
  4. Undergo and successfully pass the following testing:
    1. Breath Alcohol Test
    2. Urine Drug Test
    3. Fitness-to-Work Assessment
    4. Audiometric Testing
    5. Vision Screening
    6. Criminal Record Check

Shift, site, and start times are subject to change.

 

All successful candidates MUST provide the following items prior to confirmation of their start date:

  1. CSO or OSSA (BSO) Certification
  2. Copy of Valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License
  3. Copy of recent Driverâ€™s Abstract
  4. VOID cheque/direct deposit form

Once dispatched the following processes will occur:

  1. Will receive a call from NACG to set up all required pre-employment testing
  2. An email will be sent with all required New Hire Paperwork to be filled out
  3. After all results are received by NACG candidates will be contacted by Site Admin to schedule orientation and confirm your start date and other site specific details.

Please note the entire On-boarding process can take anywhere from 3-8 business days.

 

NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE, SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED VIA PHONE OR EMAIL.

Overview:

North American Construction Group (NACG) has served as an industry leader in the heavy construction and mining industries for over 65 years.   In that time, weâ€™ve proven ourselves as a safe and reliable contractor who can complete projects of any size and scope. Weâ€™ve also taken a number of bold steps forward to broaden our footprint, expanding to mines outside our provincial borders, and providing third-party maintenance services to clients and customers.  

In addition to providing employees with rewarding careers, North American has a whole lot more to offer:

  • Significant Growth â€“ As a company, NACG is rapidly expanding, and has practically doubled in size over the past year alone.
  • Long Term Contracts â€“ With over $1 billion dollars in contracted work booked through 2023, NACG can provide long term employment solutions and numerous opportunities for advancement.
  • Commitment To Safety â€“ With a top tier record for safety performance, NACG is dedicated to ensuring that everyone gets home safe, and constantly strives for a goal zero performance.
  • Competitive Compensation â€“ NACG provides competitive compensation packages for all employees.

North American Construction Group is an equal opportunity employer, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected.

 

Become a member of the North American family today!

title: Marketing Coordinator / Photographer
description:
Car-On Automotive Group is looking to add another exceptional team member to it's marketing team. You are not an average employee, you thrive in a fast paced environment and you take a lot of pride in your work. If that sounds like you, we need you on our team.


About Car-On Automotive Group

Car-On Auto is a pre-owned automobile dealership in a league of our own. We are Eastern Ontario's largest and fastest growing pre-owned store. We are a full fledged dealership with sales, service, parts and body shop departments and we attribute customer satisfaction as the cornerstone of our growth and success. We hire based on culture and talent. For that reason, we have very little turnover and our team members are like family to us.

In order for us to hire and retain top talent who share our commitment to customer service, we offer competitive pay and benefits along with an amazing work culture.


A day in the life of a Marketing Coordinator

As a Marketing Coordinator, you will shoot and upload interior and exterior pictures of our new vehicles to be used on our website for advertising. Once uploaded, you will use our database to create compelling descriptions that will ultimately sell our vehicles to our customers. You understand the importance of accuracy and putting our products in the best light and appreciate that nothing happens until you stand behind the camera and make these vehicles live online.

Requirements:

You must have valid driver's license

You need to be interested in learning about features, benefits and options on the various vehicles in front of your lens.

You have good work ethic and a high attention to detail. We can't afford mistakes making it to our website.

Because you are on your feet a good part of your day, you thrive in a fast-paced team environment and can stay focused despite 1000 distractions.

You are comfortable with cameras as you will be taking pictures of car interior and exterior

title: Lead Automotive Technician
description:
At Clutch, we are reinventing the way Canadians buy and own cars. We had enough of traditional dealerships that took advantage of customers and knew that we could build an incredible car-buying experience while leaving a positive impact on the communities we serve. 

Recently named one of the Fastest Growing Canadian Companies by the Globe & Mail and one of the Top Canadian Startups by LinkedIn, we're looking to add to our great team of people who embrace hard things, think like owners, and love to help their teammates. 

We pride ourselves on our high-quality certified vehicles, great prices, and customer experience. By visiting clutch.ca, customers can browse a large selection of high-quality vehicles, buy a car that's right for them, and enjoy seamless delivery - all from the comfort of their home.

Founded in 2016, Clutch is headquartered in Toronto and services Alberta, British Columbia, Nova Scotia, New Brunswick, Ontario, and Prince Edward Island. It is backed by a number of world-class investors including D1 Capital Partners, Canaan, BrandProject, Real Ventures, Upper90, FJ Labs, Global Founders Capital, and Azure Capital Partners.


About the role:

Clutch is looking for Lead Technician - Automotive to join our Mech team! 

As Clutch grows its inventory, the Lead Technician - Automotive will play a vital role on the Clutch team. We're looking for a highly motivated self-starter to help ensure our vehicles are up to our high mechanical standard.

You will be working closely with management to build Clutch Alberta's service/repair operations. You will play a leading role in the recruitment and management of our automotive service technician team. In the early days, you will also be responsible for performing vehicle inspections, maintenance work and minor repairs such as brakes, suspension, tires, batteries etc.

Our ideal candidate has experience working on European vehicles in addition to other foreign and domestic brands. They will also be highly organized, have strong communication skills, and excellent attention to detail.

 

What You'll Do:

  • Hire, manage and mentor a team of Automotive Service Technicians
  • Supervise and assess vehicle issues and damage, both internal and external
  • Make recommendations about vehicle repairs and the best course of action
  • Supervise repairs and preventative maintenance, such as oil changes, suspension and brake jobs
  • Build a cutting edge automotive service operation
  • Assist in planning for future growth, including expanding shop infrastructure and helping build new processes
  • Ensure our mechanical reconditioning is industry leading, while continually finding new ways to reduce costs
  • Perform Clutch standardized vehicle inspections (stationary and road tests)
  • Create documentation of repairs and estimates
  • Adhere to and continually help improve Clutch's high mechanical standards 

We're Looking For:

  • Hands-on Automotive Service experience and knowledge
  • Previous Automotive Technician experience is a must
  • Shop Foreman or Service Manager experience 
  • Experience working with a variety of car brands (domestic, import & European)
  • Team player above all else
  • Previous leadership experience
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Ability to multitask and prioritize competing demands
  • Desire to learn new skills
  • User of technology (Google Drive, Slack etc.)
  • Valid Driver's License (Clean Driver's Abstract)

Nice to Have:

  • Red Seal certification is an asset

Why you'll love it at Clutch: 

  • Autonomy & Ownership -- create your own path, and own your work
  • Competitive Compensation and Equity Incentives!
  • Generous Time Off Program
  • Learning Budget -- for whatever YOU want to learn
  • Health & Dental Benefits

title: Heavy Equipment Technician
description:
Company:

Finning Canada

Number of Openings:

15

Worker Type:

Permanent

Position Overview:

Did you know that Finning is the worlds largest Caterpillar dealer? Would you like to work for an industry leading dealer for the largest equipment manufacturer in the world? Here at Finning, we service what we sell; from the smallest to the largest machines in the world and we need technicians to help maintain and repair our customers fleets.

We’re looking for qualified heavy-duty technicians to assemble, maintain, repair, prepare and rebuild some of the largest heavy equipment in the world, all with safety in mind.

As the world’s largest Cat dealer, we take pride in the quality of our work and provide a safe, professional work environment for our people. Safety is not just a culture; it is a founding principal of our business. From new equipment preparation to large machine rebuilds, there is no shortage of opportunity to build a career with Finning. All while getting great pay, a comprehensive benefits package, and training to help develop your skills.

If you’re a Heavy Equipment Technician who’s self-motivated to learn, can work alone and be a team player, detail-oriented, safety conscious, excels at troubleshooting and repairing heavy equipment with pride, then you’re exactly what we’re looking for.

We’re looking to immediately hire technicians to support shop work, new equipment preparation, full machine rebuilds in the Regina facility. These are fulltime permanent positions based on a 7x7, 12-hour continuous shift rotation.

Job Description:

 

Job Duties:

  • Troubleshoot, repair, and maintain equipment
  • Component replacements
  • Large scale overhauls and rebuilds
  • New equipment preparation
  • Interface with customers, product, and sales support
  • Working with supervisors on various tasks
  • Equipment and facility continuous improvements
  • Providing support with reference to on-site safety requirements
  • Maintain Finning Customer Service Commitment
  • Various related duties as required

Qualifications:

  • JourneypersonHeavy Equipment Technician Certification
  • Previous experience troubleshooting and repairing heavy equipment required. 
  • Journeyperson Truck and Transport, Journeyperson Agriculture and Journeyperson Automotive Certification will be considered based on experience
  • Apprentices will be considered based on experience.
  • Valid driver’s license with a successful recent driver abstract
  • Safety conscious team player with excellent organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills with a high attention to detail
  • Previous experience with Caterpillar equipment/engines would be considered an asset.
  • Engine and/or component rebuilding experience would be considered an asset.
  • Transmission or Hydraulic testing would be considered an asset.
  • Previous gas engine and power generation experience would be considered an asset.
  • Completion of Finning S-Levels, Failure Analysis, Machine Electronic Controls, or Tier 4 training would be considered an asset
  • Completion of Caterpillar product courses would be considered an asset
  • Understanding of the Caterpillar product line will be considered an asset

We are committed to diversity at Finning, to building and sustaining a diverse and inclusive workforce and as an equal opportunity employer we encourage applications from all qualified individuals. Finning does not discriminate against applicants based on genders, races, national and ethnic origins, religions, ages, sexual orientation, marital and family status, and/or mental or physical disabilities.

title: Automotive Technician (Mobile Tech), Edmonton, Alberta (AI)
description:
Automotive Technician (Mobile Tech), Edmonton, Alberta (AI)
LOCATION:
  • Edmonton, Alberta
Typical Day:

Create your schedule in the company app. You will be receiving jobs  through the app. They will be scheduled within your availability hours with 1 hour intervals in between to allow for travel and other needs. You will be going to the location in the corporate provided van. Doing maintenance service, diagnostic, or repair. Doing the quotes for repairs, Selling those repairs to customers, scheduling those jobs, picking up parts. Communicating with the support team and customers.


REQUIREMENTS:
  • Automotive Journeyman (no apprentices), with a Red Seal Endorsement
  • ANY Brand Experience
  • MUST BE willing to work for yourself and remit your own taxes
  • MUST HAVE, or willing to get your own Business Number with the CRA
  • MUST HAVE, your own tools (financing for tools is available)
  • MUST HAVE, strong Customer Service Skills
  • MUST BE, organized and knows how to manage time
  • MUST HAVE, strong integrity
  • MUST HAVE,  valid Canadian driver’s license
  • No criminal record

PAY: 
  • $40/hr Flat Rate to $50.00/hour WITH Monthly Guarantee ($4,000.00) + performance bonuses (up to $3,000.00/month)
  • Paid Travel Time to and from jobs ($20.00 per job, average)
  • $5 per job gas relief (depending on price of gas)
  • 8% commission on all parts and labour sold
  • Tips are 100% yours
  • Company provided vehicle you can take home everyday including insurance at a cost of $150.00 bi-weekly
  • Company provided insurance: Liability and WCB
  • Tool subsidy:  Will help finance any tools that you might need
  • Schedule your own hours 
  • Central shop available or use your own (Edmonton and Calgary location)
  • Relocation assistance may be available; if you wish to relocate closer to a coverage area

 


ADDITIONAL INFO 
When you apply for this position you give the Recruiting Room permission to share your information with other team members and our network of employers. You further acknowledge that the Recruiting Room is a free service to all candidates and as such, further agree to indemnify and hold harmless Recruiting Room from any allegations, claims, actions, suits, demands, damages, liabilities, obligations, losses, settlements, judgments, costs and expenses (including without limitation attorneys’ fees and costs) that result from the sharing of this data.
 
You further acknowledge, and give consent, for the Recruiting Room to check your previous employers (to make a hiring decision), if you fail to provide references before the point of offer. We only ask questions that are “reasonably required,” for our employers to assess the applicant’s fitness for the job. We DO NOT contact current employers.

You further acknowledge, by applying for this position, you allow the Recruiting Room, and its agents, to contact you via SMS Messaging (texting), Facebook, Instagram or any other forms of social networking
Click here for our job board
