title: Gérant de succursale/ Branch Manager
description:
General Responsibilities

$1000 Bonus d'embauche

Largement reconnue pour sa solide réputation mondiale, Hertz est fière d’être la plus grande compagnie de location de voitures au monde. Chez Hertz, nous savons que l’excellence de notre service repose sur nos employés. Nous reconnaissons que vous êtes un individu unique et nous comprenons que vous appréciez les avantages et les récompenses offrant du choix et de la flexibilité. Les avantages de travailler chez Hertz peuvent inclure l’assurance des soins médicaux, dentaires et de la vision, le remboursement des droits de scolarité, l’apprentissage et le perfectionnement en ligne, des remises pour les employés, un régime de retraite et plus encore!

 

Joignez-vous à une équipe gagnante, au sein d’une entreprise dont la renommée parle d’elle-même.

 

En tant que gérant de succursale de Hertz, vous êtes responsable d’un ou de plusieurs secteurs d’exploitation d’une de nos succursales. Le gérant de succursale supervise tout le personnel et les activités d’une succursale. Vous êtes chargé de gérer une équipe, d’offrir un service à la clientèle de qualité, d’établir un horaire adéquat pour le personnel, de traiter les problèmes et les demandes des clients, d’examiner l’environnement concurrentiel et de former les nouveaux employés.

 

De plus, vous êtes responsable du parc de véhicules de location à votre succursale et du personnel qui en assure l’entretien. Vous devez être au courant du nombre de réservations quotidiennes et horaires, de la disponibilité des voitures et des modèles, des calendriers d’entretien préventif, etc.

 

Dans votre poste de gérant de succursale, vous évoluerez entre ces principales sphères de responsabilité, apprenant les fonctions de chacune, de manière à acquérir une connaissance pratique de l’entreprise pouvant vous aider à faire progresser votre carrière et à accéder à des postes de gestion supérieurs.

 

********************************
$1000 Sign on Bonus

Well known for our solid worldwide reputation, Hertz is proud to be the largest car rental company. At Hertz, we know service excellence is built on our employees. We recognize that you are a unique individual and we understand that you value benefits and rewards that provide flexibility, choice, and control.  Benefits to working at Hertz can include health benefits such as medical, dental, vision, tuition reimbursement, online learning and development, employee discounts, retirement plan and much more!

 

Join the winning team at a company whose reputation speaks for itself…

 

As a Branch Manager…

 

You'll develop and maintain an effective marketing plan which details the steps to take in order to improve the success of the branch

 

  • Conduct face-to-face sales calls in order to obtain new business
  • Attend/host outside sales meetings or events to promote the company and branch location
  • Continue to increase the market penetration of the branch and increase revenue
  • Actively participate in the training, coaching, and mentoring of the Management Trainees, Managers and Sales and Service Associates.
  • Complete performance reviews on Management Trainees, Managers and Sales and Service Associates and hold a meeting with the individual to discuss strengths and weakness
  • Hold monthly staff meetings to keep employees motivated and informed of business operations
  • Complete sales calls with Managers and Management Trainees in order to further their development
  • Direct and organize all reservations and pick up customers as necessary
  • Handle or assist in the resolution of customer service issues if Managers and Management Trainees cannot.
  • Maintain a high level of customer service such that the Net Promoter Score for the store is at or above the location's goal.

 


Essential Requirements

 

Scolarité :

  • Diplôme d’études collégiales ou universitaires.

 

Expérience professionnelle :

  • Un an ou plus d’expérience en gestion, un atout.
  • Expérience en service à la clientèle, en gestion et dans la vente, un atout.
  • Expérience dans la location de voiture, l’hébergement ou le tourisme, un plus.
  • Connaissance des techniques de gestion Lean/Six Sigma/Toyota, un avantage.

 

Compétences :

  • Capacité de gérer des employés de façon professionnelle, par exemple : formation, établissement des attentes, suivi et mesures correctrices.
  • Excellentes compétences en communication et capacité d’entretenir une interaction verbale avec les clients.
  • Excellentes habiletés en vente.
  • Excellentes habiletés en résolution de problèmes et en prise de décisions.
  • Capacité de projeter une image professionnelle.
  • Connaissances et compétences de base en informatique, notamment des programmes Microsoft Office.
  • Maîtrise de l’anglais.
  • Doit posséder un permis de conduire valide.

* Remarque : La forme masculine est utilisée uniquement dans le but d'alléger le texte.

 

********************************

Education:

  • College Diploma or University Degree

 

Skills:

  • Customer Service, management, and sales experience required.
  • Experience in car rental, hospitality, or tourism preferred
  • Ability to drive multiple types of vehicles (automatic)
  • Ability to project professional appearance.
  • Excellent communications skills with the ability to engage in verbal interactions with customers.
  • Strong sales skills
  • Strong problem-solving and decision making skills.
  • Properly manage employees including; training, developing, setting expectations, and disciplining.
  • Must have basic computer skills and knowledge of Microsoft Office programs

 Other Requirements:

  • Must have a valid driver's license and an excellent driving record.
  • Must be able to carry out additional duties and responsibilities as assigned by management due to operational needs.
  • Must have the ability to work flexible schedules, including holidays, weekends, and overtime as required

At Hertz, we champion and celebrate a culture of diversity and inclusion. We take affirmative steps to promote employment and advancement opportunities. The endless variety of perspectives, experiences, skills and talents that our employees invest in their work every day represent a significant part of our culture – and our success and reputation as a company.

Individuals are encouraged to apply for positions because of the characteristics that make them unique. 

Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Hertz is a drug free workplace.

EOE, including disability/veteran

title: Senior Product Manager - Vehicle Access, Remote, Ontario
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Are you interested in making the car ownership experience better for families and the everyday driver? Can you picture yourself building products that leverage data, software, hardware to enhance the car ownership experience? That is the mission of the Digital Ownership team at Stellantis. Stellantis is transforming into a customer centric sustainable mobility company. The newly created Software organization will drive personalized mobility experiences to exceed customer expectations by leveraging technology. The features and products you build will be integrated into the 14 iconic Stellantis brand vehicles. 

We're looking for someone with a startup mindset, a bias toward action, and a burning desire to innovate. You are a smart, data-driven decision maker who excels building products and features consumers love. As a Senior Product Manager, you will work closely with senior leaders, product managers, designers, dev & test to deliver features within the vehicle controls and trip management vertical. 

Job responsibilities include but not limited to: 

 
* Lead the product roadmap related to vehicle access and build the strategy for the product(s) to align with customer and market needs 
* Work with engineering teams to groom and prioritize the product backlog 
* Drive the product execution, working closely with engineering, business development, marketing, UX, legal and other partnering teams to launch products users love 
* Pitch new product or enhancements to existing products to get buy-in from leadership team 
* Build a framework to measure ongoing product performance and use data to make decisions to improve the product 

FCA Canada Inc. is committed to providing accommodation for people with accessibility needs due to disabilities in all aspects of the hiring process. If you request an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs due to disability. 

All FCA Canada Inc. employees are required to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment in accordance with the FCA Canada Inc. Covid-19 Vaccination Policy. 

 



Basic Qualifications: 

 
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical field 
* EIGHT (8) years of relevant product management, product owner and/or software development experience creating consumer products 
* Experience building and shipping cloud-connected, highly scalable products which include hardware/software interactions 
* Experience managing complex projects and collaborating with internal and external partners 
* Strong written and verbal communication skills and a desire to create a collaborative team culture 
* Legally eligible to work in Canada 

Preferred Qualifications: 

 
* MBA 
* Passion for automotive and telematics is a plus 

 

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled</section>

title: Visual Merchandising Coordinator (6 Stores)|Ottawa Region
description:
Company Description

Under the supervision of the Visual Merchandising Director, the Visual Merchandiser Coordinator is responsible for creating a captivating shopping experience through the development and implementation of visual presentation standards to maintain visual presentation constant sales results and brand loyalty.

The Visual Merchandiser Coordinator will reinforce the brand's strategy and collaborate with the sales team to execute the visual presentation in the store.

Job Description

  • Assess store limitations to improve product presentation
  • Execute merchandising strategies in the long term and in the short term
  • Communicate visual presentation standards to the in-store sales team
  • Train in-store teams on maintaining visual presentation standards
  • Analyze trends, market needs and send them to the Visual Merchandising Supervisor
  • Ensure product locations comply with health and safety measures.
Qualifications

  • BAC or certificate in interior design or visual merchandising
  • Experience in visual merchandising (1 year)
  • Ability to work with Adobe (Photoshop, Illustrator, In Design) and AutoCAD
  • Holder of a valid driver's license and access to a car
  • Attention to detail.​​​​​


Additional Information

What we offer

  • Growth and advancement possibility
  • Group insurance starting six months after hiring
  • Virtual Healthcare, stress management and well-being service;
  • On-site parking
  • Various corporate discounts (gym, telecommunications, etc.)
  • 25% discount on all Structube items
  • A collaborative and solutions-oriented work environment
  • Much more!

About us

Structube wants to offer its clients a wide range of modern edge home furniture at its best affordable prices! We help our customers rediscover their home, one room at a time. With over 80 stores nationwide and over 700 employees and counting, Structube's small family business has become a thriving retailer brand looking to transform its future retail markets. Join Structube and come experience working with our ambitious, dynamic, and motivating team!

Dream a space for them. Dream a career for you at Structube!

title: Automotive Wheel Repair Technician
description:
Faites à nouveau rouler les roues.
Soyez un magicien de Dent Wizard.

 

À titre de Technicien des roues pour Dent Wizard, vous utiliserez les plus récents outils et techniques pour remettre en état les roues et les enjoliveurs de roues – et vous en serez récompensé par un potentiel de revenus sans plafond. Nous cherchons maintenant à embaucher à Laval, QC un individu travaillant qui possède les compétences et la personnalité extravertie nécessaires pour faire rouler les choses.

 

Vous travaillerez sur place chez les clients pour réparer des dommages esthétiques (égratignures de trottoirs et hasards de route, écaillements, frottements, rainures, rouille et roues déformées) à l’aide d’équipement de pulvérisation de peinture, d’outils électriques et de matériel professionnel. Le processus implique la dépose des roues, leur réparation dans votre camion mobile et leur pose sur le véhicule. Les tâches incluent la peinture des surfaces, l’inspection des roues, la préparation et le polissage des défauts, le mélange des couleurs et la finition.

 

La différence Dent Wizard

  • Un potentiel de revenus illimité et sans plafond, basé sur les commissions : plus vous travaillez dur, plus vous gagnez.
  • Excellents avantages, y compris une assurance santé, dentaire et soins de la vue, plan de participation à un REER, vacances payées et plus encore.
  • Avantages exceptionnels, notamment outils et matériel, véhicule de compagnie, carte d’essence et autres.
  • Camions écologiques avec filtres et aménagements anti-explosion, comprenant les couleurs FEO de roues prémélangées et préassorties.
  • Indépendance pour gérer votre journée; pas de microgestion.
  • Équipe agréable et dynamique où tout le monde se soutient et veille les uns sur les autres.
  • Travail varié sur divers types de véhicules, des nouveaux modèles aux vieux modèles.
  • Trois semaines de formation dans l’un de nos établissements avec des maîtres-techniciens des roues pour vous aider à apprendre des techniques avancées.
  • Formation payée et rémunérée, déplacement et hébergement défrayés par la société.
  • Développez vos compétences techniques et vos aptitudes de service à la clientèle lorsque vous accédez à l’emploi grâce au soutien de techniciens d’expérience.
  • Potentiel d’avancement vers des niveaux techniques supérieurs (au salaire plus élevé) ou vers des postes de gestion.

 

Ce qu’il vous faut pour réussir

  • Une expérience en peinture automobile ou formation professionnelle en carrosserie serait un atout.
  • Bonne vision, notamment vision rapprochée, vision distante et vision des couleurs, perception de la profondeur et capacité à focaliser.
  • Ténacité et robustesse pour travailler dehors en toutes conditions.
  • Excellentes aptitudes de communication et d’organisation pour interagir avec les clients et développer les comptes.
  • Dextérité manuelle pour les tâches à mouvement répétitif.
  • Solide éthique professionnelle, auto-motivation et capacité à travailler de manière indépendante.
  • Endurance physique pour s’agenouiller, se pencher, fléchir les jambes, grimper et soulever des poids allant jusqu’à 20 kg.
  • Permis de conduire et bon dossier de conduite.

 

À propos de Dent Wizard

Dent Wizard est le leader national incontesté en services de réparation automobile et de produits de protection pour les véhicules, et son succès est le fruit du travail de son personnel qui dessert les clients. Dent Wizard est une société stable, en croissance et établie sur un modèle d’affaires solide. Elle exerce ses activités dans 43 États américains et cinq provinces canadiennes, répare 2,5 millions de véhicules chaque année et compte plus de 3 000 employés hautement compétents. Aidez-vous à atteindre de nouveaux sommets tout en obtenant le respect, la rémunération et la reconnaissance que vous méritez.

 

Posez votre candidature maintenant!

Put the wheels back in motion. Be a Wizard.

 

As a Wheel Technician with Dent Wizard, you’ll use the latest tools and techniques to restore wheels and wheel covers – and we’ll reward you with uncapped earning potential. We’re hiring now in Laval, QC for a hard-working individual with the skills and outgoing personality to keep things rolling.

 

Working on site at customer locations, you’ll fix cosmetic damages (curb and road rash, peeling, scrapes, gouges, oxidation and bent wheels) using spray-painting equipment, power tools and work aids. The process involves removing the wheels, repairing them in your mobile truck and placing them back on the vehicle. Tasks include painting surfaces, inspecting wheels, prepping and buffing defects, mixing colors and finishing.

 

The Dent Wizard Difference

  • Unlimited, uncapped earning potential based on commission: the harder you work, the more you can make
  • Excellent benefits, including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), paid vacation and more
  • Outstanding perks, including tools and supplies, company truck, gas card and more
  • Environmentally friendly trucks with explosion-proof filtration and fixtures, outfitted with premixed and pre-matched OEM wheel colors
  • Independence to manage your day; no micromanagement
  • Fun and dynamic team where everyone is supportive and has your back
  • Variety of work on many types of cars, both new and old models
  • Three weeks of training at one of our facilities with Master Wheel Techs to help you learn advanced techniques
  • We pay for the training, pay you a salary while you train and provide travel and lodging
  • Develop your technical and customer service skills once you are on the job, with assistance from experienced Techs
  • Advancement potential into higher Tech levels (with more $) or management roles

 

 

What You Need to Succeed

  • Auto painting experience or collision repair technical school training preferred but not required
  • Vision abilities including close, distance and color vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus
  • Toughness and grit to work outside in all kinds of weather
  • Strong organizational and communication skills to interact with customers and build accounts
  • Manual dexterity for repetitive-motion tasks
  • Strong work ethic, self-motivation and the ability to work independently
  • Physical stamina to kneel, bend, squat and climb, as well as lift up to 45 pounds
  • Valid driver’s license and good driving record

 

About Dent Wizard

Dent Wizard is the nation’s undisputed leader in automotive reconditioning services and vehicle protection products – and our success is the result of the great people who serve our customers. We’re stable, growing and have a strong business model, with opportunities in 43 states, 2.5 million vehicles repaired every year and more than 3,000 highly skilled employees. Help us reach new heights and receive the respect, rewards and recognition you deserve.

 Apply Now!

Help us reach new heights and receive the respect, rewards and recognition you deserve.', 'Develop your technical and customer service skills once you are on the job, with assistance from experienced Techs', 'Dextérité manuelle pour les tâches à mouvement répétitif.', 'Fun and dynamic team where everyone is supportive and has your back', 'Strong organizational and communication skills to interact with customers and build accounts', 'Strong work ethic, self-motivation and the ability to work independently', 'Valid driver’s license and good driving record', 'Working on site at customer locations, you’ll fix cosmetic damages (curb and road rash, peeling, scrapes, gouges, oxidation and bent wheels) using spray-painting equipment, power tools and work aids. The process involves removing the wheels, repairing them in your mobile truck and placing them back on the vehicle. Tasks include painting surfaces, inspecting wheels, prepping and buffing defects, mixing colors and finishing.']

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Now Hiring

HEAVY DUTY MECHANIC / JOURNEYMAN

 

At Canada Cartage we work with intelligent and focused leaders who are driven to create an outstanding customer experience in partnership with Canadian leading brands. Canada Cartage is deep rooted in family values with an entrepreneurial culture where ideas are welcomed, growth is fostered and high performance is championed. A recognized thought leader and founded in 1914, Canada Cartage dominates the industry by delivering innovative fleet solutions.

We are currently looking to add  full-time, Heavy Duty Mechanics to our team. Someone who is equally passionate about serving the community and achieving operational success alongside our dedicated and loyal employees.

Located at 490 Lucas Avenue, Winnipeg Manitoba and reporting to the Service Manager, the Heavy Duty Mechanic with Canada Cartage Systems, will be performing preventative maintenance on our fleet. This will include carrying out diagnostic testing and repairs to primarily OTR truck & trailer equipment, using modern maintenance practices. This position is maintenance shop based, however our mechanics may be called on to carry out service calls and perform test drives to adequately service our fleet.

Available shift:

Monday to Friday - 6:00am - 2:30pm (5 day work week)

 

Responsibilities:

  • Performs assigned repairs and preventive maintenance services
  • Performs inspections, diagnostics and repair of electrical, hydraulic, suspension, brake, and air systems on vehicles and equipment
  • Utilizes vehicle on board diagnostics and diagnostic laptop/software to troubleshoot faults & failures in order to repair as required
  • Performs all work within the Standard Repair Times (SRTs)
  • Conducts safety checks on all vehicles and equipment
  • Completes the required paperwork, enters repair into Transman FMS program. Including detail of vehicle repair, parts used, and repair time
  • Reviews, completes, repairs identified on Driver Vehicle Inspection Reports. As assigned
  • Performs maintenance related repairs as required
  • Maintains a clean, safe work area in compliance with Corporate / OSHA Standards
  • Performs all work in accordance with established safety procedures
  • Is responsible for the quality of their work and the safety of the equipment that is worked on

 

 Core Competencies and Qualification:

  • Licensed Heavy Duty Mechanic
  • Proficient in performing various diagnostics, tests, and repairs with a diagnostic computer system
  • Physical requirements of this position will include the ability to push, pull, drag, and lift items up to 50 pounds, and occasionally must work at shoulder level with equipment weighing up to 25 pounds
  • Must be able to supply your own set of hand tools to perform basic repairs
  • Must have steel toe work boots. We provide an annual allowance for new boots and we provide all PPE and coveralls and a heavy parka, as you will primarily be working outside.
  • Must hold Safety of self & equipment as highest priority
  • CVI inspector license is beneficial
  • Must successfully pass a background check
  • Have your own hand tools

 

Why work for Canada Cartage?

  • No mandatory overtime.
  • Minimal outside mobile work (only boosting).
  • Heated shop equipped with pits for easy servicing.
  • Uniforms provided.
  • Recession-proof business model, steady hours all year around.
  • Well maintained, modern fleet (mostly 2018 and newer).
  • Performance based remuneration.
  • Online OEM Education (Navistar, Cummins).
  • Comprehensive benefits (life, disability, medication, dental, vision, RRSP and more).
  • 3 paid sick days per year.
  • Group discounts (Costco, Hertz, Bell, GMC, Lenovo, Goodlife Fitness and more).
  • Tool, boot and winter coat allowance.
  • College tuition fees reimbursement for apprentices.
  • Solid career advancement opportunities.


Our Team

We are a family-oriented company with competitive benefits, including extended health and dental, RRSP and Company-Matching pension plans; discounted hotels, car rentals, entertainment, gym memberships, phone plans, electronics, to name a few of the perks; a cohesive team and a positive, hard-working atmosphere. We have fun events throughout the year, like truck rodeos, summer barbeques and driver-appreciation week that regularly bring us together. It’s important to give back to the communities in which we operate, so we volunteer with and donate to local charities

We also have Company wide recognition initiatives designed to recognize drivers and staff when they demonstrate outstanding customer service, teamwork and our core values.

Why do we have one of the lowest driver turn-over rates in Canada?  A team environment, short-haul regular routes and great benefits.

Recognized leader in the industry:

Canada Cartage has been recognized on the Forbes list of Canada’s Best Employers 2022. This is the sixth straight year that Canada Cartage has been included on this list. https://www.forbes.com/companies/canada-cartage/?list=canada-best-employers&sh=7841454553d8

The Canada’s Best Employers 2022 title, along with our 6th year of being recognized by Trucking HR as one of Canada’s “Top Fleet Employers” serves to reinforce Canada Cartage’s reputation as an employer of high quality.

 

Our Values

Integrity: We conduct our business with honour, honest and ethics with our people, the environment and legal matters. We believe I being transparent and trustworthy, respecting the traditional “handshake” value system and earning our way in.

Humanity: We are a family minded organization, caring for people and treating them with dignity, decency and respect, be it employees, customers, suppliers or our partners. Open door policy and dealings is our way.

Accountability: Accountability and accessibility to our staff, customers and our customers’ customers is of utmost importance to us. We enable a high level of two way communication, providing access to people who wil deal with issues ad have the willingness to resolve things.  We will be relied on and held accountable for our results and our long term commitments.

Collaboration: We understand that results are the product of a team effort. As part of our process, we ensure collaboration with all our staff at all levels in all roles across departmental lines. With our customers, we use a collaborative style approach, sharing ownership to ensure a successful operation.

Dedication: Our organization is employee and customer-driven. We encourage an environment of conscientious effort and earnestness, hiring problem solvers who are responsive and have a "can-do" attitude to get the job done.

Leadership: Personal leadership to us means being competent, taking ownership, demonstrating initiative, and having a voice. Corporate leadership to us means being leaders in the market, continuous improvement and innovation, and empowering those around you.https://jobs.jobvite.com/canadacartage

Come work with an industry leader!

 

We would like to thank all those expressing an interest in this position; however only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Committed to employment equity, Canada Cartage Systems LP encourages applications from Aboriginal people, members of visible minority groups, and women.

title: Operations Manager (HVAC Service)
description:
Naylor Building Partnerships Inc. is an award winning, Canadian owned and run multi-trade mechanical, electrical, plumbing and compressed air contractor. We have been providing quality service, maintenance, repairs and installations to the commercial and industrial sector for over 50 years. Our commitment to hiring the best people allows us to provide strong technical expertise and knowledge to our customers, fostering long term partnerships with both our customers and employees.

We are currently seeking a hardworking, service focused leader to join our team as an Operations Manager. The successful candidate will work out of our Oakville office location.

Duties:

  • Overseeing the day-to-day operations of the HVAC service and installation department
  • Planning and executing multiple projects to plan and budget
  • Completing quotes for upcoming work and supporting the sales team
  • Maintaining excellent customer relations, resolving issues and concerns and act as technical resource to customer and field employees
  • Overseeing quality control and ensuring regulatory compliance
  • Supervising, motivating and coaching field technicians and contractors
  • Ensuring health and safety policies and company policies are adhered to

Requirements:

  • Licensed Journeyperson (313A Refrigeration & A/C Systems Mechanic) with a Gas Fitter 1 license, or a University degree/ College Diploma holder in a related field (i.e. Business, Engineering, CET)
  • A minimum of 3 - 5 years related industry experience (industrial, commercial, institutional) is required, with previous supervisory experience considered an asset.
  • Proficiency with MS Project, MS Office  (Excel, Word and Outlook)
  • Solid knowledge of government regulations and industry practices (i.e. OHSA, codes, etc.)
  • Ability to read blue prints, estimating experience considered an asset
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal and leadership skills and the ability to problem solve
  • Candidates must have access to a car and possess a valid driver's license and a good driving record.

Accessibility for Applicants: Naylor Building Partnerships Inc. is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free workplace that reflects the communities we serve. We will provide reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities at all stages of the hiring process in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code, the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005, and Naylorâ€™s Accessibility Policy. If you are a person with a disability and need the job posting in an alternative format or any other accessible accommodations during the hiring process, please email your request to our Human Resources department at 

careers@naylorbp.com

.

description:

We have been providing quality service, maintenance, repairs and installations to the commercial and industrial sector for over 50 years. Our commitment to hiring the best people allows us to provide strong technical expertise and knowledge to our customers, fostering long term partnerships with both our customers and employees.

We are currently looking for a Sales Representative to join our Business Development team.

Reporting to the Sales Manager, the Sales Representative will be responsible for generating new business through the identification and acquisition of new customers, lead generation activities and industry networking. The primary objective of this position is to meet or exceed quarterly and annual sales objectives with respect to new maintenance contract sales in an assigned geographic territory.

title: Motorcycle Sales Associate- Barnes H-D Victoria
description:
If you are a sales person who wants opportunities for growth, great pay, awesome coworkers, and enjoys basking in the sound of a revving Harley, look no further than Barnes Harley-Davidson! 

 

What we offer: 

  • FAMILY VALUES – We are family owned and operated. For over 40 years, the Barnes family has been hands-on running our dealerships, so we have that priceless personal touch and care. No faceless corporation here. 

  • CULTURE MATTERS – Communication, accountability, transparency, and motorcycles. Every member of our team works hard and has fun while doing it. We all win together. Oh, and don’t forget our epic events that keep your work day exciting, including show-and-shines and stunt shows! 

  • BENEFITS PLEASE – Don’t worry, we’ve got you. Health, dental, vacation days, mental healthcare, gym membership reimbursement, motorcycle riding courses, crazy staff discounts, free coffee every day, and free lunch every Saturday. 

  • I WANT A CAREER – Well, we build them. We have people that go from washing bikes to running dealerships. We have so many career path success stories, we’re tripping over them! Whatever your vision for your future, we will help make it happen. 

  • ALWAYS LEARNING – You’re going to end up knowing a lot more than you’ll ever need. Our receptionists know how to change the oil on a bike! With our internal Barnes University training programs and manufacturer factory training, we never stop learning.  

  • GOOD PEOPLE – We are hardcore bikers, people who have never touched a motorcycle in their life, parents, animal-lovers, geeks, musicians, writers, gamers, foodies, movie buffs, car fanatics, artists, caffeine-addicts, amateur comedians, and more. You’ll make friends here, guaranteed. 

  • LET’S GET PAID – Best in industry pay. Our incentive-based pay plans for most positions mean you are in charge of what you earn (we also provide a paid training period). There is no cap, so the sky is the limit!

 

What we’re looking for: 

  • Available to work flexible hours and weekends

  • Self-starter mentality and ambitious spirit preferred

  • Ready to waste no time on learning new product in’s and out’s, eager to improve

  • Phenomenal communication skills with customers and team members

  • Professional, well-groomed personal appearance

  • Clean driving record, valid driver’s license, and motorcycle license

Our hiring process: 

  1. You find or are sent this job ad. 

  1. You read the ad. 

  1. It piques your interest. 

  1. You tell us you’re interested (apply, email, call, shout from the rooftops). 

  1. We call you for a quick chat, and you tell us all about how awesome you are. 

  1. You’re hired! 

  1. You brag to all your friends and family about your sweet new life. 

 

So what are you waiting for? Discover a world of opportunity in sales role at Barnes Harley-Davidson! Rev the throttle, drop the clutch, and apply today!

title: Senior Product Manager - Vehicle Access, Remote, Ontario
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Are you interested in making the car ownership experience better for families and the everyday driver? Can you picture yourself building products that leverage data, software, hardware to enhance the car ownership experience? That is the mission of the Digital Ownership team at Stellantis. Stellantis is transforming into a customer centric sustainable mobility company. The newly created Software organization will drive personalized mobility experiences to exceed customer expectations by leveraging technology. The features and products you build will be integrated into the 14 iconic Stellantis brand vehicles. 

We're looking for someone with a startup mindset, a bias toward action, and a burning desire to innovate. You are a smart, data-driven decision maker who excels building products and features consumers love. As a Senior Product Manager, you will work closely with senior leaders, product managers, designers, dev & test to deliver features within the vehicle controls and trip management vertical. 

Job responsibilities include but not limited to: 

 
* Lead the product roadmap related to vehicle access and build the strategy for the product(s) to align with customer and market needs 
* Work with engineering teams to groom and prioritize the product backlog 
* Drive the product execution, working closely with engineering, business development, marketing, UX, legal and other partnering teams to launch products users love 
* Pitch new product or enhancements to existing products to get buy-in from leadership team 
* Build a framework to measure ongoing product performance and use data to make decisions to improve the product 

FCA Canada Inc. is committed to providing accommodation for people with accessibility needs due to disabilities in all aspects of the hiring process. If you request an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs due to disability. 

All FCA Canada Inc. employees are required to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment in accordance with the FCA Canada Inc. Covid-19 Vaccination Policy. 

 



Basic Qualifications: 

 
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical field 
* EIGHT (8) years of relevant product management, product owner and/or software development experience creating consumer products 
* Experience building and shipping cloud-connected, highly scalable products which include hardware/software interactions 
* Experience managing complex projects and collaborating with internal and external partners 
* Strong written and verbal communication skills and a desire to create a collaborative team culture 
* Legally eligible to work in Canada 

Preferred Qualifications: 

 
* MBA 
* Passion for automotive and telematics is a plus 

 

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled</section>

title: Sr. Principal, Data Science
description:
External Title: Sr. Principal, Data Science

Internal Title: Sr. Principal, Data Science

Location: Remote -Anywhere in Canada

Reports to: Vice President, Automotive Data Science & Innovation Data and Analytics

 

The Role: 

JD Power is looking for talented data scientists with excellent quantitative and analytical skills. Our ideal candidates are determined to combine the art and science of data analytics and marketing to help clients address the complex challenges surrounding price, promotion, customer journeys and multi-step purchase decisions. This includes consideration and uptake of new automotive technologies such as electric vehicles, online retailing and connected vehicles

You'll work hands on with quantitative data to analyze and reveal the business drivers of consumer choice, both to help create new capabilities, and to improve and maintain existing capabilities. You will have the freedom to utilize latest technologies to solve challenging problems, create innovative machine learning processes from the ground up, deploy to production, and develop tools for monitoring them

 

The Impact:

We make data products that solve problems for the auto industry. Every data scientist will build models that go into production and directly impact new and existing products.

Responsibilities:

  • Daily immersion in automotive industry data
  • Work with senior data scientists to ensure model quality in terms of modeling methodologies, data / model validation metrics, actionable insights, and analytical/technical best practices.
  • Implement models that are based on statistics, econometrics, and/or machine learning techniques such as: logistic regression, choice model, time-series model, panel data model, Bayesian statistics, structural equations, probability theory, clustering algorithms, etc.
  • Validate model results and package them into insightful client-friendly interpretations
  • Ensure rigorous quality control and detect anomalies in the model with ongoing new data streams
  • Interdisciplinary work: you'll interact with multiple teams across the firm to implement our end-to-end solutions and improve processes. This includes Consulting, New Product Development, Data, Engineering, etc.

 

Qualifications:

  • Demonstrated expertise with modeling multiple outcomes across a consumer's journey (e.g. Ranging from awareness to consideration and search, to purchase and post-purchase experience)
  • Demonstrated expertise with data analytics and/or statistical concepts such as: promotion/price, media mix modeling, multivariate regression, logistic regression, time-series modeling, Bayesian statistics, segmentation modeling, machine learning, data mining, simulation, optimization, and/or forecasting
  • Fluency in statistical programming software: Spark, R, or Python preferred
  • Fluency of database software: SQL preferred
  • Experience resolving complex data and analytical issues in creative and effective ways
  • Independent professional who can take a vision and implement with limited instruction, and may have experience coordinating activities of other professional technical personnel
  • Bachelor's degree (required) with statistics or mathematical background: Econometrics, Statistics, Operations Research, Quantitative Marketing, Finance, Engineering or similar
  • Master's degree in a technical field (e.g. Statistics, Data Science, Economics) a plus. PhD not required
  • An effective cross functional communicator in both written and verbal skills
  • Ability to manage multiple projects with a large cross-functional team
  • Ability and willingness to learn in a fast-paced environment
  • Resilient work ethic
  • 7-10 years of full-time quantitative analytics professional (non-academic) experience and quantified business impact

 

The Career Opportunity: 

Grow as a data scientist as part of a medium sized team. You will pipeline data, build models, deploy them in the cloud, and build monitoring suites.

 

The Team / The Business: 

The team is an experienced set of creative thinkers who are uncovering new and emerging consumer dynamics in an industry starting to go through rapid disruption

 

Our Hiring Manager says:

We want data science candidates who can think through a customer journey and an industry thoroughly, creatively and intuitively to explain and predict issues that have not yet been resolved. We need the capability to leverage the right data sets from an impressive set of data assets that is unrivaled in this space at your disposal.

 

J.D. Power is a global leader in consumer insights, advisory services and data and analytics. A pioneer in the use of big data, artificial intelligence (AI) and algorithmic modeling capabilities to understand consumer behavior, J.D. Power has been delivering incisive industry intelligence on customer interactions with brands and products for more than 50 years. The world's leading businesses across major industries rely on J.D. Power to guide their customer-facing strategies. 

Company Mission 

J.D. Power is clear about what we do to ensure our success into the future. We unite industry leading data and insights with world-class technology to solve our clients' toughest challenges.  

 

Our Values 

At J.D. Power, we strive to be Truth Finders, Change Makers and Team Driven - the distinct behaviors that, together, define our unique culture.  

 

Truth Finders - At J.D. Power, we are proud of the unbiased data and findings we provide. As individuals, each and every member of our team is dedicated to living this same objectivity and embodying the highest ethical and professional standards – the only 'favorite' we have is the truth.  

 

Change Makers - At J.D. Power, we never stand still. We constantly seek better ways – innovating and evolving in everything we do to support our colleagues and our clients alike – and all in service of delivering data and insights that drive meaningful business impact.  

 

Team Driven - At J.D. Power, we are one team and we are activated. Regardless of individual role, every member of our team is dedicated to supporting their immediate colleagues and our broader J.D. Power family to deliver on our collective purpose and make us greater than the sum of our parts. At J.D. Power, these values are more than words. We bring these values to life throughout our organization through our employee event series — J.D. Power Values Days. Each quarter, we celebrate one of our core values and hold an annual event to celebrate our combined values at the end of the year. 

 

We are dedicated to leveraging comprehensive and equitable practices which contribute to the overall success of the company and its employees. We invite you to learn more about our DE&I efforts.  

 

To all recruitment agencies: J.D. Power does not accept unsolicited agency resumes and we are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. 

EOE/M/F/Vets/Disabled

title: Mechanic/Welder, Heavy Duty
description:
Job posting closes: May 10, 2022 at 5:00 pm (Yukon Standard Time) 

An Eligibility List may be established from this competition – the duration of the eligibility list may be up to 12 months. The eligibility list may be used to fill future permanent full-time, permanent part-time, temporary full-time, temporary part-time, term or casual vacancies within the same department and classification based on the organizational needs by going to the next highest ranked candidate until the eligibility list expires.

This position is covered by a collective agreement between the City of Whitehorse and the Public Service Alliance of Canada/Yukon Employees Union. 

The City wishes to thank all applicants for their interest but only those candidates selected to advance in the recruitment will be contacted.  Note that only those candidates eligible to legally work in Canada will be considered.

Heavy Duty Equipment Mechanic/ Welder

Job Code:056
Department: Fleet and Transportation Maintenance

Job Summary:

Under the direction of the Leadhand, Equipment and Maintenance, the incumbent inspects, repairs, services and maintains all City-owned heavy duty, light duty and specialized equipment, and automotive vehicles.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  1. Complete inspection, testing, servicing, maintenance and repair of all City vehicles and equipment including light, medium and heavy duty in accordance with prescribes polices, directives and procedures.
  2. Maintain, operate and ensure efficient and safe operation of a variety of heavy duty, automotive and auxiliary equipment.
  3. Prepare written mechanical assessment reports and maintain accurate records.
  4. Performs semi-annual inspections of equipment as required by the National Safety Code.
  5. Ensure that all mechanical tools and equipment are in an acceptable state of repair and safe to use.
  6. Ensure, so far as is reasonably practicable, that safety procedures and standards are followed by staff throughout the department.
  7. Enter and maintain data in asset management computerized system.
  8. Advise and direct apprentice staff on the job site and orients City of Whitehorse staff on the basic operation and maintenance of equipment as required.
  9. Act as Leadhand, Equipment Maintenance as assigned.
  10. Other related duties.

This description contains elements necessary for identification and evaluation of the job. The incumbent may be required to perform other related duties.



Job Requirements:

Working Conditions:

Exposure to dust/dirt, fumes/odours, grease, oil, dangerous substances (petroleum products) and noise on a daily basis and temperature extremes/inclement weather when working in the shop and overseeing emergency repairs onsite and travelling between work locations. Occasional exposure to bodily fluids and wastes when repairing vactor trucks and garbage packers.

Required Knowledge, Skill and Abilities:

  • Journeyman Heavy Duty or Automotive Mechanic Certificate.
  • National Vehicle Code Safety Inspection Certificate.
  • 3 years related experience and 6 months on the job training.
  • Strong computer skills in computerized preventive maintenance system.
  • Class 3 Driver’s License with Air Endorsement. Class 2 drivers' license is an asset.
  • Standard First Aid with CPR.
  • Proven ability to concentrate, pay attention to detail, organize, set priorities, be goal oriented  and be a team player
  • Must be able to work with little supervision and function in a multidiscipline envoirnment.
  • Ability to lift in excess of 23 kg for short periods of time on a daily basis

An equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered.

Examples of Equipment to Operate:

All classes of vehicles and equipment, full range of mechanical tools/equipment for the purposes of inspecting, testing, servicing, repairing and maintaining vehicles and equipment, diagnostic software applications and computer with applications such as Outlook, Word, Excel and ERP Work Tech.

Other Details:

COVID-19 Note: The City of Whitehorse recently lifted requirements for all new hires to be fully vaccinated from Covid-19 before their start date. The Covid-19 situation continues to evolve and the previous vaccination requirements for all current City employees and new hires may be re-instated, should the prevailing status change. The City of Whitehorse continues to follow the direction and recommendations from Yukon's Chief Medical Officer of Health (CMOH) and public health authorities. 

Job seekers are required to create an online profile and submit their application electronically through the City's online Applicant system via www.whitehorse.ca/careers. Instructions on applications are provided at https://www.whitehorse.ca/departments/human-resources/how-to-apply. If you have any further questions regarding this posting, please contact the recruiter at

HR@whitehorse.ca

.

To apply for this position, you are required to submit your resume. 

Various tests and/or exams may be administered as part of the recruiting process. 

At the time this posting closes, candidates must have valid and current licenses/certifications/education that match the position requirements. Candidates who are selected to continue with the recruiting process will be required to provide proof of qualifications during their interview.

title: Automotive Service Technician - Destination Mazda Vancouver ($2,000.00 Signing Bonus)
description:
Recognized as the 2019 Canadian Automotive Dealers Association (CADA) Laureate Award Winner for Business Innovation and one of Canada's Best Employers for Recent Graduates for 2022, Destination Mazda Vancouver is looking for an  Automotive Service Technician who is looking to take the next step within their career!  Are you a Journeyman technician or 4th year apprentice who needs that support to get to the Journeyman level? Come and join our team!

It's Different Here - What we can provide for you:

  • Competitive compensation plan
  • Enhanced group health benefits program - Critical Illness, Extended health (including vision care) and dental coverage, etc.
  • An environment that is friendly, respectful, collaborative and ultimately supports your success!
  • Long term career opportunities!
  • $2,000.00 Signing Bonus for successful hire!

What we need from you:

  • Fully licensed (Red Seal) automotive technician or 4th Year Apprentice with prior dealership experience.
  • Can analyze and interpret the needs of our customers concerns and offer the appropriate options, solutions, and resolutions.
  • Can operate independently in a fast-paced environment while ensuring quality is best-in-class!
  • Have an above average technical aptitude.
  • Previous Mazda training and experience is not necessary but will be considered an asset.
  • CDK dealer management system experience an asset.
  • Well developed communication skills - can effectively work and interact with other members of the dealership.
  • The ability to follow policies and procedures as mandated my manufacture guidelines.
  • Valid driver's License with a clean driving abstract.

If this sounds like you submit your resume to our human resources team today.

Destination Auto Group is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Field Service Technician - Montreal
description:
Field Service Technician - Montreal


General information


City: Montréal


State/Province: Quebec


Country: Canada


Department: Technical Customer Services


Date: Wednesday, April 13, 2022


Working time: Full-time


Ref#: 20014277


Job Level: Individual Contributor


Job Type: Experienced


Job Field: Technical Customer Services


Seniority Level: Associate


Description & Requirements


About Xerox Holdings Corporation:


For more than 100 years, Xerox has continually redefined the workplace experience. Harnessing our leadership position in office and production print technology, we’ve expanded into software and services to sustainably power today’s workforce. From the office to industrial environments, our differentiated business solutions and financial services are designed to make every day work better for clients — no matter where that work is being done. Today, Xerox scientists and engineers are continuing our legacy of innovation with disruptive technologies in digital transformation, augmented reality, robotic process automation, additive manufacturing, Industrial Internet of Things and cleantech. Learn more at xerox.com and explore our commitment to diversity, inclusion and belonging (https://www.xerox.com/en-us/jobs/diversity) .


_“The Company requires COVID-19 vaccination. Please direct requests for COVID 19 vaccination accommodation to_ _AskHR@xerox.com_ _. Reasonable accommodations will be provided where required by law.”_


We're an industry leader that's rapidly growing our Technical Services division and have an immediate need for professional field service technicians to delight our customers.


It is important that our Copier and Printer Field Service Technicians do these 3 things well:


· Provide outstanding service to our clients . It is imperative that their printers are working correctly, and that our customers receive top-notch service at all times.


· Use electro-mechanical skills to repair devices. Xerox provides training by certified instructors, as well as online and in-house training. A good foundation of electrical and mechanical knowledge will help you learn copier and printer repair quickly.


· Achieve key productivity goals. This includes 5 gross calls per day, an efficiency rating (fixing it right the first time) of 50% or higher, response time commitments between 2-4 hours, and keeping parts costs to a minimum.


Here's what we're looking for in your background, to make sure this is a mutually great fit:


· Electro-mechanical experience including using a multi-meter to troubleshoot electrical circuits, and the ability to read and comprehend electrical schematics to properly troubleshoot systems. This could include past roles as an HVAC technician, Electrician, Automotive Mechanic or Repair, Military or Veteran with electro-mechanical experience.


· Superior time management skills and RELIABILITY . Our customers are counting on you. If you're a "10 minutes early is on time, and on time is late" person, we want to talk about your career goals! If you're an "always running behind, something's always coming up" person, we'll be honest: this role isn't the best fit for you.


· Valid driver's license, appropriate insurance coverage, and a clean driving history. A Motor Vehicle Record (MVR) is included in our technician background check.


· Ability to lift 50 pounds, stand and walk for extended periods of time, pull, lift, squat, reach, bend, and stoop to equipment, parts, and supplies. Again, this is an extremely active position that requires walking, standing, squatting, bending, and driving for over 50% of the workday .


· Brownie points for A+, MCSE, or MCP certifications and familiarity with networking IT skills, including a firm grasp of IP networking and common IT protocols (SMB, FTP, SNMP, SMTP).


Do you have what it takes? Here's what success looks like in 30 days:


· You have completed new hire training, and you've built a solid foundation of knowledge of Xerox, our clients, and our customer service culture.


· You have established a thorough understanding of your daily workload, including the energy and positive attitude that it will take to maintain client satisfaction.


· You have begun to deliver great customer service as you complete calls on copier and printers, with assistance from your manager or another team member.


· You have completed at least 50% of the technical training courses on the devices in your portfolio.


· You have maintained a functional part and supplies stock to properly support the equipment within your territory.


And here's what success looks like in 60 days:


· You've completed 100% of the training courses required to fully support the equipment assigned to you.


· You are actively and correctly completing service calls on printers independently.


· You've completed your first stock audit with no variance.


And last but certainly not least, we offer great benefits, including:


· Full medical/dental/vision, wellness credits, and a company contribution to a Health Savings Account.


· Paid time off, plus holidays and personal days.


· The ability to grow! Possible career tracks include Production Technician or Field Service Manager.


_Xerox is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, national origin, age, gender identity or expression, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, use of a guide dog or service animal, military/veteran status, citizenship status, basis of genetic information, or any other group protected by law. Learn more at_ _www.xerox.com_ _and explore our_ commitment to diversity and inclusion! (https://www.xerox.com/en-us/jobs/diversity) _People with disabilities who need a reasonable accommodation to apply or compete for employment with Xerox may request such accommodation(s) by sending an e-mail to_ _XeroxStaffingAdminCenter@xerox.com_ _. Be sure to include your name, the job you are interested in, and the accommodation you are seeking._


_© 2020 Xerox Corporation. All rights reserved. Xerox® and Xerox and Design® are trademarks of Xerox Corporation in the United States and/or other countries._

title: Work Equipment Truck Driver
description:
Our client is looking for skilled tradespeople who are interested in continually learning and building a career in a safety-focused, team environment. Working on state-of-the-art equipment and train cars that carry freight from coast-to-coast-to-coast, you’ll feel proud knowing you’re a part of what makes the economy work. And with paid training, you’ll be able to evolve your skills.

The Work Equipment Truck Driver is responsible for operating various equipment such as heavy-duty and railroad machinery. Additionally, the incumbent maintains documentation such as Driver’s Logbook records and Driver-Vehicle Inspection Report (DVIR).

Major Responsibilities:
  • Operate winch tractor and trailer unit primarily within British Columbia (BC) and Alberta (AB), but may be required to travel into other provinces
  • Secure equipment and track materials for highway transport
  • Operate heavy-duty and railroad machinery for loading
  • Obtain Single Trip Permits
  • Maintain Driver’s Logbook records, DVIRs, and Fuel Reports
  • Use lowbed and deck trailers, as well as highway vans
Working Conditions:
  • Able to work, drive, and load equipment in all types of weather conditions year-round
  • Able to install and use tire chains
  • Must be able to work overtime, which is a regular part of the work regimen in order to aid in response to critical incidences
  • Must be available to regularly work away from the home terminal for considerable periods of time
  • Role is entitled to reimbursement of meals and accommodation expenses incurred
  • May be assigned other duties as required
  • Available to work shifts from Tuesday through Saturday, 7am to 3pm, the start times may be changed due to operational needs, and rest on Sundays and Mondays*
  • Incumbent located at the headquarters in Prince George, BC*
Requirements:
  • Minimum 1 year of experience with winch tractor trailer operation
  • Minimum 2 years of experience with a winch truck
  • Experience in loading, securing, and hauling machinery on deck trailers*
  • Experience in trucking inter-provincially
  • Able to obtain qualification in Canadian Rail Operating Rules (CROR) and Railway Operating Rules (ROR)
  • Must pass the Company‘s required medical assessment
  • Able to qualify in Driving Tests or equivalent
  • Must possess a Class 1 Licence with Air Endorsement required to operate tractor units with winch
  • Possess Class 1A Licence for 5 years*
  • Able to qualify in eight axle configurations utilizing jeeps and boosters
  • Must provide Driver’s Abstract Release
  • Must report all past driving violations as well as sign a Disclosure agreement stating that they are going to report all driving violations
  • Knowledge of the Mountain Region Territory
  • Must be conversant with all federal and provincial regulations
  • Any experience/education/skills/knowledge for these above would be considered as an asset
Training:
Upon hiring, the position attends formal and on-the-job training. The incumbent is required to complete the training program successfully. The position receives classroom training over a period of 4 weeks at 40 hours per week. The training is primarily on health and safety rules and basic machine operator procedures. Successful completion of the classroom and on-the-job training is mandatory to continue employment.

This position is a unionized position. As such, pay and benefits are governed by the applicable collective agreement.

title: AZ Truck Drivers - Exciting Career Opportunity
description:
The Challenger Difference      

Itâ€™s not by chance that Challenger is a leading North American freight transportation company.  In 40 years, Challenger has grown from one person with a vision and a truck to an international transportation and supply chain management company.

  • 2022 Best Fleets to Drive for Best Overall Large Carrier
  • People-first culture
  • Team-oriented approach to success

If this interests you, we want to hear from you.

300 Maple Grove Road

title: PDR Technician
description:
Grâce à vous, les bosses seront une espèce en voie de disparition. Soyez un magicien de Dent Wizard.

 

À titre de technicien en débosselage sans peinture pour Dent Wizard, vous aurez un potentiel de revenus illimité en faisant votre magie pour éliminer les bosses et surpasser les attentes des clients. Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d’un technicien en débosselage sans peinture pour Laval, QC. 

 

À l’aide de notre procédé exclusif, vous réparerez des bosses chez des clients (travail mobile) ou à un emplacement assigné. Vous évaluerez le travail avec les clients et inspecterez les lots, rédigerez des bons de commande et négocierez afin d’obtenir l’approbation et développer les affaires. Vous pourriez contribuer à former d’autres techniciens et collaborer avec votre chef de service pour trouver de nouveaux comptes clients. Ce poste requiert des compétences techniques, une attitude axée sur la qualité et une personnalité extravertie.

 

La différence Dent Wizard

  • Un potentiel de revenus illimité et sans plafond, basé sur les commissions : plus vous travaillez dur, plus vous gagnez.
  • Excellents avantages, y compris une assurance santé, dentaire et soins de la vue, plan de participation à un REER, vacances payées et plus encore.
  • Avantages exceptionnels, notamment téléphone mobile, véhicule de compagnie, carte d’essence, allocation pour des outils, vêtements et autres.
  • Indépendance pour gérer votre journée; pas de microgestion.
  • Équipe agréable et dynamique où tout le monde se soutient et veille les uns sur les autres.
  • Travail varié sur divers types de véhicules, des nouveaux modèles aux vieux modèles.
  • Huit semaines de formation théorique et pratique dans l’un de nos établissements avec des maîtres-techniciens en débosselage sans peinture pour vous aider à apprendre des techniques avancées.
  • Formation payée et rémunérée, déplacement et hébergement défrayés par la société.
  • Développez vos compétences techniques et vos aptitudes de service à la clientèle lorsque vous accédez à l’emploi grâce au soutien de techniciens d’expérience.
  • Potentiel d’avancement vers des niveaux techniques supérieurs (au salaire plus élevé) ou vers des postes de gestion.

 Ce qu’il vous faut pour réussir

  • Excellentes aptitudes de communication pour interagir avec les clients et développer les comptes.
  • Solide éthique professionnelle, auto-motivation et capacité à travailler de manière indépendante.
  • Ténacité et robustesse pour travailler dehors en toutes conditions.
  • Endurance physique pour s’agenouiller, se pencher, fléchir les jambes et soulever des poids allant jusqu’à 23 kg.
  • Excellente dextérité manuelle pour les tâches à mouvement répétitif.
  • Permis de conduire et bon dossier de conduite.

 

À propos de Dent Wizard

Dent Wizard est le leader national incontesté en services de réparation automobile et de produits de protection pour les véhicules, et son succès est le fruit du travail de son personnel qui dessert les clients. Dent Wizard est une société stable, en croissance et établie sur un modèle d’affaires solide. Elle exerce ses activités dans 43 États américains et cinq provinces canadiennes, répare 2,5 millions de véhicules chaque année et compte plus de 3 000 employés hautement compétents. Aidez-vous à atteindre de nouveaux sommets tout en obtenant le respect, la rémunération et la reconnaissance que vous méritez.

 Posez votre candidature maintenant!

Make dents an endangered species. Be a wizard.

 As a Paintless Dent Removal Tech with Dent Wizard, you’ll have unlimited earning potential as you do your magic to remove dents and exceed customer expectations. We’re hiring right now for a PDR Technician in Laval, QC.  

 Using our proprietary process, you’ll repair ding and dent damage for customers on a mobile route or at an assigned location. You’ll review your work with customers, as well as walk lots, write work orders and negotiate to gain approval and build business. You may get involved in training other Techs and working with your Manager to prospect new accounts. This job requires technical skill, a quality mindset and an outgoing personality.
The Dent Wizard Difference

  • Unlimited, uncapped earning potential based on commission: the harder you work, the more you can make
  • Outstanding perks, including mobile phone, company car, gas card, tools allowance, clothing and more
  • Independence to manage your day; no micromanagement
  • Fun and dynamic team where everyone is supportive and has your back
  • Variety of work on many types of cars, both new and old models
  • Eight weeks of hands-on and classroom training at one of our facilities with Master PDR Techs to help you learn advanced techniques
  • We pay for the training, pay you a salary while you train and provide travel and lodging
  • Develop your technical and customer service skills once you are on the job, with assistance from experienced Techs
  • Advancement potential into higher Tech levels (with more $) or management roles

 What You Need to Succeed

  • Excellent communication skills to interact with customers and build accounts
  • Strong work ethic, self-motivation and the ability to work independently
  • Toughness and grit to work outside in all kinds of weather
  • Physical stamina to kneel, bend and squat, as well as lift up to 50 pounds
  • Excellent manual dexterity for repetitive-motion tasks
  • Valid driver’s license and good driving record

 About Dent Wizard

Dent Wizard is the nation’s undisputed leader in automotive reconditioning services and vehicle protection products – and our success is the result of the great people who serve our customers. We’re stable, growing and have a strong business model, with opportunities in 43 states, 2.5 million vehicles repaired every year and more than 3,000 highly skilled employees. Help us reach new heights and receive the respect, rewards and recognition you deserve.

 Apply Now!

title: Stagiaire en gestion/Management Trainee
description:
General Responsibilities

Join the World’s Largest Car Rental Company as a Branch Manager Trainee! As a Branch Manager Trainee, you are responsible for driving your own career, we just provide the fuel! Each year, many talented people join Hertz, and the best become future Branch Managers of our Hertz Local Edition branches.

 

Our program provides hands-on training in: sales, operations, customer service, finance & accounting management, revenue management, fleet management, and most importantly: people management.

Hertz rewards its employees with competitive compensation packages including: hourly pay, overtime pay, and performance based bonuses. Our successful training employees have the ability to earn over $45,000k a year upon achievement of all company goals. You will also receive the use of a company car upon entry into the Branch Manager ranks.

 

The Hertz program provides a clearly defined career path to a Branch Manager in as little as 1 year! Our promotions don’t stop there; our top level management regularly comes from the Training ranks.

 

Your journey with Hertz will start off as a Branch Manager Trainee, quickly progressing into a Management Associate, while quickly gaining experience for a future Branch Manager role.

 

As a Branch Manager Trainee, you will be responsible for:

  • Supporting achievement of location sales and margin goals
  • Ensuring positive customer experience, making Hertz #1 in car rental company experience
  • Achieving individual sales goals and customer service goals
  • Growing sales utilizing business-to-business sales tactics
  • Support branch’s business plan by assisting the Branch Manager
  • Upholding company standards by ensuring cars are presentable to customers
  • Clean and service facilities to ensure customer satisfaction

In addition to our competitive compensation package, Hertz also provides world class benefits, which include:

  • Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
  • Life Insurance
  • Up to 4 weeks of paid vacation a year (* depending on employment level)
  • Hertz Pension Plan
  • Employee Discounts

*Successful candidates will initially be employed in our Branch Manager training program as a Manager Trainee.

 

***************************

Stagiaire en gestion

 

Joignez-vous à la plus grande entreprise de location de voitures au monde en tant que gérant de succursale stagiaire! En tant que gérant de succursale stagiaire, c’est vous qui dirigez votre carrière, alors que nous vous fournissons le carburant pour avancer! Chaque année, de nombreux individus talentueux se joignent à Hertz et les meilleurs d’entre eux deviennent de futurs gérants de nos succursales de quartier Hertz Local Edition.

 

Notre programme offre une formation pratique dans les secteurs suivants : vente, opérations, service à la clientèle, finances et gestion de comptes, gestion des revenus, gestion du parc automobile et, plus important encore, gestion du personnel. Hertz récompense ses employés au moyen d’un régime de rémunération concurrentiel comprenant un salaire horaire, la rémunération des heures supplémentaires et des primes de rendement. Nos employés qui réussissent leur formation ont la possibilité de gagner au delà de 45 000 $ par an lorsqu’ils atteignent tous les objectifs de l’entreprise. Vous aurez également un véhicule de l’entreprise à votre disposition lorsque vous deviendrez gérant de succursale.

 

Le programme de Hertz présente un parcours professionnel clairement défini qui vous permet de devenir gérant de succursale en aussi peu qu’un an! Et nos promotions ne s’arrêtent pas là : des gestionnaires de haut rang sont souvent choisis parmi les rangs des associés formés.

Vous commencerez votre carrière chez Hertz en tant que gérant de succursale stagiaire et progresserez rapidement jusqu’à devenir un associé en gestion, tout en acquérant rapidement de l’expérience en vue d’un poste futur de gérant de succursale.

 

En tant que gérant de succursale stagiaire, vous aurez les responsabilités suivantes :

  • Contribuer à l’atteinte des objectifs de vente et de marge bénéficiaire de la succursale.
  • Garantir une expérience positive aux clients, faisant ainsi de Hertz le numéro 1 des entreprises de location de voitures en matière d’expérience.
  • Atteindre vos objectifs personnels de vente et de service à la clientèle.
  • Faire croître les ventes en recourant à des tactiques de vente interentreprises.
  • Soutenir le plan d’affaires de la succursale en assistant le gérant de la succursale.
  • Respecter les normes de l’entreprise en vous assurant que les voitures sont présentables aux clients.
  • Garder les installations propres et bien entretenues de manière à garantir la satisfaction de la clientèle.

En plus de notre régime de rémunération concurrentiel, Hertz offre des avantages de premier plan incluant de qui suit :

  • Assurance des soins médicaux, dentaires et de la vue.
  • Assurance vie.
  • Jusqu’à 4 semaines de vacances payées par année (selon le niveau du poste).
  • Régime de retraite de Hertz.
  • Remises pour les employés.

* Les candidats retenus seront embauchés initialement dans notre programme de formation des gérants de succursale en tant que gérants stagiaires.


Essential Requirements

To be successful in this role, our ideal employees typically have:

  • Previous held Leadership roles i.e., Campus, Community or Sports
  • Previous sales and/or retail customer service experience
  • Strong communication and multitasking skills
  • Ability to drive multiple types of vehicles
  • Ability to read and understand driving directions and maps
  • Proficiency in English
  • Valid driver’s license in good standing
  • Minimum High School Diploma 

Physical Requirements:

Applicant must possess all auditory, speaking and communicating capabilities necessary to complete the responsibilities detailed above. The essential functions of this position include, but are not limited to, the following such as sitting, standing, walking, bending and twisting, climbing, driving, speaking, hearing, writing, lifting, typing, filing, seeing, and reading. Knowledge of equipment operation such as computer terminal, telephone, portable, copy machine, and fax machine is required.

 

All employment is contingent upon the successful completion of applicable background screening.

 

****************************

 

Pour réussir dans ce rôle, les employés idéaux ont habituellement l’expérience et les compétences suivantes :

  • Expérience dans un poste de leadership, par exemple sur un campus, au sein d’une communauté ou dans une organisation sportive.
  • Expérience dans la vente ou le service à la clientèle dans le secteur de la vente au détail.
  • Excellente compétences en communication et en fonctionnement multitâche.
  • Capacité de conduire plusieurs types de véhicules.
  • Capacité de lire et de comprendre des itinéraires et des cartes routières.
  • Maîtrise de l’anglais.
  • Permis de conduire valide et en règle.
  • Grade d’associé au minimum.

Exigences physiques :

Le candidat doit posséder toutes les capacités auditives, en expression orale et en communication nécessaires pour s’acquitter des responsabilités décrites ci-dessus. Les exigences physiques essentielles de ce poste incluent, mais sans s’y limiter : s’asseoir, se tenir debout, marcher, se pencher et se tourner, grimper, conduire une voiture, parler, écouter, écrire, soulever, taper au clavier, classer des dossiers, voir et lire. La connaissance du fonctionnement d’appareils comme un terminal d’ordinateur, un téléphone, un ordinateur portatif, un photocopieur et un télécopieur est requise.

 

Tout emploi dépend de la réussite de la vérification des antécédents applicables.

 

Tous les détenteurs d’un diplôme collégial sont encouragés à présenter leur candidature.

 

* Remarque : La forme masculine est utilisée uniquement dans le but d'alléger le texte.

 

 

At Hertz, we champion and celebrate a culture of diversity and inclusion. We take affirmative steps to promote employment and advancement opportunities. The endless variety of perspectives, experiences, skills and talents that our employees invest in their work every day represent a significant part of our culture – and our success and reputation as a company.

Individuals are encouraged to apply for positions because of the characteristics that make them unique. 

Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. 

EOE, including disability/veteran
