title: PDR Technician
description:
Grâce à vous, les bosses seront une espèce en voie de disparition. Soyez un magicien de Dent Wizard.

 

À titre de technicien en débosselage sans peinture pour Dent Wizard, vous aurez un potentiel de revenus illimité en faisant votre magie pour éliminer les bosses et surpasser les attentes des clients. Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d’un technicien en débosselage sans peinture pour Laval, QC. 

 

À l’aide de notre procédé exclusif, vous réparerez des bosses chez des clients (travail mobile) ou à un emplacement assigné. Vous évaluerez le travail avec les clients et inspecterez les lots, rédigerez des bons de commande et négocierez afin d’obtenir l’approbation et développer les affaires. Vous pourriez contribuer à former d’autres techniciens et collaborer avec votre chef de service pour trouver de nouveaux comptes clients. Ce poste requiert des compétences techniques, une attitude axée sur la qualité et une personnalité extravertie.

 

La différence Dent Wizard

  • Un potentiel de revenus illimité et sans plafond, basé sur les commissions : plus vous travaillez dur, plus vous gagnez.
  • Excellents avantages, y compris une assurance santé, dentaire et soins de la vue, plan de participation à un REER, vacances payées et plus encore.
  • Avantages exceptionnels, notamment téléphone mobile, véhicule de compagnie, carte d’essence, allocation pour des outils, vêtements et autres.
  • Indépendance pour gérer votre journée; pas de microgestion.
  • Équipe agréable et dynamique où tout le monde se soutient et veille les uns sur les autres.
  • Travail varié sur divers types de véhicules, des nouveaux modèles aux vieux modèles.
  • Huit semaines de formation théorique et pratique dans l’un de nos établissements avec des maîtres-techniciens en débosselage sans peinture pour vous aider à apprendre des techniques avancées.
  • Formation payée et rémunérée, déplacement et hébergement défrayés par la société.
  • Développez vos compétences techniques et vos aptitudes de service à la clientèle lorsque vous accédez à l’emploi grâce au soutien de techniciens d’expérience.
  • Potentiel d’avancement vers des niveaux techniques supérieurs (au salaire plus élevé) ou vers des postes de gestion.

 Ce qu’il vous faut pour réussir

  • Excellentes aptitudes de communication pour interagir avec les clients et développer les comptes.
  • Solide éthique professionnelle, auto-motivation et capacité à travailler de manière indépendante.
  • Ténacité et robustesse pour travailler dehors en toutes conditions.
  • Endurance physique pour s’agenouiller, se pencher, fléchir les jambes et soulever des poids allant jusqu’à 23 kg.
  • Excellente dextérité manuelle pour les tâches à mouvement répétitif.
  • Permis de conduire et bon dossier de conduite.

 

À propos de Dent Wizard

Dent Wizard est le leader national incontesté en services de réparation automobile et de produits de protection pour les véhicules, et son succès est le fruit du travail de son personnel qui dessert les clients. Dent Wizard est une société stable, en croissance et établie sur un modèle d’affaires solide. Elle exerce ses activités dans 43 États américains et cinq provinces canadiennes, répare 2,5 millions de véhicules chaque année et compte plus de 3 000 employés hautement compétents. Aidez-vous à atteindre de nouveaux sommets tout en obtenant le respect, la rémunération et la reconnaissance que vous méritez.

 Posez votre candidature maintenant!

Make dents an endangered species. Be a wizard.

 As a Paintless Dent Removal Tech with Dent Wizard, you’ll have unlimited earning potential as you do your magic to remove dents and exceed customer expectations. We’re hiring right now for a PDR Technician in Laval, QC.  

 Using our proprietary process, you’ll repair ding and dent damage for customers on a mobile route or at an assigned location. You’ll review your work with customers, as well as walk lots, write work orders and negotiate to gain approval and build business. You may get involved in training other Techs and working with your Manager to prospect new accounts. This job requires technical skill, a quality mindset and an outgoing personality.
The Dent Wizard Difference

  • Unlimited, uncapped earning potential based on commission: the harder you work, the more you can make
  • Outstanding perks, including mobile phone, company car, gas card, tools allowance, clothing and more
  • Independence to manage your day; no micromanagement
  • Fun and dynamic team where everyone is supportive and has your back
  • Variety of work on many types of cars, both new and old models
  • Eight weeks of hands-on and classroom training at one of our facilities with Master PDR Techs to help you learn advanced techniques
  • We pay for the training, pay you a salary while you train and provide travel and lodging
  • Develop your technical and customer service skills once you are on the job, with assistance from experienced Techs
  • Advancement potential into higher Tech levels (with more $) or management roles

 What You Need to Succeed

  • Excellent communication skills to interact with customers and build accounts
  • Strong work ethic, self-motivation and the ability to work independently
  • Toughness and grit to work outside in all kinds of weather
  • Physical stamina to kneel, bend and squat, as well as lift up to 50 pounds
  • Excellent manual dexterity for repetitive-motion tasks
  • Valid driver’s license and good driving record

 About Dent Wizard

Dent Wizard is the nation’s undisputed leader in automotive reconditioning services and vehicle protection products – and our success is the result of the great people who serve our customers. We’re stable, growing and have a strong business model, with opportunities in 43 states, 2.5 million vehicles repaired every year and more than 3,000 highly skilled employees. Help us reach new heights and receive the respect, rewards and recognition you deserve.

 Apply Now!

title: Automotive Parts Manager, Richmond, British Columbia (AORP)
description:
Automotive Parts Manager, Richmond, British Columbia (AORP)

Location:Richmond, BC
Brand: European
Requirements:
  • MUST be willing to relocate or commute to Richmond
  • MUST be willing to work 8 hour shifts (M-F) plus weekend availability
  • MUST have 3-5 years parts experience with brand experience is ideal
  • MUST have a valid Canadian Drivers' License
  • PREFER Journeyman Parts Ticket or >3years Brand Experience
  • Professional in both communication and in appearance
  • Ability to build and sustain relationships
  • Strong writing Skills
  • Self motivated and high energy
  • Can work individual and as part of a team
  • General understanding of automotive systems and parts
Pay:
  • Pay is negotiable
  • M-F 8 Hour Days with weekend availability
  • Two weeks vacation after your first year
  • Full benefits after 90 Days
  • Relocation loans are available
If this position is of interest please let us know as soon as possible
ADDITIONAL INFO:
When you apply for this position you give the Recruiting Room permission to share your information with other team members and our network of employers.You further acknowledge that the Recruiting Room is a free service to all candidates and as such, furtheragree to indemnify and hold harmless Recruiting Room from any allegations, claims, actions, suits, demands, damages, liabilities, obligations, losses, settlements, judgments, costs and expenses (including without limitation attorneys’ fees and costs) that result from the sharing of this data.
You further acknowledge, and give consent, for the Recruiting Room to check your previous employers (to make a hiring decision), if you fail to provide references before the point of offer.We only ask questions that are “reasonably required,” for our employers to assess the applicant’s fitness for the job.We DO NOT contact current employers.
You further acknowledge, by applying for this position, you allow the Recruiting Room, and its agents, to contact you via SMS Messaging (texting), Facebook, Instagram or any other forms of social networking.

title: Office Manager (part-time, in-office)
description:
OUR VISION 

At EarthDaily Analytics we strive to build a more sustainable planet by creating innovative solutions that combine satellite imagery of the Earth, modern software engineering, machine learning, and cloud computing to solve the worldâ€™s toughest challenges in agriculture, water management, carbon capture verification and more. Our focus has been on building the worldâ€™s most advanced satellite image processing pipelines capable of delivering automated, reliable, meaningful analytics from our customersâ€™ satellites and our own. Our belief is that insights can only be as good as the data itself and we pride ourselves on generating the highest quality data products in the industry. 

OUR TEAM 

Weâ€™re a multidisciplinary team of Software Engineers, Finance and Accounting, HR, IT, and Project Management and we need an experienced and independent Office Manager to join our growing crew. 

READY TO LAUNCH? (aka Role) 

Do you want to work in the space industry and own the administrative function for a fast-growing tech company?  Are you open to a part-time, in-office position that provides support for multiple departments? If so, we want to hear from you.

PREPARE FOR IMPACT! (AKA Responsibilities) 

Working closely with multiple teams to provide admin support where needed across the organization, the Office Manager will be responsible for overall office administration. As a key member of the EarthDaily team, this position will be required to have excellent multitasking and interpersonal skills, and be able to work independently in a fast-paced environment. This is an in-office position at our beautiful waterfront office in downtown Vancouver. Hours may vary between 20-30 per week, with the potential to increase to full-time hours. Responsibilities include:

  • Reception responsibilities: answer phones; check voicemails; respond to phone and email requests; maintain parking/vehicle registration for staff/visitors
  • Provide executive support: arrange meetings; prepare correspondence; send documents for signature; prepare expense reports
  • Day to day office maintenance: check mail and scan items to appropriate team members; receive/send deliveries; maintain stock of pantry, cleaning and office supplies; act as point of contact for building relations and office vendors; maintain office services
  • Administer corporate lunch programs and order catering for meetings
  • Book corporate travel, including flights, hotel and car rentals
  • Run ad hoc errands (i.e., picking up office supplies or dropping off a package to FedEx)
  • Complete miscellaneous office tasks such as filing, sorting supplies/IT equipment, etc.
  • Email company-wide communications and all hands meeting invites, update company intranet pages, alert people of important notices on Slack channels
  • With HR and/or social committee, support event coordination â€“ social hours, lunch and learns, holiday parties, etc.
  • Assist with onboarding/offboarding
  • Process employee expense reports
  • If required, act as a backup for accounts payable
  • Other responsibilities as required

YOUR PAST MISSIONS (AKA Experience) 

  • College/University degree or diploma in a relevant field an asset
  • 2 years in a senior administrative function supporting multiple departments
  • Experience in the tech industry an asset
  • Experience working independently, with limited supervision

YOUR TOOLKIT (AKA Skills and Knowledge) 

  • Advanced Microsoft Office skills in Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive, Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook
  • Knowledge of MacOS
  • Experience working with a variety of systems such as ERP systems, HRIS, Slack or similar, Confluence or similar
  • Flexible and adaptable, able to change course when urgent matters arise
  • Strong customer service and business acumen with a friendly demeanour 
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Detail-oriented, with strong ability to multitask and manage calendars
  • Use of a vehicle and valid driver's license is an asset

OUR SPACE 

Weâ€™d love to welcome you to the world of EarthDaily Analytics. We have a shared passion for building software solutions for space and are excited to be launching the groundbreaking EarthDaily Constellation in 2023. Itâ€™s a fun, fast paced, exciting environment where we hold innovation, team work, honesty and trust as our core values. And just like space exploration - weâ€™re constantly evolving and pushing new technology boundaries. 

WHY EARTHDAILY ANALYTICS? 

  • Competitive compensation and flexible time off

  • Be part of a meaningful mission as part of one of Canadaâ€™s most innovative space companies that are developing sustainable solutions for our planet

  • Great work environment, team and one of the best office locations in Vancouver (right over the water in the new Vancouver Convention Centre) 

  • Company subsidized lunches, lunch & learns and Friday afternoon social hours 

Powered by JazzHR

title: Administrative and Mail Assistant
description:
Are you looking for a stimulating and dynamic job in the surrounding area of Halifax? Would you like to be part of a team that believes in your potential and of a great company that will help you advance in your career? This is the job for you! We are currently looking for an Administrative and Mail Assistant for one of our clients.

What is in it for you:
• 12 months contract, schedule from Monday to Friday, fulltime, daytime
• Salary of 15,11$/h
• Dynamic and professional environment

A day in the life of an Administrative and Mail Assistant:
• Ensure customer issues and escalations are resolved or further escalated as appropriate
• Conduct quality checks on own work to ensure accuracy and required output is to standards
• Perform basic digital print production and adhere to all safety procedures
• Perform backfill duties for absent coworkers and other duties as assigned by Manager Office
• Prepare charge-back reporting for postage, courier, etc.
• Use of software to update or maintain mailing addresses.
• Provide mailing address clean-up (may include use of mail cleansing software)
• Set up and operate high level mail equipment in an automated high speed / high volume environment
• Use of specialized equipment for material handling (e.g., Forklift certified)
• Liaison with clients advising on available services and negotiation of turnaround times
• Clean and maintain finishing equipment to ensure optimal use
• Perform colour calibration using densitometers and perform colour adjustments
• Record meter reads, process production forms and maintain records
• Carry out regular preventative maintenance checks on client fleet of machines
• Carry out first level issue resolution utilizing basic product and/or technical skills, escalating in accordance with agreed procedures for next level maintenance and technical support on client fleet equipment
• Records Management +B5Index, store, retrieve electronic documents in a mass storage system
• Convert digital files to formats such as PDF, TIFF, PostScript, XML, etc. for import into document repository and management systems
• Manage document storage system to meet client`s archiving requirements
• Catalogue electronic documents to media such as CDROM, disk or tap and distribute as required
• Professionally greet and direct visitors adhering to security / badge requirements
• Complete and maintain all logs and reports including month-end reports
• Input Meridian (billing system) requisitions
• Order and replenish consumables, forms inventory and other supplies items as required.
• Organize business travel (flights, hotels, rental cars) for Xerox customers
• Support site continuous improvement programs including 5S, a site efficiency methodology

What you need to succeed:
• High School Diploma or equivalent certification
• Health and safety certification (WHMIS)
• 1 year of experience in customer facing, customer service role
• Proven ability to work under pressure handling multiple tasks to ensure timely completion
• Able to communicate effectively, to read, to write, and to follow basic English instructions
• Ability to lift and move up to 50 pounds
• Basic math (add, multiply, divide) and computer skills (keyboard, mouse functions
• Possess a valid driver’s license (as required)
• Effective organizational and mechanical troubleshooting/repair skills

Why Recruit Action?
We give you the opportunity to accelerate your career. Recrute Action provides recruitment services through quality support and a personalized approach to job seekers and businesses. Thank you for your interest in this position. Only qualified candidates who match hiring criteria will be contacted.



Administrative and Mail Assistant

title: Senior Risk Analyst
description:
If you are looking to join one of Canada’s fastest-growing companies, goeasy Ltd. is the place for you! Certified as a Great Place to Work®, recognized as Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures, GTA's Top 100 Employers, one of Canada’s Top 50 Fintech’s and North America’s Most Engaged Workplaces, we want the best and brightest to join our team.

We are a publicly-traded company on the TSX with over 4000% shareholder return since 2001. Accredited by the Better Business Bureau, goeasy Ltd is a Canadian company that provides non-prime leasing and lending services through easyhome, easyfinancial and LendCare. We offer a wide variety of financial products and services including lease-to-own merchandise, unsecured and secured installment loans, direct-to-consumer auto loans, and point-of-sale financing to over 4,000 merchants in the powersports, automotive, retail, home improvement and health sectors. With over 30 years of experience, our 2200 employees work with our customers to help them get access to the money they need today, while they rebuild their credit and graduate to prime rates. Our omnichannel model includes over 400 retail locations and digital/mobile platforms that enable our customers to transact with us through their channel of choice.

goeasy Ltd. is seeking a Senior Risk Analyst with proven problem-solving abilities to provide analytics expertise in support of easyfinancial, its consumer lending business.  The successful applicant will assist the Manager, Risk and Analytics, in developing, implementing and managing the proper and appropriate level of risk analysis, monitoring and controls to ensure sound and consistent credit risk management practices to create the foundation for profitable growth. Additionally, he/she will provide in-depth analytics to support easyhome, the Company’s leasing business, liaising with various business units to meet their data requirements.

Responsibilities:

Data mining, Modelling and Analysis

  • Conduct guided analytical dives to properly diagnose, document and report on the drivers of unexpected changes to portfolio/origination composition and credit performance across multiple lending channels including retail, online lending and alternative. Communicate findings and the future impacts to losses to management
  • Assist Risk and Analytics leadership by supporting the development of risk models for the purposes of origination, account management and collections
  • Perform analysis leading to credit strategy optimization, including but not limited to customer risk segmentation development that improves the portfolio’s risk-reward profile
  • Forecast, track and measure key business metrics including loss rates, approval rates, loan conversion rates, and credit quality for new initiatives and marketing campaigns

Forecasting and Reporting

  • Maintain a standard set of risk and performance reports that evaluate the overall credit risk of the portfolio
  • Monitor and maintain a comprehensive set of reports to identify delinquency and charge off trends at the vintage and segment levels. Apply observations to loss forecasting models to capture current trends and communicate to Senior Management to identify risks and opportunities to the forecast
  • Conduct sensitivity and scenario analyses to understand the impact of exogenous factors, policy and operational changes on delinquency and charge off levels
  • Assist Risk and Analytics leadership by providing an objective assessment of the risk profile and performance of the easyfinancial portfolio as well as the overall business unit by regularly monitoring key risk indicators, conducting periodic credit reviews, and consistently communicating findings

Qualifications:

  • Strong knowledge of quantitative methodologies, risk models and tools
  • Strong technical knowledge of statistical analysis, modeling techniques
  • University Degree in Statistics, Mathematics or a related discipline (advanced degree is desired)
  • Superior analytical skills – demonstrated ability to understand complex problems, detect trends, and understand data to develop and formulate solutions
  • Possess a solid understanding of data extraction/mining/modeling tools including SAS and SQL
  • 2+ year’s experience as an analyst or in a similar position
  • Able to convey complex information and concepts in understandable terms, tailors message and content to the intended audience
  • Flexibility to adapt to an evolving environment with shifting priorities with the capacity to handle multiple competing demands and meet tight turnaround timelines

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

goeasy is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, goeasy is committed to providing accommodations for applicants upon request at any stage of the recruitment process in accordance with all legislative requirements throughout Canada. Please let us know if you require an accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.

Additional Information:

All candidates considered for hire must successfully pass a criminal background check, credit check, and validation of their work experience to qualify for hire.  We thank all interested applicants, however we will only be contacting those for interview who possess the skills and qualifications outlined above.

Why should you work for goeasy?

To learn more about our great company please click the links below:

http://goeasy.com/careers/

 

PAID1234

title: Associate Sales Representative (B2B)
description:
Naylor Building Partnerships Inc. is an award winning, Canadian owned and run multi-trade mechanical, electrical, plumbing and compressed air contractor. We have been providing quality service, maintenance, repairs and installations to the commercial and industrial sector for over 50 years. Our commitment to hiring the best people allows us to provide strong technical expertise and knowledge to our customers, fostering long term partnerships with both our customers and employees.

We are currently looking for a Associate Sales Representative to join our Business Development team in the Toronto area.

Reporting to the Director of Sales, the Sales Representative will be responsible for generating new business through the identification and acquisition of new customers, lead generation activities and industry networking. The primary objective of this position is to meet or exceed quarterly and annual sales objectives with respect to new maintenance contract sales in an assigned geographic territory.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Researches, explores and identifies opportunities for business within an assigned territory through various methods such as cold calling, referrals, and networking.
  • Prepares and delivers promotional material for prospective clients
  • Responds to sales inquiries and meets with potential customers to identify immediate or future needs.
  • Creates proposals, presentations, and RFP responses that identify and provide solutions to prospective clientâ€™s needs.
  • Delivers on agreed upon KPIâ€™s and sales targets
  • Communicates sales activity and pipeline forecasts to the Sales Manager
  • Gathers and reports on competitor activities that may impact the company and its customers
  • Maintains accurate records of all sales and prospecting activities
  • Participates in industry networking events such as sales and tradeshows

Education/ Experience:

  • 6 months to 3 years sales experience, Business to Business is preferred, HVAC industry experience would be ideal.
  • A University Degree or College Diploma is preferred.
  • Excellent communication skills, presentation and persuasive skills
  • Strong organization skills with the ability to prioritize
  • Proficiency with Microsoft office applications, experience with a CRM is an asset
  • Candidates must have access to a car and possess a valid driver's license and a good driving record.

Accessibility for Applicants: Naylor Building Partnerships Inc. is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free workplace that reflects the communities we serve. We will provide reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities at all stages of the hiring process in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code, the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005, and Naylorâ€™s Accessibility Policy. If you are a person with a disability and need the job posting in an alternative format or any other accessible accommodations during the hiring process, please email your request to our Human Resources department at 

careers@naylorbp.com

.

title: Business Development Manager / Geotab Fleet Tracking and Telematics
description:
The Swish Group of Companies started over 60 years ago in distribution, expanded into Manufacturing, Fleet Telematics and Technology innovation. Swish partnered with Geotab in 2014, a global leader and highly awarded global telematics provider.
Opportunity Overview:
Swish is currently seeking a Business Development Manager – Geotab Fleet Tracking and Telematics to join our growing team. This is an opportunity to join an amazing technical team that provides end-to-end connected fleet solutions. 

Our successful history in Fleet Tracking / Telematics solutions is due to our dedicated focus of delivering better outcomes for our customers. We pride ourselves in being a trusted advisor to our customers with deep product knowledge and a long-standing partnership with a global industry leader Geotab. 
Take the lead to grow and expand our revenue. Act as a subject matter expert on the Geotab and Swish software solutions. Be responsible for the planning and execution of a business strategy to expand and grow our customer base. 

The successful candidate will have expertise to design and carry out customer site discoveries and align our service offerings to exceed our customers expectations.

In this role the Business Development Manager will be expected to showcase our software features and sell their benefits, with the goal of enabling our customers with the know-how to take full advantage of our service offerings. The role will report to the IT Director.

What’s In It For You: 
  • Remote Work – work from your home office anywhere in Ontario
  • Laptop, Tablet and Cell Phone
  • Permanent/Full Time - Competitive base salary plus commission earnings 
  • Kilometer reimbursement for travel
  • Unrestricted Canada wide territory
  • Comprehensive benefits package
  • Build the business and hire your team
  • Influence our products and shape our service offering
  • Onboarding, training and development programs
  • Dedicated business development/sales technology tools
  • Dedicated market lead generation resources
What We Are Looking For:

  • An ability to effectively demonstrate our Swish software solutions
  • Measured success and a proven track record in Software Sales
  • Solid understanding of Saas Products and services.
  • Proven ability to effectively identify and resolve issues
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Strong ability to build, influence and motivate partnerships with customers
  • Extensive technical knowledge and understanding of GPS/AVL & IT operations
  • Must have a strong work ethic and dedication
  • Strong knowledge of the public works & transportation industry
What You’ll Do:

  • Manage the end to end Fleet Tracking/Telematics business for Swish, including sales, business development, marketing, and administration.
  • Initiate the sales process by scheduling appointments; make initial presentations; understand account requirements
  • Close sales by building rapport with potential accounts; demonstrating product and software functions; overcome objections; prepare contracts
  • Expand sales in existing accounts by introducing new products and services
  • Travel to new and current customers throughout Ontario & Canada
  • Demonstrate an ability to connect with customers both technically & non-technically regarding their specific requirements
  • Present a strong comfort level in all customer-facing situations
  • Become the point of contact for new and existing clients to book enhanced product and application training
  • Assist with client support, as well as customer issue resolution when necessary
  • Outline Geotab and our Integration Services to the potential customers by effectively addressing and positioning the customer’s requirements
  • Resolve any issues with customers or the local carrier sales channel
What You’ll Need:

  • An entrepreneurial mindset, to help build and grow this business (flexible, versatile, ability to pivot as needed) 
  • Minimum 5 years Software Sales / Business Development experience
  • Experience in Geotab fleet management / public works / road operations considered a strong asset 
  • Ability to develop and execute business goals and targets
  • Strong communication skills
  • A reliable car and a valid driver's license with a clean driving record
  • Ability to travel anywhere in Ontario & Canada

title: Millwright
description:
This position works DAYS/AFT rotation.

AGS Automotive Systems is a full-service automotive supplier specializing in the manufacture and supply of complex high value-add automotive metal components, including in particular front and rear impact assemblies, principally for pick-ups and the heavy truck market. AGS offers full range of in-house capabilities including design and engineering, high tonnage metal stamping, light weighting solutions, innovative multi-material joining, high performance coatings including chrome plating and automated manufacturing processes.

AGS is committed to delivering high quality, high value products to our customers, who include several of North America's largest automakers. For over 70 years AGS has stood behind our belief in quality, technology, and teamwork.

BASIC FUNCTION:
Reporting to the Maintenance Supervisor, the Millwright is responsible for, but not limited to,
Diagnose and remedy any mechanical, pneumatic or hydraulic problems in the Windsor Plant.

PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:
• Perform all duties as outlined by the Provincial Government in accordance with Regulated Trade 433A Industrial Mechanic Millwright.
• Possess all hand tools that are common to the trade.
• Able to read, interpret and use micrometers, verniers, etc.
• Familiar with the basic operations of machine tools, lathes, mills, grinder drills, etc.
• Have basic working knowledge of hydraulics and pneumatics.
• Capable of lining up shafts and couplings, motors and drivers, etc.
• Able to determine cause of breakdowns and establish actions for remedy.
• Proficient in troubleshooting on all automatic lube systems and be capable of determining if lubrication is getting to all points of the machine.
• Capable of removing broken pieces of equipment and repairing by welding or the complete refit and reassemble of replacement parts.
• Able to complete overhauls and major repairs to all plant machinery and equipment.
• Should be capable of basic rigging, unloading and/or dismantling heavy pieces of equipment in an efficient and safe manner (both to other works and equipment).
• Knowledge of lifting capacities of various types of cables, slings, chokes, shackles and related lifting gears. Know when it is in safe, usable condition.
• Capable of reading and following instruction manuals in detail, together with blueprints, drawings and sketches, to carry out the proper installation and set up of heavy or light equipment.
• Capable of dismantling, match marking, and identifying all component parts of equipment that have to be dismantled for moving or shipping to other plants for easy re-assembling.
• Able to use acetylene equipment, such as torches, or propane torches or arc gouging torches. Be able to perform all welding functions and brazing.
• Should be capable of performing all of the above with a minimum of supervisory assistance and should be able to guide an apprentice and helper/improver.
• Work in compliance with the Safety Act and regulations [section 28 (1)(a)]

QUALIFICATIONS:
• Must hold a valid Ontario License Certificate of Qualification issued by the Ministry of Colleges and Universities.
• Certified Lift Truck Driver.
• Health and Safety related training.

This position offers a benefits and savings plan.

AGS Automotive Systems is proud to support the full inclusion of persons with disabilities as set out in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005. At AGS we are committed to ensuring the workplace is free from discrimination. During our hiring process, we will notify job applicants that accommodations are available upon request. If a selected job applicant requests accommodation, AGS will consult with the individual and provide or arrange for the appropriate accommodation taking into account the applicant's disability-related needs. Please contact AGS Human Resources at

HR@agsautomotive.com

For over 70 years AGS has stood behind our belief in quality, technology, and teamwork."]

title: Bilingual Agreement Sales Representative
description:
Description:
Are you an enthusiastic go-getter searching for a rewarding sales career?
Agilus is recruiting for a Bilingual Agreement Sales Representative in the Industrial sector in Dorval, Quebec.
This Bilingual position provides the opportunity to travel within your assigned territory of Quebec with all expenses paid and a commission that will make you smile. Your French abilities MUST be just as strong as your ability to do outside sales.
A typical day:
  • Generating new business by making calls/visiting prospective clients
  • Renew current agreements with existing clients and explore new opportunities
  • Managing your clients within a CRM by logging activities such as calls, visits, meetings, quotes
  • Weekly sales meetings with Branch Manager/District Manager
  • Expectations to meeting monthly minimum sales quotas and CRM funnel size
  • Assist in other customer relations or collection efforts. It may be required to support in customer collection issues or other customer relationship management.
  • Other duties as assigned by supervisor

Requirements:
  • Bilingual in English and French - French must be very strong and at a professional level
  • University degree, college diploma or equivalent sales experience
  • Clean driver's abstract
  • Proven ability to cold-call successfully and with perseverance
  • Enthusiastic about sales and is driven
  • Comfortable with travelling up to 50% of the time
  • Industrial experience or technical knowledge of cranes is an asset
  • Excellent communicator with a positive attitude

Total rewards:
  • 50K - 55K annually
  • Aggressive commission plan and potential of contracts over $1M
  • Company car and expenses paid
  • Company cell phone and laptop
  • Comprehensive benefits plan

We want to connect with you!
Please apply directly online by phone 613.688.0330 or by email shui@agilus.ca
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.
We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Sales Solution Engineer
description:
They say you only get one chance to make a great first impression.  At Wysdom weâ€™re here to change that. We exist to help our clients make a great first impression with their customers â€“ over and over again!

Conversation is the new user interface (UI). It will power everything from self driving cars to gadgets around your home. For a conversational UI to satisfy customers it requires continuous improvement.  Wysdom creates and manages the smartest virtual agents on behalf of our clients. 

Wysdom is a fast growing, venture-backed start-up and led by a team of serial entrepreneurs with a history of building great teams and products. We make sure Wysdom is a place that employees can learn, grow, have fun, and achieve excellence. 

Fit is everything for us.  We believe in hiring for attitude, skills, and potential.  We offer lots of autonomy and flexibility to be excellent at delivering value and hitting goals. If youâ€™re an entrepreneurial, results oriented person, who doesnâ€™t shy away from a challenge, youâ€™re going to enjoy working here.  Are you who we are looking for?

You are the right fit if you are a highly energetic and successful Sales Solution Engineer. The successful candidate must be able to show a proven track record of closing / winning deals, as well as meeting or exceeding personal quotas. We are looking for a technical sales professional with knowledge of customer business drivers.The Sales Solution Engineer acts as a trusted advisor and plays an integral part in delivering increased satisfaction, revenue generation, and cost savings to our customers.

This individual serves as the lead advocate for customers; translating technical needs into product development recommendations, testing of customer environments and driving customer demand/features internally. Must be able to understand and articulate Wysdom's advantages to our customers and support the Account Executive when it comes to proposing and designing solutions to our customers biggest VA challenges.

Wysdom is committed to slowing climate change by removing our team's personal commute so has become a fully remote company and this position can be located anywhere in Canada.

As a Sales Solution Engineer you will: 

  • Strategize with the sales team to create customized solutions.
  • Prepare and deliver high impact presentations and demonstrations that tell Wysdomâ€™s differentiated story
  • Develop and maintain customer relationships. 
  • Continually improve our insights products through performance improvements, new metrics, and visualizations.
  • Partner with Account Executives to drive complex, multi-stakeholder deal cycles across multiple customers to solve diverse mission-critical business problems
  • Drive the discovery process, helping to uncover your customerâ€™s current pains and align to their business objectives
  • Prepare and deliver high impact presentations and demonstrations that tell Wysdomâ€™s differentiated story
  • Partner with customers to design solutions that drive value and significant business impact
  • Guide customers through the evaluation process of Wysdom ensuring that our solution meets key business objectives and technical requirements
  • Act as a liaison between Product, Marketing and Sales, sharing customer feedback to help craft the product roadmap

About You 

  • Degree in Computer or Data Science, Statistical Analysis, Math and Engineering 
  • Pre-Sales enterprise software experience, skillset to establish trust with clients, and ability to influence key decision makers in the sales cycle 
  • Experience building and delivering Proofs of Concept (PoCs) and responding to functional & technical elements of RFIs/RFPs independently and effectively
  • Ability to lead architectural discussions
  • A passion for technology and translating that passion into business impact for customers
  • Experience with ETL tools: Tableau ETL, Airflow 
  • Experience using Excel/Google Sheets 
  • Strong problem solving, quantitative and analytical abilities

Whatâ€™s it like to work at Wysdom?

Ask our employees why theyâ€™re proud to be here and theyâ€™ll tell you that weâ€™ve worked hard together to build a successful, values-based business. We work hard at employee appreciation and open communication through regular staff events and meetings.  

We offer a highly competitive compensation package including full company-paid benefits from your first day, and a stock option program to ensure you share in our future growth.

Wysdom is committed to cultivating, promoting, and growing a diverse and inclusive workforce where we operate as One Team with One Focus. We are passionate about building a culture of collaboration among team members with varied pasts and perspectives who then empower us to reach our full potential, fueling innovation and creativity.  We strive to champion diversity, equity, and inclusion for all in everything we do. 

Now thatâ€™s Wysdom!  

Head here to read more about what it is like to work at Wysdom.

title: Employment Services Counsellor
company: Bob Rumball Centre of Excellence for the Deaf
description:
INTERNAL/EXTERNAL JOB POSTING (# 2022-49)

 

 TITLE:                            Employment Services Counsellor


POSITION STATUS:     Full-time – Temporary (8 weeks- Canada Summer Job) (Non-Union)


SCHEDULE:                   35 hours per week (flexibility required as needed)


REPORTS TO:                Employment Services Supervisor       

                                                       

 

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Bob Rumball Canadian Centre of Excellence for the Deaf (BRCCED) is a provincial leader in the Deaf community.

Our Programs support Deaf, Hard of Hearing, and Deafblind adults some of whom have complex behavioural, developmental and/or mental health diagnoses. This position is responsible for delivery of employment service program supports for clients which includes (but not limited to); marketing and intake of eligible clientele who meet program needs, recruiting mentors and potential employers, developing strong relationships with businesses and other stakeholders who can offer support with mentorship, guest speaking, workplace tours, employment opportunities, service coordination and cross referrals.


PRIMARY DUTIES

  • Collaborates efforts with Employment Services Supervisor
  • Provides support to individuals who are Deaf or Hard of Hearing with other possible disabilities / barriers to employment
  • Support with developing and facilitating job readiness and retention workshops that match the learning style of the participants
  • Collects client data  related to demographics, employment history, education background and employment goals
  • Support clients with applications to external resources Ex: ODSP Employment Supports
  • Organizes and tracks data and narrative information in monthly reports
  • Support employment action planning and individualized strategies for individuals with identified disabilities and/or barriers to employment to meet service goals
  • Provide job coach /employment follow-up support to individuals at the employer site
  • Initiates, prepares and participates in  initiatives for employers and the community related to accessibility, inclusion and diversity hiring for Deaf and Hard of Hearing
  • Monitors and tracks services used by clients participating in the program and follows-up when necessary
  • Collects and analyzes labour market information, develops firm understanding of skill acquisition for clients for potential job opportunities and prospecting of potential employers

 

 

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Diploma or currently enrolled in Social Services or a related field and some experience supporting adults with developmental disabilities / learning challenges, mental health needs and/or dual diagnosis
  • Experience working within the Deaf community and some proficiency in American Sign Language is preferred
  • Experience with workshop facilitation and 1:1 support for individuals who have a disability
  • Experience supporting in a job support program is an asset
  • Demonstrated self-driven learner who is eager to show initiative on work projects and has excellent time management skills Excellent communication, literacy and interpersonal skills
  • Demonstrated experience in computer literacy (including, but not limited to; Excel, Outlook, Powerpoint)
  • Valid Ontario Full G Driver’s License (with access to car) and clean driving record an asset
  • French language/ LSQ an asset


Canada Summer Jobs Requirements

  • Must be within 15 to 30 years of age (as per Canada Summer Jobs requirements)
  • Must be legally entitled to work in Canada with a valid Social Insurance Number
  • Must be able to commit to the full 8 weeks at 35 hours per week

 

 

Interested candidates please visit https://www2.bobrumball.org/careers/ or fax resume to 855.492.1612

We thank all applicants in advance, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

 

Posting Date: April 25, 2022                                Closing Date: May 9, 2022                   Start Date: June 6, 2022

title: Field Sales Representative - Full-Time
description:
Job Details

Job Description

At Kruger Products we have a shared vision for greatness. We manufacture some of North America’s most popular tissue brands - Cashmere®, Purex®, Scotties®’, SpongeTowels®, White Cloud®, as well as products for use away from home. We always want to do better for our customers and our world. The awards we’ve earned remind us that our hard work and commitment to doing the right thing pays off. But they aren’t what keep us going. It’s the people who work here, who believe in what we do – and how we do it that truly matters.

We are leaders in our communities, leaders in sustainability, and leaders in connecting with our consumers. Our headquarters is in Mississauga, ON, and we proudly have nearly 2,700 employees spread across eight manufacturing plants in Quebec, British Columbia, Ontario, and Tennessee.

 WHAT YOU WILL DO

The Field Sales Representative will work collaboratively with our retail customers to maximize the presence of our brands in your territory. You will be responsible for in-store execution of merchandising and promotions & sales.

In this role, you will:

  • Increase sales and expand the positioning of our brands
  • Execute and deliver retail coverage
  • Set call objectives, achieve targets and utilize strong interpersonal skills to present monthly priorities to store decision makers
  • Work on core program execution including; shelf management, distribution, planograms, pricing, merchandising, sales
  • Maximize in-store display and product visibility

WHAT YOU WILL BRING

  • Must have 1-3 years of retail sales and/or merchandising experience working in the Grocery, Mass and Drug retail trade
  • Valid full G driver’s license
  • A car or reliable, consistent access to a car
  • Post-secondary degree from either a University or College preferred 
  • Proficiency in a PC/Windows environment: Excel, Word, PowerPoint & Outlook
  • High level of attention to detail and accuracy working in a competitive business environment with changing priorities and deadlines
  • The incumbent must possess strong written and oral communication skills
  • Must be available for limited travel

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU

Our mission is to make everyday life more comfortable for our consumers. Together we bring this mission to life. As an ever-evolving business, there are always exciting new challenges, diverse career options, and opportunities to innovate. Want to learn more? Come unleash your greatness with Kruger Products.

We have been named one of GTA’s Top Employers for the past 10 consecutive years, as well as Forbes' Best Employers in Canada.

Kruger Products is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals.  Accommodation will be provided in all parts of the hiring process as required under KPLP’s Accessibility Policy and Multi-Year Accessibility Plan - 1.04.33.  Applicants need to make their needs known in advance.

We thank all applicants for their interest in Kruger Products but only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Delivery Driver (Mississauga)
description:
Before you apply to a job, select your language preference from the options available at the top right of this page.

Explore your next opportunity at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow—people with a unique combination of skill + passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.

Job Description:

At UPS we also discover how we combine endless opportunities innovation and rewards to create a truly unique career experience. With our unique promote-from-within culture you'll always find exciting new opportunities at every level of the organization. From training and education to growth and empowerment you have the freedom to forge a career path that can take you anywhere you want to go.

POSITION SUMMARY:

A UPS Driver performs the task of delivering and picking up UPS packages in a brown UPS car.

Location: 3195 Airway Dr, Mississauga, ON L4V 1C2, Canada

Key Accountabilities:

  • Delivering and picking up UPS packages
  • Learning and properly executing UPS safe driving methods
  • Operating vehicles with standard (manual) transmission
  • Possessing a valid driver’s license
  • Complying with UPS appearance guidelines

Requirements:

  • Ability to lift up to 70 lbs
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Ability to drive standard (manual) transmission
  • Available to work 8-12 hour shifts* Monday through Friday and some Saturdays/holidays if required. *Hours are dependent on work volume and not guaranteed during probationary period (90 working days).
  • Minimum 21 years of age
  • Possession of a valid Ontario G driver’s license
  • Clean driver's abstract - No at-fault accidents within the last 3 years
  • No traffic violations within the last 12 months
  • Strong customer service skills  

Compensation:

  • Pay rate of $20.00/hr (base rate of $17.00 + an hourly bonus of $3.00).
  • Automatic pay rate progression as per the existing Union Collective Agreement (top rate: $32.59/hr after 48 months)
  • Extended health and dental benefits after one year of service
  • 2 weeks of paid vacation after one year of service
  • Immediate access to UPS ‘Employee Discounts’ upon hiring
  • Paid training
  • Opportunity for advancement within a Fortune 50 Company
  • Free onsite parking

UPS Canada is a diverse and equal opportunity employer. Please advise our HR representatives if workplace accommodation is needed. Thank you for your interest in UPS Canada.

title: Estate Manager #1789
description:
Summary

We are looking for an experienced, self-guided Estate Manager to ensure the day-to-day operation of a main residence in Kelowna, British Columbia, and a secondary residence in Vancouver.

This position requires to be organized and flexible with an excellent work ethic and a sense of pride in work well done. The right candidate is discreet, intuitive and self-starter.

Duties

PROPERTY MANAGEMENT
  • Day to day management of one private residence.
  • Act as the point of contact for home suppliers, contractors, and visitors.
  • Ensuring all the residence’s equipment are functioning normally, including the Wi-Fi, lighting, A/C, heating, A/V, Smart Home systems, swimming pools, etc.
  • Identify maintenance needs and repair projects.
  • Scheduling and supervising of household installations, independent contractors, trades and vendors for both the interior & exterior as well as seasonal projects including quotes analysis, negotiation and documents filing.
  • Management of vehicles and motorized equipment.
  • Managing and monitoring all household inventories.
  • Travel to Vancouver, as needed.
  • Assist with security responsibilities of the residence.
INFORMATION AND FILE MANAGEMENT
  • Overall calendar management of internal work, staff schedules & external contractor visits, guests stays, etc.
  • Maintain both a paper and electronic filing system that is organized and easy to follow.
ADMINISTRATION
  • Develop and manage annual plans and budgets for the maintenance and upkeep of all assets.
  • Expense reports.
  • Create and maintain house manuals.
TEAM SUPERVISION / MANAGEMENT
  • Hiring, management and coordination of household staff, and work alongside as needed.
  • Employee time sheets management.
ENTERTAINING AT THE RESIDENCE 
  • Coordinate and assisting with event planning and coordination.
OTHER
  • Internet research and personal shopping.
  • Various errands, as needed.


Requirements

  • Minimum five (5) years previous experience working in a similar role.
  • Ability to thrive in a team-based environment; develop and maintain positive relationships with staff, trades and services.
  • Excellent communication skill.
  • Excellent troubleshooter.
  • Excellent proficiency with MS Office Suite. Must be tech savvy (familiar with the use of Apps, Smartphones, Cloud computing, etc.)
  • Problem solver and resourceful.
  • Thorough knowledge of household technology and mechanical systems.
  • Energetic problem solving with the ability to take the initiative.
  • Effective time management with strong execution and completion strategies.
  • Careful and thorough, with particular attention to detail.
  • Mature, self-confident, and excellent representative/ambassador for the family.
  • Professional and respectful; a quiet presence in the household.
  • Highly discreet in preserving the confidentiality and privacy of the household members and guests.
  • Can travel as needed.
  • Legally entitled to work in Canada.
  • Must have a valid driver’s license and a vehicle in good condition.
  • Must like dogs.
  • Must be fully vaccinated against Covid-19.


Benefits

Additional Information
  • Full time and permanent.
  • Working days: Monday to Friday (flexibility required).
  • Working hours: 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. (flexibility required).
  • Availability for off-hours communication is essential.
  • House car available for work duties.
Reference #1789


• Minimum five (5) years previous experience working in a similar role. • Ability to thrive in a team-based environment; develop and maintain positive relationships with staff, trades and services. • Excellent communication skill. • Excellent trouble-shooter. • Excellent proficiency with MS Office Suite. Must be tech savvy (familiar with the use of Apps, Smartphones, Cloud computing, etc.) • Problem solver and resourceful. • Thorough knowledge of household technology and mechanical systems. • Energetic problem solving with the ability to take the initiative. • Effective time management with strong execution and completion strategies. • Careful and thorough, with particular attention to detail. • Mature, self-confident, and excellent representative/ambassador for the family. • Professional and respectful; a quiet presence in the household. • Highly discreet in preserving the confidentiality and privacy of the household members and guests. • Can travel as needed. • Legally entitled to work in Canada. • Must have a valid driver’s license and a vehicle in good condition. • Must like dogs. • Must be fully vaccinated against Covid-19.

title: Store Manager - CAN6401
description:
A Store Manager must be committed to inspiring our team, helping our Customers succeed and growing our business with integrity. Professional level sales and management position capable of supporting functions on both sides of the business. The role requires understanding of store systems, automotive systems, parts knowledge and has the ability to identify, troubleshoot and project assist for DIY. Responsible for developing and maintaining Professional Customer relationships and program growth. Is accountable for achieving financial metrics and maintaining service and appearance standards. Store Managers are required to work a schedule based on the needs of the business.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Achieve overall store sales goals and service objectives
  • Manage and grow Professional Customer relationships/sales, including building and holding team accountable to executing Customer action plans
  • Selection, hiring, development, performance mgmt., coaching, scheduling and engagement of store Team Members
  • Ensure execution of all inventory and operational standards
  • Coach all Team Members to deliver on Customer expectations (DIY and Professional)
  • Manager on duty responsibilities (touch base/coaching, floor/phone mgmt., task assignment and completion, safety, open/close duties)
  • Ability to lead change management
  • Embrace diversity and foster a respectful environment for both Customers and Team Members

Success Factors

  • Friendly communication
  • Ability to locate and stock parts
  • Safety knowledge and skills
  • Ability to execute and train project and product quality recommendations
  • Advanced parts lookup and sourcing
  • Ability to source from numerous places including special order, FDO, second source, etc.
  • Ability to execute and train inventory systems and store equipment
  • Ability to execute and train POS and Parts lookup systems
  • Ability to review and analyze P&L statement
  • Ability to recruit, select, hire and develop quality Team Members
  • Ability to build and grow relationships with Professional Customers

Essential Job Skills Necessary for Success as a General Manager

  • Working knowledge of automotive systems preferred
  • Calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, percentages, sales increases, and gross profit percent
  • Ability to review and analyze business reports, such as profit and loss statement (P&L)
  • Hold others accountable, inspect work quality and give feedback in a way that is inspiring
  • Ability to work an assortment of days, evenings and weekends as needed

Prior Experience that Sets a General Manager up for Success 

  • 2-3 years of experience managing a team of 5-10 Team Members in a fast-paced and highly dynamic retail environment
  • Successful experience managing profitability; proven financial and business acumen

Education, Certificates, Licenses, Registrations

High school diploma or general education degree (GED), Bachelor’s degree in business or a related area preferred.

Must have a valid driver's license

title: Automotive Technician
description:
We are urgently hiring for an Auto Mechanic position.

*****Must have an AST (Automotive Service Technician) ticket.

We are looking for an Auto Mechanic in Burnaby with a minimum of 3 years of experience in vehicle maintenance and mechanical maintenance experience.

Position: Auto Mechanic
Location: Burnaby
Shift: 8:00 am - 4:30 pm
Pay: Competitive pay, depending on experience + benefits

Advantages
- Be part of a well established company
- Full-time permanent position
- Full benefits packages
- Fixed hours - Monday to Friday


Responsibilities
- In charge of performing routine upkeep on vehicles
- Maintains company vehicles, and ensure they are in optimal running conditions
- Maintenance of plant equipment and all on-location equipment, ensuring they are in good running condition
- In charge of providing training to drivers regarding the trucks and all equipment-related processes, and train on the daily maintenance that will be required to be performed by the drivers.
- Assist staff on the road, when breakdowns occur
- Reports status of repairs to Fleet Manager
- Works with management, drivers and ICBC to ensure timely completion of repairs following vehicle accidents


Qualifications
- Required to have completed successfully an Automotive Service Technician Program.
- Clean driving record
- Beneficial to have experience with General Motors
- Experience working with gas and propane vehicles
- Basic computer knowledge

Summary
If you fulfill all of the qualifications and believe this is the right position then we want to hear from you! Please reach out directly to me today!
Apply via this application link alternatively you can email raquel.funes@randstad.ca
Or text with your full name and position you are applying for at 778-956-8372

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Logistics Coordinator
description:
Title:            Logistics Coordinator
Location:     Kitchener, Ontario
Term:           Full-Time
Education:   College Diploma
Experience: 0+ years of relevant work experience
Salary:         $22/hr
Other:          G or G2 driver’s license and access to a vehicle


About OTTO Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

As OTTO Motors grows exponentially, so does the need to receive, handle materials, package, and ship robots. You are adaptable. Where others see barriers, you see opportunities for improvement. No day is the same - curveballs won’t make you break a sweat! This position offers the best mix of responsibility, challenge, and enjoyment. We need someone to come in, take charge, and help keep our materials and shipments moving smoothly.

Reporting into our Logistics Lead, as our Logistics Coordinator you will wear many hats, work with every department in our company, and be around robots that are paving the way for the material handling revolution. 

This position requires the employee to be on site for the full day shift. There is no opportunity to work from home. The performance of duties in this position will require the candidate to travel locally (within Kitchener-Waterloo) to our various locations. 

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Sign for and unload packages from couriers, inspect for visual damage.
  • Sign for and unload trucks using a forklift or reach truck
  • Receiving Purchase orders in a timely and efficient manner.
  • Put parts away in their proper locations
  • Timely execution of Pick and ship spare parts orders
  • Print Pick lists and kit items to support production
  • Ensure the Shortage Report is accurate and up to date.
  • Quote and arrange small package/LTL shipments to international and domestic customers.
  • Packing shipments large and small
  • Assist with the coordination of logistics for off-site demonstrations, events and trade shows worldwide.
  • Maintain our ERP system to ensure it reflects accuracy during transactions (Receiving, Inventory Transfer, Kitting and shipping).
  • Working closely with Production, Purchasing, and Client Success teams, to improve inter-departmental cooperation and effectiveness.
  • Other duties as assigned.

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

Required Skills:

  • Detail-oriented and exceptionally organized.
  • Experience with Microsoft Excel, Word.
  • Comfortable navigating a computer and using software tools
  • Able to quickly evaluate and assess a problem situation and prioritize courses of action.
  • Able to work under pressure and tight deadlines.
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.
  • Must be a team player and self-motivated.
  • Able to lift and carry up to 50 pounds

Bonus points for: 

  • Being an H.T.S code whiz!
  • Previous forklift and/or reach truck experience.
  • Comfortable using pallet jacks.
  • Experience with shipping freight domestically/internationally using UPS and FedEx.
  • Experience working with EPR systems and/or JIRA.
  • Familiar with inventory/cycle counting, finding root causes and solving discrepancies.

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

title: Foot Care Nurse
description:
Love helping people? We're looking for diverse and equity minded passionate, hardworking, and self-directed people to join our team of caregivers. Spark Inc is an innovative and award-winning inclusive and equity focused organization that matches diverse clients to the best one to one care in the community.  

FOOT CARE NURSE
Our clients are lovely individuals seeking a Nursing Foot Care specialist for complex or routine foot care in the Ottawa region and valley. After experiences such as trauma, complex medical diagnoses, surgeries, or wound care, they are looking for support as they transition from hospitals to home and/or enjoy their life at home with high-quality in-home nursing foot care. Our clients have a wide range of interests, everything from animals, to conversations, to cars and mechanics, and everything in between! You would be the ideal candidate to work with us if you are passionate about helping people, are reliable, love working in a team, are registered as a nurse with the College of Nurses of Ontario, and have experience working with individuals in the community. 
 
HOURS:
Casual hours and flexible scheduling options available 
 
RATE OF PAY
Starting at $63/hr
Mileage costs covered 

Requirements

  • Cover letter outlining why you would be a great match for Spark. Tell us who you are!
  • Valid First Aid and CPR Standard level C certification
  • Smartphone with a data plan
  • Criminal Record & Vulnerable Sector Check (within the last 12 months)
  • Registered Nurse or Registered Practical Nurse in good standing with the College of Nurses of Ontario
  • Foot Care experience or member of the Canadian Association of Foot Care Nurses (CAFCN)
  • Advanced Foot Care experience and able to provide foot care services to a variety of clients living with complex comorbidities
  • Certification in Advanced Foot Care Nursing
  • Owns podiatry tools and sterilization equipment

Assets

  • Experience working in a multi-disciplinary team
  • Driver's License "G" class with access to a vehicle

Spark is looking to hire motivated, dedicated, and experienced Nurses.  In this role, you'll be supporting individuals in the community requiring direct care with personal hygiene, wound care, bladder/bowel care, and surgery recovery.  Care is tailored to each person, so each position is unique. Some clients need mainly in-home support. Others require support participating in community activities. Whatever the circumstances, we want people who will genuinely care about their well-being.  

Why Choose Spark?

At Spark, we value community, work life balance and career development. To help foster your personal and professional growth, we partner with Spark University, a non-profit focused on connecting, educating, and empowering caregivers. Spark U provides you with learning opportunities to make sure you are providing quality care for your clients. You can check them out at www.sparku.ca

Whatever our clients' age, background, or circumstances, we help them choose the perfect fit from our handpicked team of passionate, skilled and committed caregivers. As a caregiver with Spark, you have a voice in the matching process. We believe that your input will foster the best long-term relationships with your clients. At Spark, you'll have flexibility, autonomy and a team who truly cares about you.

Whatever your age, ability, orientation, ethnicity, race, culture, religion or gender identity - you are welcome. Our community is stronger and more vibrant when it is more diverse and inclusive.

Check us out: www.sparkcares.ca

title: Customer Service Specialist
description:
General Responsibilities

Do you enjoy working in a customer service role? Are you looking for a dynamic and growing organization that will both challenge and reward you? If so, then this role is for you….

 

The primary function of the Customer Service Specialist is to provide world class service to Hertz customers calling to confirm, cancel and modify existing reservations, and book reservations. Providing Hertz clients with the best in class service is essential to achieving a high level of productivity and service. 

 

The responsibility of a Customer Service Specialist includes:

  • Convert phone shops to reservations and rentals
  • Creating a positive customer service experience by listening to and identifying customer needs
  • Engaging customers in a courteous professional manner
  • Completing the reservations or change process expeditiously
  • Providing accurate information
  • Ensuring overall customer satisfaction and service

Additional responsibilities may involve the following:

  • Answering general customer questions, resolving customer complaints/issues and servicing customer questions/requests on existing reservations.
  • Assist customers with various post rental inquiries that involve the rental and billing process.
  • Assist customers with questions and requests associated with the Hertz Gold Rewards program.
  • Handle calls from customers who have a Hertz car who want to either extend or their rental or change the return time/location.
  • Ensure a positive experience by efficiently handling the phone calls Hertz according Call Performance Guidelines, answering the customer's questions accurately regarding Hertz rates and services and booking, cancelling, confirming or modifying the reservations correctly in the PC Excalibur computer system.
  • Maximize revenue opportunities with customers by actively soliciting business after every rate quote, addressing/overcoming customer objections to placing a reservation, utilizing various sales techniques as appropriate to obtain every possible booking.
  • Viewing every customer contact as a sales opportunity and soliciting reservations on customer service calls.
  • Providing excellent customer service to Hertz loyalty program members by updating customer profile information as requested by callers.
  • Provide excellent customer by efficiently handling the incoming calls from customers with inquiries about their billing and rental transactions.
  • Develop positive customer rapport with every caller by fully demonstrating the SMILES principles on a consistent basis.
  • Assist customers wanting to extend or change a reservation already in progress. This would include changing the return date, return time, and/or return location.
  • Uphold company policies and standards by being knowledgeable in utilizing various resources in order to research time discrepancies, rates, mileage, etc. The goal is to achieve first call resolution of customer disputes, thus minimizing costs involving further correspondence or communication.

Essential Requirements

  • Must be 20 years of age, have a valid drivers license and a clean motor vehicle record. 

At Hertz, we champion and celebrate a culture of diversity and inclusion. We take affirmative steps to promote employment and advancement opportunities. The endless variety of perspectives, experiences, skills and talents that our employees invest in their work every day represent a significant part of our culture – and our success and reputation as a company.

Individuals are encouraged to apply for positions because of the characteristics that make them unique. 

Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Hertz is a drug free workplace.

EOE, including disability/veteran
