title: Merchandiser
description:
Here at Scotts Miracle-Gro there is no such thing as a typical day.  Our culture is constantly energized by new and exciting growth opportunities and at a rapid pace.  Every Associate plays an important role in providing innovative solutions for today’s gardeners and growers and contributing new ideas to improve operations. In our company you need grit, it is what we were founded on over 150 years ago and is what keeps us growing. Regardless of your level in the organization there is a platform for your voice to be heard and the ability to influence change. Family, community and hard working values are weaved into all that we do. Come grow with us, where we develop and nurture the next generation of leaders. ​
Do you enjoy hands-on, physical work and being outdoors? 
Do you want a job that keeps you busy, physically fit and challenged creatively?
Do you want to have the winter months off for travel/leisure/school? 
Do you have previous merchandising/retail experience or are you willing to learn?
Do you have a passion for gardening/horticulture and/or lawn care?
Recently retired and looking to keep busy?
If any of the above sound like you and you are interested in learning more, then we'd love to chat with you!

As a Merchandiser Counselor, you will be merchandising in the Seasonal/Garden Centre department at local retailers. Primary locations will include Home Depots - Abbotsford and Chilliwack, and Lowes - Abbotsford. There are separate job postings for various locations, one being the Surrey area, if you, or someone you know, are looking for a job opportunity do not hesitate to inquire here or visit the other postings.
This is a contract position with a start date in mid-February and an end date in late September. Exact dates will be provided at the interview stage. Average weekly hours for the spring/summer season are 32 to 40 hrs/week and an average of 16 to 24 hrs/week for the remaining summer to September. Shift times are flexible and mostly bound by retail store hours. Typical shifts are weekdays but we may require a few Saturday shifts during key retail sales weekends.
We are now offering a $500 hire/stay bonus, paid after 4 weeks of employment.

Key Work Performed:
  • Merchandise Scotts products including restocking shelves, racks, and displays; cleaning and facing product; repairing or removing damaged items, etc.
  • Drive in-store sales in conjunction with Scotts Sales Manager.
  • Assemble fixtures and displays in-store.
  • Install and maintain point of purchase materials.
  • Provide recommendations and product knowledge to both consumers and retail customer associates.
  • Provide consumer counselling sessions including lawn and garden educational clinics, promotional events and in-aisle consumer education as needed.

Job Specifications: (Minimum Requirements)
Skill Factors (education, experience, communication, technical, etc.)
  • Strong initiative, self-directed and able to work independently with little supervision.
  • Reliable. 
  • Good organization and planning skills.
  • Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills.
  • Ability to fluently read, write and speak English. (fluency in French required for some territories)
  • Basic computer skills.

Effort Factors: (physical and mental demands)
  • Some Heavy lifting required; bending, kneeling, standing for extended periods of time; comfortable with ladders.
Working Conditions:
  • Early morning, evening and weekend work may be necessary.
  • Ability to travel locally by car as needed.
  • Works in “big box” retail stores with natural and artificial light exposure; forklifts and/or similar machinery is present.
  • Will be exposed to changes in temperature and humidity including indoor/outdoor working conditions.
A few other things we’ll expect from you:
  • Current valid Driver’s License, Driver’s Abstract, Criminal Record which meets Company criteria.
  • Must have full access to a car during work hrs. (mileage reimbursed).
  • Must have access to a computer with high-speed internet and printing capabilities.
  • Must have daily use of cell phone.
  • Must have Steel Toe boots/shoes. (green patch)

THIS IS NOT AN EXCLUSIVE OR EXHAUSTIVE LIST OF ALL JOB FUNCTIONS AND DEMANDS THAT AN EMPLOYEE IN THIS JOB MAY BE ASKED TO PERFORM FROM TIME TO TIME.
COME GROW WITH US, WHERE THE GRASS REALLY IS GREENER!

Not interested in this role? Check out our other career opportunities and learn more about what it’s like to work at Scotts MiracleGro by accessing our Talent Network: SMG Talent Network

The Scotts Miracle-Gro Company (NYSE: SMG) is the world's largest marketer of branded consumer lawn and garden products, with a full range of products for professional horticulture as well. Scotts Miracle-Gro has helped to grow the nearly $7 billion global consumer lawn and garden market through product innovation, industry-leading advertising efforts and its trusted brands.

The brands and products within our portfolio include: Scotts, Miracle-Gro, TomCat, Ortho, RoundUp, Bonnie Plants, Osmocote, Earthgro and Fafard.

Scotts is an EEO Employer.

Notification to Agencies:
Please note that the Scotts Miracle-Gro company does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Master Service Agreement, and specific approval to submit resumes to an approved requisition, the Scotts Miracle-Gro company will not consider or approve payment regarding recruiter fees or referral compensations.

title: Field Service Technician - Canada
description:
Description

This is a position located in Ontario Canada.


Summary

This position is responsible for equipment installation and technical support of Weber, Inc. product lines and maintaining good customer relations. Investigate and resolve customer reports of technical issues with equipment and eliminating future operational or service difficulties.


Duties and Responsibilities

  • Provides on-site technical assistance to help troubleshoot and repair equipment in a reasonable amount of time. Provides a communication link between the customer and Weber, Inc. to help ensure that effective service is provided to the customer.
  • Installs and/or repairs equipment at customer's facility to ensure full functionality according to specifications in a timely manner.
  • Communicate with technical logistics manager on a regular basis to give updates on current job status and receive additional job assignments.
  • Maintain quality and quantity of work on equipment. Listens attentively and asks questions as appropriate. Complete work assignments with minimum supervision. Retrieve and respond to messages daily on all communication tools.
  • Completes Service Documentation in Salesforce on what was repaired during the service call and time spent on the call. Reports are complete, accurate, and submitted at the time of site departure.
  • Consistently makes travel arrangements within company policy guidelines and in the most cost effective and time efficient manner possible. Keeps service team members and customers informed of arrival times. Travel arrangement will include: hotel, car rental and airline flights.
  • Weekly Expense Reports are completed in accurate and timely manner. All expenses incurred are handled in a cost-effective manner.
  • Provide contact information for service team for future service needs and parts needs. Ensure the customer are comfortable with operational and safety procedures of their equipment.

Requirements

Skills and Abilities

  • Electrical, pneumatic, mechanical, and machine shop skills required.
  • Mechanical aptitude needed.
  • Must have the ability to respond and adjust to changing or new situations. Work well in high stress environments and maintain professionalism in dealing with customers and co-workers.
  • Needs to be a self-starter and have the ability to work in unsupervised settings.
  • Must be able to troubleshoot basic mechanical, electronic and operational aspects of machines.
  • Responsible for machine service and concentrates on problem solving and preventative maintenance.
  • Excellent customer service skills.
  • Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.
  • Ability to write routine reports and correspondence.
  • Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or associates of organization.
  • Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference, and fundamentals of plane and solid geometry and trigonometry. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations.
  • Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
  • Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.
  • To perform this job successfully, an individual should be proficient in Microsoft Office, as well as having working knowledge of database applications and contact management systems. Salesforce Experience a plus.

Education and Experience

  • Associate degree or equivalent technical school diploma in electrical or mechanical engineering or similar discipline; 
  • Minimum of two years field service, packaging, maintenance or related experience
  • Will consider equivalent combination of education and experience.

Other Requirements

  • Vaccination requirement - Weber values the safety of our employees and customers. To ensure a safe and welcoming environment for all, Weber currently requires all U.S. based new hires to have received at least 1 dose of an approved COVID-19 vaccine prior to their position start date. Second doses, if required, must be completed within 5 weeks of their start date. Weber will consider requests for reasonable accommodation based on disability and/or religious reasons on an individualized basis. 
  • Current valid driver's license.
  • Valid passport or have the ability to obtain one.
  • Must have the ability to frequently travel within Canada and occasionally North America and Germany .

Travel Requirements:

Up to 70% travel required, depending on customer needs. Must maintain flexible scheduled and work outside of normal business hours, as needed.

title: Manufacturing Supervisor
description:
Overview:

Flex-N-Gate is a leading manufacturer and supplier of components for the automotive industry, recently ranked 10th of the 150 Top North American Suppliers in â€œAutomotive News.â€ A growing and vital company, Flex-N-Gate provides a great opportunity for hard-working and skilled individuals.

Scope of the Position:

The Manufacturing Supervisor is responsible for supervising operations to ensure production is operating in a safe, efficient, and timely manner. Responsible for productions schedules and posting of daily work assignments based upon production needs and individual strengths. Must be shop floor orientated and provide â€œhands-onâ€ product/process support for all reports on a daily basis. This individual will be the driver behind product/process safety, quality, delivery and morale.  Accountable for continuous improvement of assigned department as well as training and development of direct reports.

Responsibilities:
  • All work must be performed in a safe, efficient manner in compliance with Company Policy, Local, Provincial and/or Federal rules and regulations and if applicable Collective Agreement.
  • Communicates, trains, guides and coaches employees to achieve operational initiatives that optimize team efforts in the manufacturing of high quality products.
  • Schedules and assigns personnel to work according to the demand of the manufacturing schedules.
  • Measures performance and quality.
  • Drives positive results in operational Key Process Indicators.
  • Performs other related tasks as assigned.
    • The incumbent is responsible for the awareness, understanding, specific responsibilities and management of the Environmental Management System (EMS) as stated in EMS policy CEVPL.00005.
    • The incumbent is responsible for the awareness, understanding, specific responsibilities and management of the Quality Management System (QMS) as stated in
Qualifications:
  • 1-3 yearsâ€™ related work experience in Injection Moulding  
  • Knowledge of Occupational Health and Safety Act, and Labour Laws.
  • Conflict Resolution Management and Time Management.
  • Strong communication, presentation, organizational, problem solving, teamwork interpersonal and leadership skills.
  • Proficient computer skills.
  • Effective use of technology, instruments, tools and information systems.
  • Ability to seek a team approach.
Benefits:

â€¢ Medical, dental, prescription, vision, life and disability insurance
â€¢ RRSP retirement savings plan
â€¢ Extensive safety training, new hire orientation, continuous learning and development programs and tuition reimbursement
â€¢ Paid holidays and vacation time

What do our employees have to say?

â€œLots of growth opportunity.â€
â€œThe companyâ€™s young enough to be exciting, but old enough to be stable.â€
Not just a jobâ€”a great place to work!

title: Claims Administrator - Transportation
description:
Now Hiring

CLAIMS ADMINISTRATOR

 

At Canada Cartage we work with intelligent and focused leaders who are driven to create an outstanding customer experience in partnership with Canadian leading brands. Canada Cartage is deep rooted in family values with an entrepreneurial culture where ideas are welcomed, growth is fostered and high performance is championed. A recognized thought leader and founded in 1914, Canada Cartage dominates the industry by delivering innovative fleet solutions.

We are currently looking to add a Full-time, permanent Claims Administrator to our team. Someone who is equally passionate about serving the community and achieving operational success alongside our dedicated and loyal employees.

Located at 490 Lucas Avenue, Winnipeg and reporting to the National Manager, Risk Insurance & Claims, the Claims Administrator is for investigating and processing assigned company commercial insurance claims. You will be working closely with our Safety, Fleet & Operations departments in providing commercial trucking claims service and support. You will be acting as a liaison between Canada Cartage and our Insurance Company and investigate, negotiate, and settle claims based on Insurer and Corporate claims guidelines.

 

Responsibilities:

 

•Coordinates and handles all internal claims investigations and communicates the findings internally and to the customer/vendor within a timely manner.

  • Provide quality customer service to customers and claimants with a primary goal of resolving claims  efficiently and expeditiously
  • Verifies/analyzes applicable coverage for the reported loss and administers the financial aspects of assigned claims including establishing claim reserves, internal cost allocation, processing loss payments and subrogation collection.
  • Negotiates, settles and resolves motor vehicle accident claims, cargo and property losses with insurance company adjusters, claimants, customers and third parties claimant representatives.
  • Receives and reviews incident reports and claim investigation material including Police reports, Motor Accident reports, and Property Damage and Exception reports.
  • Sets and monitors claim file reserves
  • Works with assigned independent adjusters and representatives from our insurance company on bringing claims to resolution.
  • Perform duties in accordance with industry standards, regulations, corporate timelines, performance standards and workplace safety and health policies and procedures
  • Coordinates with the fleet department, repair facilities, recovery companies and operations teams on getting damaged equipment repaired and back into operations in a timely and efficient manner.
  • Establishes, maintains and manages paperless and computer claim files, on assigned liability, property and physical damage claims with all documentation and investigation material housed in chronological order.
  • Prepares subrogation documents and manages cost recovery for applicable claim files
  • Maintain active monitoring file and diary ensuring claim files are managed effectively
  • Participates with an on call rotation which entails answering phone calls during off-duty hours
  • Other duties as reasonably assigned

 

 Core Competencies and Qualification:

 

•Completion of high school required.

•Minimum 2 years of experience handling auto and cargo Claims (Commercial Transportation claims preferred)

  • Insurance Institute of Canada (CIP Program) designation considered asset
  • Must be able to demonstrate strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent time management, prioritization, organizational and planning skills required
  • Ability to problem solve, self-motivated and work independently
  • Good negotiation skills and customer service focus
  • Proficient in internet and database applications and Microsoft Office programs including Excel
  • Must have excellent keyboarding skills, be able to type over 40 WPM and have the ability to create, modify and manipulate data in spreadsheets
  • Thrive in a high volume, fast paced environment

 

Why work for Canada Cartage?

Our Team

We are a family-oriented company with competitive benefits, including extended health and dental, RRSP and Company-Matching pension plans; discounted hotels, car rentals, entertainment, gym memberships, phone plans, electronics, to name a few of the perks; a cohesive team and a positive, hard-working atmosphere. We have fun events throughout the year, like truck rodeos, summer barbeques and driver-appreciation week that regularly bring us together. It’s important to give back to the communities in which we operate, so we volunteer with and donate to local charities

We also have Company wide recognition initiatives designed to recognize drivers and staff when they demonstrate outstanding customer service, teamwork and our core values.

Why do we have one of the lowest driver turn-over rates in Canada?  A team environment, short-haul regular routes and great benefits.

Recognized leader in the industry:

Canada Cartage has been recognized on the Forbes list of Canada’s Best Employers 2022. This is the sixth straight year that Canada Cartage has been included on this list. https://www.forbes.com/companies/canada-cartage/?list=canada-best-employers&sh=7841454553d8

The Canada’s Best Employers 2022 title, along with our 6th year of being recognized by Trucking HR as one of Canada’s “Top Fleet Employers” serves to reinforce Canada Cartage’s reputation as an employer of high quality.

Our Values

Integrity: We conduct our business with honour, honest and ethics with our people, the environment and legal matters. We believe I being transparent and trustworthy, respecting the traditional “handshake” value system and earning our way in.

Humanity: We are a family minded organization, caring for people and treating them with dignity, decency and respect, be it employees, customers, suppliers or our partners. Open door policy and dealings is our way.

Accountability: Accountability and accessibility to our staff, customers and our customers’ customers is of utmost importance to us. We enable a high level of two way communication, providing access to people who wil deal with issues ad have the willingness to resolve things.  We will be relied on and held accountable for our results and our long term commitments.

Collaboration: We understand that results are the product of a team effort. As part of our process, we ensure collaboration with all our staff at all levels in all roles across departmental lines. With our customers, we use a collaborative style approach, sharing ownership to ensure a successful operation.

Dedication: Our organization is employee and customer-driven. We encourage an environment of conscientious effort and earnestness, hiring problem solvers who are responsive and have a "can-do" attitude to get the job done.

Leadership: Personal leadership to us means being competent, taking ownership, demonstrating initiative, and having a voice. Corporate leadership to us means being leaders in the market, continuous improvement and innovation, and empowering those around you.https://jobs.jobvite.com/canadacartage

 

Come work with an industry leader!

 

We would like to thank all those expressing an interest in this position; however only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Committed to employment equity, Canada Cartage Systems LP encourages applications from Aboriginal people, members of visible minority groups, and women.

title: Technical Support Specialist II - Vancouver
description:
Nova Biomedical is hiring a Technical Support Specialist II for the Western Canada and is responsible for working closely with the National Support Manager in implementing and supporting all the Nova Biomedical devices and providing superior value in technical service that exceeds customer needs. This position will be responsible for installations, training customers, preventive maintenance, and emergency service to all Nova Biomedical instrumentation within the assigned region while working closely with Sales Representatives and technical team to ensure total customer satisfaction is achieved for both pre and post implementation phases. Also responsible for properly documenting all service-related activities in a timely and professional manner, including inventory, service orders, expense reports, and all other required records as well as performing clinical applications activities such as correlation, linearity, and precision to assist customers with analyzer validation. This position requires the ability to understand and educate end users on instrument application issues and the ability to perform data analysis in support of applications objectives and participate in onsite validation activities on all Nova products and ensures a successful smooth transition to Nova technology including StatStrip, pHOx Ultra, Prime Plus and Flex.

 

 

Responsibilities:

• Executes rapid response recovery that is focused on minimizing device downtime as well as the resolution of problems so that they do not recur, while keeping the customer constantly aware of progress.

• Delivers technical service within established departmental plans and budgets.

• Maintains acceptable productivity levels, customer satisfaction levels and time fix percentage as determined to be appropriate by National Support Manager.

• May require attendance and assistance at trade shows, customer seminars and similar events.

• Responsible for maintaining service agreements, properly billing customers for service performed and parts used.

• Ensures timely and accurate entry of information into the service database, which includes customer information, correspondence, and device history records.

• Control expenses through proper inventory management, good judgment with all Nova property (i.e.: company car, inventory, and tools) and attention to cost in normal duties of the position.

 

 

Qualifications:

• Clinical lab, chemistry knowledge, and equivalent industry experience required.

• Technical degree or equivalent with medical electronics background preferred.

• Windows and networking experience along with solid knowledge of interfaces and relational Databases preferred.

• Must have valid driver's license and good driving record.

• Requires extended travel on short notice within Canada for extended periods of time as required.

• Requires above average verbal communication skills, above average interpersonal skills and able to work well with teams.

• Exceptional organizational skills, customer focus and an absolute commitment to exceeding customer expectations are a must in this position.

• Familiarity with Blood Glucose Testing meters is a plus.

• Bilingual in both English and French languages is a plus.

title: Parts Helper
description:
Westerra Equipment has been selling, renting, and fixing equipment for over 100 years. We also train people in all corners of British Columbia on how to operate machinery safely and effectively. From forklifts to skid steers, excavators, loaders, and dump trucks, Westerra Equipment services industries such as warehousing, milling, construction, forestry, recycling, and more with their equipment needs. Join our award-winning company and experience working at Gold Certified Canadaâ€™s Best Managed Company, A Great Place to Work, and one of BCâ€™s Top Employers. 

The Parts Helper/Picker will work alongside the Shipper and Receiver to support warehouse functions.

 

Key Responsibilities:  

  • Perform warehouse functions, which may include loading, picking, packing, scanning, shipping/receiving, general cleaning;
  • Plan ahead for future deliveries and streamline the process;
  • Be responsible for meeting delivery deadlines commitments;
  • Maintain strict housekeeping standards in accordance with 5S protocols;
  • Ensure high levels of internal customer satisfaction;
  • A Safe Attitude and compliance with Health and Safety practices and procedures including wearing PPE such as steel-toed work boots or shoes;
  • Identify product and vendor information through computer systems;
  • Operate powered industrial equipment (PIT); we provide special training to associates based on interest and availability;
  • Lift up to 22 kilograms /50 pounds to organize merchandise;
  • Operate carts, dollies, hand trucks, forklifts, order pickers, and other equipment to move large quantities of merchandise;
  • Accept other responsibilities as required to support the companyâ€™s business needs;
  • Other duties as assigned.

 

Required Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:  

  • Completion of Grade 12 supplemented by related training and experience;
  • Experience in an Automotive/Industrial parts department will be considered an asset.
  • Valid B.C. Driver's License with safe driving record.
  • Experience in warehousing and distribution environment is a plus;
  • Proven experience and knowledge of deliveries planning;
  • Excellent attention to detail and a positive attitude, with good interpersonal skills;
  • Time management and organizational skills required;
  • Excellent communication, customer service, and problem-solving skills;
  • Ability to read delivery invoices an asset;
  • Previous forklift and/or lift truck experience is an asset but not required;
  • Ability to work in a quick-paced group environment;
  • Stand/walk during shifts lasting up to 8 hours, and frequently push, pull, squat, bend, and reach;
  • Climb and descend stairs (applies to sites with stairs) to manager merchandise;

 

Who We Are: Our people are at the core of what we do. We take the time to hire the right people who share our 5 core values, train them, coach them, and reward them for their successes.

  1. Build Trust â€“ Build trust with others and & each other.
  2. Be a Team Player â€“ Commit to working together to win.
  3. Be Customer Focused â€“ â€œWowâ€ customers so they become â€œRaving Fansâ€.
  4. Support Community â€“ Care for our people, our community, and the planet.
  5. Deliver Results â€“ Know what you need to do and get it done.

 

Due to the volume of applicants, only those candidates shortlisted will be contacted. Thank you for exploring career opportunities with Westerra Equipment.

title: Service Technician
description:
PURPOSE OF JOB


Swish Maintenance Limited is a distributor for janitorial equipment/supplies, industrial supplies and cleaning chemicals. We represent major manufacturers who manufacture these products and then distribute them through our warehouses.


Maintains customer satisfaction by ensuring timely equipment service including but not limited to emergency repairs, planned maintenance, pre-and post-delivery inspections, training and general customer service as it pertains to equipment service.
 

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

●        Responsible for servicing and repairing industrial and commercial equipment (small motors) including electrical problems in house and on-site

●        Responsible for inventory control of replacement parts and equipment

●        Responsible for care, maintenance, stocking and general housekeeping of service van

●        Responsible to complete all scheduled service calls based on service procedures

●        Responsible to assist with any Industrial equipment demonstrations/rentals required by sales, staff, management or customers

●        Responsible and accountable for hours spent on outside or in house service calls

●        Responsible and accountable for all paperwork done on outside or in house service calls

●        Responsible to reduce customer down time through Planned Maintenance Agreement sales

●        Responsible to assist, when required, with all service related inquiries

●        Responsible to report any injuries incurred in-house or off-site while performing service-related duties

●        May be required to perform after hours’/weekend emergency Industrial Service repairs

●        Reports to Branch Manager

 

PLANNING AND BUDGETING

 

●        Daily and monthly planning of service work orders assigned to the technician ensuring customer work orders are completed within 7 days where circumstances beyond the control of the technician are not a factor

 

PHYSICAL DEMANDS / WORKING CONDITIONS

●        Conditions may cause some stress or physical discomfort due to exposure to:                    

                -Repetitive lifting                                -Temperature variations

                -Time constraints                                 -Moving product more than 50 lbs.

●        Moderate intensity activities add up to an average of four to six hours a day

●        High intensity physical activities add up to and average of four to six hours a day

●        Travel required  

 

RECOMMENDED QUALIFICATIONS

Experience:

●        Clean Drivers abstract

●        Commercial level of acquired technical/mechanical knowledge such as small engine or automotive technician.

●        WHMIS and TDG training required (company will provide training)

●        Good organizational skills and clerical abilities as you will be responsible for maintaining a fully stocked parts department.

●        Ability to handle powered machinery

●        Ability to do basic math, problem solve

●        Unique problems are passed to Operations Lead or Service Manager

●        Ability to handle customer service inquiries

●         Interpersonal skills to communicate with customers, staff and suppliers in a pleasant and professional manner

●        Motor skills to operate computer, Custom software, phones, debit and interac machines

●        Minimum of 2 years’ motor and electrical experience

Education:

●        Minimum High School Diploma

title: Field Sales Representative & Merchandiser - Part-Time
description:
Job Details

Job Description

At Kruger Products we have a shared vision for greatness. We manufacture some of North America’s most popular tissue brands - Cashmere®, Purex®, Scotties®’, SpongeTowels®, White Cloud®, as well as products for use away from home. We always want to do better for our customers and our world. The awards we’ve earned remind us that our hard work and commitment to doing the right thing pays off. But they aren’t what keep us going. It’s the people who work here, who believe in what we do – and how we do it that truly matters.

We are leaders in our communities, leaders in sustainability, and leaders in connecting with our consumers. Our headquarters is in Mississauga, ON, and we proudly have nearly 2,700 employees spread across eight manufacturing plants in Quebec, British Columbia, Ontario, and Tennessee.

 WHAT YOU WILL DO

The Field Sales Representative will work collaboratively with our retail customers to maximize the presence of our brands in your territory. You will be responsible for in-store execution of merchandising and promotions & sales.

In this role, you will:

  • Increase sales and expand the positioning of our brands
  • Execute and deliver retail coverage
  • Set call objectives, achieve targets and utilize strong interpersonal skills to present monthly priorities to store decision makers
  • Work on core program execution including; shelf management, distribution, planograms, pricing, merchandising, sales
  • Maximize in-store display and product visibility

WHAT YOU WILL BRING

  • Must have 1-3 years of retail sales and/or merchandising experience working in the Grocery, Mass and Drug retail trade
  • Valid full G driver’s license
  • A car or reliable, consistent access to a car
  • Post-secondary degree from either a University or College preferred 
  • Proficiency in a PC/Windows environment: Excel, Word, PowerPoint & Outlook
  • High level of attention to detail and accuracy working in a competitive business environment with changing priorities and deadlines
  • The incumbent must possess strong written and oral communication skills
  • Must be available for limited travel

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU

Our mission is to make everyday life more comfortable for our consumers. Together we bring this mission to life. As an ever-evolving business, there are always exciting new challenges, diverse career options, and opportunities to innovate. Want to learn more? Come unleash your greatness with Kruger Products.

We have been named one of GTA’s Top Employers for the past 10 consecutive years, as well as Forbes' Best Employers in Canada.

Kruger Products is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals.  Accommodation will be provided in all parts of the hiring process as required under KPLP’s Accessibility Policy and Multi-Year Accessibility Plan - 1.04.33.  Applicants need to make their needs known in advance.

We thank all applicants for their interest in Kruger Products but only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Wind Turbine Technician - Travelling Canada - $2000 New Hire Bonus!
description:
Wind Technician – Travelling Canada - $2000 New Hire Bonus!

Overview:

Spark Power is a leading independent power solutions provider to the electrical service industry across North America. We deliver technical solutions that help our customers transition to the grid of the future – Renewable Energy.

The Travel Wind Turbine Technician will travel to support various scopes of work across Canada. The technician must be competent and qualified to work on wind turbines. Specific trainings and electrical / mechanical competencies are an asset.

We are excited to provide careers in Renewables and are committed to being the best employer possible. Our product is our people!

Here's what you will do as a Wind Technician:

  • Follow all Health and Safety policies to maintain a zero-incident workplace
  • Scheduled maintenance of Wind Turbine Generators including: inspection, greasing, cleaning, torquing and tensioning of bolted connections
  • Apply LOTO
  • Electrical Troubleshooting
  • Hydraulic Troubleshooting
  • Follow and implement work procedures to for specific scopes of work to inspect, repair and maintain Wind Turbine components
  • Populate, track and communicate client and company documentation on a daily basis
  • Maintain a clean work area, equipment and tooling
  • Perform other daily work requirements as directed by Site Management
  • Maintain required training certifications for position (Fall Protection/Rescue Training, NFPA 70E, OSHA 10, LOTO, First Aid/CPR/AED)

Do you have the Spark?  Here's what we're looking for:

  • Firm commitment to safety
  • Positive attitude, strong work ethic and a willingness to learn
  • Believer in Renewable Energy
  • 2-years experience working as a Wind Turbine Technician is preferred
  • Strong electro-mechanical troubleshooting, maintenance or repair experience
  • Experience with motors, rotors, drives, gears, or similar is required
  • Experience using hand and power tools including torque tooling
  • Valid Driver's License
  • Digital literacy (proficiency with mobile apps, all our reporting is digital)
  • Attention to detail
  • Ability to work with a team mentality and liaise with customers to ensure quality of service
  • Able to travel 80-100% of the time across Canada
  • Must be able to lift 23kg (50 lbs)
  • Ability to work at heights (up to 400 ft) with good ergonomics, work may take place on ladders, platforms, and cramped spaces with constant standing and kneeling.
  • Able to determine color codes
  • Work in adverse weather conditions and extreme temperatures
  • Post secondary education with an electrical or mechanical base is an asset
  • High school diploma or equivalent

Here are some of the perks Spark employees enjoy:

  • Competitive hourly wages
  • Generous daily per diem
  • Paid travel days
  • Guaranteed 40 hour work week
  • 1.5X overtime after 40 Hours / week
  • Fast-track growth opportunities
  • Opportunities to train and work in other sectors (Solar, Electric Car Charging, Battery Storage)
  • Hands-on, positive Management Team that began as Technicians and have been promoted from within
  • Positive and fun company culture. No one is 'just a number' at Spark.
  • Benefits (health, vision, dental)
  • RRSP Matching and Employee Share Ownership Program (ESOP)
  • Company vehicles
  • Monthly cell phone allowance
  • All travel, training, workwear & PPE paid for

Who is Spark Power?

  • We provide end-to-end electrical contracting, operations and maintenance services, and energy sustainability solutions to the industrial, commercial, utility, and renewable asset markets.
  • We have over 1300 employees across 38 offices across North America.
  • We have numerous exciting projects in commercial, industrial, and institutional sectors across Canada and the US.

title: Housekeeping Supervisor
description:
Company Description

WHO ARE WE?
We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.

Job Description

Requirements:

  • Must be authorized to work in Canada.

  • Must have a valid SIN number.

  • Must have a car and valid Canadian Driver’s license. 

  • At least 3 years of experience in janitorial or housekeeping

  • Must be fully Vaccinated

  • Available to work nights and weekends

Job Description:

  • Hire and Train new employees

  • Inspect the facilities and supervise the cleaning crews

  • Accomplish compliance work requirements by orientating, training, assigning, scheduling, and guiding.

  • Meet work standards by following production, productivity, quality, and customer-service standards; resolving operational problems; identifying work process improvements.

  • Perform site audits using company inspection software

  • Follow up with cleaning team on a regular basis

  • Communicate audit progress and findings by preparing reports, providing information in meetings to all staff

  • Provide management reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing management information

Qualifications

  • Communication – Oral and written

  • Leadership 

  • Great Time Management skills

  • Training & Learning Strategies

  • Judgement and Decision Making



Additional Information

Dexterra Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the hiring selection process are available upon request.

title: GÉNÉRALISTE DES RH BILINGUE / HR GENERALIST
description:
Poste à combler

GÉNÉRALISTE DES RH BILINGUE

 

Chez Canada Cartage, nos leaders sont talentueux et axés sur la création d’une expérience client exceptionnelle, en partenariat avec les grandes marques canadiennes.La culture d’entreprise de Canada Cartage est profondément enracinée dans les valeurs familiales où les idées sont les bienvenues, la croissance est encouragée et un rendement élevé est recherché.Un chef de file reconnu et fondé en 1914, Canada Cartage domine l'industrie en offrant des solutions de flottes novatrices.

Nous cherchons actuellement à ajouter à notre équipe un(e) généraliste permanent en ressources humaines à temps plein.Une personne qui est tout aussi passionnée à servir la communauté et à atteindre le succès opérationnel aux côtés de nos employés dévoués et loyaux.

Sous la responsabilité du gestionnaire des ressources humaines, le/la généraliste en RH est le premier point de contact pour offrir un soutien et résoudre les problèmes de relations avec les employés, mettre en œuvre les programmes, les politiques et les procédures des RH, la formation et le perfectionnement et cette personne fournit également un soutien mensuel/trimestriel pour la production de rapports et de données sur les RH.

Ce poste convient à une personne qui aime relever des défis et travailler dans un environnement de travail dynamique, où il est essentiel d’avoir la capacité de s’adapter efficacement au changement.Idéalement, cette personne est bilingue et a de l’initiative et de la confiance en soi, elle possède un bon jugement et la capacité de prendre des décisions et des initiatives pour offrir un excellent service, tout en faisant partie d’une équipe dynamique axée sur la collaboration, qui s’engage à ajouter une valeur à l’organisation.

Responsabilité :

•Encadrer et conseiller les gestionnaires sur les questions diverses et complexes liées au relations de travail avec des employés (c.-à-d. gestion du rendement, de la présence, de l’invalidité, des enquêtes en milieu de travail, des licenciements d’employés, etc.), y compris rassembler et préparer des preuves à l’appui de recommandations appropriées.

•Fournir un soutien global aux relations avec les employés pour toutes les demandes du personnel concernant les politiques et les procédures.

• Organiser des séminaires d'accueil et d'orientation des employés sur une base hebdomadaire.

• Gérer les dossiers de cas du CNESST, les plans de retour au travail et les rapports au besoin.

•Participer à l’élaboration et à la mise en œuvre de programmes et d’initiatives organisationnelles.

•Établir des relations efficaces avec les clients internes pour comprendre leurs objectifs d’affaires afin d’identifier proactivement et mettre en œuvre des solutions en acord avec leur stratégie.

•Examiner, faire enquête et résoudre les problèmes, les préoccupations et les plaintes des employés.

•Surveiller l'engagement et le maintien en poste des employés et suggérer des recommandations au besoin.

•Faciliter la prestation de programmes de formation en ressources humaines, y compris les mesures disciplinaires progressives, le mentorat de performance, le leadership pour les postes de supervision, etc.

•Communiquer et participer à l’élaboration d’objectifs pour les examens de rendement semestriels et annuels.

•Gérer différents projets en RH liés à la stratégie des RH.

• Mener des enquêtes en milieu de travail sur des allégations d'inconduite des employés qui (en raison de la nature des questions ou des personnes en cause) sont réputées avoir un profil de risque élevé.

•Recommander de nouvelles approches, politiques et procédures pour apporter des améliorations continues en ce qui concerne l'efficacité des services fournis.

•Maintenir et tisser des liens qui favorisent la collaboration à tous les niveaux de l’organisation en s’assurant de fournir un haut niveau de service aux clients.

•Mettre à jour les dossiers du personnel.

•Autres fonctions au besoin.

•Il peut être nécessaire de voyager.

 

 Compétences de base et qualification :

•Baccalauréat ou certificat en ressources humaines, relations industrielles ou dans une discipline connexe

•Minimum de 5 ans d'expérience en tant que généraliste en RH exigé

• Doit être entièrement bilingue en français et en anglais pour la communication écrite et orale

• Expérience de l'évaluation de la preuve selon une norme de prépondérance des probabilités

• Doit bien fonctionner dans un environnement dynamique et complexe, avec la capacité de gérer simultanément diverses tâches et de travailler avec des priorités changeantes

• Compétences de négociation et d'influence démontrées, avec la capacité d'exercer un bon jugement en matière de résolution de problèmes

•Compétences en communication et en relations interpersonnelles; la capacité d’influer sur les décisions est nécessaire

•Capacité à travailler avec la haute direction afin de mettre en œuvre des processus efficaces de gestion du changement

•Faire preuve de professionnalisme et d’une capacité à respecter la confidentialité; avoir un comportement éthique

•Capacité à développer et maintenir des relations à tous les niveaux de l'organisation

•Une connaissance approfondie du Code canadien du travail (CCT), des droits de la personne, des droits en matière d’adaptation, etc.

• Un titre reconnu en RH ou l'équivalent serait un atout

• Expérience et connaissances en matière de transport serait un atout.

 

Pourquoi travailler chez Canada Cartage?

Notreéquipe

Nous sommes une entreprise familiale qui offre des avantages concurrentiels, y compris une assurance médicale et dentaire complémentaire, des REER et un régime de retraite avec une contribution équivalente de l’entreprise; des tarifs réduits pour les hôtels, la location de voitures, les divertissement, l’adhésion à un centre de conditionnement, des appareils électroniques, des forfaits téléphoniques, pour ne citer que quelques-uns des avantages; une équipe soudée et une atmosphère positive et dynamique au travail.Nous organisons des événements amusants tout au long de l'année, comme les rodéos de camion, les barbecues d'été et la Semaine d'appréciation des conducteurs qui nous rassemblent régulièrement.Il est important de redonner aux communautés où nous sommes présents, c'est pourquoi nous participons et faisons des dons aux organismes de bienfaisance locaux.

Nous avons également des initiatives de reconnaissance à l'échelle de l'entreprise qui a été élaborée pour souligner l’apport des camionneurs et des membres du personnel qui font preuve d'un service à la clientèle et d'un esprit d'équipe exceptionnels, et nos valeurs essentielles.

Pourquoi notre roulement du personnel est-il parmi le plus bas au Canada?  Parce que nous avons un bon esprit d’équipe, des trajets réguliers de courte distance, et de grands avantages.Venez travailler avec nous :https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rpMA1riOzPI 

 

Un chef de file reconnu dans l’industrie :

Canada Cartage a été reconnu sur la liste Forbes comme faisant partie des Meilleurs employeurs du Canada en 2022.C'est la sixième année consécutive que Canada Cartage a été inclus sur cette liste.https://www.forbes.com/companies/canada-cartage/?list=canada-best-employers&sh=7841454553d8

Le titre de Meilleur employeur du Canada en 2022, ainsi que notre reconnaissante pour une 6e année par RH Camionnage comme l’un des « Meilleurs transporteurs employeurs » du Canada renforcent la réputation de Canada Cartage en tant qu’employeur de haute qualité.

Notre célébration de notre centenaire : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b3S-CtHQhVY 

 

Nos valeurs

Intégrité :Nous exerçons nos activités en faisant preuve d'honneur, d'honnêteté, et de sens éthique avec nos collaborateurs, l'environnement, et les questions juridiques.Nous croyons qu'il faut être transparent et digne de confiance, en respectant le traditionnel système de valeur établi par des liens personnels, pour laisser notre marque.

Humanité :Nous sommes une organisation à caractère familial : nous sommes attentifs et nous traitons les autres avec dignité, courtoisie et respect, qu'il s'agisse des employés, des clients, des fournisseurs ou de nos partenaires.Nous faisons preuve d'ouverture et de transparence.

Responsabilité :L'accessibilité et la responsabilité envers notre personnel, nos clients, et les clients de nos clients, sont de la plus haute importance pour nous.Nous entretenons une communication bidirectionnelle de haut niveau, en offrant un accès aux personnes-ressources qui ont la volonté et la capacité de résoudre les problèmes.  Nous assumons la responsabilité pour nos résultats et nos engagements à long terme.

Collaboration :Nous comprenons que les résultats sont le produit d'un effort d'équipe.Dans le cadre de notre processus, nous nous assurons de la collaboration de l'ensemble de notre personnel à tous les niveaux de service.Nous adoptons avec nos clients une approche collaborative, en partageant la responsabilité pour le succès des activités.

Dévouement :Notre organisation est axée sur les besoins des employés et des clients.Nous favorisons un environnement ou nous recrutons des personnes consciencieuses et appliquées qui résolvent les problèmes et qui ont une attitude ouverte et positive dans l'accomplissement de leurs  tâches.

Leadership :Le leadership personnel signifie pour nous être compétent et responsable, faire preuve d'initiative, et avoir la capacité de s'exprimer.Le leadership d'entreprise signifie pour nous être un leader dans le marché, et favoriser l'amélioration continue et l'innovation, tout en renforçant la capacité des gens qui vous entourent.https://jobs.jobvite.com/canadacartage-fr/

Venez travailler avec un chef de file de l'industrie.

 

Nous tenons à remercier toutes les personnes qui expriment leur intérêt envers ce poste; toutefois, nous communiquerons uniquement avec les candidat(e)s qui sont sélectionnés pour une entrevue.

En tant que société engagée envers l'équité en matière d'emploi, Canada Cartage LP encourage les candidatures provenant des Autochtones, des membres de minorités visibles et des femmes. 

___________________________________________________

Now Hiring

HR GENERALIST BILINGUAL

 

At Canada Cartage we work with intelligent and focused leaders who are driven to create an outstanding customer experience in partnership with Canadian leading brands. Canada Cartage is deep rooted in family values with an entrepreneurial culture where ideas are welcomed, growth is fostered and high performance is championed. A recognized thought leader and founded in 1914, Canada Cartage dominates the industry by delivering innovative fleet solutions.

We are currently looking to add a full-time permanent Human Resources Generalist to our team. Someone who is equally passionate about serving the community and achieving operational success alongside our dedicated and loyal employees.

Reporting to the Manager, Human Resources, the HR Generalist will serve as the first point of contact for supporting and resolving employee relations issues, implementing HR programs, policies and procedures, training & development and providing monthly/quarterly support for HR reporting and metrics.

This position is well positioned for someone who thrives on challenges and who enjoys working in a fast paced dynamic work environment where the ability to adapt effectively to change is key. The ideal candidate is self-motivated, confident, bilingual, exercises good judgment and decision making ability and takes initiative to provide excellent service to our stakeholders while being part of a collaborative and energetic HR team who is committed to add value to the organization.

Responsibilities:

  • Coach and advise Managers on complex and diverse employee relations issues (i.e. performance, management, attendance management, disability management, workplace investigations, employee exits), including compiling and preparing evidence to support appropriate recommendations.
  • Provide overall employee relations support to all staff inquiries regarding policies and procedures.
  • Perform employee onboarding and orientation seminars on a weekly basis.
  • Manage CNESST case files, return to work plans and reporting as needed.
  • Participates in the development and implementation of organizational programs and initiatives.
  • Build effective relationships with internal clients to understand their business goals to proactively identify and implement solutions in line with their strategy.
  • Field, investigative and resolve employee issues, concerns and complaints.
  • Monitor employee engagement and retention and suggest recommendations where required.
  • Facilitate Human Resources training programs including Progressive Discipline, Coaching for Performance, Supervisory Leadership, etc.
  • Communicate and assist with the development of objectives for semi-annul and annual performance reviews.
  • Manage various HR projects related to the HR strategy as assigned.
  • Lead workplace investigations into allegations of employee misconduct that (due to the nature of the issues or individuals involved) are deemed to have a high risk profile.
  • Recommends new approaches, policies and procedures to effect continual improvements in efficiency of the department and services performed.
  • Maintain and foster relationships to enable collaboration with all levels of the organization ensuring a high level of customer service is provided.
  • Maintenance of personnel files
  • Other duties as required
  • Travel may be required

 

 Core Competencies and Qualification:

  • Bachelor’s Degree/Certificate in Human Resources, Industrial Relations or a related discipline
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience as an HR generalist is required
  • Most be fully bilingual in English and French for written and spoken communication
  • Experience assessing evidence on a standard of balance of probabilities
  • Must work well in a fast–paced and ambiguous environment with the ability to manage various tasks simultaneously and work with changing priorities
  • Demonstrated negotiating and influencing skills, with the ability to exercise sound judgment in problem resolution
  • Effective interpersonal and communication skills; the ability to influence decisions is required
  • Ability to work with senior leadership to implement effective change management processes
  • Demonstrated professionalism and ability to maintain confidentiality; ethical
  • Ability to develop and maintain relationships with all levels of the organization
  • Comprehensive knowledge of Canada Labor Code (CLC), Human Rights, Accommodation, etc.
  • HR designation or equivalent would be an asset
  • Transportation experience/knowledge an asset

 

Why work for Canada Cartage?

Our Team

We are a family-oriented company with competitive benefits, including extended health and dental, RRSP and Company-Matching pension plans; discounted hotels, car rentals, entertainment, gym memberships, phone plans, electronics, to name a few of the perks; a cohesive team and a positive, hard-working atmosphere. We have fun events throughout the year, like truck rodeos, summer barbeques and driver-appreciation week that regularly bring us together. It’s important to give back to the communities in which we operate, so we volunteer with and donate to local charities

We also have Company wide recognition initiatives designed to recognize drivers and staff when they demonstrate outstanding customer service, teamwork and our core values.

Why do we have one of the lowest driver turn-over rates in Canada?  A team environment, short-haul regular routes and great benefits. Come work with us: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rpMA1riOzPI 

 

Recognized leader in the industry:

Canada Cartage has been recognized on the Forbes list of Canada’s Best Employers 2022. This is the sixth straight year that Canada Cartage has been included on this list. https://www.forbes.com/companies/canada-cartage/?list=canada-best-employers&sh=7841454553d8

The Canada’s Best Employers 2022 title, along with our 6th year of being recognized by Trucking HR as one of Canada’s “Top Fleet Employers” serves to reinforce Canada Cartage’s reputation as an employer of high quality.

Celebrating 100 years: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b3S-CtHQhVY 

 

Our Values

Integrity: We conduct our business with honour, honest and ethics with our people, the environment and legal matters. We believe I being transparent and trustworthy, respecting the traditional “handshake” value system and earning our way in.

Humanity: We are a family minded organization, caring for people and treating them with dignity, decency and respect, be it employees, customers, suppliers or our partners. Open door policy and dealings is our way.

Accountability: Accountability and accessibility to our staff, customers and our customers’ customers is of utmost importance to us. We enable a high level of two way communication, providing access to people who wil deal with issues ad have the willingness to resolve things.  We will be relied on and held accountable for our results and our long term commitments.

Collaboration: We understand that results are the product of a team effort. As part of our process, we ensure collaboration with all our staff at all levels in all roles across departmental lines. With our customers, we use a collaborative style approach, sharing ownership to ensure a successful operation.

Dedication: Our organization is employee and customer-driven. We encourage an environment of conscientious effort and earnestness, hiring problem solvers who are responsive and have a "can-do" attitude to get the job done.

Leadership: Personal leadership to us means being competent, taking ownership, demonstrating initiative, and having a voice. Corporate leadership to us means being leaders in the market, continuous improvement and innovation, and empowering those around you. https://jobs.jobvite.com/canadacartage

Come work with an industry leader!

 

We would like to thank all those expressing an interest in this position; however only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Committed to employment equity, Canada Cartage Systems LP encourages applications from Aboriginal people, members of visible minority groups, and women.

title: Application Analyst - WMS Project Management
description:
Now Hiring

APPLICATIONS ANALYST 

Project Management / Warehouse Management Systems

 

At Canada Cartage we work with intelligent and focused leaders who are driven to create an outstanding customer experience in partnership with Canadian leading brands. Canada Cartage is deep rooted in family values with an entrepreneurial culture where ideas are welcomed, growth is fostered and high performance is championed. A recognized thought leader and founded in 1914, Canada Cartage dominates the industry by delivering innovative fleet solutions.

We are currently looking to add Full-time permanent and Experienced Applications Analyst to our IT team. Someone who is equally passionate about serving the community and achieving operational success alongside our dedicated and loyal employees.

Located at 6767 Davand Drive, Mississauga and reporting to the Manager, IT, the Applications Analystwill play a key role in supporting Canada Cartage’s applications and technology. The portfolio encompasses the Warehouse Management System, customer web portal, shipping platforms, picking technology, printing solutions and ancillary systems. The applications are a mix of 3rd party systems with some customizations and internally built applications.

The individual will administer the portfolio of warehouse applications and support day-to-day issues in a timely manner. This is a key role in ensuring the ongoing smooth operation of the business and becomes the natural go-to person for both resources within the technical team and the business community. They will act as a Subject Matter Expert for internal initiatives relating to these applications and participate in projects involving the warehouse.

 

Responsibilities:

•Utilize our Ticketing System to Log, prioritize, troubleshoot, route and monitor all support incidents or questions relating to the applications supported. Adhere to our SLA on issue/resolution turnaround.

•        Assist other internal teams such as the Service Desk, Infrastructure Team or EDI Team with troubleshooting and technical support of related issues.

•        Perform root cause analysis to determine the cause of recurring issues and either fix or provide recommendations toward solutions.

•       Manage the upkeep of the application. Work with the Infrastructure, IT Security, DBAs and vendors to ensure that the applications and environments are updated routinely and functioning at an acceptable performance level.

 

•        Continually drive improvements within the support processes by identifying opportunities for automation or simplifying processes.

  • Coordination of IT deliverables for small to medium sized projects
    • Define scope, deliverables, success criteria and work breakdown structure for projects with management and stakeholders.
    • Elicit and document requirements for system and process changes through interviews, discussions and review of systems or documentation.
    • Use analytical skills and knowledge of systems and processes to critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources (as sampled above), reconcile conflicts, identify gaps, perform root cause analysis, suggest improvements and arrive at value driven solutions.
    • Proactively develop, direct and monitor the progress on a project by managing the plan, tasks and resources.
    • Manage changes to scope associated with the project in a timely and suitable manner. Group changes into releases and manage expectations of stakeholders.

•        Be a subject matter expert for the warehouse applications. Progressively understand the current functionality, keep up with future enhancements on the product roadmap, and assess capabilities in competing applications within the same domain.

•        Review incoming IT Work Requests to understand the need, translate the business needs into technical requirements, and provide feedback into the project’s Solution/Design phases.

•        Configure the applications based on the project’s design

•        Lead and participate in testing activities within the supported applications by preparing test plans and test cases, managing or executing the tests, capturing results and ensuring defects are triaged and resolved.

•        Support process mapping and SOP building for business processes undertaken using the application set.

•        Prepare training documentation/SOPs and train both users and other trainers on system use.

•        Mentor L1 staff or Super Users within the Business departments on activities they support in the systems.

  • Relationships & Communication

•        Use effective communication and listening skills with internal customers, external customers, vendors, and team members within the IT department while troubleshooting system issues.

  • Be flexible and astute in tailoring communication to different audiences. Example: Technical/vendor vs every day users and customers
  • Build and maintain strong relationships with key day-to-day users of the system such that you can reinforce proper use of the system and become a change agent during project rollouts.
  • Form relationships with the leadership of CCLS as appropriate to promote further understanding and appreciation of the systems in place.
  • Manage the relationship with the Application vendors. This will involve routine touch-points to ensure open issues are being addressed promptly and escalated for further attention as required.

 

 Core Competencies and Qualification:

•Ability to travel when required on a per project basic to CCS facilities within Canada and provide Warehouse on-site support and training when required

•Sound Analytical skills developed over 5+ years working in the capacity of an Application Support Analyst, Business Analyst or related roles.Experience working within the Supply Chain along with a good understanding of the business lifecycle managed within the Applications supporting it.

  • Proficient within Körber Enterprise 3PL System (Accellos 3PL) or other Warehouse Management Systems integrated with picking and shipping technologies.
  • Excellent communication skills (written, verbal, listening and presentation).
  • Keen self-starter who is interested to learn new technologies and enjoys leading change.
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision and with a cross-functional team to achieve organizations goals.
  • Ability to support multiple initiatives concurrently, balancing support and projects, and recognizes the importance of prioritization.
  • Understanding of the role of Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) and integrations within Warehousing.
  • Technically competent with MS Office suite of products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio and Project).
  • Completion of a post-secondary degree in an analytical specialization (Engineering, Sciences or Business with IT concentration preferred) or equivalent practical experience.
  • Successfully pass a background check
  • Weekend and afterhours support is required based on production issues and project timelines

Nice-to-have’s

  • Lean Six Sigma or process improvement training
  • Logistics industry certifications
  • Experience using Jira, ManageEngine or other work management tools
  • IT industry certifications
  • Competence using SQL to query databases
  • Experience with release management and scrums
  • Experience working with Business Intelligence tools such as PowerBI

 

Why work for Canada Cartage?

Our Team

We are a family-oriented company with competitive benefits, including extended health and dental, RRSP and Company-Matching pension plans; discounted hotels, car rentals, entertainment, gym memberships, phone plans, electronics, to name a few of the perks; a cohesive team and a positive, hard-working atmosphere. We have fun events throughout the year, like truck rodeos, summer barbeques and driver-appreciation week that regularly bring us together. It’s important to give back to the communities in which we operate, so we volunteer with and donate to local charities

We also have Company wide recognition initiatives designed to recognize drivers and staff when they demonstrate outstanding customer service, teamwork and our core values.

Why do we have one of the lowest driver turn-over rates in Canada?  A team environment, short-haul regular routes and great benefits.

Recognized leader in the industry:

Canada Cartage has been recognized on the Forbes list of Canada’s Best Employers 2022. This is the sixth straight year that Canada Cartage has been included on this list. https://www.forbes.com/companies/canada-cartage/?list=canada-best-employers&sh=7841454553d8

The Canada’s Best Employers 2022 title, along with our 6th year of being recognized by Trucking HR as one of Canada’s “Top Fleet Employers” serves to reinforce Canada Cartage’s reputation as an employer of high quality.

 

Our Values

Integrity: We conduct our business with honour, honest and ethics with our people, the environment and legal matters. We believe I being transparent and trustworthy, respecting the traditional “handshake” value system and earning our way in.

Humanity: We are a family minded organization, caring for people and treating them with dignity, decency and respect, be it employees, customers, suppliers or our partners. Open door policy and dealings is our way.

Accountability: Accountability and accessibility to our staff, customers and our customers’ customers is of utmost importance to us. We enable a high level of two way communication, providing access to people who wil deal with issues ad have the willingness to resolve things.  We will be relied on and held accountable for our results and our long term commitments.

Collaboration: We understand that results are the product of a team effort. As part of our process, we ensure collaboration with all our staff at all levels in all roles across departmental lines. With our customers, we use a collaborative style approach, sharing ownership to ensure a successful operation.

Dedication: Our organization is employee and customer-driven. We encourage an environment of conscientious effort and earnestness, hiring problem solvers who are responsive and have a "can-do" attitude to get the job done.

Leadership: Personal leadership to us means being competent, taking ownership, demonstrating initiative, and having a voice. Corporate leadership to us means being leaders in the market, continuous improvement and innovation, and empowering those around you.https://jobs.jobvite.com/canadacartage

Come work with an industry leader!

 

We would like to thank all those expressing an interest in this position; however only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Committed to employment equity, Canada Cartage Systems LP encourages applications from Aboriginal people, members of visible minority groups, and women.

title: Service Technician
description:
Service Technician

Bolton, ON, Canada Req #4397

Tuesday, March 15, 2022

$2500 Sign-On Bonus!

Service Center Technician - Bolton

We are Morgan Truck Body, LLC - the largest manufacturer of medium duty freight and refrigerated van and truck bodies in North America. With a total of fourteen manufacturing and six service facilities strategically located across the U.S. and Canada, Morgan is able to provide the quality, service, and prompt delivery our customers expect.

We offer competitive wages and progressive benefits including health, dental, vision, life insurance, disability plans, group pension, paid time off, tuition reimbursement and more. We pride ourselves in team member development, performance, recognition, and a culture of diversity and respect. As a subsidiary of J.B. Poindexter, a privately held diversified manufacturing company we offer a vast variety of career opportunities.

We have a great opportunity in our Bolton service facility - Service Center Technician to work on truck body and trailer repairs.

You will be responsible for:

  • Performing standard service repairs to the truck bodies and trailers of our customers with minimal supervision
  • Performing electrical wiring tasks, some complex in nature on the vehicles
  • Using power and non-power tools safely in completing repairs
  • Interpreting and applying work orders and measurements to tasks at hand
  • Keeping safety, quality and quoted times "top of mind" always
You will need:

Minimum Qualifications
  • High School Diploma or equivalent GED
  • Valid driver's license
  • Ability to lift up to 35 lbs.
  • A thorough knowledge of workplace safety.
  • Good decision-making skills.
Preferred Qualifications
  • Welding certified
  • Automotive service collision experience a plus
  • Prior experience with hydraulic systems
  • Prior experience in truck body repairs
Physical Requirements:

This job operates in a manufacturing plant environment. While performing the duties of this job, the team member is regularly required to talk or hear. The team member frequently is required to stand (sometimes for extended periods); walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms and lift up to 35 pounds. The team member may, at times, sit, bend, stoop, squat, reach overhead, or crawl (may be in confined spaces). The team member is expected to perform repetitive tasks using their hands and have the ability to climb ladders and/or work in high places.

J.B. Poindexter & Co., Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, provincial, or municipal laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

#LI-TK1
#PIQ

Other details

  • Job Family Morgan Truck Body
  • Job Function Service
  • Pay Type Hourly
  • Employment Indicator Hourly

title: Purchasing Manager Indirect - Mexico
description:
Job Number: 43527 
Group: Magna Corporate  
Division: Magna Servicios de Mexico 
Job Type: Permanent/Regular 
Location: Ramos 

 

Group Description 

At Magna, we create technology that disrupts the industry and solves big problems for consumers, our customers, and the world around us. We’re the only mobility technology company and supplier with complete expertise across the entire vehicle.

We are committed to quality and continuous improvement because our products impact millions of people every day. But we’re more than what we make. We are a group of entrepreneurial-minded people whose collective expertise gives us a competitive advantage. World Class Manufacturing is a journey and it’s our talented people who lead us on this journey.

 

Role Summary

Responsible for managing and supporting the company’s procurement requirements and developing and/or assisting in developing regional supply base strategies and solutions to continuously improve cost levels, stable sources of supply, high quality of supply categories, and other governing factors. Supports supplier selection, development, and overall supplier management to deliver superior financial returns and competitive advantage to the business.  Assist in developing and Implementing company/regulatory policies and procedures with suppliers to improve quality, delivery, cost, productivity, and support.  Performs other duties as necessary in support of business objectives.

Key Responsibilities

1.- Responsible for developing and/or assisting in developing indirect regional strategies in alignment with indirect purchasing category strategies.

2.- Leads and coordinates all aspects of indirect purchasing and supplier development activities including, but not limited to supplier evaluation, requests for quotation, cost breakdown analysis, negotiations, supplier cost audits, contract management, and supplier selection to meet the strategies, policies, standards, and audit requirements of Magna International.

3.- Coordinates all supplier issues with applicable functional organizations.

4.- Develops cost and scenario analysis, cost breakdowns, and benchmarks, including evaluation of cost drivers to support negotiation strategies to reach the best cost and optimal terms, while at the same time assessing and mitigating risks.

5.- Manages and negotiates supply agreements in support of overall supply chain goals and objectives.

6.- Keeps abreast of indirect supply base development, market conditions, industry trends, and technologies in the region for the different indirect categories; research indirect categories and products in the region to support local requirements; able to identify potential risks, devise solutions and construct plans to mitigate any negative impacts.

7.- Establishes and manages key indirect supplier performance goals and objectives; communicates periodic results to plan and assist in the supplier development process to ensure success internally and externally; develops a keen awareness of industry performance benchmarks for indirect products and categories.

8.- Develop alignment and work with local purchasing teams to collaborate on regional strategies and processes.

9.- Provides formal and informal status on strategies and performance feedback to Team Members.

10.- Responsible for supplier recommendations for indirect categories and working with the divisional purchasing teams to implement these sourcing recommendations.

11.- Responsible for developing and managing cost reduction projects for indirect categories in the region.

Key Qualifications/Requirements

a.- Post-Secondary Degree in Business Administration/Engineering or similar – Required.

b.- Master’s degree in business or engineering – Desired.

c.- Business Finance Training – Desired.

d.- Minimum five (5) years of leadership experience in the automotive or related manufacturing industry.

e.- Minimum five (5) to ten (10) years of purchasing experience for a large multi-plant manufacturing enterprise.

f.- Knowledge and technical understanding of automotive manufacturing processes and supply chain management.

g.- Strong understanding of contract language.

h.- Strong negotiations, persuasive and effective decision-making skills.

i.- Experience procuring utilities, equipment, MRO, and other indirect categories.

j.- Demonstrates ability to work effectively with different teams in different environments.

k.- Fluent in English & Spanish.

l.- Indirect Supply base leverage and cost savings.

m.- Indirect Supply base development in alignment with indirect strategies.

n.- Unwavering resolve to set high ethical standards in all aspects of the business.

o.- Compliance with all aspects of business processes and controls.

p.- Outstanding results when working together with divisional purchasing and divisional teams.

Additional Information

1.- Works on extremely complex problems where analysis of situations or data requires an evaluation of intangible variables.

2.- Exercises independent judgment in developing methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. Ability to uphold confidentiality.

3.- Acts independently to determine methods and procedures on new assignments; highly motivated self-starter who is able to work in a fast-paced and multifaceted environment.

4.- Prepares reports, cost analysis, charts, graphs, and other statistical information.

5.- Interprets and complies with Company policies, procedures, and regulations.

6.- High proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.

7.- Strong interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills.

8.- Will be located in a Magna division.

9.- Able to travel.

Competencies

Key Qualifications/Requirements
Act Decisively
Be Agile and Adapt
Prioritize Achievement
Think Strategically

Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.

At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law.
