title: Intermediate Developer
description:
Now Hiring

INTERMEDIATE DEVELOPER

 

At Canada Cartage we work with intelligent and focused leaders who are driven to create an outstanding customer experience in partnership with Canadian leading brands. Canada Cartage is deep rooted in family values with an entrepreneurial culture where ideas are welcomed, growth is fostered and high performance is championed. A recognized thought leader and founded in 1914, Canada Cartage dominates the industry by delivering innovative fleet solutions.

We are currently looking to add a full-time, permanent, Intermediate Developer to our team. Someone who is equally passionate about serving the community and achieving operational success alongside our dedicated and loyal employees.

Located at6767 Davand Drive, Mississauga, ON and reporting to the Director of Development and Integration, the Intermediate Developer is a customer service oriented individual who is able to work on multiple assignments in a fast pace professional environment. The Intermediate Developer is responsible for designing, building, documenting, and testing system components to support the Transport and Logistics business at Canada Cartage.

 

Responsibilities:

•Design and code Web and mobile applications, integration interfaces, dashboards and reports.

•Write technical specifications, use-case diagrams, and deployment documents.

•Collaborate with IT team members and Business representatives to understand and validate business requirements.

•Manage application lifecycle to ensure smooth deployment and post-production modifications.

•Assist IT team members and Business representatives on user testing.

•Provide day-to-day support to existing applications, integration interfaces, and reports for internal and external business customers.

 

 Core Competencies and Qualification:

•Expert analytical and problem solving skills.

•Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

•Ability to plan things effectively to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.

•Experience and good understanding of software development lifecycle methodologies.

•Strong believer in documentation and standardization.

•Ability to learn quickly and work independently.

•Team player with forward-thinking and seeing the larger picture.

•5+ years of development experience in Microsoft .NET using C#, Web Services, MVC.

•5+ years of development experience in Microsoft SQL Server, including complex stored procedures, functions, and views.

•3+ years of experience in Web API development.

•5+ years of experience in using Microsoft Visual Studio and Team Foundation Server.

•Successfully pass a background check

 Nice to have:

•Knowledge and experience in Microsoft integration technologies, including BizTalk, SSIS, and Logic Apps.

•Knowledge and experience in Microsoft Power BI and SSRS.

•Knowledge and experience in transportation industry.

•Knowledge and experience in warehouse and logistics industry.

•Project management experience.

 

Why work for Canada Cartage?

Our Team

We are a family-oriented company with competitive benefits, including extended health and dental, RRSP and Company-Matching pension plans; discounted hotels, car rentals, entertainment, gym memberships, phone plans, electronics, to name a few of the perks; a cohesive team and a positive, hard-working atmosphere. We have fun events throughout the year, like truck rodeos, summer barbeques and driver-appreciation week that regularly bring us together. It’s important to give back to the communities in which we operate, so we volunteer with and donate to local charities

We also have Company wide recognition initiatives designed to recognize drivers and staff when they demonstrate outstanding customer service, teamwork and our core values.

Why do we have one of the lowest driver turn-over rates in Canada?  A team environment, short-haul regular routes and great benefits. Come work with us: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rpMA1riOzPI 

 

Recognized leader in the industry:

Canada Cartage has been recognized on the Forbes list of Canada’s Best Employers 2022. This is the sixth straight year that Canada Cartage has been included on this list. https://www.forbes.com/companies/canada-cartage/?list=canada-best-employers&sh=7841454553d8

The Canada’s Best Employers 2022 title, along with our 6th year of being recognized by Trucking HR as one of Canada’s “Top Fleet Employers” serves to reinforce Canada Cartage’s reputation as an employer of high quality.

Celebrating 100 years: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b3S-CtHQhVY 

Our Values

Integrity: We conduct our business with honour, honest and ethics with our people, the environment and legal matters. We believe I being transparent and trustworthy, respecting the traditional “handshake” value system and earning our way in.

Humanity: We are a family minded organization, caring for people and treating them with dignity, decency and respect, be it employees, customers, suppliers or our partners. Open door policy and dealings is our way.

Accountability: Accountability and accessibility to our staff, customers and our customers’ customers is of utmost importance to us. We enable a high level of two way communication, providing access to people who wil deal with issues ad have the willingness to resolve things.  We will be relied on and held accountable for our results and our long term commitments.

Collaboration: We understand that results are the product of a team effort. As part of our process, we ensure collaboration with all our staff at all levels in all roles across departmental lines. With our customers, we use a collaborative style approach, sharing ownership to ensure a successful operation.

Dedication: Our organization is employee and customer-driven. We encourage an environment of conscientious effort and earnestness, hiring problem solvers who are responsive and have a "can-do" attitude to get the job done.

Leadership: Personal leadership to us means being competent, taking ownership, demonstrating initiative, and having a voice. Corporate leadership to us means being leaders in the market, continuous improvement and innovation, and empowering those around you.https://jobs.jobvite.com/canadacartage

Come work with an industry leader!

 

We would like to thank all those expressing an interest in this position; however only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Committed to employment equity, Canada Cartage Systems LP encourages applications from Aboriginal people, members of visible minority groups, and women.

title: Quality Control Representative – On site
description:
Your Employer

Englobe distinguishes itself due to its expertise in applied sciences, particularly in the fields of geotechnical, environmental and materials engineering, as well as soil and biomass treatment. With more than 2,700 employees and a broad Canadian and European presence, Englobe is a guarantee of quality for its customers.

 

You like

  • Working outdoors,
  • Finding solutions to concrete technical challenges,
  • Share your knowledge with your colleagues.

We offer

  • Full range of benefits (group insurance with shared costs upon hiring, group RRSP after 3 months, cumulative time bank available),
  • Annual reimbursement of the costs of sports activities,
  • Fully remunerated in-company training,
  • An opportunity for skills development,
  • Reimbursement of travel expenses,
  • A telemedicine programme,
  • An unparalleled work atmosphere!

Your Contribution

You will have the opportunity to work on site for several of our clients, such as Hydro-Québec, the Ministère des transports du Québec and various municipalities. Englobe also participates in the implementation of many major projects, such as the construction of engineering structures and government buildings.

Your mandate will be to control the quality of the materials used on various construction sites. Your functions will mainly be:

Responsibilities

  • Monitor the work and record the quantities of materials received,
  • Perform technical tasks (testing and monitoring) as directed by project managers,
  • Check the quality and implementation of materials (floor, concrete, asphalt),
  • Take samples at the site and/or at source, according to the planned frequency,
  • Collaborate with project managers for the day-to-day management of construction sites),
  • Write memos in the event of non-conformity and follow up on corrective actions,
  • Complete reports for each of the assigned projects,
  • Travel to the different sites according to the established current work plan.

Your Profile

  • Relevant training or experience in Civil Engineering or Geology (asset)
  • ASP Construction and WHMIS Card 2015 (asset);
  • ACI certification (asset),
  • Valid driver's licence,
  • Have access to a car for travel as part of the work (the technician will have to transport equipment to carry out the various tests on site).

Positions are available in: Montreal, Baie-Comeau, Chicoutimi, Drummondville, Gatineau, Îles de la Madeleine, La Romaine, Laval, Rimouski, Rouyn-Noranda, Quebec, Sept-Îles, Sherbrooke St-Georges, Shawinigan or Varennes.

title: Canadian Field Technical Representative
description:
The purpose of the Technical Representative's role is to work with sales representatives to grow spray foam product sales by providing installation training and job support services. The Technical Representative will be responsible for demonstrating new products, improving JM owner relationships while solving product issues, conducting training seminars and maintaining and building relationships with Johns Manville contractor field personnel.

Applicants can expect to make between $81,000 to $110,000 upon hire. Pay within this range will vary based upon relevant experience, skills, and education among other factors. In addition, this position is eligible for a target incentive bonus under our variable incentive plan as well as a company truck.

This position needs to be based near a major airport in Canada.

Your Day-to-Day:

* Responsible for improving JM owner relationships by sharing best practices to improve installers' efficiencies (safety, tools, accessories, job site staging, machine set-up, application and clean-up), and solving product compliant issues.

* Staying current on all Canadian provincial building insulation regulations, and providing guidance to owners, specifiers, and contractors.

* Monitors and ensures compliance with the required Field Quality Assurance Program.

* Provides annual customer training as required by S705.1.

* Conduct training demos for owners, specifiers, and contractors.

* Maintain and build relationships with Johns Manville contractor field personnel, account managers and sales representatives.

* Demonstrate new products to owners, specifiers, and contractors.

* Capture installers requirements to ensure products are designed cost effectively to meet their preferences.

* Analyze and make recommendations to optimize spray equipment performance.

* Enter information into iPad after site visit and maintain tools.

What You Bring to the Team:

* 2 years spray foam and/or spray insulation (i.e., fiber glass, cellulose, etc.) experience with a 2-year technical degree, or

* 3-5 years spray foam and/or spray insulation (i.e., fiber glass, cellulose, etc.) experience with a high school diploma or GED

* Mechanical aptitude preferred

* Familiarity with Canadian spray foam regulations.

* Proven ability to build rapport and relationships from the building owner to the installer

* Interest in working in a hands-on environment

* Demonstrated customer/service orientation

* Experience using MS Word, Outlook, Excel

* Ability to work with minimal supervision

* Ability to travel 70% of the time

* Valid driver's license and good driving record

Benefits

Johns Manville (JM) offers a wide range of benefits to employees. Some are subsidized by the company and others are fully employee-paid. Health benefits include a choice of comprehensive medical plans, a dental plan, vision plan, wellness program and critical illness insurance. JM sponsors a 401(k) plan which includes a sizeable company match. JM offers paid vacation and provides paid sick and parental leave for eligible employees.

Additionally, Johns Manville provides basic life Insurance, short-term and long-term disability coverage, an employee assistance program, and business travel accident coverage. Supplemental life insurance and accidental death and dismemberment insurance are available as well. The company also offers a variety of tax saving accounts, health spending account, traditional flexible spending account, and a dependent care spending account. JM also offers a tuition reimbursement program for undergraduate and certain graduate programs.

Why Johns Manville

Johns Manville is a proud member of the Berkshire Hathaway family of companies, serving customers in more than 80 countries, supplying innovative products to the construction, aerospace, automotive, filtration and energy industries. With a more than 160-year legacy, we understand that our story continues to grow only with the right people saying, thinking, and doing the right things. Make your story our story.

Johns Manville believes diversity and inclusion in our workplace is critical for the long-term success of our company. We are committed to retaining, developing, and attracting a diverse workforce that fosters an inclusive work environment in which all employees are treated with dignity and respect. This is the right thing to do for our employees, our company, and our communities.

Learn more at www.jm.com/careers and on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter.

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

title: Cash Apps Specialist
description:
Now Hiring

CASH APPLICATION SPECIALIST

 

At Canada Cartage we work with intelligent and focused leaders who are driven to create an outstanding customer experience in partnership with Canadian leading brands. Canada Cartage is deep rooted in family values with an entrepreneurial culture where ideas are welcomed, growth is fostered and high performance is championed. A recognized thought leader and founded in 1914, Canada Cartage dominates the industry by delivering innovative fleet solutions.

We are currently looking to add a Full-time permanent Cash Applications Specialist, to our team. Someone who is equally passionate about serving the community and achieving operational success alongside our dedicated and loyal employees.

Located at 6767 Davand Drive, Mississauga and reporting to the Director of Credit and Collections, the Cash Apps Specialist is a vital part of our account receivable team.  You enjoy working with number and are organized and analytical. Working in a fast paced environment, you will review remittances from customers and match the payments to the appropriate invoices to ensure payment has been received.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Daily preparation and application of incoming payments for a specific group of accounts
  • Gather and print all EFT / Wire payment notifications
  • When required, prepare Excel spreadsheets to post EFT/Wire payments
  • Verify, apply and post EFT / Wire Payments with a high level of accuracy
  • Prepare daily bank deposit, as needed
  • Verify, apply and post non-AR cheques
  • Verify, apply and post Visa and MasterCard payments
  • Update daily EFT and cheque receipt spreadsheet
  • Scan and file all recorded documents for future reference
  • Coordinate with Collection Specialists and/or Manager for short/overpaid invoices and missing EFT backup
  • Verify and post Daily Sales batch integration in AR System
  • Verify, apply and post all AR adjustments / offsets as requested
  • Provide support to cover vacation and absences within the team, as needed
  • Other duties as assigned by National Director of Credit & Collections

 •insert

 

 Core Competencies and Qualification:

  • Advanced Excel skills mandatory - Vlookup and Pivot Tables
  • Experience and ability to work within a high volume environment
  • 2-3 years of Cash Application experience in an AR environment preferred
  • Excellent data entry skills – accuracy and speed
  • Very good communication skills - verbal and written
  • Detail oriented
  • Strong Team Player
  • Professional, positive attitude with a focus on Customer Service
  • Great Plains experience would be an asset


 

 Why work for Canada Cartage?

Our Team

We are a family-oriented company with competitive benefits, including extended health and dental, RRSP and Company-Matching pension plans; discounted hotels, car rentals, entertainment, gym memberships, phone plans, electronics, to name a few of the perks; a cohesive team and a positive, hard-working atmosphere. We have fun events throughout the year, like truck rodeos, summer barbeques and driver-appreciation week that regularly bring us together. It’s important to give back to the communities in which we operate, so we volunteer with and donate to local charities

We also have Company wide recognition initiatives designed to recognize drivers and staff when they demonstrate outstanding customer service, teamwork and our core values.

Why do we have one of the lowest driver turn-over rates in Canada?  A team environment, short-haul regular routes and great benefits.

Recognized leader in the industry:

Canada Cartage has been recognized on the Forbes list of Canada’s Best Employers 2022. This is the sixth straight year that Canada Cartage has been included on this list. https://www.forbes.com/companies/canada-cartage/?list=canada-best-employers&sh=7841454553d8

The Canada’s Best Employers 2022 title, along with our 6th year of being recognized by Trucking HR as one of Canada’s “Top Fleet Employers” serves to reinforce Canada Cartage’s reputation as an employer of high quality.

Our Values

Integrity: We conduct our business with honour, honest and ethics with our people, the environment and legal matters. We believe I being transparent and trustworthy, respecting the traditional “handshake” value system and earning our way in.

Humanity: We are a family minded organization, caring for people and treating them with dignity, decency and respect, be it employees, customers, suppliers or our partners. Open door policy and dealings is our way.

Accountability: Accountability and accessibility to our staff, customers and our customers’ customers is of utmost importance to us. We enable a high level of two way communication, providing access to people who wil deal with issues ad have the willingness to resolve things.  We will be relied on and held accountable for our results and our long term commitments.

Collaboration: We understand that results are the product of a team effort. As part of our process, we ensure collaboration with all our staff at all levels in all roles across departmental lines. With our customers, we use a collaborative style approach, sharing ownership to ensure a successful operation.

Dedication: Our organization is employee and customer-driven. We encourage an environment of conscientious effort and earnestness, hiring problem solvers who are responsive and have a "can-do" attitude to get the job done.

Leadership: Personal leadership to us means being competent, taking ownership, demonstrating initiative, and having a voice. Corporate leadership to us means being leaders in the market, continuous improvement and innovation, and empowering those around you.https://jobs.jobvite.com/canadacartage

 

Come work with an industry leader!

 

We would like to thank all those expressing an interest in this position; however only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Committed to employment equity, Canada Cartage Systems LP encourages applications from Aboriginal people, members of visible minority groups, and women.

title: Motorcycle/Small Engine Journeyman Technician, Fruitvale, BC, (AGHA)
description:
Motorcycle/Small Engine Journeyman Technician, Fruitvale, BC, (AGHA)
Location: Fruitvale, British Columbia
Might be a good fit if you are:
  • Journeyman Small Engine Technician
  • Automotive Technician
  • Small Engine Technician
  • Motorcycle Technician (Journeyman or Apprentice or Min 3-5 years experience)
Requirements:
  • MUST, be Journeyman Small Engine Technician, OR
  • MUST, be Journeyman Motorcycle Technician, OR
  • WILL CONSIDER, an experienced Small Engine Technician with 3-5 years of recent experience
  • WILL CONSIDER, Apprentice Technicians (small engine or motorcycle)
  • MUST, have experience working on: ATV, Generators, Lawn Mowers, Pumps, Snowblowers, Motorcycles
  • MUST, be willing to relocate to Fruitvale, B.C.
  • MUST, have your own tools
  • DEMONSTRATE, Strong Customer Service Skills
  • DEMONSTRATE, abilities to keep your work space organized and presentable
  • DEMONSTRATE, strong integrity
  • REQUIRE, valid drivers’ license
  • No criminal record
Pay:
  • Earnings, Negotiable
  • Relocation Loan (amount is negotiable)
  • Two weeks vacation after the first year (negotiable)
  • Benefits after 90 Days (negotiable)
ADDITIONAL INFO:
When you apply for this position you give the Recruiting Room permission to share your information with other team members and our network of employers.You further acknowledge that the Recruiting Room is a free service to all candidates and as such, furtheragree to indemnify and hold harmless Recruiting Room from any allegations, claims, actions, suits, demands, damages, liabilities, obligations, losses, settlements, judgments, costs and expenses (including without limitation attorneys’ fees and costs) that result from the sharing of this data.
You further acknowledge, and give consent, for the Recruiting Room to check your previous employers (to make a hiring decision), if you fail to provide references before the point of offer.We only ask questions that are “reasonably required,” for our employers to assess the applicant’s fitness for the job.We DO NOT contact current employers.
You further acknowledge, by applying for this position, you allow the Recruiting Room, and its agents, to contact you via SMS Messaging (texting), Facebook, Instagram or any other forms of social networking.

title: Materials Technician/Technologist
description:
Your Employer:

Dare to join Englobe

 

Englobe, and itâ€™s more than 2,600 people, concerned about the environment daily, engaged in sustainable engineering, process soils and biomass, and manage the quality and integrity of assets.

 

At Englobe, we adopt innovative, human-centred management. We welcome new ideas and are open to discussion. We are determined to succeed in partnership with our teams.

 

We offer  

 

  • A full range of benefits (group insurance with shared costs upon hiring, group RRSP);
  • A telemedicine virtual healthcare service;
  • An annual reimbursement of sports expenses;
  • Opportunities for skills development;
  • Flexible hours and ability to compress working hours;
  • Internal policy to encourage teleworking.

 

Dare to join Englobe and lead a career marked by growth and accomplishments.

 

Englobe Corp. is on an exciting growth path in Atlantic Canada and we are currently looking for a Materials Technician/Technologist to join our growing team! We have openings in our Moncton, NB office for individuals looking for a regular, seasonal role with full benefits.

Your Contribution:
  • Apply and promote  Englobeâ€™s  health and safety rules.
  • Receiving and properly recording all field samples for testing and/or holding.
  • Laboratory testing of soil, aggregate, asphalt and Portland cement concrete samples according to the relevant ASTM, AASHTO, CSA or other applicable test standard.
  • Field inspection and testing during placement of aggregates, hot mix asphalt and Portland cement concrete.   Note that extended stays at site operations throughout the Maritimes may be required based on project requirements.
  • Monitoring exploration programs for geotechnical studies.
  • Communicate results effectively with client and Englobe supervisor.
  • Maintain proper record of field test results for review and subsequent submissions
Your Profile:
  • Civil technology diploma from an accredited community college;
  • CADD and/or Civil 3D experience would be an asset;
  • Team-oriented and an excellent communicator;
  • Valid driver's license and submission of driverâ€™s abstract;
  • A reliable car is a requirement and reimbursement of mileage will be provided; and,
  • Willingness and ability to travel throughout the Maritime Provinces on an as-required basis.

title: Auto body technician
description:
We are currently seeking a Licensed Auto Body Technician to join our team. We are seeking an individual who is dependable, driven, efficient and strives to achieve above-average results. If this sounds like you, we encourage you to apply. Please provide your resume and list of any credentials you may have.

Requirements and responsibilities· 3rd year Apprentice or Journeyman· Valid drivers license· Previous experience in automotive shop· Be professional, punctual, efficient, and thorough.· Responsible for repairing vehicles for refinishing in accordance with industry requirements, using hand tools, power tools, frame, welding and painting equipment.· Work with the team by communicating with appropriate team members to make sure of the vehicle’s repair status and any additional work that need to be completed or reported as complete· Work with and support other repair technicians and staff if needed

Job Description· Prepare all vehicles and parts for painting, by using proper techniques, equipment and materials:· Make small mirror pulls and work with frame technician to ensure frame and unibody vehicles are restored to proper dimensions· Restore and/or maintain vehicle corrosion protection (undercoating)· Hand-sprays parts to cover unpainted areas or applies rust preventative· Repairs or replaces defective mechanical parts· Remove and replace sheet metal, glass and cosmetic parts as necessary· Straighten/repair damaged panels and parts as necessary· Bench vehicles and conduct pulls on vehicles as necessary.· Measure and document vehicle dimensions when required· Removes, upholstery, accessories, electrical and hydraulic window and seat operating equipment, and trims to gain access to vehicle and fenders • Files, grinds and sands repaired surfaces, using power tools and hand tools.· Aims headlights

Job Types: Full-time, PermanentBenefits: Dental care, Extended health careWage range of $25-$35 and will be dependent on experience. Immediate start for the right candidate. We thank you in advance for the interest in our shop. Please feel free to call our shop with any questions regarding this posting.

Notice

Synergistic International LLC is the franchisor of the Glass Doctor® franchised system. Each Glass Doctor® franchised location is independently-owned and operated by an independent franchisee performing services. As a service to its independent franchisees, Synergistic International LLC lists employment opportunities available throughout the franchised network so those employment opportunities may be conveniently found by interested parties at one central location for brand management purposes only. Synergistic International LLC is NOT the employer seeking help. The only employer is the independent franchisee who has listed its available positions on this website.

*Acknowledgement

I acknowledge that each independent Glass Doctor® franchisee hires and determines the terms and conditions of employment for its own employees. Any employment benefits, compensation and employment practices vary by location. Neither Synergistic International LLC (“Franchisor”) nor its affiliates have the power to: (1) hire, fire or modify the employment condition of franchisee’s employees; (2) supervise and control franchisee’s employee work schedule or conditions of employment; (3) determine the rate and method of payment; or (4) accept, review or maintain franchisee employment records. Synergistic International LLC is NOT the employer and/or joint employer for: (i) any of the job opportunities listed on this website; (ii) any of the independent franchisees; and, (iii) any of the employees of the independent franchisees.

title: Business Development Manager
description:
Business Development Manager 
Primary Location: CA-ON-Western Ontario-Hamilton  Other Locations: CA-ON-Western GTA-Burlington, CA-ON-Western GTA-Niagara
Employee Status: Regular  
 
Schedule: Full-time  
  
  
  • Do you have experience in business development?
  • Do you know how to build relationships of trust with your partners?
  • Are you autonomous, organized, and perseverant?
 As a Business Development Manager in this role, you will be creating strong business relationships with merchants primarily in the automotive and leisure market segments; while also supporting the RV and Marine industries. You will be working in the Ontario for the Consumer Financing Services sector with a team of 15 colleagues reporting to the Senior Manager.This position covers the St.Catherines- Hamilton-Burlington Corridor (and surrounding areas) in Ontario and based out of the Hamilton area.
  • You will develop and implement action plans and business development tactics based on your sector's established business development strategies
  • You will be involved in business development and will work towards ensuring client loyalty by providing efficient advising service
  • In addition, you will increase your sector's profitability by developing the current and potential clientele in your market.
More information about the role
  • Identify emerging business opportunities in the market and make recommendations regarding the appropriate action to take
  • Ability to execute a business plan and be nimble in adapting your plan to the changing reality in your territory.
  • Establish and maintain effective communication with merchants and various other parties involved in the sector's activities
  • Help define the business orientations for products and services under your responsibility
  • Work in partnership with various Bank sectors to develop new products or to create a tailored product mix to meet client needs.
  • Establish a preferred relationship with clients and ensure client satisfaction by providing personalized service.
  • Ensure the visibility of the Bank's products and services by taking part in various external activities and by acting as representative for various organizations or stakeholders.
  • Suggest new products, services and technology, and recommend changes to existing ones so to meet our clients' changing needs with a focus on client retention.
  • The candidate needs to be able to identify all risks inherent to the Personal and Commercial Banking sector’s activities
Want more information about the positions and the challenges? Contact the Hiring Manager Roberto Nardi. 
 
  • Completed Bachelor’s degree in a related field
  • A minimum of 5 years of relevant experience and demonstrated success in B2B business development
  • Experience in account management
  • Experience in sales and customer service
  • Experience in commercial banking, an asset
  • Experience in the Indirect Financing industry or leasing, an asset
  • Excellent knowledge of and ability to use MS Office tolls, particularly Excel and Word
  • Excellent knowledge of English (spoken and written), knowledge of another language, an asset

 

Your benefits: 

Upon hiring, you will be eligible for a wide range of benefits. In addition to competitive compensation, we offer attractive benefits for you and your family: 

  • Health and wellness program, including many benefits 

  • Flexible group insurance 

  • Defined benefit pension plan 

  • Employee Share Ownership Plan 

  • Employee and family assistance program 

  • Preferred banking services 

  • Volunteer program 

  • Telemedicine 

  • Virtual sleep clinic 

 

These are just a few of the many benefits we offer. We've rolled out a number of additional measures to ensure your health, safety and wellbeing during the pandemic.  

We're putting people first : 

We're a bank on a human scale that stands out for its courage, entrepreneurial culture, and passion for people.   Our mission is to have a positive impact on peoples' lives. 

Our core values of partnership, agility, and empowerment inspire us, and inclusivity is central to our commitments. We offer a barrier-free workplace that is accessible to all employees.  

We want our recruitment process to be fully accessible. If you require accommodations, feel free to let us know during your first conversations with us. 

We welcome all candidates! What can you bring to our team? 

 Ready to live your ambitions?

 

 
Particular conditions (external): The incumbent in this position has to be flexible to travel 90% of his/her time in their assigned region. A car and valid driver’s license are necessary for this position When not on the road, the incumbent in this position will be working from home. This is a home-office based role The role allows reimbursement of business travel expenses as per Bank Policy
Job field: Advisory Services, Commercial Banking
Job Posting: Apr 25, 2022
Unposting Date: May 10, 2022
Work Postal Code: l9h5b 
Job Number: ADV001YT

title: Apprentice Auto Technician
description:
Are you an organized, driven and motivated young technician? Do you like to learn a ton of new things at a very fast pace? Do you want to work within a team of A players? If you've answered yes, this opportunity may be right for you.


A day in the life of an Apprentice Automotive Technician Apprentice

Car-On Auto is the largest used car dealership in Eastern Ontario an we are looking to add a new team member to our service and reconditioning department. It is a great, fun environment with a team that supports each other and often works collaboratively. This is the place for a new challenge and the opportunity to learn and grow.

You will be road testing and diagnosing issues on every brand from Acura to Mercedes and from sub-compacts to 1 ton trucks. No two days will be the same and you will learn a ton of new stuff. In order for us to hire and retain top talent, we need A players that believe in quality work and doing it right the first time. If you show you can be a top player, promotions and increases will happen quickly as we are constantly growing.


Qualifications for Automotive Technician Apprentice


Valid drivers license

Ability to work effectively with computerized systems

Ability to work in a fast-paced environment

Own your own tools


Work Schedule

Our Service hours are Monday to Friday 7:30 to 5:00

title: Account Associate Tier 2-25302
description:
This person must present a personal professional image and be able to accomplish several tasks daily with tight deadlines. Candidates must possess proven multi-tasking abilities, be punctual and very personable; outgoing and customer service focused.
Skills:
• Strong computer skills
• Willingness to learn and be part of a team
• Ability to adapt and learn new procedures
• Communication - written & oral
• Customer service
• Organization and attention to detail
Daily tasks:
• File sorting and refilling in centralized filing areas
• Customer reporting with Excel and online tools
• File archiving and retrieval through Iron Mountain and File Trail
• File folder creation and labelling
• Annual purging/archiving of files
• Assisting customers with file reporting/retrieval over multiple databases
• Data entry
• Office supply management


POSITION CONCEPT:
This position works as part of the service delivery team that is aligned to one or more customers. He/she will have a focus on the following:
• Delivery of service that meets the Service Level Agreements and delights the customer
• Supporting the achievement of productivity improvements
• Contributing to service transformation and business growth

SCOPE: The work undertaken by the role holder is completed in line with the Service Level Agreements and Statements of Work relevant for the customer.
Overview of Tier Responsibilities: These positions will have primary or secondary responsibility in any of the services within their tier. They will be responsible for delivering high standards of quality service. A high level overview of the major responsibilities for each level is as follows: Tier 2 - Mail inserters, complex document finishing, basic digital print (black & white/colour), equipment care, client facing reception, records management, inventory management

ESSENTIAL DUTIES: The following describes the main job duties by work area for the XS Account Associate Tier 2 Profile. Duties for a specific role may include - but are not limited to - these duties. Specific roles may also include duties from other tiers as a portion of their duties.
GENERAL
• Ensure customer issues and escalations are resolved or further escalated as appropriate
• Conduct quality checks on own work to ensure accuracy and required output is to standards
• Adhere to all safety procedures
• Perform backfill duties for absent coworkers
• Perform other duties as assigned by Manager Office
• Prepare charge-back reporting for postage, courier, etc.
• Use of software to update or maintain mailing addresses.
• Provide mailing address clean-up (may include use of mail cleansing software)
Mail Insertion
• Set up and operate high level mail equipment such as: mail inserters, sorters and finishing equipment in an automated high speed / high volume environment
Forklift
• Use of specialized equipment for material handling (e.g. Forklift certified)
Front Counter
• Liaison with clients advising on available services and negotiation of turnaround times for service requests
• Printing and Finishing
• Perform basic digital print production
• Clean and maintain finishing equipment to ensure optimal use
• Perform colour calibration using densitometers and perform colour adjustments
• Record meter reads, process production forms and maintain records
Equipment Care
• Carry out regular preventative maintenance checks on client fleet of machines
• Order and replenish fleet consumables as required
• Carry out first level issue resolution utilizing basic product and/or technical skills, escalating in accordance with agreed procedures for next level maintenance and technical support on client fleet equipment
Records Management +B5Index, store, retrieve electronic documents in a mass storage system
• Convert digital files to formats such as PDF, TIFF, PostScript, XML, etc. for import into document repository and management systems
• Manage document storage system to meet client`s archiving requirements
• Catalogue electronic documents to media such as CDROM, disk or tap and distribute as required
Inventory Management
• Order and replenish consumables, forms inventory and other supplies items as required
Reception
• 1st point of contact for clients customers
• Professionally greet and direct visitors adhering to security / badge requirements
Administration
• Complete and maintain all logs and reports including month-end reports
• Input Meridian (billing system) requisitions
• Order and replenish consumables, forms inventory and other supplies items as required.
• Organize business travel (flights, hotels, rental cars) for  customers
Continuous Improvement
• Support site continuous improvement programs including 5S, a site efficiency methodology

REQUIRED SKILLS:
• Proven ability to work under pressure handling multiple tasks to ensure timely completion of all activities
• Able to listen and communicate effectively
• Able to read, write and follow basic English instructions
• Ability to lift and move up to 50 pounds
• Basic math skills (add, multiply, divide)
• Basic computer skills (keyboard, mouse functions)
• Excellent communication and Customer service skills
• Possess a valid driver’s license (as required)
• Reliable, dependable transportation (as required)
• Effective organizational skills
• Mechanical trouble-shooting and repair skills
• vocational or technical certificate in computer / network skills

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:
• High School Diploma or equivalent certification
• Health and safety certification (WHMIS)
• Experience in customer facing role / customer service role (1-2 years’ experience)

title: Warehouse clerk
description:
Permanent position of Warehouse clerk

You deserve job stability. You deserve a permanent position with fixed hours and all your weekends off. No vague contracts. We'll hire you as a warehouse worker and keep you forever, if that's your wish. In addition, there are great opportunities to grow within the company.

In Longueuil, St-Hubert sector, a new logistics warehouse is looking for warehouse workers.

Full time, day or evening.

No car? We offer a free shuttle from the Longueuil metro station. Be sure to be on time for every shift and get home safely.

Large free parking lot for your car.

Monday to Friday from 8:00 am to 4:30 pm ($17/hr + .50/hr attendance bonus = $17.50/hr)
Monday to Friday from 3:30 pm to midnight ($18.50/hr + .50/hr attendance bonus = $19/hr)

No experience required. Training paid on site.
** Also available: Forklift driver position without experience, as we train on site.

Apply directly on this offer or by text with Julie at 418-564-4067.

Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version)

Advantages
With us the warehouse worker gets ....
- Weekly salary
- Salary above the salaries of the surrounding companies
- Free and easy access to the main parking lot
- Free shuttle from the Longueuil metro station for each shift
- Permanent position

Responsibilities
The warehouse clerk will....

- Handle articles
- Receive, check and store products
- Prepare deliveries and shipments
- Use a basic computer system for inventory management
- Label, grade and package products
- Load and unload trailer trucks ( 30 lbs);

Qualifications
In our company, the warehouse worker can be described as having...
- Good judgment
- Sense of responsibility
- Good physical capacity (able to lift 30 pounds)
- Dynamic, positive and respectful attitude
- Enjoy teamwork

** You must have a Canadian work permit and currently live in Canada**.
NO salary is paid in cash.

Summary
Your next job is in Longueuil...
Your job as a warehouse clerk is just a click away! Don't be shy, apply directly through this offer.
If you want, bring a friend along in this professional adventure!

Any questions? Text Julie at 418-564-4067

Randstad is the largest employment agency in Canada and each consultant is specialized in their field. They can advise you on how to find a job that matches your skills.
Since occupational health and safety is one of our top priorities, you'll also have access to our free online training courses.

Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version)

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Quality Control Technician – On site
description:
Your Employer

Englobe distinguishes itself due to its expertise in applied sciences, particularly in the fields of geotechnical, environmental and materials engineering, as well as soil and biomass treatment. With more than 2,700 employees and a broad Canadian and European presence, Englobe is a guarantee of quality for its customers.

 

You like

  • Working outdoors,
  • Finding solutions to concrete technical challenges,
  • Share your knowledge with your colleagues.

We offer

  • Full range of benefits (group insurance with shared costs upon hiring, group RRSP after 3 months, cumulative time bank available),
  • Annual reimbursement of the costs of sports activities,
  • Fully remunerated in-company training,
  • An opportunity for skills development,
  • Reimbursement of travel expenses,
  • A telemedicine programme,
  • An unparalleled work atmosphere!

Your Contribution

You will have the opportunity to work on site for several of our clients, such as Hydro-Québec, the Ministère des transports du Québec and various municipalities. Englobe also participates in the implementation of many major projects, such as the construction of engineering structures and government buildings.

Your mandate will be to control the quality of the materials used on various construction sites. Your functions will mainly be:

Responsibilities

  • Monitor the work and record the quantities of materials received,
  • Perform technical tasks (testing and monitoring) as directed by project managers,
  • Check the quality and implementation of materials (floor, concrete, asphalt),
  • Take samples at the site and/or at source, according to the planned frequency,
  • Collaborate with project managers for the day-to-day management of construction sites),
  • Write memos in the event of non-conformity and follow up on corrective actions,
  • Complete reports for each of the assigned projects,
  • Travel to the different sites according to the established current work plan.

Your Profile

  • Relevant training or experience in Civil Engineering or Geology (asset)
  • ASP Construction and WHMIS Card 2015 (asset);
  • ACI certification (asset),
  • Valid driver's licence,
  • Have access to a car for travel as part of the work (the technician will have to transport equipment to carry out the various tests on site).

Positions are available in: Montreal, Baie-Comeau, Chicoutimi, Drummondville, Gatineau, Îles de la Madeleine, La Romaine, Laval, Rimouski, Rouyn-Noranda, Quebec, Sept-Îles, Sherbrooke St-Georges, Shawinigan or Varennes.

title: Service Receptionist - The BMW Store
description:
UNLIMITED POSSIBILITIES AHEAD.

 

We believe in doing good for our customers and for ourselves. Whether it’s launching the most anticipated model of the year or purchasing a vehicle for your next adventure, great people and relationships are at every turn with OpenRoad.

 

 We are proud of our forward-thinking culture developed over 40 years of continuous improvement initiatives. OpenRoad is one of the largest and fastest growing automotive retail groups in the country (representing 20 automotive brands across 25 locations) with a shared vision to become the national automotive leader in customer experience. As one of Canada’s Best Employers and Best Managed Companies, we are looking for team players who are excited to continually learn, work hard, and take ownership of their role.

 

If you love the idea of joining an organization with unlimited possibilities to accelerate your career, then apply to OpenRoad and grow with us today! 

 

OpenRoad Auto Group is currently seeking to expand our team with a Full-time Service Receptionist at The BMW Store.

 

A Career at OpenRoad Means You’ll Enjoy:

 

  • Many opportunities for internal growth
  • Comprehensive healthcare benefits package
  • Discounted vehicle purchase program
  • Associate perks program
  • Company social events
  • And more!

 

Your contribution:

  • Greeting Customers upon arrival
  • Completing Service Loaner Contracts with customers
  • Checking loaners out / in with customers, explaining features and reporting any damage
  • Billing for loaner usage, damage and tickets
  • Tracking loaner usage
  • Coordinating Service Shuttles for customer drop off and pick up.
  • Maintaining quality control (cleanliness) of all loaner vehicles that exceeds customer expectations
  • Overseeing and coordinating all necessary repairs of loaner vehicles
  • Scheduling and tracking loaner vehicles to ensure availability
  • Maintaining, scheduling and tracking rental vehicles
  • Providing weekly status reports on the entire loaner fleet
  • Driving the courtesy shuttle when needed
  • Maintaining the flow in the Service drive

 

What it takes to be part of our dynamic team:

  • Class 5 Driver’s License
  • Knowledge of the automotive industry
  • Be familiar with the Vancouver area, you will be planning the pick up and drop off of customers.
  • Previous experience and knowledge working with fleet and loaner vehicles is an asset
  • Have strong organizational skills
  • Have strong computer skills (internet and MS Office suite proficiency)
  • The ability to work closely with a team
  • You must be self-motivated with the ability to complete assignments with minimal supervision

 

Internal Candidates MUST apply by filling out the Internal Endorsement Form on the Intranet. Failure to complete the form will cause a delay in your application. 

 

https://orag.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=2942 

 

We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity. We stand behind the growth of our associates to help them achieve their vision and goals.

 

JOIN US AND GROW WITH US! 

 

We thank all those that have applied. Only those considered for the position will be contacted.

title: Environmental Engineer or Scientist - Intermediate
description:
Why GHD? Being the best we can be is in our culture. We are a family of smart, innovative and creative problem solvers. In our employee-owned company, everything feels like it matters more. Challenge us and help us come up with new solutions to ensure water, energy and urbanisation are made sustainable for generations to come. Our commitment to you Commitment is a powerful word that defines how we do business, how we serve our clients and how we care for one another. We will support your needs by giving you the tools to do your best work and then recognise achievements. We will set your curiosity free to allow brilliant minds to do their best work. We will invest in new ideas, removing barriers where we can. Finally, we will encourage you to collaborate with thousands of diverse people across our global business. Who we are We are committed to solving the world's biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanisation. GHD is a global professional services company that is a leader in engineering, construction and architectural expertise. Established in 1928, we remain wholly owned by our people. We are 10,000+ diverse and skilled individuals, yet we are proudly ‘One GHD’ across more than 200 offices, spanning five continents – Asia, Australia, Europe, North and South America, and the Pacific region. Delivering extraordinary social and economic outcomes, we are passionate about building lasting relationships with our partners and clients.

Join a global professional services leader. We are committed to solving the world’s biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanization.

The Calgary, AB office of GHD is growing our team and is looking to add an Environmental Engineer or Scientist to our fabulous Contamination Assessments & Remediation (CAR) team! We work in several different industries including municipal, infrastructure, waste and landfills, water and wastewater, oil and gas upstream and downstream, industrial, pipelines, emergency spill response and energy & resources.

Responsibilities:

  • Working with senior staff for implementing environmental investigations for Stage 1 and 2 PSIs, DSIs and Phase I and II ESAs and remediation work, including:
  • Oversight of field investigations, including drilling (various rig types), monitoring well and soil vapour probe installation oversight; coordination of environmental monitoring (soil, sediment, groundwater, soil vapour, surface water);
  • Field oversight of remediation and decommissioning contractor;
  • Managing subcontractors, analytical set up, and health and safety program adherence
  • Completing Stage I PSIs/Phase I ESAs
  • Preparing permitting applications (VFPA, municipalities etc.)
  • Preparation of remediation, demolition and construction tender documents, bid packages
  • Assist with field scope development, scheduling, budgeting
  • Assist with data compilation, reduction and interpretation, preparation of technical environmental reports for senior review and regulatory forms (NIR, NOM, SLRA, SOSC etc.)
  • Maintain safety training to conduct environmental contaminated sites work

Qualifications and Position Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Environmental Engineering, Science or equivalent
  • 3+ years of experience in environmental consulting
  • Eligible for professional engineering or science designation in AB
  • Knowledge of AB Contaminated Sites Regulation and associated guidance, protocols, etc. and federal guidelines
  • Demonstrated experience conducting field work (in particular complex drilling and hydrogeological setting and overseeing remediation contractors)
  • Willingness to travel throughout AB to undertake field work, is required (field demands can include working long hours, working in inclement weather conditions, and lifting up to 50lbs)
  • Ability to work independently in remote settings
  • Experience managing multiple tasks while maintaining a high degree of attention to detail in a consulting environment is preferred
  • Must be flexible with project types and responsibilities
  • Must be proficient with Microsoft Office
  • Excellent English writing and verbal communication is required to effectively express technical information to multiple audiences including subcontractors, field staff, clients, colleagues, etc.
  • Valid driver's license (an MVR check will be performed prior to hire)

As a diverse and inclusive organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workforce. GHD is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, GHD will provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.

#LI-JC1

title: Licensed Technician- OpenRoad Hyundai Richmond
description:
UNLIMITED POSSIBILITIES AHEAD.


We believe in doing good for our customers and for ourselves. Whether it’s launching the most anticipated model of the year or purchasing a vehicle for your next adventure, great people and relationships are at every turn with OpenRoad.


 We are proud of our forward-thinking culture developed over 40 years of continuous improvement initiatives. OpenRoad is one of the largest and fastest growing automotive retail groups in the country (representing 20 automotive brands across 25 locations) with a shared vision to become the national automotive leader in customer experience. As one of Canada’s Best Employers and Best Managed Companies, we are looking for team players who are excited to continually learn, work hard, and take ownership of their role.


If you love the idea of joining an organization with unlimited possibilities to accelerate your career, then apply to OpenRoad and grow with us today! 


OpenRoad Auto Group is currently seeking to expand our team with a Full-time Licensed/Ticketed Technician (ie/ Red Seal Certificate, Journeyman) at OpenRoad Hyundai Richmond.


A Career at OpenRoad Means You’ll Enjoy:


  • Many opportunities for internal growth
  • Discounted vehicle purchase program
  • Associate perks program
  • Company social events
  • And more!


ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Receive repair orders from dispatch tower/Service Advisor and perform work as outlined on repair order with efficiency and accuracy.
  • Ensure work is performed in accordance with dealership and factory standards.
  • Communicate with parts department to obtain needed parts. Save and tag parts if the job is under warranty or if requested by the customer.
  • Examine the vehicle to determine if additional safety or service work is required.
  • Advise Service Advisor immediately if additional work is needed, if work outlined is not needed, or if repairs cannot be completed within the time promised.
  • Inform dispatcher when job is started, finished, or interrupted. Be particularly attentive to repair orders on vehicles marked “RUSH” or “CUSTOMER WAITING”.
  •  Complete and maintain documentation of work performed.
  • Road-test vehicles to quality-check work performed.
  • Supervise work of any Apprentice technicians as assigned to you by management.
  •  Attend factory-sponsored training classes. Keep abreast of factory technical bulletins.
  • Ensure that customers’ cars are kept clean.
  •  Keep shop area neat, clean and free of safety hazards.
  • Comply with Federal, Provincial and Municipal regulations, such as those governing the disposal of hazardous wastes
  •  Assist in creating quotes for additional work required.
  •  Keep up to date on online training as require
  •  Follow company safety policies and practices, and immediately, report any and all accidents to a Manager/Supervisor.
  • This position will be expected to perform other duties as assigned by management.


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:

  • Must be a fully licensed Technician.
  • Working knowledge of automotive equipment
  • Possess strong diagnostic and problem solving skills in order to maintain optimal customer satisfaction.
  • A highly self-motivated and organized individual.
  • Well-developed interpersonal skills to effectively work with other members of the Service Department team.
  • Must be committed to consistently delivering high quality work.
  • Ability to make sound decisions in a manner consistent with the essential job functions.
  • A valid Canadian drivers license, and ability to provide drivers abstract for review. 


Internal Candidates MUST apply by filling out the Internal Endorsement Form on the Intranet. Failure to complete the form will cause a delay in your application. 


https://orag.bamboohr.com/hiring/jobs/2838 


We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity. We stand behind the growth of our associates to help them achieve their vision and goals.


JOIN US AND GROW WITH US! 


We thank all those that have applied. Only those considered for the position will be contacted.

title: Armed guard
description:
We are currently seeking on-call Cash Handlers for our Gatineau branch.

 

Your mission at GardaWorld:

 

As a Cash Handling Agent, you will work in various roles such as Driver/Guard, Team Leader and Vault.

You will be responsible for the management and safe transportation of valuables for our clients. We are looking for candidates who enjoy teamwork, challenges, who seek to be self-sufficient in their work and who provide outstanding customer service.

GardaWorld Cash Logistics Division is the largest provider of its industry in North America and offers you the opportunity to work in an exciting, high risk occupation.

 

We offer:

 

  • Hourly wages between 26.38$ and 29.29$ depending on the assignment
  • Premium of $0.81 for night shifts
  • Complete and free training for selected candidates
  • Full uniform (shirts, pants, work boots, bullet proof vest, coat etc)
  • Non-routine work on variable schedules
  • Safe working environment
  • The chance to work for an international company with many long term career opportunities

 

What will you do:

 

  • Pick up and deliver valuables to our customers
  • Ensure a safe environment for your team and your customers when you travel
  • Supply the ATMs of various financial institutions
  • Offer a quality service to our customers
  • Make sure that the itineraries and schedules established for the delivery are respected
  • Drive the armored vehicle in a safe manner while respecting the highway safety code
  • Load and unload the armored car at the branch
  • Ensure the sorting and distribution of packages
  • Carry out operations in accordance with GardaWorld procedures and regulations
  • Complete various reports and route sheets
  • All other related tasks

 

Your profile:

 

  • High school diploma (DES) or an equivalence recognized by the Ministry of Education
  • Permit to possess and acquire a non-restricted firearm AND a restricted firearm (PAL) (* see bottom of posting for procedure to obtain)
  • Minimally available on Sundays and Thursdays from 2:00 pm to 8:30 am the next day
  • Class 5 driver's license for a minimum of two years
  • Willing to take steps to obtain a class 3 learner's permit during the hiring process (maximum 3 demerit points on driving record)
  • Good team spirit, good analytical skills and good customer service
  • Good observation and organization skills as well as a good capacity to learn and adapt
  • Speak French

 

Interested? Apply online or send your resume to Fanny.Blais@garda.com

 

"Want to know more about the agent profession? Watch this episode of the High Security series, you won't be disappointed: Episode 4

 

How do I get the required PAL?

the CFSC and the Canadian Restricted Firearms Safety Course (CRFSC)

You must first take the CFSC (non-restricted firearm) and CRFSC (restricted firearm) courses.

To obtain the CFSC (non-restricted firearm) certification, please contact Safety Nature at 1-888-523-2863 or www.fedecp.qc.ca.

To obtain CRFSC (restricted firearm), please contact the Fédération québécoise de tir at 514-252-3056 or www.fqtir.qc.ca.

To download the necessary forms to apply for a PAL: https://www.rcmp-grc.gc.ca/en/firearms/licensing)

title: Vehicle Transporter - Casual
description:
General Responsibilities

Well known for our solid worldwide reputation, Hertz is proud to be the largest car rental company. At Hertz, we know service excellence is built on our employees. We recognize that you are a unique individual and we understand that you value benefits and rewards that provide flexibility, choice, and control.

 

Join the winning team at a company whose reputation speaks for itself…

 

As a Tripper, you will be responsible for driving different types of vehicles from location to location, completing necessary paperwork and re-fueling.


Essential Requirements

General Requirements:

  • Able to work various hours, weekends, holiday and overtime
  • Must be able to communicate effectively & courteously to customers

  • This position requires you to work outdoors and drive in all weather conditions
  • Honest & Dependable
  • Professional Attitude
  • Organized
  • Must have a pleasant, outgoing, and friendly personality

 

Educational Requirements:

  • Secondary School Diploma/GED

 

Professional Requirements:

  • 6 months to 1 year customer service experience

At Hertz, we champion and celebrate a culture of diversity and inclusion. We take affirmative steps to promote employment and advancement opportunities. The endless variety of perspectives, experiences, skills and talents that our employees invest in their work every day represent a significant part of our culture – and our success and reputation as a company.

title: Direct Hire - Appliance Technician
description:
We are currently recruiting for a Permanent Coffee Service Technician for the Mississauga area!

Work with a successful and growing company that offers direct industry training, great benefits, a competitive salary based on experience, and a flexible work environment. If you have a passion for coffee and are mechanically savvy, this is a job for you.


Title: On-road service technician or installer

Shift: 8 am to 5 pm + OT

Pay: - $50K – $70K base salary

Job Duties:
- Diagnosing and repairing commercial espresso machines, grinders, and brewers.
- You will have machines in the office, as well as on-site to work on.
- Maintenance, responding to customers, documenting work, and working in a clean and safe manner, is all in your day today.
- Mechanically inclined, experienced, and skilled with different machine operations
- Perform other duties as assigned.

-Experience with repairing any home appliances (an asset)

- HOW DO I APPLY?
Please send your resume to charlotte.dcunha@randstad.ca or TEXT "SERVICE TECHNICIAN" AT 647 770 6419



Advantages
- Company Benefits
- On-site parking
- Straight day shifts
Company car provided

Responsibilities
Job Duties:
• Installing new machines in accordance with a fast paced rollout schedule
• Scheduling and performing preventative maintenance on all machines in your service area
• Emergency on-site technical support for Toronto and surrounding areas
• Covering other service areas as needed on a national basis
• Customer Equipment and Recipe training
• Troubleshooting and repair of mechanical , electrical , hydraulic and electronic systems


Qualifications
-Experience with repairing any home appliances
-Ability to work on commercial espresso and coffee brewing systems an asset but not a must
-Previous field service experience in similar field preferred
-Electronics, appliance technician or other related degree preferred
-Excellent troubleshooting skills and mechanical aptitude
-Skilled with the use of test instruments such as multimeters
-Superior customer service skills
-Professional attitude and appearance
-Ability to work independently and organize own activities
-Must be able to work on your own or as part of a team
-Ability to communicate clearly both verbally and in writing
-Valid Driver 's License and an acceptable driving record
-Must be able to regularly lift up to 25 lbs and occasionally up to 75 lbs
-Experience in the coffee industry is helpful , but not required
-Must be able to drink coffee as the final step is the quality evaluation of dispensed coffee (taste and appearance)


Summary
- HOW DO I APPLY?
Please send your resume to charlotte.dcunha@randstad.ca or TEXT "SERVICE TECHNICIAN" AT 647 770 6419

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Design Release Engineer - Intermediate - PSP - JLS241
description:
Job Description

Description:
The Design Release Engineer may work more specifically as a DRE within Passive Safety Electronics Component, Active Chassis Components or other area.
Responsibilities may include (but not limited to):
• Design, release, and validate the passive safety electrical system and its components, leading the process from inception through launch
• Work closely with supply base to ensure on-time implementation and validation of software, hardware, and diagnostics following company guidelines
• Interface with Electronic Component Groups, Suppliers, Purchasing, Quality and Assembly Plants to develop Electronic Stability Control, Electronic Braking Actuation Module, Wheel Speed Sensors and Clutch/Brake pedal sensor/switch components
• Manage product performance to meet vehicle and component level functional, cost and weight targets.
• Perform product release and change management processes
• Develop software and hardware release timing for feature rollout and performance goal milestones
• Manage supplier and internal DVPR’s, including:
o Tracking of the validation activities and the related bug-fixes
o Definition of countermeasures in case of issues and delays
o Coordination of HW / SW releases of the component, ensuring the alignment with the validation activities
o Approval of tests results and related deviations
• Support AQP, PSO, product launch and problem resolution during vehicle launch gates

Requirements:
Basic Qualifications:

• Bachelor's degree in Electrical / Computer / Mechanical / Automotive / Systems Engineering, or a related field of study
• 3+ years of experience of Design and/or Validation of Electrical systems and components
• Ability to effectively lead a cross-functional team in the execution of robust designs, including suppliers, Passive Safety calibration team, Restraints, Interior, Electrical, and Body, etc.
• Proficient in the creation and implementation of DFMEAs and/or DVP&Rs and design practices
• Proficient with Microsoft Office products (PowerPoint, Excel, Word, Outlook, and Project) and G-Suite
• Knowledge of systems engineering principles, hardware and software design concepts
• Knowledge of testing and validation tools
• Proven record of interpreting requirements from design to production
• Knowledge and execution of change management processes
• Excellent oral and written communication skills in English
• Knowledge of Electronic Stability Control systems
• Calibration and diagnostic experience using typical automotive controls system development environments
• Intermediate knowledge in automotive communication protocols ((CAN networks, Electrical/EMC requirements, Environmental requirements, FMEA, functional safety analysis – ISO 26262 norm, etc.)
• Intermediate knowledge in automotive vehicle mechanical and electrical system architectures (e.g., distributed control systems)
• Associate level candidates may be considered IF they possess strong SAE or Alt Practical experience



Preferred Qualifications:

• 3+ years Passive Safety E/E experience, or electronic brake system releasing
• Strong GD&T skill set
• Formal training/experience in problem solving, quality and reliability
• Experience in manufacturing of electronic brake components and vehicle assembly
• Understanding of Team Center
• Design for Six Sigma (DFSS) GreenBelt certification
• Shainin/Reactive GreenBelt certification
• Able to work well with others
• Strong oral and written communication skills
• Strong problem-solving skills

* May be required to drive a company car. Valid driver’s license is required as well as a clean driving record.

title: Information Technology Technician
description:
Overview:

Flex-N-Gate is a leading manufacturer and supplier of components for the automotive industry, recently ranked 10th of the 150 Top North American Suppliers in â€œAutomotive News.â€ A growing and vital company, Flex-N-Gate provides a great opportunity for hard-working and skilled individuals.

Scope of the Position:

The Information Technology Technicianâ€™s role is to ensure proper computer operations so that end users can accomplish organizational tasks. This includes receiving, prioritizing, documenting and actively resolving end user help requests. Problem resolution may involve the use of approved diagnostics and help tools, as well as require that the individual give hands-on help at the desktop level.

Responsibilities:
  • Evaluate documented resolutions and suggest ways to prevent future problems.
  • Field incoming help requests from end users via telephone, email and text in a courteous manner.
  • Document all pertinent end user problem or issue.
  • Escalate problems (when required) to the appropriate experienced technician.
  • Record, track, and document - help desk request, problem-solving process, including all successful and unsuccessful decisions made, and brief IT Support Supervisor on final resolution.
  • Use only approved diagnostic utilities to aid in troubleshooting.
  • Access approved software updates, drivers, knowledge bases, and frequently asked questions resources on the Internet to aid in problem resolution.
  • Identify and learn appropriate software and hardware used and supported by the organization.
  • Perform hands-on fixes at the desktop level, including installing and upgrading software, implementing file backups, and configuring systems and applications.
  • Test fixes to ensure problem has been adequately resolved and report all finding and final resolutions.
  • Perform post-resolution follow-up, with users and supervisor.
  • Available for support calls 24/7
  • Must be able to work Afternoon shift
Qualifications:
    • 2 to 4 year work experience in related field required.
    • Recommended certificates in information systems
    • Recommended completion of a one-year college level curriculum
    • Knowledge of basic computer hardware and application software.
    • Experience with desktop operating systems including Windows XP, 7 and 8
    • Working knowledge of a range of diagnostic utilities.
    • Exceptional customer service orientation and the ability to present ideas in user-friendly language.
    • Be prompt, directed, reliable, self-motivated and highly dependable
    • Keen attention to detail and able to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
    • Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
    • Exceptional interpersonal skills, with a focus on rapport-building, listening, and questioning.

 

Benefits:

â€¢ Medical, dental, prescription, vision, life and disability insurance
â€¢ RRSP retirement savings plan
â€¢ Extensive safety training, new hire orientation, continuous learning and development programs and tuition reimbursement
â€¢ Paid holidays and vacation time

What do our employees have to say?
â€œIt engages you professionally, and provides learning opportunities.â€
â€œLots of growth opportunity.â€
â€œThe companyâ€™s young enough to be exciting, but old enough to be stable.â€
Not just a jobâ€”a great place to work!
 

Flex-N-Gate is an equal opportunity employer.     Ontario Human Rights Code and AODA.

title: HR Assistant
description:
The 401 Group of Companies, is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's fastest growing dealer groups offering a full line of automotive, recreational vehicle, powersport and marine products and services. The 401 Group of Companies has 20+ locations across Ontario including the Blackshop Restaurant and Wine Bar as well as our headquarters, both located in the thriving city of Cambridge, Ontario. Our brands include but aren't limited to Kia, Mitsubishi, Volkswagen, Hyundai, Yamaha, 401 Auto Financing, CampMart and Grand River Boats. If you have a growth mindset like us, we'd love to see your resume and have a conversation. The opportunities at the 401 Group of Companies are endless!

 

Location: 2225 Eagle Street North, Cambridge, Ontario


Hours: On-site Monday to Friday 8 am to 5 pm


We are seeking an entry level HR professional who would love to work in a fast-paced company and has the ability to grow from within. 


If you believe you would be a great fit, we’d love to meet you!  

  
Role and Responsibilities:   

  • Assisting the Director of HR in day to day business operations including but not limited to filing, creating letters, scanning, copying, etc.
  • New employee set up and access level assignment related to many systems and portals
  • Employee changes and offboarding related to many company systems and portals
  • Orientation package creation
  • New hire documentation review
  • HR special projects
  • Other duties as assigned
      

Qualifications and Skills:  

  • Completion of a Human Resource Management degree, diploma, or certificate program
  • CHRP designation is an asset
  • Well-versed in employment laws and regulations
  • Above average computer skills
  • HRIS experience is considered an asset and specifically BambooHR
  • PBS experience is an asset
  • Excellent judgment, professionalism, maturity, and problem-solving skills
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Multitasking, time-management skills, and the ability to prioritize tasks  
  • Valid G Driver's License and acceptable driving record 

 

The 401 Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer and we are pleased to accommodate individual needs within our recruitment process. Please speak with our HR department should you require any accommodation.
