title: #3520 Software Developer - Bailment
description:
Our client, a leading global provider of talent solutions, is hiring a Software Developer on a 12-month contract engagement in Toronto, ON! As a software developer in the Infotainment Software Team, you will contribute to the development and integration of software features in various areas such as Android Framework, Multimedia, Connectivity and Core Applications.

Your contribution will enable customers to connect their personal consumer devices to the vehicle infotainment system as well as providing a user friendly User Interface to control the vehicle infotainment system.

Perks You'll Love
- Join a supportive team that champions diversity with abundant growth & development opportunities
- Supportive leadership that invests in developing its team, to grow their careers and gain new experiences
- Be part of a company that values transparency, listening and honesty

What You'll Be Doing
- Contribute as designer and developer to design, code and release software for Android target
- Participate in the implementation of connectivity framework features (BT, USB and Wi-Fi etc.)
- Participate in improving and maintaining existing Infotainment software
- Participate in feature requirements analysis, and test-case design review
- Participate in feature prototype building, testing, and refinement
- Participate in improving and tailoring existing drivers, stack and applications to our needs
- Provide clear and complete documentation based on the definition of the software development process
- Collaborate with other engineers by using Scrum/Agile development process.
- Be able to occasionally travel domestically and internationally

Qualifications You're Bringing
- 8+ years of experience developing applications or middleware for mobile platforms like Android or iOS
- Object-oriented software development experience with a solid grasp of algorithms and data structures
- Experience working with large code bases, developing entirely new code and maintaining existing code
- Knowledge of Android components, framework and architecture (such as Apps, Multimedia, BT V4, USB, NFC, Wi-Fi and Projection, CarPlay, Speech, ScreenCasting, OpenMax, GStreamer, etc.)
- Knowledge of test development and testing of embedded system firmware
- Knowledge and experience about embedded LAN and Ethernet
- Software platform development experience, such as Linux and Android platform
- Commercial software development experience in C, C++, Java
- Familiar with Android development toolkit and process
- Experience with SCM tools, GIT, JIRA, Eclipse IDE, ClearCase etc.
- Experience of Scrum/Agile software development process
- Ability to perform diagnostic and investigation based on limited information
- Creative, discipline, strong sense of responsibility, delivery and schedule commitment
- High level of oral and written communication skills
- High level of interpersonal skills to work effectively in a geographically dispersed team
- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent field
- Valid Drivers license
- Advanced degrees preferred

Other Skills Preferred
- Working experience with Mobile Platforms/Services and Apps, CarPlay, and Android Auto
- Working experience of Android component
- Working experience in firmware development
- Experience in developing automotive infotainment solutions
- Experience in automotive and/or portable consumer electronic devices

We Are An Equal Opportunity Employer
All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Canadian Work Authorization
All applicants MUST be authorized to work in Canada. Any applicants not meeting this criteria will not be notified and will not be considered eligible for the position.

title: Préposé au service pour les véhicules/Car Cleaner (FT)
description:
$500 Sign-on Bonus!!
Well known for our solid worldwide reputation, Hertz is proud to be the largest car rental company. At Hertz, we know service excellence is built on our employees.
Join the winning team at a company whose reputation speaks for itself…
As a Vehicle Service Attendant (VSA)...
  • You'll be responsible for vehicle preparation to ensure the vehicle is ready for customer pick-up.
  • Drive and park vehicles on-lot as needed.
  • Check for vehicle damage and ensure features of the vehicles are operational.
  • Check vehicle status. (rentable/non-rentable)
  • Ensure the interior of the vehicle is clean. (windows, door jams, trunk, vacuum, etc)
  • Fill gasoline tank and check fill levels of all fluids.
  • Clean the exterior of the vehicle. (debug and wash)
  • Meet processing and standardization quotas.
  • Perform related tasks as directed by managers.
  • Able to work outdoors in all types of weather conditions.
******************
Bonus à l’embauche 500$!
Préposé au service pour les véhicules
Largement reconnue pour sa solide réputation mondiale, Hertz est fière d’être la plus grande compagnie de location de voitures au monde. Chez Hertz, nous savons que l’excellence de notre service repose sur nos employés.
Joignez-vous à une équipe gagnante, au sein d’une entreprise dont la renommée parle d’elle-même.
En tant que préposé au service pour les véhicules, vous aurez les responsabilités suivantes:
  • Préparer les véhicules afin de vous assurer qu’ils sont prêts au moment où les clients viennent les chercher.
  • Conduire les véhicules et les stationner à leur emplacement au besoin.
  • Inspecter les véhicules pour les dommages et vous assurer que toutes les fonctions de la voiture sont opérationnelles.
  • Vérifier l’état des véhicules (louables ou non).
  • Vérifier que l’intérieur des véhicules est propre (notamment fenêtres et coffre; blocages de portière; passer l’aspirateur, etc.).
  • Remplir le réservoir à essence et vérifier le niveau de tous les liquides.
  • Nettoyer l’extérieur des véhicules (mise au point et nettoyage).
  • Respecter les quotas de traitement et de normalisation.
  • Effectuer les tâches connexes à la demande des gérants.
  • Être en mesure de travailler dehors dans toutes les conditions météorologiques.

Educational Background:
  • Secondary School Diploma/GED.
Professional Experience:
  • Detailing experience preferred.
Skills:
  • Must have a valid driver's license and excellent driving record.
  • Ability to drive multiple types of vehicles
  • Effective verbal communication skills with customers, co-workers, and management.
Additional Notes:
  • Must be able to carry out additional duties and responsibilities as assigned by management due to operational needs.
  • Must be able to work days, nights, weekends, and holidays.
  • Must be at least 20 years of age.
  • Must be able to work outside year-round.
***********************
Scolarité :
  • Diplôme d’études secondaires (formation générale).
Expérience professionnelle :
  • Detailing experience preferred.
Compétences :
  • Doit détenir un permis de conduire valide et un excellent dossier de conducteur.
  • Capacité de conduire plusieurs types de véhicules.
  • Bonnes compétences en communication orale avec les clients, les collègues et la direction.
Remarques additionnelles :
  • Doit être capable d’accomplir d’autres tâches et d’assumer des responsabilités supplémentaires, à la demande de la direction, selon les besoins opérationnels.
  • Doit être en mesure de travailler le jour, la nuit, les fins de semaine et les jours de congés fériés.
  • Doit être âgé d’au moins 20 ans.
  • Doit être en mesure de travailler dehors tout au long de l’année.

The endless variety of perspectives, experiences, skills and talents that our employees invest in their work every day represent a significant part of our culture – and our success and reputation as a company.

Individuals are encouraged to apply for positions because of the characteristics that make them unique.

Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Hertz is a drug free workplace.

title: Sr. Power Electronics Engineer
description:
Sr. Power Electronics Engineer


Position Summary:

The talented individual will have a strong background in Power Electronics, Passion for new technologies strong verbal and written communication skills and a strong Team Player.


Responsibilities:

  • Researches innovative technological approaches to devise new technological solutions and findings and knowledge to influence product roadmaps.
  • Responsible for preparing customer facing technical materials providing thought leading technical solutions and perspectives.
  • Interfaces with customers to understand problems and applications, uses feedback to generate and drive new product design requirements.
  • Works with technical customers to define and develop customized system solutions and/or product designs.
  • Participates in product design from concept to production release in accordance with internal project management process. These activities to include all cycles of product development from design, test, debugging, EMC, safety compliance etc.
  • Conduct experimental laboratory tests and evaluate results, such as electrical performance, electromagnetic compliance (EMC), etc
  • Leads and/or participates in developing product functional specifications, theory of operation, design verification test procedures and creates various technical assets for products.
  • Leads and/or participates in design, analysis and development of electronic circuit design for embedded hardware, mixed signal and power conversion circuitry.
  • Applies best practices to maximize balance between, design complexity, reliability, product cost and design for manufacturability.
  • Provide technical thought leadership on multi-disciplinary design team of electrical, mechanical, technicians, manufacturing etc, through complete product development cycles.
  • Diligently executes design concepts through a combination of computer simulation, laboratory empirical testing and design verification testing.
  • Execute discipline of maintaining records of design calculations, simulations, tests and other design records in project repository.
  • Develops engineering test plans to verify electrical, environmental and functional compliance of the design to it functional specification.


Required Qualifications:

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills required for documentation creation, discussions, correspondence etc. Mandarin speaking is an asset.
  • Experience in system design using Lithium-Ion batteries and related BMS, Inverters, Chargers, and Renewable Energy Industry experience, preferred.
  • Solid history of execution on several development projects from concept to industrialization.
  • Experience designing single phase power conversion products up to 10KW.
  • Knowledgeable designing with and selecting IGBTs, IGBT gate drivers, MOSFETs and MOSFET gate drivers. Component loss and stress calculations and design margin application. Component selection for semiconductors and passive components.
  • Knowledge in hardware design and interfacing embedded microcontrollers and FPGA’s. Familiar with developing control algorithms and embedded controller design along with converter stability analysis.
  • Familiarity or design experience in communication protocols such as Modbus/TCP, EtherNet/IP, CAN, USB etc.
  • Solid understanding of good product design principles and standards, including those for hardware, firmware, and product safety.
  • Performed worst case analysis and strong knowledge and familiarity with design for reliability (DFR), design for Quality (DFQ), FMEA principles and practices.
  • Experience with Printed Circuit Board layout requirements for power electronics and high speed and mixed-signal circuitry.
  • Familiar with EMC design principles, EMC design and testing including preventative approaches.
  • Familiarity with industry safety standards and certifications (e.g. UL1741, CSA107.2, IEC62109, NEC, NFPA 70E, etc.) an asset.


Education and Experience:

  • Bachelor’s Degree or higher education in Electrical Engineering with focus on Power Electronics.
  • Minimum 4+ years of Engineering experience Designing Power Electronics Hardware.


Work Location:

Burnaby, British Columbia, Canada @ our Xantrex Technology Location


Work Hours:

8AM - 5PM (Monday - Friday). Production warehouse environment.


Travel Requirements:

None


Starting Salary:

TBD – Based on Experience.


Perks:

Our company offers excellent benefits including competitive health and dental insurance coverages. RRSP, DC Plan (Matching up to 5%) and paid Holidays and Vacation accrual are also offered.



About Mission Critical Electronics:

Mission Critical Electronics LLC. represents a platform of distinctive brands and products focusing on industrial electronic and electrical applications where durability, reliability, and performance in hostile environments is essential. A focus on critical system applications in commercial marine vessels, mega yachts, DC control & standby power, railroad passenger cars, wireless networks, emergency vehicles, and public safety communications and has resulted in a unique offering of high value products and well-respected brands in our respective markets. Mission Critical Electronics is dedicated to supplying high quality products to the markets we serve.  Please visit our website: www.mission-critical-electronics.com


﻿As per company policy, official hiring will be pending the results of a background check and drug test. Mission Critical Electronics and its subsidiaries provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by local laws.

title: Manager, Technical Accounting & Reporting -Electrify Companies (12 Month Contract)
description:
Manager, Technical Accounting & Reporting -Electrify Companies (12 Month Contract) - GRO000950

Primary Location

: Canada-CA-Ontario

Description

 

Drive your Career!

 

We love our cars, but it’s the people behind them who make them what they are. To market, sell, and service great cars, we need great people. That’s why at Volkswagen Group Canada, we are passionate about our cars and our brand and foster this same passion and drive in our people. We know that the right people in the right positions can do incredible things, and we love making that happen.

Join the growing team of Electrify Canada, a subsidiary of Volkswagen Group Canada leading the deployment of high power Electric Vehicle (EV) infrastructure in Canada.  Electrify Canada is committed to creating and facilitating a highly visible, reliable, interoperable, and driver-oriented EV charging infrastructure network to support the increased adoption of Electric Vehicles in Canada.  It will create the “Fueling Stations of the Future” by investing in a range of current and future charging technologies that will provide ubiquitous access to EV drivers along highways and in metro areas.  Electrify Canada’s investment will enable millions of Canadians to discover the benefits of driving electric.

 

We are currently looking for aManager, Technical Accounting & Reporting- Electrify Companies (12 Month Contract)

at our Corporate Offices in Ajax, ON

 

The VGCA Accounting Shared Services Centre provides essential back office accounting functions for General Ledger, Inventory, Accounts Receivable and Affiliates, Accounts Payable and Fixed Assets for multiple VW Group Companies including Volkswagen, Audi, Bentley, Lamborghini, Chattanooga factory production, and electric vehicle infrastructure in Canada as well as in the United States.

 

The Manager, Technical Accounting and Reporting – Electrify Companies is responsible for the management of the financial accounting and reporting functions of the Electrify America LLC, Electrify Canada LP and Electrify Canada GP. The role must ensure the integrity, accuracy and timeliness of financial statements prepared in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS), as well as the analysis of information to ensure appropriate business decision making and corporate steering. The incumbent leads the team by coaching, guiding and measuring the team members towards the achievement of established objectives.

The role must ensure the proper management of a substantial capital investment plan spanning over 1,000 physical locations across the USA under a start-up phase.

Additional responsibilities include ownership and execution of various projects coming from business initiatives and IT requirements.

 

Primary Responsibilities: 

  • Provide technical accounting guidance to ensure the company’s controlling and financial accounting functions comply with IFRS and the VW Accounting Handbook, and accounting processes in critical areas are appropriately and adequately supported and documented. Draft position papers in support of accounting treatment for complex contracts and arrangements as required.
  • Responsible for all accounting requirements for the $2 billion USD infrastructure investment project over a 10 year period (currently in the startup phase).
  • Manage fixed asset accounting requirements for capital project sites spanning in excess of 1,000 physical locations across North America.
  • Oversee and review Electrify America’s and Electrify Canada’s local financial statement and disclosure notes preparation.
  • Lead and develop a team of 5 direct reports through active coaching, timely discussions and measuring individuals against role metrics and specific performance objectives. Foster continuous growth of team members through alignment of career paths and succession planning.
  • Coordinate monthly and year-end timetables with team and other relevant parties to ensure parent, audit and tax requirements are met completely, accurately and on time.
  • Manage monthly close process including manual journal entry review/approval and oversee the development and preparation of monthly financial results review reporting, as well as presentation to Management with supporting variance analysis and explanations.
  • Oversee financial analysis and support to external auditors during annual audit and interim reviews. Provide analysis and support to internal audit as required.
  • Develop and maintain robust internal controls over financial reporting (ICFR) across all functional areas of Accounting Services, including detailed narratives, key control matrices, process flowcharts. Oversee annual ICFR update testing.
  • Build and maintain good working relationships with VWAG Group Accounting including liaising on Group Accounting Guidelines, VoKUs requirements, and technical accounting and IFRS interpretations.
  • Maintain and propose performance metrics and KPIs to drive informed decisions regarding resources and areas of focus.
  • Liaise with Tax and external consultants on tax matters.
  • Lead and/or assist with ad-hoc projects and preparation of financial presentations.
  • One of multiple signers responsible for the review and approval of weekly payment runs and manual wires for all companies supported by the Shared Service Center.

Qualifications

 

What we're asking for:

  • Bachelor of Commerce, major in Accounting or Finance and Accounting designation completion (*CPA,CA)
  • 5+ years of solid experience on IFRS and audit
  • 3+ years of experience in a management role as a well-developed leader
  • Thorough knowledge of functional accounting methods and application of IFRS.
  • Commitment to results, works well under daily and monthly deadlines.
  • Ability to respond quickly to changing environment.
  • Supports continuous improvements and shows strong commitment to quality.
  • Highly advanced knowledge of MS Office, especially Excel and PowerPoint.
  • Working knowledge of SAP
  • Excellent communication skills – Written, oral and presentation to document, articulate and convey functions and processes.
  • Must be customer focused – identifies and demonstrates sensitivity to and understanding of customer needs without sacrificing process and system consistency and adherence to financial standards.
  • Actively builds relationship of trust and seeks customer feedback to improve service with customers.
  • Strong business acumen – understanding of large, complex organizations and ability to interact with all levels of the organization
  • Analytical skills – Ability to dissect complex accounting and financial processes and identify risks and process improvements.
  • Must be flexible for periodic travel to Headquarters in Herndon, VA and Wolfsburg, Germany once or twice a year for IFRS conference
  • Must be a team player and willing to help out colleagues to achieve overall team goals. 
  • Willing to work late hours during month close to achieve month end deadlines, including Stat Holidays

 

  What you’ll get in return:

  • A flexible, collaborative, dynamic, and fast-paced work environment with an award-winning employer
  • Many opportunities for personal and professional development
  • Opportunities to participate in exciting company events that give back to the community
  • And much, much more 

 

*Please note that we appreciate the interest of all candidates, however only those under consideration will be contacted.

Additional information: Volkswagen Group Canada and Audi Canada are committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities during all phases of the hiring process including the application process. If you require an accommodation because of a disability, we will work with you to meet your needs. Applicants need to make their needs known in advance. If you are selected for an interview and require an accommodation, you are encouraged to advise the Recruiter who will consult with you to determine an appropriate accommodation. 

Volkswagen Group Canada Inc. is committed to the health, safety, and well-being of our employees.  Effective November 8, 2021, Volkswagen Group Canada Inc. will require all new employees to be fully vaccinated (with the number of doses recommended by public health guidance) against COVID-19. New employees will be required to provide proof of vaccination or entitlement to an exemption. If you are entitled to an exemption (as determined by Volkswagen Group Canada Inc.) then you will be required to follow the company’s applicable protocol for unvaccinated workers. Volkswagen Group Canada Inc.  is also committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. Please let your recruiter know if you need an accommodation at any point during the interview process.

Oversee annual ICFR update testing.', 'Maintain and propose performance metrics and KPIs to drive informed decisions regarding resources and areas of focus.', 'Actively builds relationship of trust and seeks customer feedback to improve service with customers.', 'Excellent communication skills – Written, oral and presentation to document, articulate and convey functions and processes.']

title: Part-Time Field Specialist (United States)
description:
About Poppy

Poppy is the world’s first commercially available pathogen sensing and detection network that helps protect the places where we work, live, and visit by monitoring both air and surfaces for the COVID-19 virus and thousands of other known pathogens.

Poppy was founded in 2019 with a simple mission: to empower the world to stay healthy together by revealing the pathogens in our spaces, so we all can live safer lives.

Privately held, with offices in San Francisco and Toronto, Poppy’s team comprises award-winning serial entrepreneurs and an advisory board representing some of the best scientific and technical minds. We’re hiring part-time Field Scientists located in Washington, D.C., New York, Las Vegas, Dallas, and San Jose who are able to travel for work and support our growing customer base across the nation. 

Poppy is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to an inclusive environment for all employees and contractors.

We're on a quest to help people feel safe when working together. We provide full PPE and training and expect this role to be able to explain the basics of COVID and infectious disease transmissions.

About the Role

We are looking for motivated medically or pharmacologically trained people, or those with MSc, PhD or PostDoc microbiology backgrounds (students welcome) located in Washington, D.C., New York, Las Vegas, Dallas, or San Jose with a desire to get deeply involved with working hard to help with managing COVID-19 across the United States

About You

You are an excellent communicator with experience in customer service and a knack for paying attention to detail, who’s looking for hands-on experience at the earliest stage of a tech/biotech startup. You are ready to try your hand at a variety of tasks and projects in support of the founding team. You deliver high-quality work when you say you will, and are eager to learn what it takes to get a new product & company off the ground.

You are located in one of the following U.S. cities and are both willing and able to travel periodically to other locations in the United States:

  • Washington, D.C.
  • New York, New York
  • Las Vegas, Nevada
  • Dallas, Texas
  • San Jose, California

What You’ll Do

  • Travel to customer sites across the United States to conduct bioaerosol assessment projects

  • Connect with customers to help design and execute air assessment projects

  • Visit customer sites regularly to collect samples and data

  • Follow protocols closely to ensure high-quality collections

  • Interact with customers and act as a liaison to the rest of the team

  • Collaborate in a team environment to provide the best Poppy experience

  • Meet regularly with the team to discuss operational tasks

What You Need

  • Ability to travel within the United States

  • Excellent time management skills

  • Exceptional verbal communication skills and attention to detail

  • Know the importance of following protocols and making logical scientific judgments

  • Experience in connecting with customers

  • Willingness to adapt and improvise if necessary

  • Not afraid to share novel ideas and insights

  • Valid drivers license & car (not required if Uber/Lyft is available in your area)

Bonus Points For

  • Background in pharmacology, microbiology, immunology, or life sciences

  • Laboratory experience and in-depth knowledge in biosafety

  • Previous experience in customer service


Job type: Part-time, Contract

Contract length: 12 months

Part-time hours: 10-20 hours per week

Salary: $20.00 - $27.00 USD per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

  • Weekend availability

title: PE Firmware Engineering
description:
Overview:

Rambus, a premier chip and silicon IP provider, is seeking to hire an exceptional Embedded Software Engineer (Firmware) to join our Connectivity Business Unit team in North America.  Candidates will be joining some of the brightest inventors and engineers in the world to develop products that make data faster and safer.  

 

The goal is to create scalable and optimized software systems.  The candidate needs to be deeply hands-on and capable of self-guidance and technical  leadership to execute complete embedded software  development lifecycle. The ideal individual will possess prior experience with electronics hardware â€“ especially memory,  and CPU interface integration IP within System-On-Chips (SoC). The candidate needs to have solid experience with  PCB hardware as well â€“ specifically bring-up, testing, and troubleshooting.  The candidate will be expected to interact extensively in a tight team environment with  employees in other disciplines and geographies.

 

Position can be located in: San Jose, California; Raleigh, North Carolina, Vancouver, Canada, or other US / Canada locations.

Responsibilities:
  • Design and implement software for embedded devices and systems from the requirements stage to  commercial deployment of the product.  
  • Analyze and enhance efficiency, stability and scalability of system resources.
  • Design, develop, code, test and debug system software.
  • Integrate and validate new product designs.
  • Develop, test, and debug software using pre silicon development platforms.
  • Support embedded software during post silicon bring-up effort.
  • Interface and work closely with IP designers, integrators, hardware designers, and validation engineers.
  • Create design documents for software architectures and algorithms.
  • Participate in code and software design reviews, to ensure adherence to coding convention and best practices.
  • Provide training, mentorship and coaching to less experienced software developers.
Qualifications:
  • BS or higher degrees preferred (Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Electrical  Engineering with Software experience).
  • Minimum 5 years experience in developing and debugging embedded software preferred
  • Strong C/C++ design and programming skills.
  • Experience developing device drivers and low-level code for hardware peripherals such as timers, UART, GPIO, DMA, and serial interfaces.
  • Experience with real time OS techniques including preemptive multi-tasking schedulers, multi-threaded execution, semaphores, mutexes, and interrupts.
  • Proficient in writing performance optimized code for CPU and memory constrained environments.
  • Experience with memory RAS (Reliability, Availability and Serviceability) features, including  error detection and correction.
  • Experience with embedded security features, such as hardware root of trust, secure boot, and key authentication.
  • Ability to follow guidance from more senior members of the team.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • Ability to work independently and in small teams.

Desired Skills:

  • Experience writing software for embedded ARM or RISCv platforms, System-On-Chip (SoC), or x86 platforms.
  • Experience with PCIe, CXL, ONFI, NVMe, I3C, or QSPI.
  • Hardware bring-up experience using JTAG debug tools.
  • Experience with PCB and full system debug.
  • Experience working in lean development organizations and/or startups.

 

About Rambus

 

With 30 years of innovation and semiconductor expertise, Rambus leads the industry with products and solutions speed performance, expand capacity and improve security for today's most demanding applications. From data center and edge to artificial intelligence and automotive, our interface and security IP, and memory interface chips enable SoC and system designers to deliver their vision of the future.

 

Rambus offers a competitive compensation package, including base salary, bonus, equity and employee benefits.

   
Rambus is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

 

Rambus is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may let us know in the application.

 

For more information about Rambus, visit rambus.com. For additional information on life at Rambus and our current openings, check out  rambus.com/careers/.

title: Manager - PFT - Rehabilitation Clinics
description:
Posting # 2021-880241

Non-Union

Position : Manager,Rehabilitation Clinics

Department: Transitions, Integrated Care & Rehabilitation

Status: Permanent Full-time

Hours: Monday to Friday - 8:30am - 4:30pm with evenings & weekends as needed

Site: Multi-site (Oakville, Milton and Georgetown Hospitals)

Halton Healthcare is a state-of-the-art facility that takes great pride in providing quality, compassionate healthcare services to our rapidly growing communities. As a progressive and vibrant healthcare organization, we are committed to being an innovative centre of excellence in community hospital care in the Halton Region.

We take healthcare to a new level to meet the urgent needs of ourcommunity's growing and aging population. We are adistinctive centre of healthcare excellence that offers first-rate care in an innovative environment that supports the physical, mental, emotional and spiritual needs of the community.

Position Profile:

The Rehabilitation and Geriatrics Program encompasses an array of inpatient and outpatient services at Georgetown Hospital (GH), Milton District Hospital (MDH), and Oakville Trafalgar Memorial Hospital (OTMH). Together the Rehabilitation & Geriatrics Program with Transitions & Integrated Care work collaboratively to address the complex needs of the adult population requiring specialized care, general rehabilitation and/or reactivation within the Halton Healthcare catchment area.

The Manager of Rehabilitation Clinics will provide leadership to both publicly (not-for-profit) and privately (for-profit) funded rehab clinics across the three sites in the outpatient areas. The Rehabilitation Clinics Manager will work collaboratively with the Rehab & Geriatric Program to achieve high productivity in the various outpatient clinics to synergistically achieve exemplary patient experiences always.

This is what you’ll be doing:

  • Oversight of100+(full and part-time) highly trained allied health professionals in over 20+ outpatient clinicsat all 3 hospital siteswho provide variousclerical support andspecialty therapy services
  • Ensuring the standards of care and professional guidelines of all health professionals, regulated or otherwise, who directly report to the manager are current and reflect best practice and based on current evidence-based practice guidelines and standards of practice
  • Performance reviews to be completed annually
  • Ensure clinical priorities and reporting are met within the portfolio
  • For the each of the discrete funding mechanisms for the clinics, ensure that the mandated treatment and administrative requirements are met and exceeded, i.e. implementation of clinical programs of care as outlined by Ministry of Health and Ontario Health publicly funded clinics
  • Participates with the Rehab Program Directors (PD) ensure the achievement of clinical program priorities, within available resources and assists with the development of the Quality Report and Balance Scorecard
  • Communicates regularly with Physicians and Patient Care Managers to obtain their input and support for patient care and program initiatives and facilitates cross-site communication, collaboration and teamwork amongst front-line staff to establish and maintain standardization of service /program policies, procedures and practices as appropriate
  • Facilitates optimal care and high patient, family and staff satisfaction through coordination and collaboration with patients, families and staff
  • Participates as required in regional Ontario Health initiatives and committees (e.g.Community Rehab Steering Committee)
  • Performing market need assessments to diversify service and establish new specialty revenue generating programs that will service the community of Halton
  • Develop, coordinate, and maximize the revenue generating efforts of the Clinic by responding to Requests for Proposals (RFPs)
  • Develop business partnerships; for instance establishing preferred provider status with external organizations for instance insurance companies and negotiating terms of these agreements
  • Maintain independent contracts with Ontario Health by providing required reporting to ensure the relationship is maintained and by passing accreditation/audits to ensure high quality and efficient care
  • Enable the achievement of the strategic direction of the Transitions and Integrated Care portfolio through engaging with other members of the team to investigate, recommend and operationalize initiatives that increase efficiencies, generate revenues, increase profitability and improve patient experiences
  • Ensure that the fees charged for services are within the guidelines set out by the Health Professionals Regulatory Bodies
  • Ensure professional liability insurance and licensing requirements and audits of professional conduct are current and maintained while providing services at the clinics
  • Participates with the PD in the development of appropriate risk and quality indicators for his/her services/programs that measures the service accessibility, quality of care, and family satisfaction

This is what you’ll need to do it:

Halton Healthcare endeavors to hire individuals who are competent in their chosen profession and who exemplify our mission, vision and values of accountability, respect and compassion, which guide our individual behaviours and attitudes.

  • Regulated health professional with a Baccalaureate degree required; Masters preferred
  • Completion of an accredited post-grad program in Health or Business Administration (or in the process of earning same) an asset
  • A minimum of three to five years’ experience in a supervisory/leadership capacity in a rehab/healthcare environment required
  • Relevant current clinical skills, experience and knowledge of private practice of physiotherapy preferred
  • Demonstrated ability to secure new business through soliciting outside stakeholders and development of new programs to increase market value
  • Budgetary preparation and fiduciary management experience required
  • A business/entrepreneurial mind-set, with experience in marketing and promotion an asset
  • Experience in proposal writing
  • Membership on relevant regional committees - (i.e. West GTA Stroke Network, GTA Rehab Network, Provincial Bone & Joint Network. MH LHIN committees/task forces etc.)
  • Clear understanding and knowledge of each rehabilitation professional’s standards and current best practice principles
  • Strong working knowledge of MS Office applications
  • Demonstrated communication, conflict resolution and creative problem solving skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, ability to motivate, inspire, and facilitate teamwork
  • A self-starter and initiator
  • Valid Driver's License and access to a car to allow the ability to commute regularly between all three hospital sites (OTMH, MDH and GH) and efficiently manage the competing workload demands
  • Satisfactory performance and attendance record

Position will remain open until filled. Internals who applied need not re-apply.

If you are passionate about what you do, motivated by a job well done, and as committed to excellence, quality and patient satisfaction as we are, we would like to hear from you. Please submit your application via our website at www.haltonhealthcare.com directly to this posting and include a current copy of your resume.

W e thank all those who apply but only those individuals selected for further consideration will be contacted.

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code, Halton Healthcare will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your accommodation needs to ensure your equal participation.

All personal information is collected under the authority of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act.

Halton Healthcare is a smoke free facility in and around all three sites. Smoking is not permitted on hospital properties. We thank everyone who works at or visits our hospitals for respecting this healthy initiative. We are also a scent-free environment for all employees and visitors to accommodate individuals’ health concerns arising from exposure to scented products. We ask for everyone's cooperation in our efforts to accommodate health concerns

title: Professional Home Cleaner
description:
About the Housecleaner position

We're a successful maid service company looking for people who enjoy cleaning, like working in a fun team-based environment, who take pride in a job well done and love receiving lots of positive inspiring feedback from management and clients!

We offer:

· Pay up to $22/hr + TIPS

· Paid training

· Performance bonuses

· Flexible weekday hours - no nights/weekends!

· Full and part-time positions - perfect for moms!

· Weekly pay

If you have never done team cleaning before, here is how it works:

· We train you on our cleaning methods and so prior experience is not required

· We clean in teams of two people

· A team of two people would typically clean three - four homes in a day

· You need to have a car

· When you start working here we will assign you a partner.

· Travel to our equally awesome and very appreciative clients' homes -- usually your end time depends on how big the homes are, how many people are on your team and how long it has been since the client last had their home cleaned by us

· Next Day: Get lots of terrific feedback for the amazing job you did the day before, and do it again!

Job Requirements:

· Must have own vehicle, driver's license and insurance (for driver's position)

· (For non-driver position - no vehicle necessary)

· Hard working and reliable with a great attitude

· Able to work weekday hours Monday to Friday

· Must be willing to provide a recent police check upon hiring

Candidates to live in Mississauga, Toronto

Please Note: The position available requires a vehicle, so please be sure to mention in your reply if you have a vehicle.

If you don't have a car, feel free to apply to be considered for a non-driver role.

title: Detailer (Audi Niagara)
description:
Drive for Excellence

Delivering top tier service for over four decades, Audi Niagara is an award winning team who believes in a personalized guest experience. We offer a first-class sales and service consultation while maintaining our commitment to supporting local communities across Niagara.

Part of the Performance Auto Group, a leading automotive group, we are committed to integrity, believe in employee empowerment, passionate about innovating, care about a great guest experience and giving back.

Audi Niagara is currently seeking a team oriented, hard working individual to join their exceptional team as an Detailer. The ideal candidates will have passion for all things automotive, high attention to detail, strong work ethics and a willingness to learn and succeed. This position will mainly be responsible for maintaining the exteriors and the interiors of the vehicle. Automotive detailing experience is preferred.

About you.

You will shine in our friendly and guest focused environment. At Audi Niagara, we work hard as a team to achieve our individual and team goals. You are positive, welcome others with a smile and want to grow in the retail automotive industry. We look forward to having you on board!

Here’s what you’ll deliver:

  • Prepare new and pre-owned vehicles for customer deliveries.
  • Detail the interior and exterior of all inventory and sold vehicles.
  • Perform rustproofing, undercoating, paint protection and fabric protection.
  • Use the buffer to polish vehicles as required.
  • Maintain the detailing equipment.
  • Organize and prepare rental vehicles.
  • Treat every vehicle as if it were your own.
  • Other duties as assigned by the Service Manager.

What you need to succeed:

  • Minimum one year automotive detailer experience. 
  • Experienced in providing exceptional customer service.
  • High attention to detail
  • Team oriented, adaptable, with a positive attitude.
  • A proven self-starter with excellent attention to detail. 
  • Must have at least a valid Ontario Class 'G' driver's licence with a clean driving record.
  • Must have a non-skid/safety shoes.
  • Must be available to work Saturday rotating shifts.

What’s in it for you

  • Excellent management support and guidance
  • Opportunities through our Internal career mobility program
  • Access to health, dental and vision insurance
  • Disability, critical illness and life insurance for the unexpected
  • Our Employee Assistance Plan (EAP) for you and your family's wellness
  • Discount on vehicles, service and parts for you and your family
  • Discounts to retailers and service providers across the country
  • Free and engaging employee events 
  • Did we mention we love giving back to our communities?!
Performance Auto Group is a leading automotive company in Southern Ontario with over 1800 employees, 22 brands and 30 locations in Brampton, Brantford, Bolton, Grimsby, Mississauga, Oakville, Orangeville, St. Catharines and Toronto. Performance Auto Group also includes AutoPlanet Direct, Ontario's largest indoor used car showroom. 

Performance Auto Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. In keeping with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, accommodations are available for all parts of the recruitment and selection process. Applicants may request any accommodation needs required.

No Phone Calls please. We thank all applicants, however only those contacted for an interview will be considered.

title: Electrical Engineer
description:
Flex-N-Gate is a leading manufacturer and supplier of components for the automotive industry, recently ranked 10th of the 150 Top North American Suppliers in “Automotive News.” A growing and vital company, Flex-N-Gate provides a great opportunity for hard-working and skilled individuals.


Electronic Engineer develops electronics to support automotive exterior lighting.


  • Design, develop, characterize, optimize, validate, release and launch automotive lighting electronic products.
  • Develop electronic quotes and schematics for new program pursuits.
  • Develop specifications for LED lighting, HID lighting, wiring harnesses, stepper motors, communications (such as LIN and CAN) and other electrical and electronic components in exterior lighting.
  • Build knowledge base for latest technology in lighting devices and drivers and automotive regulations / requirements.  Drive re-use of proven, cost effective designs.  Provide Electronic in-house support to manufacturing plant and product engineering team
  • Communicate and interface with OEM customers—presentations, design reviews, e-mails.

  • ElectronicDesign Experience – 5 years with MS, 10 years with BSEE (automotive electronics preferred).  Understands DFMEAs, DVP&Rs, reliability requirements and quality design and robust validation testing.
  • Cost effective electronic application designer.  Experienced in circuit design and simulation in Pspice and Altium or equivalent systems.  Switching power supplies (Buck/Boost), linear power regulation and LED design development and application skills preferred.
  • Worst Case Circuit Analysis (Using MathCAD or equivalent) 
  • EMC circuit design robustness and testing requirements for automotive products.
  • Embedded microcontroller application designer using C or C++.  CAN and/or LIN buss programming ability a plus.
  • Electronics design for manufacturability practices.
  • Circuit thermal analysis, with CAD experience
  • Electronics Project Manager, overseeing, leading, and directing simultaneous projects. Integrates OEM requirements into design while managing both supplier and OEM expectations.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills
  • Works well in cross-functional teams

• Medical, dental, prescription, vision, life and disability insurance
• RRSP retirement savings plan
• Extensive safety training, new hire orientation, continuous learning and development programs and tuition reimbursement
• Paid holidays and vacation time

What do our employees have to say?
“It engages you professionally, and provides learning opportunities.”
“Lots of growth opportunity.”
“The company’s young enough to be exciting, but old enough to be stable.”
Not just a job—a great place to work!
 

Flex-N-Gate is an equal opportunity employer.   Ontario Human Rights Code and AODA.

title: Automotive Sales, Yellowknife, NWT (AY)
description:
Automotive Sales, Yellowknife, NWT (AY)
LOCATION
  • Yellowknife, NWT
  • Domestic
REQUIREMENTS
  • Min: 5 Years Automotive recent sale experience
  • MIN: 5 Years Domestic Brand Experience
  • Ensuring the customer’s complete satisfaction
  • Greeting customers, building rapport and responding to inquiries
  • Matching the right vehicle to their needs
  • Maintaining thorough and accurate customer records and communications history
  • Prospecting in the community, building previous customer contacts and developing buyer relationships
  • Learning and understanding each customer’s needs and interests
  • Understanding our products’ characteristics, capabilities, features and benefits
  • Second nature for prospecting, cold calling and closing a deal
  • Must have a valid driver's licence
  • Demonstrating product features, benefits and conducting test drives
  • Presenting pricing options
  • Addressing and overcoming objections
  • Explaining warranties and services
  • Committing to on-going professional development
  • Providing sales management with sales activity reports
  • Achieving sales goals
  • Delivering the vehicle
PAY
  • Base Salary PLUS commission
  • Expect to earn over $100,000 - $160,000/ year
  • 2 weeks vacation after 1st year
  • Benefits after 90 Days
  • Relocation subsidy available
ADDITIONAL INFO:

When you apply for this position you give the Recruiting Room permission to share your information with other team members and our network of employers.You further acknowledge that the Recruiting Room is a free service to all candidates and as such, furtheragree to indemnify and hold harmless Recruiting Room from any allegations, claims, actions, suits, demands, damages, liabilities, obligations, losses, settlements, judgments, costs and expenses (including without limitation attorneys’ fees and costs) that result from the sharing of this data.

You further acknowledge, and give consent, for the Recruiting Room to check your previous employers (to make a hiring decision), if you fail to provide references before the point of offer.We only ask questions that are “reasonably required,” for our employers to assess the applicant’s fitness for the job.We DO NOT contact current employers.

You further acknowledge, by applying for this position, you allow the Recruiting Room, and its agents, to contact you via SMS Messaging (texting), Facebook, Instagram or any other forms of social networking.

title: Manager, Continuous Improvement
description:
JOB TITLE: Manager, Continuous Improvement

START DATE: As soon as possible

STATUS: Permanent, Full-Time

REPORTS TO: Director, Quality and Risk Management

LOCATION: Home and Community Care Support Services – Waterloo Wellington 

COMPETITION NO.: 21-A-05

PRIMARY PURPOSE

As a member of the Continuous Improvement team, this position is responsible for the planning, implementation and management of projects to support strategic and business goals. This position provides leadership and direction in the development, implementation and evaluation of a variety of organizational projects, with a focus on both knowledge management and relationship management.

As a Project Manager, you will work with project sponsors and process owners to complete project plans, establish the team and ensure that there is active communication and engagement of the project sponsor throughout the project lifecycle. You will incorporate Lean Six Sigma principles and concepts into project planning and implementation and utilize Project Management theory and technology to support implementation of projects.

 

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES AREAS

  • Prepares and keeps current master project plans as well as sub-project plans for monitoring and tracking the requirements, and stays abreast of changes to the requirements
  • Creates, manages, maintains and updates schedules in a complex project environment
  • Performs critical path analysis and develops timelines for completion of tasks, measuring the deliverable work packages of the project against the project plan
  • Updates master and sub-project plans with new information as changes occur. Monitors dependencies affected by changes
  • Develops detailed project plans (with all tasks, durations, resources, etc.) from concept through completion for approved projects with all the interacting departments
  • Identifies resource availability internally or secures external resources for specific projects/tasks
  • Communicates and publishes plans to appropriate involved individuals to ensure each person understands the overall scope of the project and when tasks are initiated and completed
  • Supports the preparation of progress reports, standardized reporting procedure and the monitoring of overall project performance
  • Estimates labour requirements, required project equipment, supplies, contracted services, costs, prepare cost estimates and monitor expenditures
  • Supports quantitative risk assessments; provide inputs and analysis for prediction of project cost and resource risk
  • Supports other analysis as required
  • Other duties as assigned.

Patient Safety

  • Promotes patient safety in alignment with the Vision, Mission, Values and Strategic Directions of Home and Community Care Support Services
  • Works within the basic principles of patient safety by doing the right thing for the right client, using the right method at the right time
  • Adheres to Home and Community Care Support Services patient safety policies and procedures.

POSITION REQUIREMENTS

Education

  • A university degree, MBA would be an asset
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) designation or trained in the principles of Lean Six Sigma Improvement methodology and certified at the Black Belt level.

 

Preferred Experience

  • Minimum 5 years of demonstrable experience as a professional project manager from initiation to completion
  • Experience in a service industry or healthcare environment is preferred
  • Must have valid driver’s license and car to travel between branches and other sites.

 

Skills and Competencies

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and ability to communicate well at all levels of the organization
  • Knowledge of and competency in project management theory and processes, including planning tasks and allocating resources, risk management, issues management, time management, financial management, change management, working in teams, quality management, monitoring and reporting, documentation and record keeping
  • Ability to plan and facilitate meetings
  • Strategic, conceptual analytical thinking and decision making skills
  • Adaptability and flexibility including ability to manage deadline pressure, ambiguity and change
  • Negotiating skills within a context of political sensitivity and conflicting interests
  • Well-developed presentation and written communication skills
  • Well-developed consulting skills and demonstrated understanding of range of consulting roles
  • Ability to consult or provide guidance on complex matters to non-specialists; ability to communicate effectively with senior management
  • Extensive knowledge of project management methodology
  • Ability to build a team and generate a spirit of cooperation while coordinating diverse activities and groups; people management and negotiating skills within a team environment
  • Proficient in MS Office including Project, Excel, Visio, Minitab would be an asset.

Physical and Sensory Demands

  • Minimal demands typical of a support position operating within an office environment.

 

Working Environment

  • Minimal exposure to disagreeable conditions typical of an office position exposed to stress and pressure associated with multiple priorities and deadlines.

 

Home and Community Care Support Services Waterloo Wellington strives to create a respectful, accessible and inclusive work environment.  Upon individual request, hiring processes will be modified to remove barriers to accommodate those with disabilities.  Should any applicant require accommodation through the application, interview or selection processes, please contact Human Resources at

hr.ww@lhins.on.ca

for assistance. 

 

If you are interested in this position, please submit a cover letter, along with a detailed resume, outlining how your skills, qualifications and experience meet the position requirements, quoting competition #21-A-05 before midnight on Thursday, May 20, 2021 to Human Resources (e-mail:

hr.ww@lhins.on.ca

). We thank all applicants in advance; however, we will be communicating only with those selected for an interview.

 

*** PLEASE NOTE*** Cover letters and resumes need to be submitted as a single file, acceptable files are: doc, docx, and pdf. Please include your first name, last name and job title in the file name when applying, example JohnSmith_Recruiter.

 

HOME AND COMMUNITY CARE SUPPORT SERVICES WATERLOO WELLINGTON IS COMMITTED TO THE PRINCIPLES OF EMPLOYMENT EQUITY

title: Live-in Caregiver - Vancouver Area
company: Always Best Care Senior Services - North Vancouver, BC
description:
Job Description Always Best Care Senior Services, North Vancouver We are currently hiring experienced female Caregivers in the Vancouver area. A car is preferred. Do you enjoy helping others? Are you caring and compassionate? If yes, then this is the perfect job for you! Since 1996, ABC has helped thousands of families with non-medical in-home care. Our passion for helping people maintain a safe, independent and dignified lifestyle represents the strong foundation of ABC. Every client receives extraordinary care in a friendly environment with caring and compassionate people. Here at ABC we are a family and that is how you will be treated. Our Caregivers are the backbone of our business, providing much-needed service to seniors and their families who struggle to keep their independence on a daily basis. Our Caregivers are compassionate, caring, dependable, professional, honest, flexible, problem-solvers, possess positive attitudes and are of course loving. To those we serve, our Caregivers represent who we are and what we stand for. From basic companion care (which includes, but is not limited to light housekeeping, sitter care, transportation, meal preparation, etc.) to more integral personal care (which includes, but is not limited to incontinence care, transferring, dressing and bathing, etc.), our Caregivers provide a wide range of services. They also may work a variety of shifts, from 1-24 hours (live-in), over weekends, at night, in the morning, etc. Desired Skills and Experience: At least one year of experience working with seniors in a home setting Proof of eligibility to work in Canada Valid driver's license and own transportation; proof of current Autoplan insurance English proficiency and excellent communication skills Two references required Must be able to pass a background check Health Care Assistant Certificate (HCA), Home Support Worker Certificate (HSW) would be an asset A valid criminal record check Some benefits of becoming a Caregiver with us are: Flex Schedules (Part-Time & Full-Time) Ongoing, professional training A career that is filled with both personal and professional satisfaction Flexible territories Great support from our team Employment Benefits (Dental, Prescription drugs, Vision care & etc. for employees and family members) Worksafe BC Coverage, EI and CPP contributions Direct deposit of salary every 2 weeks We care for our employees as we care for our clientsCaregivers are essential to our clients

Responsibilities
  • Companionship,meal prep, personal care, housekeeping

Qualifications
  • Health Care Aide certificate or Home Support Worker Certificate with at least 1 years experience working with seniors in their home.
skills: ['Health Care Aide certificate or Home Support Worker Certificate with at least 1 years experience working with seniors in their home.', 'Companionship,meal prep, personal care, housekeeping']

title: Account Manager
description:
Account Manager

The company is a very successful distributor and manufacturer. They supply some of the largest facilities, properties and private label brands across North America. They are also a division of a much larger brand of companies.

This is a full-time remote/work-from-home position, with exceptional benefits as well as an opportunity to become an important part of a rapidly growing Canadian Owned and Operated company. It is also expected that you will visit clients in person, so travel is required, as is a full license and outside sales experience.

This position is supported with a comprehensive on-boarding, training and mentoring program, designed to help you make an immediate impact on growing your sales and gross margins.

The best news? This opportunity is available due to growth! We are hiring for this role to replace someone that has been promoted into a management role with the company.


Minimum requirements to be considered for this opportunity include:
  • Minimum 3-5 years of experience of successful B2B account sales experience, including both prospecting and nurturing accounts
  • Field sales experience, including planning and execution of business calls, meetings and follow ups
  • Good knowledge of the GTHA
  • Proof of Covid-19 vaccination
  • Clear criminal back check
  • Drivers License, for travel purposes


Job description & Responsibilities:
  • Identifying, qualifying, prospecting, and selling to new customers
  • Introducing and selling product innovation to existing and new customers
  • Farming existing portfolio - work with customers to better understand their business needs and objectives.
  • Execute strategic plans to meet your quarterly sales targets
  • Work with suppliers and align expectations and objectives with company’s strategic objectives and customer demand
  • Lead, train and motivate staff to improve sales growth and customer service with clients
  • Develop long lasting rapport with customers to grow loyalty
  • You own your customer price - assess costs, competition, and supply and demand to identify selling prices
  • Accurately forecast future sales to adapt to constantly shifting marketplace
  • Stays well-informed of current industry trends and new technology through professional associations, trade journals, networking, and associated training and seminars
  • Pro-actively solving business problems that prevent us from achieving our sales targets

Candidate Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in an outside sales capacity
  • A minimum of 3-5 years’ experience in a B2B sales or account manager role, selling sales and services
  • In-depth knowledge of marketing techniques and best practices
  • Proficient with Microsoft office suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
  • Capacity to manage various projects and work to tight deadlines
  • Excellent negotiation and leadership skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Proven ability to be able to interact with senior executives
  • Travel may be required with this position including overnight stays which would be approved and covered as a company expense

What is in it for you?
  • Excellent compensation package
  • Commission, based on target achievement
  • You will inherit a current book of business, you are not starting from scratch!
  • Car Allowance
  • Benefits Package
  • Vacation Package
  • RRSP / DPSP matching program
  • All other business-related expenses
  • 407 ETR Transponder

COVID-19 considerations:
  • Proof of Vaccination is required (Covid-19) - No exceptions 
  • Social Distancing
  • Work from home
  • Masking
  • Minimal contact with in-office (meetings held virtually as much as possible

title: Manufacturing Supervisor
description:
Overview:

Flex-N-Gate is a leading manufacturer and supplier of components for the automotive industry, recently ranked 10th of the 150 Top North American Suppliers in â€œAutomotive News.â€ A growing and vital company, Flex-N-Gate provides a great opportunity for hard-working and skilled individuals.

Scope of the Position:

The Manufacturing Supervisor is responsible for supervising operations to ensure production is operating in a safe, efficient, and timely manner. Responsible for productions schedules and posting of daily work assignments based upon production needs and individual strengths. Must be shop floor orientated and provide â€œhands-onâ€ product/process support for all reports on a daily basis. This individual will be the driver behind product/process safety, quality, delivery and morale. Accountable for continuous improvement of assigned department as well as training and development of direct reports.

Responsibilities:
  • All work must be performed in a safe, efficient manner in compliance with Company Policy, Local, Provincial and/or Federal rules and regulations and if applicable Collective Agreement.
  • Communicates, trains, guides and coaches employees to achieve operational initiatives that optimize team efforts in the manufacturing of high quality products.
  • Evaluates interpersonal skills, provides feedback and recommends as well as methods to improve interpersonal communications.
  • Schedules and assigns personnel to work according to the demand of the manufacturing schedules.
  • Continually assesses the limitations of equipment capacity and materials supply to directly make adjustments to personal for optimization of manufacturing output.
  • Assesses each employeeâ€™s abilities and skills to match with capabilities required for each area of the manufacturing floor.
  • Continuously monitors and tracks output, manufacturing processes, labour efficiencies, direct operating expenses and quality indicators for assigned cost centers.
  • Measures performance and quality.
  • Drives positive results in operational Key Process Indicators.
  • Establishes and builds working relationships with other departmental personnel, such as Maintenance, Engineering, Finance, Planning and Quality to meet production schedules.
  • Meets regularly on a formal basis with Management Team to review production results and improvement priorities.
  • Performs other related tasks as assigned.
Qualifications:
  • 1 to 3 yearsâ€™ related work experience
  • Knowledge of Occupational Health and Safety Act, and Labour Laws.
  • Conflict Resolution Management and Time Management.
  • Strong communication, presentation, organizational, problem solving, teamwork interpersonal and leadership skills.
  • Proficient computer skills.
  • Effective use of technology, instruments, tools and information systems.
  • Ability to seek a team approach.
  • Ability to give guidance and direction as required.
  • Ability to set direction, make decisions and oversee the line with little to no direct supervision.
  • Solid computer proficiency and knowledge of Microsoft Office software suite.
  • Availability to support/operate on off shifts as required.
  • Ability to deliver business results both independently and through others.
Benefits:

â€¢ Medical, dental, prescription, vision, life and disability insurance
â€¢ RRSP retirement savings plan
â€¢ Extensive safety training, new hire orientation, continuous learning and development programs and tuition reimbursement
â€¢ Paid holidays and vacation time

What do our employees have to say?
â€œIt engages you professionally, and provides learning opportunities.â€
â€œLots of growth opportunity.â€
â€œThe companyâ€™s young enough to be exciting, but old enough to be stable.â€
Not just a jobâ€”a great place to work!
 

Flex-N-Gate is an equal opportunity employer.     Ontario Human Rights Code and AODA.

title: Sales/Designer
description:
DO YOU ENJOY HELPING PEOPLE GET ORGANIZED?

Closets by Design is hiring designers/sales representatives in DURHAM REGION, ON :

Pickering, Ajax ,Whitby ,Oshawa ,Courtice, Bowmanville, Clarington, Uxbridge, Sunderland, Brock ,Scugog, Beaverton, Port Perry.

Are you a “people person?”

Are you creative, with good communication skills and like helping people?

You can help others organize their home. As a Closets by Design Designer, you can enjoy the flexibility of working .

We provide:

  • pre-set appointments with nice people just like you, close to your home.
  • You will receive complete sales and design training, so no experience is necessary.
  • We are looking for people who have:
  • Great people skills Fun and outgoing personalities
  • A creative side Have a car Can work 12 days per month full time hours on weekdays and two Saturday mornings per month.
  • Live in , (Scarborough, or Durham Region) 
  • Sales background Interior Design background would be considered

An asset Earn $2500 - $5000 in commission and bonuses per month

We offer the following:

  • No Cold Calling; pre-set appointments
  • Product and sales training provided Excellent marketing materials
  • Great support from management Work out of the office
  • Flexible Schedule (daytime hours, from 3-4 days per week and up)
  • Ability to thrive in a full commission/bonus sales environment

Call now at 416-712-7171 and join a fun and rewarding team.

Required license or certification:

  • Drivers License

Job Type:

  • Full-time, Part-time, Permanent Salary: $2,500.00-$5,000.00 per month

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Overview:

Enterprise Holdings is not only is the worldâ€™s largest car rental operator, but also an industry leader in mobility technology as well as one of the top global travel companies, ranking ahead of many airlines and most cruise lines, hotels, tour operators and online travel agencies. And no matter what transportation challenges our customers face, we have an innovative  solution.

Enterprise Holdings operates the Enterprise Rent-A-Car, National Car Rental and Alamo Rent A Car brands via more than 10,000 fully staffed neighborhood and airport offices in 100 countries and territories. Every year, these branch offices collectively handle more than 70 million consumer transactions worldwide and spend millions of dollars with local dealerships and vendors.

We are excited to announce an opening for an Administrative Assistant position based out of our British Columbia Headquarters in Surrey, BC. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who is extremely organized, detail-oriented, and highly cognizant of the importance of maintaining confidentiality.

The Administrative Assistant will provide clerical and administrative support for  the General Manager and Group Rental Manager (file, mail distribution, data entry, copy tasks and basic business correspondence).

 

This is a full time position working Monday to Friday, 8:00am to 5:00pm.

 

Location: 13160 88 AVE SURREY, BC V3W 3K3

 

Responsibilities:

Responsibilities:

  • Preparation/organization of miscellaneous meetings and Group events
  • Arrange lodging, air, ground transportation for Management and Department Personnel as needed for various meetings  
  • Event  planning and vendor negotiations for meetings and events  
  • Handling of customer  and account inquiries
  • Preparation of daily, weekly, and monthly reports & analysis
  • Office management and supply ordering and distribution
  • Maintain the filing system in an accurate, systematic and timely manner
  • Maintain confidentiality and security of all activities and records
  • General administrative duties and   various miscellaneous tasks
Qualifications:

Qualifications:

  • Must be at least 18 years old
  • 2-year College Diploma or 4-year Bachelorâ€™s Degree required
  • Must have Advanced Level of Proficiency with Excel, Word, PowerPoint and  Outlook
  • Must have 1 year of administrative experience
  • Must have 1 year of customer service experience
  • Must be authorized to work in Canada and not require work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future.
  • No drug or alcohol related convictions on driving record (DWI/DUI)  in past 5 years
  • Must have a valid BC class 5 driver's license with no more than two chargeable moving violations or accidents within the last three years.  

Qualified Candidates must also possess the following knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

  • Strong organizational and time management skills
  • Effective verbal and interpersonal communication skills
  • Excellent written communication skills
  • Strong negotiation skills
  • Dependable and self-motivated
  • Ability to prioritize, follow-up, multi-task and meet assigned deadlines
  • Comfortable working independently and in a team environment

title: Infotainment and Connected Services Team Lead - Intermediate - PSP - EC1294
description:
Job Description
Description:
  • The Infotainment and Connected Services Team Lead will be responsible for overseeing, participating in and performing, but not limited to, the following tasks:
  • Leading a team of Infotainment and Connected Services Validation and Integration Engineers.
  • Coordinating tasks with team and assigning day-to-day tasks to a group of integration and validation engineers.
  • Analyzing business, user and system requirements to determine optimal solutions.
  • Preparing project plan detailing scope of work and timeline and obtaining approval from required parties.
  • Defining and coordinating Validation projects.
  • Creating timelines, launch criteria, and RASICs (assigning Responsible, Approving, Supporting, Informed and Consulted team members for each task). Identifying risks. Ensuring test case creation.
  • Ensuring that DVP&R (Design Verification Plan & Report) is accurate.
  • Ensuring that systems and components are ordered for all applicable vehicles.
  • Determining amount of effort required for each task.
  • Preparing technical documents for system integration.
  • Support design and implementation of tools to support the development, Integration and validation of infotainment, telematics and applications across functions areas such as: CAN / Cellular Networks / QNX / Linux / HMI emulators.
  • Testing and assuring the quality of all features developed through automated test scripts, unit testing, regression testing, user acceptance testing, etc.
  • Conducting root cause analysis to isolate problems in the system and determine solutions.
  • Maintaining list of problems and solutions through: Defect creation / Clarification / Re-testing / Verification / Resolution of open issues.
  • Providing technical support to other team members, as necessary.
  • Preparing and presenting reports and participating in-group meetings.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/IT or Engineering degree
  • 4+ years of experience in Embedded Testing is required– Must be relevant work experience (will not consider internships or coops as part of that experience).
  • 3+ years of experience with CAN
  • Linux/QNX/Command Line and/or Telnet
  • Test case writing
  • Ticket/defect managementexperience
  • Excellent problem solving skills and able to think quickly and adeptly about how ot effectively address issues, implement effective risk mitigation plans
  • Strong communication skills (both written and verbal)
  • Fast Learner, clear, concise, precise communication skills both oral and written
  • Ability to discern what issues need management escalation and when.
  • Able to lead project teams, fostering team cooperation
Preferred Requirements:
  • Experience with CAPL
  • Experience and knowledge of cutting edge technologies
  • In-vehicle Connected Vehicle Application experience(i.e. cloud/SDP)
  • Master's degree in Computer Science/IT or Engineering degree
  • 1+ year leading a team
Travel and Driving Notes:
  • Will be required to drive a company car. A valid driver's license as well as a clean driving record.
  • Will be required to travel domestically up to 20%.
  • Proof of Covid Vaccination will be required
  • Onsite (at ARDC) with some travel to the US for meetings.
