title: Delivery Driver
description:
Delivery Driver
Salary:$20.50/hour
Shift: Monday-Friday (Early Start Times). NO WEEKENDS!!
Perks: Hourly increase possible after 60 days, 6 months, & 1 year. **$1,000 sign-on bonus!** (Paid out as $500 after 6 months & $500 after 12 months of continuous employment as a full-time employee)!

What can Keystone Automotive Operations do for YOU?
KAO provides its employees with more than a job;we provide them with a career. Our company believes in offering its employees the opportunity tolearnandgrowusingcompetitive training programs, coaching, communication, and collaboration.This empowers our employees, further allowing them to pursue both functional and upward mobility within the company. Keystone Automotive Operations also offers:
  • Company paid training
  • Company provided uniforms & steel toe footwear
  • Medical, Dental, & Vision Insurance available
  • RSP (Retirement Savings Plan)
  • Paid Company Holidays, Paid Time Off
  • Tuition Reimbursement for Employees
  • Employee Discounts
  • And More!

Who is Keystone Automotive Operations?
We are the leading distributor of specialty automotive and RV aftermarket parts and accessories, and we have developed a culture of family that has allowed our business to grow across the globe.

With our more than 2,000 employees, we strive to reflect this culture by living our values ofCommitment, Customer Service, Execution, Integrity, Leadership, Teamwork, & Fun. Through these values, we’ve been able to provide our employees with the tools they need to succeed. That’s because when you succeed, we succeed at our goal ofdelivering the products that people need when they need them!

Your Role with Keystone Automotive Operations
Keystone Automotive Operations, Inc. is currently looking to hire Delivery Drivers for our Lethbridge, ABlocation. Our drivers provide a face-to-face delivery service to our customers. In addition to our full-time schedule & excellent benefits, our delivery vehicles are equipped with heat, A/C, and are regularly maintained!

Responsibilities Include:
  • Having fun while being safe!
  • Driving company vehicles in a responsible manner.
  • Delivering invoiced product to our customers.
  • Accurately and carefully loading & unloading product.
  • Providing excellent customer service.
  • Communicating well with team members and management.
  • Maintaining a clean, professional appearance.
Basic Qualifications:
  • Must be 21 years of age or older
  • At least 6 months experience driving 15 ft (or bigger) box truck
  • No motor vehicle violations in the last 24 months
  • Ability to lift up to 75 lbs.

title: Driver
description:
Overview:

Enterprise Holdings, operating the National, Enterprise, and Alamo car rental brands is looking for a driver to join our amazing team!  Enterprise Holdings is the largest and fastest growing privately owned automotive rental and leasing company in the  North America.    

 

The Driver delivers vehicles and in some instances, customers, employees or vendors safely and timely to the appropriate destination(s) while giving helpful, courteous and professional customer service.

 

This Position is Part Time and Pays $13.20 / hour

 

Branch Location: 12 Maple Valley Road, Corner Brook NL A2H 3C2

 

Schedules: SHIFT WORK (on call)- up to 20 hours per week

  • Shifts available Monday-Friday 7am-6pm

 

Responsibilities:

The Part Time Driver is responsible for the transporting of fleet cars and vans to and from rental locations, as well as navigating written directions.

  • Drive and deliver vehicles locally or out of area as needed, following all rules of the road
  • Deliver customers and vehicles to appropriate destination in a safe and courteous manner
  • Ride with or follow another driver to drop off vehicle(s) or pick up multiple vehicles
  • Organize travel route and ensure vehicle paperwork is accurate and timely
  • May need to communicate via 2-way radio or cellular phone
  • May be asked to clean vehicle and/or keep bus clean during shift
  • May be asked to assist customer(s) with directions, car options and basic policy/procedures
  • May be asked to assist customer(s) load and unload luggage, enter and exit vehicle and miscellaneous customer needs
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned
Qualifications:
  • Must be at least 18 years of age
  • Must have a valid driver's license with no more than 2 moving violations and/or at-fault accidents on driving record in the past 3 years
  • No drug or alcohol related convictions on driving record (DWI/DUI) or criminal record within the last 5 years  
  • Must be able to lift 30 lb. in order to assist customers
  • Must be authorized to work in Canada and not require work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future.
  • As per governement mandate, all employees on-site are required to be fully vaccinated per Vaccination Requirement, subject only to limited exceptions mandated by legislation.

title: Forklift Driver
description:
Check this out! WE are hiring for a Licensed Forklift Driver on Royal Windsor Dr, Mississauga to start next week! Check out this urgent walkie/forklift driver opportunity in a great automotive manufacturing warehouse.

Are you a Walkie / Forklift Driver ready to step up in a great manufacturing company? Have you been looking for a Forklift opportunity for a long time? This is the time for you to join the team at one of Canada’s leading automotive manufacturers in Mississauga! This is your chance to work for a forward-thinking manufacturing company that puts employees first. This is a great opportunity for Pump Trucks/Walkie Drivers who are looking for an opportunity for career growth and advancement. We’re looking for experienced Walkie Operators, ideally with a background in the automotive manufacturing industry. If you are a Licensed Forklift / Walkie Operator and is looking for a long term career, we have a great opportunity for you! Our Client is looking for a candidate to start immediately.

Job Title: Licensed Walkie or Forklift Driver

Warehouse Location:
Winston Churchill & Royal Windsor Drive (Mississauga)

Shifts Available:
Afternoon: 2:30pm - 10:30pm (Monday - Friday)

Pay Rate:
$18.75
*$.50 premium is added after 4 months = $19.25ph

RESPONSIBILITIES
- Operating the Pump Truck/ Walkie
- Order-picking, shipping and receiving with the RF scanner
- Handling automotive parts
- Sorting
- Put-away
- Loading and offloading
- Lifting up to 30lbs

Reach us at meryrose.acero@randstad.ca or text " Forklift Mississauga " at 437 326 6034


Mery


Advantages
-Opportunity to work with a world class Manufacturing company
-Competitive pay (including 4% vacation pay)
-Paid breaks
-Full time opportunity
-Great benefits
-Monday - Friday working
-Cooperative and inclusive culture
-Training & Development opportunities

Responsibilities
- Operating the walkie and counterbalance
- Order-picking, shipping and receiving with the RF scanner
- Handling automotive parts
- Sorting
- Put-away
- Loading and offloading
- Lifting up to 30 lbs


Qualifications
- 6 months of forklift experience
- 6 months manufacturing experience
- comfortable lifting up to 30lbs (not continuously)
- must be eligible to work in Canada

Summary
Pallet Jack Operator
Straight Day shift
Mississauga location
Contract to hire role


If you meet the qualifications, APPLY IMMEDIATELY as these position fill fast.
• Email: meryrose.acero@randstad.ca
• Apply through this posting!
• Text "FORKLIFT OPERATOR" to 437 326 6034
• Call 437 326 6034

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Management Trainee
description:
Requisition Number: 93594

Job Description

Cintas is offering a Management Trainee program to college graduates designed to prepare you for your professional life. We have the same goals. You want an exceptional job, and we want a dedicated employee-partner to join our team and lead our company. Cintas is currently seeking a Management Trainee to participate in an extensive, well-structured training program designed to provide a strong knowledge of all aspects of our business. The Management Trainee program combines a series of rotations in various departments and classroom seminars, with the purpose of preparing the individual for a leadership role in the area that maximizes their strengths and career advancement potential. Upon completion of the program, the Management Trainee will be eligible to apply for a position in one of several areas, including but not limited to: Outside Sales, Production/Warehouse Management, Office Management or Service Management. Driving a van/truck or personal car is required in two of the rotations. Our Management Trainee program is available nationwide.

Skills/Qualifications

Required

  • Must have, or will obtain, a Bachelor's degree within six months

Qualified candidates must meet all requirements outlined by the Department of Transportation (DOT) for driving a regulated vehicle weighing more than 10,000 lbs.  In order to comply with DOT requirements, qualified candidates must, prior to their first day of employment:

  • Have an active driver's license
  • Be at least 21 years of age
  • Obtain a DOT medical certification
  • Provide documentation regarding their previous employment

 

Preferred

  • Co-op or internship experience in a Customer Service, Sales, Production or Administrative role
  • A business or otherwise related academic major
  • A leadership/management role on campus or related extracurricular activities
  • Willingness to relocate regionally during, or at the end of, the program

Our employee-partners enjoy:

 

  • Competitive Pay
  • Weekly Pay Cheques
  • RRSP and DPSP Contribution
  • Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance Package
  • Disability & Life Insurance Package
  • Paid Vacation & Holidays
  • Career Advancement Opportunities

 

Headquartered in Cincinnati, Cintas is a publicly held company traded over the Nasdaq Global Select Market under the symbol CTAS and is a component of both the Standard & Poor’s 500 Index and Nasdaq-100 Index.

Cintas Corporation helps more than 900,000 businesses of all types and sizes get READY™ to open their doors with confidence every day by providing a wide range of products and services that enhance our customers’ image and help keep their facilities and employees clean, safe and looking their best. With products and services including uniforms, mats, mops, restroom supplies, first aid and safety products, fire extinguishers and testing, and safety and compliance training, Cintas helps customers get Ready for the Workday®.

To support our growth across North America, we’re seeking driven professionals with ambition to move up within our company. Our professional culture, our dedication to our employee-partners and limitless career opportunities—these are just a few benefits we’re proud to offer. Our employee-partners know every job is critical, and that teamwork drives innovation. Let’s talk about how you’ll fit into our team and how your hard work will be recognized through competitive pay, world-class benefits and ongoing career development. Are you Ready™ for limitless opportunities at Cintas?

In accordance with applicable laws (including human rights and accessibility legislation), accommodations will be provided in all parts of the hiring process. Applicants are required to make their needs known in advance.



Job Category: Service 
Organization: Rental
Employee Status: Regular
Schedule: Full Time
Shift: 1st Shift

title: Drivers - AMA Service Vehicle (Tow Truck) Operator
description:
AMA:

PART PROBLEM SOLVER.PART MECHANIC.

ALL superhero.

 

 

Posted: 2022-05-02

Closing: Until Filled

Location: Calgary Service Centre

 

Our AMA brand is important to us and we set the bar for the towing industry.   Safety, using the best towing equipment available, and providing a first-class member experience are the hallmarks of working for AMA.

AMA leads the towing industry in compensation providing a competitive base salary and an incentive compensation program for our drivers.   In addition to this, AMA offers a flexible benefit plan and company provided uniforms and moreâ€¦  

 

We are hiring for ;

  • Full-Time Seasonal (Hourly) roles are 6-months in length.
  • Auxiliary (Hourly) employees typically work weekends, as well as weekdays as per availability.
  • Regular Part-Time (Hourly) employees work a minimum of 21 hours per  week providing coverage over weekend and weekday shifts, with the opportunity for additional hours and overtime.    

Successful candidates will be trained on standard tow truck operation and required to work rotational 8-hour shifts, Monday through Sunday (including holidays), between the hours of 5:30am and midnight.

 

 

ABOUT YOU

Youâ€™re one of those amazing people who goes out of their way to help others. Helping a young mother with a baby stroller up the stairs or carrying groceries inside for an elderly person is just all in a typical day for you. Youâ€™re like an everyday superhero (only without the weird cape). We could use someone with your super powers and passion for helping others. You donâ€™t have to be a top-notch mechanic or have any other special skills â€“ with your willingness to learn, weâ€™ll provide you with all the training youâ€™ll need, along with access to state-of-the-art technology and equipment.

 

WHAT MOVES YOU

  • You love the idea of being able to help people and make a difference in their day â€“ even in a challenging situation.
  • You may not be a mechanic by trade, but you have a knack for the automotive industry and enjoy working with your hands (and donâ€™t mind getting them dirty). You also donâ€™t mind showing off your muscles by doing a bit of lifting now and then.
  • You know how to think on your feet â€“ for you, thereâ€™s nothing more satisfying than solving puzzles and finding creative solutions.
  • You're not a 9-to-5 desk job type of person. You want variety and a job that offers something different each day.
  • You work well on your own but you also enjoy being part of a team.
  • You care about doing things right and your mom is proud of your safety-first attitude.

 

WHAT YOU'LL DO

  • Report to the Fleet Supervisor.
  • Work various shifts (including evenings and weekends) enduring all kinds of Alberta weather.
  • Respond to our members when they need service, minor mechanical assistance or towing.
  • Ensure that AMA vehicles, communication equipment, and tools are kept clean, orderly, and in good working condition.
  • Promote AMA memberships and provide general information about AMA to our members.
  • Stay up-to-date on your knowledge of our communications and operating equipment.
  • Make sure Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) is used and worn at all times.
  • Keep yourself and everyone else safe by ensuring all engineered controls, safe work procedures/ policies, environmental issues, rules and work practices are followed as outlined in the Service Vehicle Operator handbook.

 

WHAT YOU'VE DONE

  • You have a high school diploma.
  • You have a Class 5 driverâ€™s license with fewer than 6 demerit points at any one time and have been driving for at least five years (you'll get bonus points if you have a good grasp of city routes).
  • Youâ€™re able to be licensed for Automotive Lock Bypass
  • You will be able to pass a Canadian Criminal Record Check
  • You're not required to be licensed as an Automotive Service Technician, but it definitely helps!
  • Youâ€™re comfortable working rotational shift work.

 

WHAT YOU'LL GET

  • You'll be provided with all the training needed to become a Service Vehicle Operator by one of our AMA experts.
  • Competitive salary.
  • Benefits options.
  • Great AMA discounts.
  • Unlimited learning opportunities.
  • Vacation earnings.  
  • Floater day (Regular Part-Time).  

 

We thank all applicants for their interest;  however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Automotive Technician (Mobile Tech), Stony Plain, Alberta (AI)
description:
Automotive Technician (Mobile Tech), Stony Plain, Alberta (AI)

LOCATION:
  • Stony Plain, Alberta
Typical Day:

Create your schedule in the company app. You will be receiving jobs  through the app. They will be scheduled within your availability hours with 1 hour intervals in between to allow for travel and other needs. You will be going to the location in the corporate provided van. Doing maintenance service, diagnostic, or repair. Doing the quotes for repairs, Selling those repairs to customers, scheduling those jobs, picking up parts. Communicating with the support team and customers.


REQUIREMENTS:
  • Automotive Journeyman (no apprentices), with a Red Seal Endorsement
  • ANY Brand Experience
  • MUST BE willing to work for yourself and remit your own taxes
  • MUST HAVE, or willing to get your own Business Number with the CRA
  • MUST HAVE, your own tools (financing for tools is available)
  • MUST HAVE, strong Customer Service Skills
  • MUST BE, organized and knows how to manage time
  • MUST HAVE, strong integrity
  • MUST HAVE,  valid Canadian driver’s license
  • No criminal record

PAY: 
  • $40/hr Flat Rate to $50.00/hour WITH Monthly Guarantee ($4,000.00) + performance bonuses (up to $3,000.00/month)
  • Paid Travel Time to and from jobs ($20.00 per job)
  • $5 per job gas relief
  • 8% commission on all parts and labour sold
  • Tips are 100% yours
  • Company provided vehicle you can take home everyday including insurance at a cost of $150.00 bi-weekly
  • Company provided insurance: Liability and WCB
  • Tool subsidy:  Will help finance any tools that you might need
  • Schedule your own hours 
  • Central shop available or use your own (Edmonton and Calgary location)
  • Relocation assistance may be available; if you wish to relocate closer to a coverage area

 


ADDITIONAL INFO 
When you apply for this position you give the Recruiting Room permission to share your information with other team members and our network of employers. You further acknowledge that the Recruiting Room is a free service to all candidates and as such, further agree to indemnify and hold harmless Recruiting Room from any allegations, claims, actions, suits, demands, damages, liabilities, obligations, losses, settlements, judgments, costs and expenses (including without limitation attorneys’ fees and costs) that result from the sharing of this data.
 
You further acknowledge, and give consent, for the Recruiting Room to check your previous employers (to make a hiring decision), if you fail to provide references before the point of offer. We only ask questions that are “reasonably required,” for our employers to assess the applicant’s fitness for the job. We DO NOT contact current employers.

You further acknowledge, by applying for this position, you allow the Recruiting Room, and its agents, to contact you via SMS Messaging (texting), Facebook, Instagram or any other forms of social networking
Click here for our job board

title: Account - Logistics Coordinator
description:
Now Hiring!

ADMINISTRATIVE COORDINATOR

 

At Canada Cartage we work with intelligent and focused leaders who are driven to create an outstanding customer experience in partnership with Canadian leading brands. Canada Cartage is deep rooted in family values with an entrepreneurial culture where ideas are welcomed, growth is fostered and high performance is championed. A recognized thought leader and founded in 1914, Canada Cartage dominates the industry by delivering innovative fleet solutions.

We are currently looking to add a full-time, permanent Admin Coordinator to our team. Someone who is equally passionate about serving the community and achieving operational success alongside our dedicated and loyal employees.

Located in Port Coquitlamand reporting to the Operations Manager,the Admin Coordinator will provide daily administrative support to our team as required with daily operations.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Providing daily support with customer service, both internal and external
  • Ensure customer expectations and service levels are met
  • Working in a time sensitive, fast paced environment as part of a cohesive service driven team
  • Respond to incoming calls and emails
  • Serve as first point of contact for customers; answer incoming calls and emails
  • Daily contact with customers regarding orders, pickups and deliveries
  • Follow up with warehouse staff for outstanding customer paperwork, escalate to Account Coordinator if corrective action required
  • Respond and comply with other tasks, which may be reasonably assigned during the course of and in addition to the completion of normal duties.
  • Daily data entry of paperwork, audit of process, to ensure all information is correct, include attachment of pro bills and trip numbers as required
  • Order entry and customer follow up
  • Administrative support as required with data entry, order entry
  • Other duties as required

 

 

 

 Core Competencies and Qualification:

  • Previous 1-2 years of customer service or transportation experience is an asset
  • Data entry, reporting, administrative experience
  • Customer service experience via phone or email
  • Order entry, order taking and data entry experience
  • Strong communication skills and phone/email etiquette
  • Fast and accurate typing skills
  • Proficient with Excel, Word, Outlook
  • Organized and proactive
  • Ability to thrive in a fast paced environment
  • Must pass a criminal record check; must be bondable

 

Why work for Canada Cartage?

Our Team

We are a family-oriented company with competitive benefits, including extended health and dental, RRSP and Company-Matching pension plans; discounted hotels, car rentals, entertainment, gym memberships, phone plans, electronics, to name a few of the perks; a cohesive team and a positive, hard-working atmosphere. We have fun events throughout the year, like truck rodeos, summer barbeques and driver-appreciation week that regularly bring us together. It’s important to give back to the communities in which we operate, so we volunteer with and donate to local charities

We also have Company wide recognition initiatives designed to recognize drivers and staff when they demonstrate outstanding customer service, teamwork and our core values.

Why do we have one of the lowest driver turn-over rates in Canada?  A team environment, short-haul regular routes and great benefits. Come work with us: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rpMA1riOzPI 

 

Recognized leader in the industry:

Canada Cartage has been recognized on the Forbes list of Canada’s Best Employers 2022. This is the sixth straight year that Canada Cartage has been included on this list. https://www.forbes.com/companies/canada-cartage/?list=canada-best-employers&sh=7841454553d8

The Canada’s Best Employers 2022 title, along with our 6th year of being recognized by Trucking HR as one of Canada’s “Top Fleet Employers” serves to reinforce Canada Cartage’s reputation as an employer of high quality.

Celebrating 100 years: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b3S-CtHQhVY 

 

Our Values

Integrity: We conduct our business with honour, honest and ethics with our people, the environment and legal matters. We believe I being transparent and trustworthy, respecting the traditional “handshake” value system and earning our way in.

Humanity: We are a family minded organization, caring for people and treating them with dignity, decency and respect, be it employees, customers, suppliers or our partners. Open door policy and dealings is our way.

Accountability: Accountability and accessibility to our staff, customers and our customers’ customers is of utmost importance to us. We enable a high level of two way communication, providing access to people who wil deal with issues ad have the willingness to resolve things.  We will be relied on and held accountable for our results and our long term commitments.

Collaboration: We understand that results are the product of a team effort. As part of our process, we ensure collaboration with all our staff at all levels in all roles across departmental lines. With our customers, we use a collaborative style approach, sharing ownership to ensure a successful operation.

Dedication: Our organization is employee and customer-driven. We encourage an environment of conscientious effort and earnestness, hiring problem solvers who are responsive and have a "can-do" attitude to get the job done.

Leadership: Personal leadership to us means being competent, taking ownership, demonstrating initiative, and having a voice. Corporate leadership to us means being leaders in the market, continuous improvement and innovation, and empowering those around you.https://jobs.jobvite.com/canadacartage

Come work with an industry leader!

 

We would like to thank all those expressing an interest in this position; however only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Committed to employment equity, Canada Cartage Systems LP encourages applications from Aboriginal people, members of visible minority groups, and women.

title: Dispatcher - Day shift
description:
Now Hiring

DISPATCHER – DAYSHIFT

 

At Canada Cartage we work with intelligent and focused leaders who are driven to create an outstanding customer experience in partnership with Canadian leading brands. Canada Cartage is deep rooted in family values with an entrepreneurial culture where ideas are welcomed, growth is fostered and high performance is championed. A recognized thought leader and founded in 1914, Canada Cartage dominates the industry by delivering innovative fleet solutions.

We are currently looking to add a Full-time, permanent, day shiftDispatcher to our team. Someone who is equally passionate about serving the community and achieving operational success alongside our dedicated and loyal employees.

Located at 1488 Coast Meridian Road, Port Coquitlam, BC and reporting to the TForce Freight Canada - Operations Manager, the dispatcher will be responsible for managing day-to-day operations of driver dispatch, scheduling, routing and ensuring that all activities are accurately recorded I the company’s transportation management system.

Shift: Monday to Friday, starting at 5:30am

 

Responsibilities:

  • Ensuring that all work is accurately entered and managed in the A1T system in a timely manner, from; order entry, to planning, to activating, progressing and closing trips
  • Plan and schedule drivers efficiently, resulting in the reduction/elimination of non-revenue hours, empty miles and an increase in driver productivity
  • Manage and direct all incoming inquiries through the dispatch telephone lines to ensure a clear, efficient flow of information to the appropriate people
  • Be the front line contact for drivers regarding scheduling and work availability
  • Coordinate with maintenance and Operations to ensure that the required equipment is available
  • Assign equipment to upcoming runs to ensure all of our customer’s needs will be met
  • Communicate with drivers to ensure that appointment delivery times are met
  • Monitor special driver requirements for each site to ensure they are being adhered to
  • Report all driver absences and tardiness to the Manager
  • Ensure proper placement of trailer pool to support customers’ daily requirements while maintaining costs
  • Complete customer reporting and tracking spreadsheets as required
  • Assist in the dispatching of drivers as required
  • To perform other duties as assigned by the reporting manager

 

 Core Competencies and Qualifications:

•Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • Ability to handle multiple projects and tasks
  • 2 years of prior dispatch experience
  • 1-2 years of planning and scheduling experience
  • Previous experience and/or a familiarity with trucking
  • Must be able to work in a fast paced environment and possess excellent problem solving skills
  • Proficient in Windows Outlook, Microsoft excel, and a transportation management system
  • Must be willing to work a flexible schedule and overtime if the demand arises
  • Experience in a 24 x 7 operation, preferably in the transportation industry
  • Familiarity with A1T an asset
  • Successfully pass a criminal background check

 

 

Why work for Canada Cartage?

Our Team

We are a family-oriented company with competitive benefits, including extended health and dental, RRSP and Company-Matching pension plans; discounted hotels, car rentals, entertainment, gym memberships, phone plans, electronics, to name a few of the perks; a cohesive team and a positive, hard-working atmosphere. We have fun events throughout the year, like truck rodeos, summer barbeques and driver-appreciation week that regularly bring us together. It’s important to give back to the communities in which we operate, so we volunteer with and donate to local charities

We also have Company wide recognition initiatives designed to recognize drivers and staff when they demonstrate outstanding customer service, teamwork and our core values.

Why do we have one of the lowest driver turn-over rates in Canada?  A team environment, short-haul regular routes and great benefits.

Recognized leader in the industry:

Canada Cartage has been recognized on the Forbes list of Canada’s Best Employers 2022. This is the sixth straight year that Canada Cartage has been included on this list. https://www.forbes.com/companies/canada-cartage/?list=canada-best-employers&sh=7841454553d8

The Canada’s Best Employers 2022 title, along with our 6th year of being recognized by Trucking HR as one of Canada’s “Top Fleet Employers” serves to reinforce Canada Cartage’s reputation as an employer of high quality.

Our Values

Integrity: We conduct our business with honour, honest and ethics with our people, the environment and legal matters. We believe I being transparent and trustworthy, respecting the traditional “handshake” value system and earning our way in.

Humanity: We are a family minded organization, caring for people and treating them with dignity, decency and respect, be it employees, customers, suppliers or our partners. Open door policy and dealings is our way.

Accountability: Accountability and accessibility to our staff, customers and our customers’ customers is of utmost importance to us. We enable a high level of two way communication, providing access to people who wil deal with issues ad have the willingness to resolve things.  We will be relied on and held accountable for our results and our long term commitments.

Collaboration: We understand that results are the product of a team effort. As part of our process, we ensure collaboration with all our staff at all levels in all roles across departmental lines. With our customers, we use a collaborative style approach, sharing ownership to ensure a successful operation.

Dedication: Our organization is employee and customer-driven. We encourage an environment of conscientious effort and earnestness, hiring problem solvers who are responsive and have a "can-do" attitude to get the job done.

Leadership: Personal leadership to us means being competent, taking ownership, demonstrating initiative, and having a voice. Corporate leadership to us means being leaders in the market, continuous improvement and innovation, and empowering those around you.https://jobs.jobvite.com/canadacartage

 

Come work with an industry leader!

 

We would like to thank all those expressing an interest in this position; however only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Committed to employment equity, Canada Cartage Systems LP encourages applications from Aboriginal people, members of visible minority groups, and women.

title: Sales Representative - Facility Services
description:
Requisition Number: 113465

Job Description

Cintas is seeking a Sales Representative to focus on new business-to-business account development in our Facility Services Division. Responsibilities include prospecting, cold calling, setting appointments with prospects, presenting programs and meeting a sales quota. Sales Representatives will also transport samples of products for presentations. Cintas provides a thorough sales training program, which includes product knowledge, mentorship, sales process and business development strategies.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Generating revenue and meeting sales targets
  • Developing and qualifying leads within respective territory to drive additional sales opportunities through cold-calling and lead generation campaigns
  • Gathering and utilizing business intelligence on prospects to support sales calls, product presentations and driving new business

 

Our Sales Representatives enjoy:

  • Solid base salary and commission potential
  • Extensive car package (lease/gas/insurance/maintenance allowance)
  • Monthly/Quarterly performance bonuses & incentives
  • Comprehensive 12-week sales training program
  • Mentorship program
  • Tablet & AirCard
  • Annual recognition events

Skills/Qualifications

Required

  • Minimum of 1 year outside sales experience or successful completion of a Cintas sales training program
  • Valid driver's license
  • High School Diploma/GED; Bachelor's Degree preferred

 

Preferred

  • New business-to-business (B2B) sales experience
  • Hunter sales mentality - goal driven and self-motivated
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook), intranet/internet and Contact Management System

Our employee-partners enjoy:

 

  • Competitive Pay
  • Weekly Pay Cheques
  • RRSP and DPSP Contribution
  • Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance Package
  • Disability & Life Insurance Package
  • Paid Vacation & Holidays
  • Career Advancement Opportunities

 

Headquartered in Cincinnati, Cintas is a publicly held company traded over the Nasdaq Global Select Market under the symbol CTAS and is a component of both the Standard & Poor’s 500 Index and Nasdaq-100 Index.

Cintas Corporation helps more than 900,000 businesses of all types and sizes get READY™ to open their doors with confidence every day by providing a wide range of products and services that enhance our customers’ image and help keep their facilities and employees clean, safe and looking their best. With products and services including uniforms, mats, mops, restroom supplies, first aid and safety products, fire extinguishers and testing, and safety and compliance training, Cintas helps customers get Ready for the Workday®.

To support our growth across North America, we’re seeking driven professionals with ambition to move up within our company. Our professional culture, our dedication to our employee-partners and limitless career opportunities—these are just a few benefits we’re proud to offer. Our employee-partners know every job is critical, and that teamwork drives innovation. Let’s talk about how you’ll fit into our team and how your hard work will be recognized through competitive pay, world-class benefits and ongoing career development. Are you Ready™ for limitless opportunities at Cintas?

In accordance with applicable laws (including human rights and accessibility legislation), accommodations will be provided in all parts of the hiring process. Applicants are required to make their needs known in advance.



Job Category: Sales 
Organization: Rental
Employee Status: Regular
Schedule: Full Time
Shift: 1st Shift

title: PTO Technician
description:
Company Description

Make an impact with SGS! With more than 97,000 employees and 2,600 offices and laboratories across the world, SGS is a silent force working hard behind the scenes to deliver quality and integrity to businesses across nine industries. As the world’s leader in providing inspection, verification, testing and certification services, Forbes ranked the SGS Group as one of the world’s top multinationals and one of the world’s most innovative companies. The Dow Jones Sustainability Index has also recognized the SGS Group for its sustainability processes. In Canada, SGS employs over 2,000 team members across 70 locations.

Job Description

Successful candidate will have to complete Drug & Alcohol Testing, provide a clear 5 year Driver's Abstract, complete a Criminal Background Check and provide 2 professional References.

Schedule: 

Week One:  Monday, Tuesday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday Week Two: Wednesday, Thursday

Also Required: High School Diploma

Rail Car Loading Duties Include:

·       Visually inspect tops and bottoms of rail cars in order to ensure car is mechanically sound with no defective equipment prior to loading or unloading hydrocarbons.

·       Physically open railcar manway and prepare car for loading by installing applicable loading arms or hoses into the railcars.

·       Utilizing loading manifests load the desired amount of specific product into the railcars and capture inspections, loading volumes, temperatures, as well as releases on applicable checklists and manifests

·       Physically break down loading equipment and secure railcar for shipping as per TDG standards

·       Work outdoors in a team setting at both ground level and elevation on railcar loading racks

·       Understand, Utilize, and Champion a behavioral based safety system to achieve the goal of zero losses

 

 

Qualifications

• Education: High school Diploma (or equivalent) is required.
• Experience: 0-1 years of relevant work experience required or equivalent experience through education.
• Previous experience in a Petroleum Refinery field would be a strong asset.
• Ability and willingness to work rotating on-call shifts, weekends, holidays and overtime.
• Organizational, communication and interpersonal skills are essential. 
• Sufficient verbal and written communication skills.
• Must be comfortable working outdoors for entire shift
#SGSIND5



Additional Information

SGS Canada is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to achieving greater accessibility by providing accommodation for people with disabilities during our hiring process. Accommodations are available on request for qualified candidates during each stage of the recruitment process.

Please note that candidates applying for Canadian job openings should be authorized to work in Canada.

title: Location Manager I
description:
General Responsibilities


$1000 Sign On Bonus

Well known for our solid worldwide reputation, Hertz is proud to be the largest car rental company.   At Hertz, we know service excellence is built on our employees. We recognize that you are a unique individual and we understand that you value benefits and rewards that provide flexibility, choice, and control.  Benefits to working at Hertz can include health benefits such as medical, dental, vision, tuition reimbursement, online learning and development, employee discounts, retirement plan and much more!

 

Join the winning team at a company whose reputation speaks for itself…

 

General Responsibilities:

  

As a Hertz Location Manager, you have responsibility for one or more distinct areas of operation at our airport locations. A Location Manager oversees all of the personnel and operational functions of an airport location. You are responsible for managing a workforce, delivering quality customer service, scheduling adequate staff coverage, handling customer issues and requests, reviewing competitive situations and training new personnel.

 

In addition, you are responsible for the rental fleet at your location and the staff that maintains it. You need to be aware of daily and hourly reservation counts, car and model availability, preventive maintenance schedules, etc.

 

In your position as a Location Manager, you will move between these key areas of responsibility, learning the functions of each, and in that way gain a working, on-site knowledge of the business that can help you move to higher management career growth.

 

******************************************************************

 

Bien connu pour sa solide réputation mondiale, Hertz est fier d’être la plus grande entreprise de location de voitures. Chez Hertz, nous savons que l’excellence du service repose sur nos employés. Nous reconnaissons que vous êtes une personne unique et nous comprenons que vous appréciez les avantages et les récompenses ainsi que la flexibilité, le choix et le contrôle. Les avantages de travailler chez Hertz peuvent comprendre des avantages pour la santé tels que l’accès à la médecine, les soins dentaires, la vision, l’apprentissage et le perfectionnement en ligne, les rabais pour les employés, le plan de retraite et bien plus encore!

 

 Joignez-vous à l’équipe gagnante d’une entreprise dont la réputation parle d’elle-même...

 

 Responsabilités générales:

En tant que gestionnaire de location Hertz, vous êtes responsable d’un ou de plusieurs domaines d’exploitation distincts à nos aéroports. Un gestionnaire de location supervise l’ensemble du personnel et des fonctions opérationnelles d’un aéroport. Vous êtes responsable de la gestion d’une équipe d’employé, de la prestation d’un service à la clientèle de qualité, de la planification d’une couverture adéquate du personnel, du traitement des problèmes et des demandes des clients, de l’examen des situations concurrentielles et de la formation du nouveau personnel.

 

 De plus, vous êtes responsable de la flotte de location à votre emplacement et du personnel qui l’entretient. Vous devez connaître le nombre de réservations quotidiennes et horaires, la disponibilité des voitures et des modèles, les calendriers d’entretien préventif, etc.

 Dans votre poste de gestionnaire de location, vous alternerez entre ces différents champs de responsabilité, en apprenant les fonctions de chacun, afin d’acquérir une connaissance de travail sur place de l’entreprise qui peut vous aider à croitre dans une carrière de gestion supérieure.

 


Essential Requirements

Requirements:

 

Educational Background:

  • College Diploma or University Degree

 

Professional Experience:

  • 1+ years of management experience preferred
  • Customer Service, Management, and Sales experience preferred.
  • Experience in car rental, hospitality, or tourism a plus.
  • Familiarity with Lean/Six Sigma/Toyota Management techniques is an advantage.

 

Skills:

  • Professionally direct employees including training, setting expectations, follow up and corrective action.
  • Excellent communications skills with the ability to engage in verbal interactions with customers.
  • Strong sales skills.
  • Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills.
  • Ability to project professional appearance.
  • Must have basic computer skills and knowledge of Microsoft Office programs.
  • Proficiency in English.
  • Must have a valid driver's license.

******************************************************************

Formation:

  • Diplôme d’études collégiales ou universitaires
  • Expériences professionnelles:
  • Une année ou plus d’expérience en gestion est un atout.
  • Service à la clientèle, gestion et ventes sont un atout.
  • Expérience dans une agence de location de véhicule, Hotel et ou tourisme est un atout.
  • La connaissance des techniques de gestion Lean/Six Sigma/Toyota est un avantage.

 

Compétences:

  • Diriger professionnellement les employés, y compris la formation, l’établissement des attentes, le suivi et les mesures correctives.
  • Excellentes aptitudes en communication avec la capacité d’engager des interactions verbales avec les clients.
  • Excellentes aptitudes en vente.
  • Solides aptitudes pour la résolution de problèmes et la prise de décisions.
  • Habileté à projeter une image professionnelle.
  • Doit avoir des compétences de base en informatique et une connaissance des programmes Microsoft Office.
  • Maîtrise de l’anglais.
  • Doit posséder un permis de conduire valide.

 

At Hertz, we champion and celebrate a culture of diversity and inclusion. We take affirmative steps to promote employment and advancement opportunities. The endless variety of perspectives, experiences, skills and talents that our employees invest in their work every day represent a significant part of our culture – and our success and reputation as a company.

Individuals are encouraged to apply for positions because of the characteristics that make them unique. 

Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Hertz is a drug free workplace.

EOE, including disability/veteran

You need to be aware of daily and hourly reservation counts, car and model availability, preventive maintenance schedules, etc.', "Must have a valid driver's license.", 'Strong sales skills.', 'Excellent communications skills with the ability to engage in verbal interactions with customers.', 'Customer Service, Management, and Sales experience preferred.', 'As a Hertz Location Manager, you have responsibility for one or more distinct areas of operation at our airport locations. title: Automotive Parts Technician, Brampton, Ontario (AORH)
description:
Automotive Parts Technician, Brampton, Ontario (AORH)

Location: Brampton, ON
Brand: Import
 
Requirements:
  • MUST be willing to relocate or commute to Brampton
  • MUST be willing to work 8 hour shifts (M-F); with some weekend hours
  • MUST have 3-5 years parts experience with brand experience is ideal
  • MUST have a valid Canadian Drivers' License
  • PREFER Journeyman Parts Ticket or >3 years Brand Experience
  • PREFER CDK experience if not will train
  • MUST have experience doing both counts and reconciliations
  • Professional in both communication and in appearance
  • Ability to build and sustain relationships
  • Strong writing Skills
  • Self motivated and high energy
  • Can work individual and as part of a team
  • General understanding of automotive systems and parts
Pay:
  • Pay is negotiable
  • M-F 8 Hour Days; with weekend hours available
  • Two weeks vacation after your first year
  • Full benefits after 90 Days
  • Relocation loans are available
If this position is of interest please let us know as soon as possible
 
ADDITIONAL INFO:
 
When you apply for this position you give the Recruiting Room permission to share your information with other team members and our network of employers. You further acknowledge that the Recruiting Room is a free service to all candidates and as such, further agree to indemnify and hold harmless Recruiting Room from any allegations, claims, actions, suits, demands, damages, liabilities, obligations, losses, settlements, judgments, costs and expenses (including without limitation attorneys’ fees and costs) that result from the sharing of this data.
 
You further acknowledge, and give consent, for the Recruiting Room to check your previous employers (to make a hiring decision), if you fail to provide references before the point of offer. We only ask questions that are “reasonably required,” for our employers to assess the applicant’s fitness for the job. We DO NOT contact current employers.
 
You further acknowledge, by applying for this position, you allow the Recruiting Room, and its agents, to contact you via SMS Messaging (texting), Facebook, Instagram or any other forms of social networking. 

 
Click here for our job board

title: Sales Representative - Uniform
description:
Requisition Number: 99485

Job Description

Cintas is seeking a Sales Representative - Uniform to focus on new business-to-business account development in our Uniform Division. Responsibilities include prospecting, cold calling, setting appointments with prospects, presenting programs and meeting a sales quota. Sales Representatives will also transport samples of products for presentations. Cintas provides a thorough sales training program, which includes product knowledge, mentorship, sales process and business development strategies.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Generating revenue and meeting sales targets
  • Developing and qualifying leads within respective territory to drive additional sales opportunities through cold-calling and lead generation campaigns
  • Gathering and utilizing business intelligence on prospects to support sales calls, product presentations and driving new business

 

Our Sales Representatives enjoy:

  • Solid base salary and commission potential
  • Extensive car package (lease/gas/insurance/maintenance allowance)
  • Monthly/Quarterly performance bonuses & incentives
  • Comprehensive 12-week sales training program
  • Mentorship program
  • Tablet & AirCard
  • Annual recognition events

Skills/Qualifications

Required

  • Minimum of 1 year outside sales experience or successful completion of a Cintas sales training program
  • Valid driver's license
  • High School Diploma/GED; Bachelor's Degree preferred

 

Preferred:

  • New business-to-business (B2B) sales experience
  • Hunter sales mentality - goal driven and self-motivated
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook), intranet/internet and Contact Management System

Our employee-partners enjoy:

 

  • Competitive Pay
  • Weekly Pay Cheques
  • RRSP and DPSP Contribution
  • Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance Package
  • Disability & Life Insurance Package
  • Paid Vacation & Holidays
  • Career Advancement Opportunities

 

Headquartered in Cincinnati, Cintas is a publicly held company traded over the Nasdaq Global Select Market under the symbol CTAS and is a component of both the Standard & Poor’s 500 Index and Nasdaq-100 Index.

Cintas Corporation helps more than 900,000 businesses of all types and sizes get READY™ to open their doors with confidence every day by providing a wide range of products and services that enhance our customers’ image and help keep their facilities and employees clean, safe and looking their best. With products and services including uniforms, mats, mops, restroom supplies, first aid and safety products, fire extinguishers and testing, and safety and compliance training, Cintas helps customers get Ready for the Workday®.

To support our growth across North America, we’re seeking driven professionals with ambition to move up within our company. Our professional culture, our dedication to our employee-partners and limitless career opportunities—these are just a few benefits we’re proud to offer. Our employee-partners know every job is critical, and that teamwork drives innovation. Let’s talk about how you’ll fit into our team and how your hard work will be recognized through competitive pay, world-class benefits and ongoing career development. Are you Ready™ for limitless opportunities at Cintas?

In accordance with applicable laws (including human rights and accessibility legislation), accommodations will be provided in all parts of the hiring process. Applicants are required to make their needs known in advance.



Job Category: Sales 
Organization: Rental
Employee Status: Regular
Schedule: Full Time
Shift: 1st Shift

title: Automotive Wheel Repair Technician
description:
Faites à nouveau rouler les roues.
Soyez un magicien de Dent Wizard.

 

À titre de Technicien des roues pour Dent Wizard, vous utiliserez les plus récents outils et techniques pour remettre en état les roues et les enjoliveurs de roues – et vous en serez récompensé par un potentiel de revenus sans plafond. Nous cherchons maintenant à embaucher à Laval, QC un individu travaillant qui possède les compétences et la personnalité extravertie nécessaires pour faire rouler les choses.

 

Vous travaillerez sur place chez les clients pour réparer des dommages esthétiques (égratignures de trottoirs et hasards de route, écaillements, frottements, rainures, rouille et roues déformées) à l’aide d’équipement de pulvérisation de peinture, d’outils électriques et de matériel professionnel. Le processus implique la dépose des roues, leur réparation dans votre camion mobile et leur pose sur le véhicule. Les tâches incluent la peinture des surfaces, l’inspection des roues, la préparation et le polissage des défauts, le mélange des couleurs et la finition.

 

La différence Dent Wizard

  • Un potentiel de revenus illimité et sans plafond, basé sur les commissions : plus vous travaillez dur, plus vous gagnez.
  • Excellents avantages, y compris une assurance santé, dentaire et soins de la vue, plan de participation à un REER, vacances payées et plus encore.
  • Avantages exceptionnels, notamment outils et matériel, véhicule de compagnie, carte d’essence et autres.
  • Camions écologiques avec filtres et aménagements anti-explosion, comprenant les couleurs FEO de roues prémélangées et préassorties.
  • Indépendance pour gérer votre journée; pas de microgestion.
  • Équipe agréable et dynamique où tout le monde se soutient et veille les uns sur les autres.
  • Travail varié sur divers types de véhicules, des nouveaux modèles aux vieux modèles.
  • Trois semaines de formation dans l’un de nos établissements avec des maîtres-techniciens des roues pour vous aider à apprendre des techniques avancées.
  • Formation payée et rémunérée, déplacement et hébergement défrayés par la société.
  • Développez vos compétences techniques et vos aptitudes de service à la clientèle lorsque vous accédez à l’emploi grâce au soutien de techniciens d’expérience.
  • Potentiel d’avancement vers des niveaux techniques supérieurs (au salaire plus élevé) ou vers des postes de gestion.

 

Ce qu’il vous faut pour réussir

  • Une expérience en peinture automobile ou formation professionnelle en carrosserie serait un atout.
  • Bonne vision, notamment vision rapprochée, vision distante et vision des couleurs, perception de la profondeur et capacité à focaliser.
  • Ténacité et robustesse pour travailler dehors en toutes conditions.
  • Excellentes aptitudes de communication et d’organisation pour interagir avec les clients et développer les comptes.
  • Dextérité manuelle pour les tâches à mouvement répétitif.
  • Solide éthique professionnelle, auto-motivation et capacité à travailler de manière indépendante.
  • Endurance physique pour s’agenouiller, se pencher, fléchir les jambes, grimper et soulever des poids allant jusqu’à 20 kg.
  • Permis de conduire et bon dossier de conduite.

 

À propos de Dent Wizard

Dent Wizard est le leader national incontesté en services de réparation automobile et de produits de protection pour les véhicules, et son succès est le fruit du travail de son personnel qui dessert les clients. Dent Wizard est une société stable, en croissance et établie sur un modèle d’affaires solide. Elle exerce ses activités dans 43 États américains et cinq provinces canadiennes, répare 2,5 millions de véhicules chaque année et compte plus de 3 000 employés hautement compétents. Aidez-vous à atteindre de nouveaux sommets tout en obtenant le respect, la rémunération et la reconnaissance que vous méritez.

 

Posez votre candidature maintenant!

Put the wheels back in motion. Be a Wizard.

 

As a Wheel Technician with Dent Wizard, you’ll use the latest tools and techniques to restore wheels and wheel covers – and we’ll reward you with uncapped earning potential. We’re hiring now in Laval, QC for a hard-working individual with the skills and outgoing personality to keep things rolling.

 

Working on site at customer locations, you’ll fix cosmetic damages (curb and road rash, peeling, scrapes, gouges, oxidation and bent wheels) using spray-painting equipment, power tools and work aids. The process involves removing the wheels, repairing them in your mobile truck and placing them back on the vehicle. Tasks include painting surfaces, inspecting wheels, prepping and buffing defects, mixing colors and finishing.

 

The Dent Wizard Difference

  • Unlimited, uncapped earning potential based on commission: the harder you work, the more you can make
  • Excellent benefits, including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), paid vacation and more
  • Outstanding perks, including tools and supplies, company truck, gas card and more
  • Environmentally friendly trucks with explosion-proof filtration and fixtures, outfitted with premixed and pre-matched OEM wheel colors
  • Independence to manage your day; no micromanagement
  • Fun and dynamic team where everyone is supportive and has your back
  • Variety of work on many types of cars, both new and old models
  • Three weeks of training at one of our facilities with Master Wheel Techs to help you learn advanced techniques
  • We pay for the training, pay you a salary while you train and provide travel and lodging
  • Develop your technical and customer service skills once you are on the job, with assistance from experienced Techs
  • Advancement potential into higher Tech levels (with more $) or management roles

 

 

What You Need to Succeed

  • Auto painting experience or collision repair technical school training preferred but not required
  • Vision abilities including close, distance and color vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus
  • Toughness and grit to work outside in all kinds of weather
  • Strong organizational and communication skills to interact with customers and build accounts
  • Manual dexterity for repetitive-motion tasks
  • Strong work ethic, self-motivation and the ability to work independently
  • Physical stamina to kneel, bend, squat and climb, as well as lift up to 45 pounds
  • Valid driver’s license and good driving record

 

About Dent Wizard

Dent Wizard is the nation’s undisputed leader in automotive reconditioning services and vehicle protection products – and our success is the result of the great people who serve our customers. We’re stable, growing and have a strong business model, with opportunities in 43 states, 2.5 million vehicles repaired every year and more than 3,000 highly skilled employees. Help us reach new heights and receive the respect, rewards and recognition you deserve.

 Apply Now!

title: Driver Road Test Evaluator
description:
Now Hiring

DRIVER ROAD TEST EVALUATOR

 

At Canada Cartage we work with intelligent and focused leaders who are driven to create an outstanding customer experience in partnership with Canadian leading brands. Canada Cartage is deep rooted in family values with an entrepreneurial culture where ideas are welcomed, growth is fostered and high performance is championed. A recognized thought leader and founded in 1914, Canada Cartage dominates the industry by delivering innovative fleet solutions.

We are currently looking to add a full-time, Road Test Evaluator, to our team. Someone who is equally passionate about serving the community and achieving operational success alongside our dedicated and loyal employees.

Located at 1115 Cardiff Blvd, Mississauga and reporting to the Safety and Compliance Manager, the Road Test Evaluator will be responsible for conducting training and development opportunities for all drivers located out of the Mississauga terminal. As a Company resource you will perform duties such as road safety training, assist with compliance audits, emergency road response and necessary paperwork and record keeping.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Providing on-the-road training in all type of Canada Cartage vehicles to new driver candidates and current drivers to ensure compliance with provincial legislations requirements and Company SOP
  • Supporting driver training and evaluating of Owner Operators
  • Deliver new employee classroom orientations on Safety & Compliance
  • Complete all new hire paperwork, Safety & Compliance, Human Resource, Contracts, Payroll Advice
  • Performing pre/post-trip inspections on equipment
  • Perform on-road driver evaluations with new drivers and complete written driver evaluations
  • Create Driver Files for new drivers, close out files for departing drivers
  • Monitor Driver records and Training expiries (Dangerous Goods, WHMIS, Forklift, Moffett, LCV, PDIC) and notify/retrain drivers when required
  • Accurately document and address training progress and problems
  • Maintain driver records for violations
  • Assist with managing and coordinate programs for compliance with all applicable provincial and federal regulations.
  • Investigate road accidents and violations and recommend corrective actions to improve road safety
  • Practice, support, and enforce safe work procedures including safety and company policies and procedures
  • Monitoring and responding to customer & driver complaints
  • Assisting the Canada Cartage Fleet department as needed
  • Ensure staff are complying with all applicable transportation and employment laws/regulations as well as customer and Company requirements
  • Generating reports as required
  • Other duties as assigned

 

 Core Competencies and Qualification:

  • Valid Ontario AZ Driver’s License with a minimum of 5 years of Tractor Trailer Driving Experience
  • Clear CVOR and Abstract 
  • Hands on Safety & Compliance experience in the Transportation industry an asset
  • Experience or knowledge of operating a shunt truck preferred
  • Excellent interpersonal and written/verbal communication skills
  • Passion for coaching and mentoring new drivers
  • Proficient Computer Skills; ability to use Microsoft Programs such as Word, Excel and Outlook
  • Training Experience preferred; LCV, PDIC, Load Securement, Hours of Service, Dangerous Goods, WHMIS
  • Certification: Driver Trainer Certification (to be issued by Canada Cartage), PDIC, LCV, DG, WHMIS, and HOS training certifications an asset
  • Proven classroom/vehicle training experience an asset
  • Ability to work in non-climate controlled conditions such as outside in the yard weather permitting
  • Willingness to travel as necessary within the district (customers yards, close geographical area and training sites), work the required schedule, and work at the specific locations required

 

Why work for Canada Cartage?

Our Team

We are a family-oriented company with competitive benefits, including extended health and dental, RRSP and Company-Matching pension plans; discounted hotels, car rentals, entertainment, gym memberships, phone plans, electronics, to name a few of the perks; a cohesive team and a positive, hard-working atmosphere. We have fun events throughout the year, like truck rodeos, summer barbeques and driver-appreciation week that regularly bring us together. It’s important to give back to the communities in which we operate, so we volunteer with and donate to local charities

We also have Company wide recognition initiatives designed to recognize drivers and staff when they demonstrate outstanding customer service, teamwork and our core values.

Why do we have one of the lowest driver turn-over rates in Canada?  A team environment, short-haul regular routes and great benefits. Come work with us: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rpMA1riOzPI 

 

Recognized leader in the industry:

Canada Cartage has been recognized on the Forbes list of Canada’s Best Employers 2022. This is the sixth straight year that Canada Cartage has been included on this list. https://www.forbes.com/companies/canada-cartage/?list=canada-best-employers&sh=7841454553d8

The Canada’s Best Employers 2022 title, along with our 6th year of being recognized by Trucking HR as one of Canada’s “Top Fleet Employers” serves to reinforce Canada Cartage’s reputation as an employer of high quality.

Celebrating 100 years: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b3S-CtHQhVY 

 

Our Values

Integrity: We conduct our business with honour, honest and ethics with our people, the environment and legal matters. We believe I being transparent and trustworthy, respecting the traditional “handshake” value system and earning our way in.

Humanity: We are a family minded organization, caring for people and treating them with dignity, decency and respect, be it employees, customers, suppliers or our partners. Open door policy and dealings is our way.

Accountability: Accountability and accessibility to our staff, customers and our customers’ customers is of utmost importance to us. We enable a high level of two way communication, providing access to people who wil deal with issues ad have the willingness to resolve things.  We will be relied on and held accountable for our results and our long term commitments.

Collaboration: We understand that results are the product of a team effort. As part of our process, we ensure collaboration with all our staff at all levels in all roles across departmental lines. With our customers, we use a collaborative style approach, sharing ownership to ensure a successful operation.

Dedication: Our organization is employee and customer-driven. We encourage an environment of conscientious effort and earnestness, hiring problem solvers who are responsive and have a "can-do" attitude to get the job done.

Leadership: Personal leadership to us means being competent, taking ownership, demonstrating initiative, and having a voice. Corporate leadership to us means being leaders in the market, continuous improvement and innovation, and empowering those around you.https://jobs.jobvite.com/canadacartage

Come work with an industry leader!

 

We would like to thank all those expressing an interest in this position; however only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Committed to employment equity, Canada Cartage Systems LP encourages applications from Aboriginal people, members of visible minority groups, and women.

title: Leak Survey Technician - Ottawa
description:
• Full-time permanent position. Monday-Friday
  • Entry-level
  • Competitive hourly rate ($18.58 starting wage) with regularly scheduled opportunities for performance-based raises and bonuses
  • Exceptional health benefits, including for family
  • Defined contribution pension plan and employee assistance program
  • Company cell phone provided
  • Company car provided for work only, which you can park at home
  • Work independently outdoors

Wouldn’t it be great to find a company that will give you a chance to prove yourself, and grow a career quickly?

Look no further. G-Tel is hiring and training new Leak Survey Technicians to complete jobs in and around your area. The G-Tel family includes multiple growing companies providing electrical distribution infrastructure, energy and power generation services.

 

In this role, you will:

  • Receive full 3 - 4 weeks’ training
  • Receive assignments and routes to follow each day
  • Use state of the art equipment (including infra-red and flame ionization) to examine buried gas lines, and detect/report buried gas leaks.
  • Prepare reports and documentation that based on your work
  • From there, your reports will go to the people who repair the leaks, so they can make sure the gas lines stay in good working order.

 

Qualifications

  • Have experience, or would definitely enjoy, working outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Be physically fit and able to walk frequently (up to 20-25km/day), sit in a vehicle, and lift/carry up to 20 lbs
  • Be able to visually distinguish colours
  • Have a valid Ontario “G” class driver’s license and be able to produce a clean drivers abstract
  • Have a high school diploma
  • Be willing to obtain and wear CSA approved steel toe safety boots
  • Be willing to undergo and successfully clear a criminal background check
  • Willingness to work weekends and overtime is an asset, but not required
  • Have general computer knowledge (browser, email, Microsoft Office)

Note: Proof of COVID vaccination is not required.

title: Auto Body Paint Technician
description:
Faites de chaque peinture un chef-d'œuvre.
Soyez un magicien de Dent Wizard.

 

À titre de technicien en peinture pour Dent Wizard, vous aurez un potentiel de revenus illimité et la possibilité de contrôler vos journées de travail en exécutant rapidement des tâches de peinture irréprochables qui auront de quoi éblouir. Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d’un technicien en peinture pour Lavall, QC.

 

Avec une préparation de surface spécifique, le tout dernier équipement de peinture et des techniques de peinture éprouvées, vous veillerez à l’inspection, à la préparation, au mélange et à la finition des surfaces sur les véhicules. En travaillant à divers emplacements, dont des concessionnaires automobiles, des entreprises de location et des enchères automobiles, vous ferez un peu de tout, allant des simples retouches jusqu’aux réparations de peinture.

 

La différence Dent Wizard

  • Un potentiel de revenus illimité et sans plafond, basé sur les commissions : plus vous travaillez dur, plus vous gagnez.
  • Excellents avantages, y compris une assurance santé, dentaire, et soins de la vue, plan de participation à un REER, vacances payées et plus encore.
  • Avantages exceptionnels, notamment téléphone mobile, véhicule de compagnie, carte d’essence et autres.
  • Nous vous fournirons tous les outils et les fournitures les plus récents.
  • Indépendance pour gérer votre journée; pas de microgestion.
  • Excellent équilibre travail-vie personnelle qui vous permet de gérer vous-même votre horaire.
  • Formation au travail avec nos systèmes informatisés de correspondance des couleurs et nos techniques de peinture enseignées par nos peintres chevronnés.
  • Certifications et formations avancées avec des sociétés telles que PPG et BASF.
  • Cheminement de carrière défini comptant cinq niveaux, de technicien supérieur à technicien de classe mondiale, chaque niveau ayant ses primes, avantages et reconnaissances spécifiques.

 

Ce qu’il vous faut pour réussir

  • Une à deux années d’expérience en peinture automobile.
  • Bonne vision, notamment vision rapprochée, vision distante et vision des couleurs, perception de la profondeur et capacité à focaliser.
  • Excellentes aptitudes de communication pour interagir avec les clients et développer les comptes.
  • Dextérité manuelle pour les tâches à mouvement répétitif.
  • Solide éthique professionnelle, auto-motivation et capacité à travailler de manière indépendante.
  • Endurance physique pour s’agenouiller, se pencher, fléchir les jambes et soulever des poids allant jusqu’à 20 kg.
  • Permis de conduire et bon dossier de conduite.

 

À propos de Dent Wizard

Dent Wizard est le leader national incontesté en services de réparation automobile et de produits de protection pour les véhicules, et son succès est le fruit du travail de son personnel qui dessert les clients. Dent Wizard est une société stable, en croissance et établie sur un modèle d’affaires solide. Elle exerce ses activités dans 43 États américains et cinq provinces canadiennes, répare 2,5 millions de véhicules chaque année et compte plus de 3 000 employés hautement compétents. Aidez-vous à atteindre de nouveaux sommets tout en obtenant le respect, la rémunération et la reconnaissance que vous méritez.

 

Posez votre candidature maintenant!

Make every paint job a masterpiece. Be a wizard.

 As a Paint Tech with Dent Wizard, you’ll have unlimited earning potential and the ability to control your day as you deliver fast, flawless paint jobs that dazzle. We’re hiring right now for a Paint Technician in  Laval, QC.  

 Utilizing specific surface preparation, the latest spray equipment and proven painting techniques, you will inspect, prepare, blend and finish vehicle surfaces. Working at locations that may include automotive dealerships, rental agencies and auto auctions, you’ll do everything from simple touch-ups to repairing paint damage.

 The Dent Wizard Difference

  • Unlimited, uncapped earning potential based on commission: the harder you work, the more you can make
  • Excellent benefits, including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), paid vacation and more
  • Outstanding perks, including mobile phone, company vehicle, gas card and more
  • We will fully equip you with the most current tools and supplies
  • Independence to manage your day; no micromanagement
  • Great work/life balance that puts you in charge of your schedule
  • On-the-job training in our computerized color matching systems and painting techniques from experienced painters
  • Certifications and advanced training with organizations like PPG and BASF
  • Defined career path with five levels from Senior Technician to World-Class Technician, each with bonuses, perks and recognition

 What You Need to Succeed

  • 1-2 years of auto painting experience
  • Vision abilities including close, distance and color vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus
  • Great communication skills to interact with customers and build accounts
  • Manual dexterity for repetitive-motion tasks
  • Strong work ethic, self-motivation and the ability to work independently
  • Toughness and grit to work outside in all kinds of weather
  • Physical stamina to kneel, bend and squat, as well as lift up to 45 pounds
  • Valid driver’s license and good driving record

 About Dent Wizard

Dent Wizard is the nation’s undisputed leader in automotive reconditioning services and vehicle protection products – and our success is the result of the great people who serve our customers. We’re stable, growing and have a strong business model, with opportunities in 43 states, 2.5 million vehicles repaired every year and more than 3,000 highly skilled employees. Help us reach new heights and receive the respect, rewards and recognition you deserve.

 Apply Now!

title: Raymond Reach Driver / Multiple Sites
description:
Randstad is currently hiring stand-up Raymond Reach Forklift operators for 3 Brampton facilities on the day shift starting immediately. We are looking for candidates that are able to work Monday to Friday on a regular basis (Sometimes weekends). The ideal candidate should have a minimum of 2 years of driving experience on the Reach Truck with external certification. Must have access to their own car as the candidate must be capable to drive to 3 different Brampton locations depending on client's need.

Advantages
- Competitive Pay Rate: $20/hr
- Long term Perm opportunity
- Reputable Company
- a fully comprehensive benefits package is included. Health, dental, eyeglasses, safety shoes, RRSP and 4% vacation pay
- Sometimes Weekends due to facility move (Overtime)
- Straight Day Shifts Available: -
Mon.-Thu. : 7 AM to 5 PM
Fri.: 7 AM to 4 PM

Responsibilities
- Operating Reach Truck, Pump Truck, & Dock Stocker
- Loading and unloading trucks
- RF Scanner usage
- Lift up to 55 lbs
- Pick, wrap and stage orders to be shipped
- Attention to detail to process the orders

Qualifications
- Must have Forklift certification ( especially Dockstocker & Reach Truck)
- Must have access to own vehicle as you must drive to 3 locations (within Brampton) depending on the client's need
- 2 years experience in a warehouse or industrial environment operating the Forklift
- Past shipping experience
- Attention to detail / organizational skills
- Great communication skills

Summary
Are you interested in this position? We already started the interview process. Don’t miss your chance to obtain this long-term opportunity. Apply today and our recruitment team will contact you shortly.

Interested in applying? Email a copy of your resume to ali.wasti@randstad.ca, vikramjit.bansal@randstad.ca, avery.salmon@randstad.ca or ryan.galera@randstad.ca
Call 905-799-9972

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Automotive Technician, Kamloops , British Columbia (ATCA)
description:
Automotive Technician, Kamloops , British Columbia (ATCA)

LOCATION:
  • Kamloops, British Columbia
  • Aftermarket Shop

REQUIREMENTS:
  • Automotive Journeyman or 3rd Year Apprentice and higher
  • Dealership or Aftermarket Experience
  • Strong Customer Service Skills
  • Organized and knows how to keep the shop looking presentable
  • Must have your own tools
  • Strong integrity
  • Valid Driver’s license

PAY:
  • $32/hr - $40/hr straight-time
  • Benefits (After 90days): Health, Dental and Vision
  • Regular day-time shifts
